JFA.text: O povo que estava sentado em trevas viu uma grande luz; sim, aos que estavam sentados na região da sombra da morte, a estes a luz raiou.

RVA.text: El pueblo asentado en tinieblas, Vió gran luz; Y á los sentados en región y sombra de muerte, Luz les esclareció.

KJV.text: The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.

WEBM.text: The people who sat in darkness saw a great light, to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, to them light has dawned.

JFA.text: Responde-me quando eu clamar, ó Deus da minha justiça! Na angústia me deste largueza; tem misericórdia de mim e ouve a minha oração.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: sobre Neginoth: Salmo de David. Respondeme cuando clamo, oh Dios de mi justicia: Estando en angustia, tú me hiciste ensanchar: Ten misericordia de mí, y oye mi oración.

KJV.text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

WEBM.text: Answer me when I call, God of my righteousness. Give me relief from my distress. Have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.

JFA.text: Filhos dos homens, até quando convertereis a minha glória em infâmia? Até quando amareis a vaidade e buscareis a mentira?

RVA.text: Hijos de los hombres, ¿hasta cuándo volveréis mi honra en infamia, Amaréis la vanidad, y buscaréis la mentira? (Selah.)

KJV.text: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? Selah.

WEBM.text: You sons of men, how long shall my glory be turned into dishonor? Will you love vanity, and seek after falsehood? Selah.

JFA.text: Sabei que o Senhor separou para si aquele que é piedoso; o Senhor me ouve quando eu clamo a ele.

RVA.text: Sabed pues, que Jehová hizo apartar al pío para sí: Jehová oirá cuando yo á él clamare.

KJV.text: But know that the Lord hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the Lord will hear when I call unto him.

WEBM.text: But know that the Lord has set apart for himself him who is godly: The Lord will hear when I call to him.

JFA.text: Irai-vos e não pequeis; consultai com o vosso coração em vosso leito, e calai-vos.

RVA.text: Temblad, y no pequéis: Conversad en vuestro corazón sobre vuestra cama, y desistid. (Selah.)

KJV.text: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.

WEBM.text: Stand in awe, and don’t sin. Search your own heart on your bed, and be still. Selah.

JFA.text: Oferecei sacrifícios de justiça, e confiai no Senhor.

RVA.text: Ofreced sacrificios de justicia, Y confiad en Jehová.

KJV.text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the Lord.

WEBM.text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness. Put your trust in the Lord.

JFA.text: Muitos dizem: Quem nos mostrará o bem? Levanta, Senhor, sobre nós a luz do teu rosto.

RVA.text: Muchos dicen: ¿Quién nos mostrará el bien? Alza sobre nosotros, oh Jehová, la luz de tu rostro.

KJV.text: There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? Lord, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

WEBM.text: Many say, “Who will show us any good?” Lord, let the light of your face shine on us.

JFA.text: Puseste no meu coração mais alegria do que a deles no tempo em que se lhes multiplicam o trigo e o vinho.

RVA.text: Tú diste alegría en mi corazón, Más que tienen ellos en el tiempo que se multiplicó su grano y su mosto.

KJV.text: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.

WEBM.text: You have put gladness in my heart, more than when their grain and their new wine are increased.

JFA.text: A suprema sabedoria altissonantemente clama nas ruas; nas praças levanta a sua voz.

RVA.text: La sabiduría clama de fuera, Da su voz en las plazas:

KJV.text: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

WEBM.text: Wisdom calls aloud in the street. She utters her voice in the public squares.

JFA.text: Do alto dos muros clama; às entradas das portas e na cidade profere as suas palavras.

RVA.text: Clama en los principales lugares de concurso; En las entradas de las puertas de la ciudad dice sus razones:

KJV.text: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

WEBM.text: She calls at the head of noisy places. At the entrance of the city gates, she utters her words:

JFA.text: Até quando, ó estúpidos, amareis a estupidez? E até quando se deleitarão no escárnio os escarnecedores, e odiarão os insensatos o conhecimento?

RVA.text: ¿Hasta cuándo, oh simples, amaréis la simpleza, Y los burladores desearán el burlar, Y los insensatos aborrecerán la ciencia?

KJV.text: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

WEBM.text: How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity? How long will mockers delight themselves in mockery, and fools hate knowledge?

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os humildes de espírito, porque deles é o reino dos céus.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los pobres en espíritu: porque de ellos es el reino de los cielos.

KJV.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

WEBM.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os que choram, porque eles serão consolados.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los que lloran: porque ellos recibirán consolación.

KJV.text: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

WEBM.text: Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os mansos, porque eles herdarão a terra.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los mansos: porque ellos recibirán la tierra por heredad.

KJV.text: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

WEBM.text: Blessed are the gentle, for they shall inherit the earth.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os que têm fome e sede de justiça porque eles serão fartos.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los que tienen hambre y sed de justicia: porque ellos serán hartos.

KJV.text: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.

WEBM.text: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os misericordiosos, porque eles alcançarão misericórdia.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los misericordiosos: porque ellos alcanzarán misericordia.

KJV.text: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

WEBM.text: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os limpos de coração, porque eles verão a Deus.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los de limpio corazón: porque ellos verán á Dios.

KJV.text: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.

WEBM.text: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os pacificadores, porque eles serão chamados filhos de Deus.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los pacificadores: porque ellos serán llamados hijos de Dios.

KJV.text: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

WEBM.text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called children of God.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os que são perseguidos por causa da justiça, porque deles é o reino dos céus.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los que padecen persecución por causa de la justicia: porque de ellos es el reino de los cielos.

KJV.text: Blessed are they which are persecuted for righteousness' sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

WEBM.text: Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados sois vós, quando vos injuriarem e perseguiram e, mentindo, disserem todo mal contra vós por minha causa.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados sois cuando os vituperaren y os persiguieren, y dijeren de vosotros todo mal por mi causa, mintiendo.

KJV.text: Blessed are ye, when men shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

WEBM.text: Blessed are you when people reproach you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

JFA.text: Vós sois o sal da terra; mas se o sal se tornar insípido, com que se há de restaurar-lhe o sabor? para nada mais presta, senão para ser lançado fora, e ser pisado pelos homens.

RVA.text: Vosotros sois la sal de la tierra: y si la sal se desvaneciere ¿con qué será salada? no vale más para nada, sino para ser echada fuera y hollada de los hombres.

KJV.text: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.

WEBM.text: You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? It is then good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men.

JFA.text: Vós sois a luz do mundo. Não se pode esconder uma cidade situada sobre um monte.

RVA.text: Vosotros sois la luz del mundo: una ciudad asentada sobre un monte no se puede esconder.

KJV.text: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.

WEBM.text: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill can’t be hidden.

JFA.text: Nem os que acendem uma candeia a colocam debaixo do alqueire, mas no velador, e assim ilumina a todos que estão na casa.

RVA.text: Ni se enciende una lámpara y se pone debajo de un almud, mas sobre el candelero, y alumbra á todos los que están en casa.

KJV.text: Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.

WEBM.text: Neither do you light a lamp, and put it under a measuring basket, but on a stand; and it shines to all who are in the house.

JFA.text: Assim resplandeça a vossa luz diante dos homens, para que vejam as vossas boas obras, e glorifiquem a vosso Pai, que está nos céus.

RVA.text: Así alumbre vuestra luz delante de los hombres, para que vean vuestras obras buenas, y glorifiquen á vuestro Padre que está en los cielos.

KJV.text: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

WEBM.text: Even so, let your light shine before men; that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven.

JFA.text: Seja, porém, o vosso falar: Sim, sim; não, não; pois o que passa daí, vem do Maligno.

RVA.text: Mas sea vuestro hablar: Sí, sí; No, no; porque lo que es más de esto, de mal procede.

KJV.text: But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.

WEBM.text: But let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes’ and your ‘No’ be ‘No.’ Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.

JFA.text: Eu, porém, vos digo que não resistais ao homem mau; mas a qualquer que te bater na face direita, oferece-lhe também a outra.

RVA.text: Mas yo os digo: No resistáis al mal; antes á cualquiera que te hiriere en tu mejilla diestra, vuélvele también la otra.

KJV.text: But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

WEBM.text: But I tell you, don’t resist him who is evil; but whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other also.

JFA.text: Eu, porém, vos digo: Amai aos vossos inimigos, e orai pelos que vos perseguem.

RVA.text: Mas yo os digo: Amad á vuestros enemigos, bendecid á los que os maldicen, haced bien á los que os aborrecen, y orad por los que os ultrajan y os persiguen.

KJV.text: But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;

WEBM.text: But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you,

JFA.text: E, se saudardes somente os vossos irmãos, que fazeis demais? não fazem os gentios também o mesmo?

RVA.text: Y si abrazareis á vuestros hermanos solamente, ¿qué hacéis de más? ¿no hacen también así los Gentiles?

KJV.text: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? do not even the publicans so?

WEBM.text: If you only greet your friends, what more do you do than others? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?

JFA.text: Sede vós, pois, perfeitos, como é perfeito o vosso Pai celestial.

RVA.text: Sed, pues, vosotros perfectos, como vuestro Padre que está en los cielos es perfecto.

KJV.text: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.

WEBM.text: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.

JFA.text: Apartai-vos de mim todos os que praticais a iniquidade; porque o Senhor já ouviu a voz do meu pranto.

RVA.text: Jehová ha oído mi ruego; Ha recibido Jehová mi oración.

KJV.text: The Lord hath heard my supplication; the Lord will receive my prayer.

WEBM.text: The Lord has heard my supplication. The Lord accepts my prayer.

JFA.text: Porquanto aborreceram o conhecimento, e não preferiram o temor do Senhor; não quiseram o meu conselho e desprezaram toda a minha repreensão; portanto comerão do fruto do seu caminho e se fartarão dos seus próprios conselhos.

RVA.text: Por cuanto aborrecieron la sabiduría, Y no escogieron el temor de Jehová, Ni quisieron mi consejo, Y menospreciaron toda reprensión mía: Comerán pues del fruto de su camino, Y se hartarán de sus consejos.

KJV.text: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof. Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

WEBM.text: because they hated knowledge, and didn’t choose the fear of the Lord. They wanted none of my counsel. They despised all my reproof. Therefore they will eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own schemes.

JFA.text: Porque o desvio dos néscios os matará, e a prosperidade dos loucos os destruirá. Mas o que me der ouvidos habitará em segurança, e estará tranqüilo, sem receio do mal.

RVA.text: Porque el reposo de los ignorantes los matará, Y la prosperidad de los necios los echará á perder. Mas el que me oyere, habitará confiadamente, Y vivirá reposado, sin temor de mal.

KJV.text: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them. But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

WEBM.text: For the backsliding of the simple will kill them. The careless ease of fools will destroy them. But whoever listens to me will dwell securely, and will be at ease, without fear of harm.

JFA.text: Não vos esqueçais da hospitalidade, porque por ela alguns, sem o saberem, hospedaram anjos.

RVA.text: No olvidéis la hospitalidad, porque por ésta algunos, sin saberlo, hospedaron ángeles.

KJV.text: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.

WEBM.text: Don’t forget to show hospitality to strangers, for in doing so, some have entertained angels without knowing it.

JFA.text: E conhecereis a verdade, e a verdade vos libertará.

RVA.text: Y conoceréis la verdad, y la verdad os libertará.

KJV.text: And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

WEBM.text: You will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.

JFA.text: E o segundo é este: Amarás ao teu próximo como a ti mesmo. Não há outro mandamento maior do que esses.

RVA.text: Y el segundo es semejante á él: Amarás á tu prójimo como á ti mismo. No hay otro mandamiento mayor que éstos.

KJV.text: And the second is like, namely this, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. There is none other commandment greater than these.

WEBM.text: The second is like this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.

JFA.text: Não to mandei eu? Esforça-te, e tem bom ânimo; não te atemorizes, nem te espantes; porque o Senhor teu Deus está contigo, por onde quer que andares.

RVA.text: Mira que te mando que te esfuerces y seas valiente: no temas ni desmayes, porque Jehová tu Dios será contigo en donde quiera que fueres.

KJV.text: Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.

WEBM.text: Haven’t I commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid. Don’t be dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.

JFA.text: Pois eu bem sei os planos que estou projetando para vós, diz o Senhor; planos de paz, e não de mal, para vos dar um futuro e uma esperança.

RVA.text: Porque yo sé los pensamientos que tengo acerca de vosotros, dice Jehová, pensamientos de paz, y no de mal, para daros el fin que esperáis.

KJV.text: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.

WEBM.text: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, says the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you hope and a future.

JFA.text: Porque Deus amou o mundo de tal maneira que deu o seu Filho unigênito, para que todo aquele que nele crê não pereça, mas tenha a vida eterna.

RVA.text: Porque de tal manera amó Dios al mundo, que ha dado á su Hijo unigénito, para que todo aquel que en él cree, no se pierda, mas tenga vida eterna.

KJV.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

WEBM.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

JFA.text: E sabemos que todas as coisas contribuem juntamente para o bem daqueles que amam a Deus, daqueles que são chamados segundo o seu propósito.

RVA.text: Y sabemos que á los que á Dios aman, todas las cosas les ayudan á bien, es á saber, á los que conforme al propósito son llamados.

KJV.text: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.

WEBM.text: We know that all things work together for good for those who love God, to those who are called according to his purpose.

JFA.text: E não vos conformeis a este mundo, mas transformai-vos pela renovação da vossa mente, para que experimenteis qual seja a boa, agradável, e perfeita vontade de Deus.

RVA.text: Y no os conforméis á este siglo; mas reformaos por la renovación de vuestro entendimiento, para que experimentéis cuál sea la buena voluntad de Dios, agradable y perfecta.

KJV.text: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

WEBM.text: Don’t be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, so that you may prove what is the good, well-pleasing, and perfect will of God.

JFA.text: Não andeis ansiosos por coisa alguma; antes em tudo sejam os vossos pedidos conhecidos diante de Deus pela oração e súplica com ações de graças.

RVA.text: Por nada estéis afanosos; sino sean notorias vuestras peticiones delante de Dios en toda oración y ruego, con hacimiento de gracias.

KJV.text: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

WEBM.text: In nothing be anxious, but in everything, by prayer and petition with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God.

JFA.text: Confia no Senhor de todo o teu coração, e não te estribes no teu próprio entendimento.

RVA.text: Fíate de Jehová de todo tu corazón, Y no estribes en tu prudencia.

KJV.text: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

WEBM.text: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and don’t lean on your own understanding.

JFA.text: Posso todas as coisas naquele que me fortalece.

RVA.text: Todo lo puedo en Cristo que me fortalece.

KJV.text: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

WEBM.text: I can do all things through Christ, who strengthens me.

JFA.text: E a paz de Deus, que excede todo o entendimento, guardará os vossos corações e os vossos pensamentos em Cristo Jesus.

RVA.text: Y la paz de Dios, que sobrepuja todo entendimiento, guardará vuestros corazones y vuestros entendimientos en Cristo Jesús.

KJV.text: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

WEBM.text: And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus.

JFA.text: Reconhece-o em todos os teus caminhos, e ele endireitará as tuas veredas.

RVA.text: Reconócelo en todos tus caminos, Y él enderezará tus veredas.

KJV.text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

WEBM.text: In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

JFA.text: Mas buscai primeiro o seu reino e a sua justiça, e todas estas coisas vos serão acrescentadas.

RVA.text: Mas buscad primeramente el reino de Dios y su justicia, y todas estas cosas os serán añadidas.

KJV.text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

WEBM.text: But seek first God’s Kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well.

JFA.text: E sede cumpridores da palavra e não somente ouvintes, enganando-vos a vós mesmos.

RVA.text: Mas sed hacedores de la palabra, y no tan solamente oidores, engañándoos á vosotros mismos.

KJV.text: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

WEBM.text: But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves.

JFA.text: Por esta razão sofro também estas coisas, mas não me envergonho; porque eu sei em quem tenho crido, e estou certo de que ele é poderoso para guardar o meu depósito até aquele dia.

RVA.text: Por lo cual asimismo padezco esto: mas no me avergüenzo; porque yo sé á quien he creído, y estoy cierto que es poderoso para guardar mi depósito para aquel día.

KJV.text: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.

WEBM.text: For this cause I also suffer these things. Yet I am not ashamed, for I know him whom I have believed, and I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed to him against that day.

JFA.text: Ainda que eu ande pelo vale da sombra da morte, não temerei mal algum, porque tu estás comigo; a tua vara e o teu cajado me consolam.

RVA.text: Aunque ande en valle de sombra de muerte, No temeré mal alguno; porque tú estarás conmigo: Tu vara y tu cayado me infundirán aliento.

KJV.text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

WEBM.text: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me. Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

JFA.text: Pedro então lhes respondeu: Arrependei-vos, e cada um de vós seja batizado em nome de Jesus Cristo, para remissão de vossos pecados; e recebereis o dom do Espírito Santo.

RVA.text: Y Pedro les dice: Arrepentíos, y bautícese cada uno de vosotros en el nombre de Jesucristo para perdón de los pecados; y recibiréis el don del Espíritu Santo.

KJV.text: Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.

WEBM.text: Peter said to them, “Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.”

JFA.text: Um novo mandamento vos dou: que vos ameis uns aos outros; assim como eu vos amei a vós, que também vós vos ameis uns aos outros.

RVA.text: Un mandamiento nuevo os doy: Que os améis unos á otros: como os he amado, que también os améis los unos á los otros.

KJV.text: A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.

WEBM.text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also love one another.

JFA.text: Qual dentre todas estas coisas não sabe que a mão do Senhor fez isto?

RVA.text: ¿Qué cosa de todas estas no entiende Que la mano de Jehová la hizo?

KJV.text: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the Lord hath wrought this?

WEBM.text: Who doesn’t know that in all these, the Lord’s hand has done this,

JFA.text: Toda Escritura é divinamente inspirada e proveitosa para ensinar, para repreender, para corrigir, para instruir em justiça.

RVA.text: Toda Escritura es inspirada divinamente y útil para enseñar, para redargüir, para corregir, para instituir en justicia.

KJV.text: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

WEBM.text: Every Scripture is God-breathed and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness

JFA.text: Todas as coisas foram feitas por intermédio dele, e sem ele nada do que foi feito se fez.

RVA.text: Todas las cosas por él fueron hechas; y sin él nada de lo que es hecho, fué hecho.

KJV.text: All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.

WEBM.text: All things were made through him. Without him was not anything made that has been made.

JFA.text: A riqueza adquirida às pressas diminuira; mas quem a ajunta pouco a pouco terá aumento.

RVA.text: Disminuiránse las riquezas de vanidad: Empero multiplicará el que allega con su mano.

KJV.text: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

WEBM.text: Wealth gained dishonestly dwindles away, but he who gathers by hand makes it grow.

JFA.text: Ele enxugará de seus olhos toda lágrima; e não haverá mais morte, nem haverá mais pranto, nem lamento, nem dor; porque já as primeiras coisas são passadas.

RVA.text: Y limpiará Dios toda lágrima de los ojos de ellos; y la muerte no será más; y no habrá más llanto, ni clamor, ni dolor: porque las primeras cosas son pasadas.

KJV.text: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.

WEBM.text: He will wipe away from them every tear from their eyes. Death will be no more; neither will there be mourning, nor crying, nor pain, any more. The first things have passed away.

JFA.text: Somente em Deus espera silenciosa a minha alma; dele vem a minha salvação.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: á Jeduthúm: Salmo de David. EN Dios solamente está callada mi alma: De él viene mi salud.

KJV.text: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.

WEBM.text: My soul rests in God alone. My salvation is from him.

JFA.text: E ele me disse: A minha graça te basta, porque o meu poder se aperfeiçoa na fraqueza. Por isso, de boa vontade antes me gloriarei nas minhas fraquezas, a fim de que repouse sobre mim o poder de Cristo.

RVA.text: Y me ha dicho: Bástate mi gracia; porque mi potencia en la flaqueza se perfecciona. Por tanto, de buena gana me gloriaré más bien en mis flaquezas, porque habite en mí la potencia de Cristo.

KJV.text: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

WEBM.text: He has said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.” Most gladly therefore I will rather glory in my weaknesses, that the power of Christ may rest on me.

JFA.text: Instrui o menino no caminho em que deve andar, e até quando envelhecer não se desviará dele.

RVA.text: Instruye al niño en su carrera: Aun cuando fuere viejo no se apartará de ella.

KJV.text: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

WEBM.text: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.

JFA.text: E, aproximando-se Jesus, falou-lhes, dizendo: Foi-me dada toda a autoridade no céu e na terra.

RVA.text: Y llegando Jesús, les habló, diciendo: Toda potestad me es dada en el cielo y en la tierra.

KJV.text: And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth.

WEBM.text: Jesus came to them and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.”

JFA.text: Tudo tem a sua ocasião própria, e há tempo para todo propósito debaixo do céu.

RVA.text: Para todas las cosas hay sazón, y todo lo que se quiere debajo del cielo, tiene su tiempo.

KJV.text: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven.

WEBM.text: For everything there is a season, and a time for every purpose under heaven:

JFA.text: E não nos cansemos de fazer o bem, porque a seu tempo ceifaremos, se não houvermos desfalecido.

RVA.text: No nos cansemos, pues, de hacer bien; que á su tiempo segaremos, si no hubiéremos desmayado.

KJV.text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

WEBM.text: Let us not be weary in doing good, for we will reap in due season, if we don’t give up.

JFA.text: A tua fidelidade estende-se de geração a geração; tu firmaste a terra, e firme permanece.

RVA.text: Por generación y generación es tu verdad: Tú afirmaste la tierra, y persevera.

KJV.text: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

WEBM.text: Your faithfulness is to all generations. You have established the earth, and it remains.

JFA.text: Agora, pois, permanecem a fé, a esperança, o amor, estes três; mas o maior destes é o amor.

RVA.text: Y ahora permanecen la fe, la esperanza, y la caridad, estas tres: empero la mayor de ellas es la caridad.

KJV.text: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.

WEBM.text: But now faith, hope, and love remain—these three. The greatest of these is love.

JFA.text: Tu me farás conhecer a vereda da vida; na tua presença há plenitude de alegria; à tua mão direita há delícias perpetuamente.

RVA.text: Me mostrarás la senda de la vida: Hartura de alegrías hay con tu rostro; Deleites en tu diestra para siempre.

KJV.text: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.

WEBM.text: You will show me the path of life. In your presence is fullness of joy. In your right hand there are pleasures forever more.

JFA.text: Em verdade vos digo que se não vos converterdes e não vos fizerdes como crianças, de modo algum entrareis no reino dos céus.

RVA.text: Y dijo: De cierto os digo, que si no os volviereis, y fuereis como niños, no entraréis en el reino de los cielos.

KJV.text: And said, Verily I say unto you, Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.

WEBM.text: Most certainly I tell you, unless you turn, and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

JFA.text: Tu conservarás em paz aquele cuja mente está firme em ti; porque ele confia em ti.

RVA.text: Tú le guardarás en completa paz, cuyo pensamiento en ti persevera; porque en ti se ha confiado.

KJV.text: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.

WEBM.text: You will keep whoever’s mind is steadfast in perfect peace, because he trusts in you.

JFA.text: E andai em amor, como Cristo também vos amou, e se entregou a si mesmo por nós, como oferta e sacrifício a Deus, em cheiro suave.

RVA.text: Y andad en amor, como también Cristo nos amó, y se entregó á sí mismo por nosotros, ofrenda y sacrificio á Dios en olor suave.

KJV.text: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

WEBM.text: Walk in love, even as Christ also loved you, and gave himself up for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling fragrance.

JFA.text: Este é o dia que o Senhor fez; regozijemo-nos, e alegremo-nos nele.

RVA.text: Este es el día que hizo Jehová Nos gozaremos y alegraremos en él.

KJV.text: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

WEBM.text: This is the day that the Lord has made. We will rejoice and be glad in it!

JFA.text: Não se aparte da tua boca o livro desta lei, antes medita nele dia e noite, para que tenhas cuidado de fazer conforme tudo quanto nele está escrito; porque então farás prosperar o teu caminho, e serás bem sucedido.

RVA.text: El libro de aquesta ley nunca se apartará de tu boca: antes de día y de noche meditarás en él, para que guardes y hagas conforme á todo lo que en él está escrito: porque entonces harás prosperar tu camino, y todo te saldrá bien.

KJV.text: This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt meditate therein day and night, that thou mayest observe to do according to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thy way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success.

WEBM.text: This book of the law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, that you may observe to do according to all that is written in it; for then you shall make your way prosperous, and then you shall have good success.

JFA.text: E tudo quanto fizerdes, fazei-o de coração, como ao Senhor, e não aos homens.

RVA.text: Y todo lo que hagáis, hacedlo de ánimo, como al Señor, y no á los hombres.

KJV.text: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;

WEBM.text: And whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord, and not for men.

JFA.text: Pedí, e dar-se-vos-á; buscai, e achareis; batei e abrir-se-vos-á.

RVA.text: Pedid, y se os dará; buscad, y hallaréis; llamad, y se os abrirá.

KJV.text: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:

WEBM.text: Ask, and it will be given you. Seek, and you will find. Knock, and it will be opened for you.

JFA.text: Torre forte é o nome do Senhor; para ela corre o justo, e está seguro.

RVA.text: Torre fuerte es el nombre de Jehová: A él correrá el justo, y será levantado.

KJV.text: The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

WEBM.text: The Lord’s name is a strong tower: the righteous run to him, and are safe.

JFA.text: O Senhor é o meu pastor; nada me faltará.

RVA.text: Salmo de David. JEHOVA es mi pastor; nada me faltará.

KJV.text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.

WEBM.text: The Lord is my shepherd: I shall lack nothing.

JFA.text: Sede sóbrios, vigiai. O vosso adversário, o Diabo, anda em derredor, rugindo como leão, e procurando a quem possa tragar.

RVA.text: Sed templados, y velad; porque vuestro adversario el diablo, cual león rugiente, anda alrededor buscando á quien devore.

KJV.text: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

WEBM.text: Be sober and self-controlled. Be watchful. Your adversary, the devil, walks around like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.

JFA.text: O Senhor julga os povos; julga-me, Senhor, de acordo com a minha justiça e conforme a integridade que há em mim.

RVA.text: Jehová juzgará los pueblos: Júzgame, oh Jehová, conforme á mi justicia y conforme á mi integridad.

KJV.text: The Lord shall judge the people: judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

WEBM.text: The Lord administers judgment to the peoples. Judge me, Lord, according to my righteousness, and to my integrity that is in me.

JFA.text: Tendo por certo isto mesmo, que aquele que em vós começou a boa obra a aperfeiçoará até o dia de Cristo Jesus.

RVA.text: Estando confiado de esto, que el que comenzó en vosotros la buena obra, la perfeccionará hasta el día de Jesucristo.

KJV.text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:

WEBM.text: Being confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ.

JFA.text: O Senhor é bom, uma fortaleza no dia da angústia; e conhece os que nele confiam.

RVA.text: Bueno es Jehová para fortaleza en el día de la angustia; y conoce á los que en él confían.

KJV.text: The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.

WEBM.text: The Lord is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; and he knows those who take refuge in him.

JFA.text: Abençoai aos que vos perseguem; abençoai, e não amaldiçoeis.

RVA.text: Bendecid á los que os persiguen: bendecid y no maldigáis.

KJV.text: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.

WEBM.text: Bless those who persecute you; bless, and don’t curse.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurado o homem que suporta a provação; porque, depois de aprovado, receberá a coroa da vida, que o Senhor prometeu aos que o amam.

RVA.text: Bienaventurado el varón que sufre la tentación; porque cuando fuere probado, recibirá la corona de vida, que Dios ha prometido á los que le aman.

KJV.text: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

WEBM.text: Blessed is the man who endures temptation, for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord promised to those who love him.

JFA.text: Os céus proclamam a glória de Deus e o firmamento anuncia a obra das suas mãos.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: Salmo de David. Los cielos cuentan la gloria de Dios, Y la expansión denuncia la obra de sus manos.

KJV.text: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

WEBM.text: The heavens declare the glory of God. The expanse shows his handiwork.

JFA.text: Mas, como está escrito: As coisas que olhos não viram, nem ouvidos ouviram, nem penetraram o coração do homem, são as que Deus preparou para os que o amam.

RVA.text: Antes, como está escrito: Cosas que ojo no vió, ni oreja oyó, Ni han subido en corazón de hombre, Son las que ha Dios preparado para aquellos que le aman.

KJV.text: But as it is written, Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love him.

WEBM.text: Things which an eye didn’t see, and an ear didn’t hear, which didn’t enter into the heart of man, these God has prepared for those who love him.

JFA.text: Para que saibam que só tu, cujo nome é o Senhor, és o Altíssimo sobre toda a terra.

RVA.text: Y conozcan que tu nombre es JEHOVA; Tú solo Altísimo sobre toda la tierra

KJV.text: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is Jehovah, art the most high over all the earth.

WEBM.text: That they may know that you alone, whose name is the Lord, are the Most High over all the earth.

JFA.text: Mas, a todos quantos o receberam, aos que crêem no seu nome, deu-lhes o poder de se tornarem filhos de Deus.

RVA.text: Mas á todos los que le recibieron, dióles potestad de ser hechos hijos de Dios, á los que creen en su nombre.

KJV.text: But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name:

WEBM.text: But as many as received him, to them he gave the right to become God’s children, to those who believe in his name.

JFA.text: Verdadeiramente ele tomou sobre si as nossas enfermidades, e carregou com as nossas dores; e nós o reputávamos por aflito, ferido de Deus, e oprimido.

RVA.text: Ciertamente llevó él nuestras enfermedades, y sufrió nuestros dolores; y nosotros le tuvimos por azotado, por herido de Dios y abatido.

KJV.text: Surely he hath borne our griefs, and carried our sorrows: yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted.

WEBM.text: Surely he has borne our sickness, and carried our suffering; yet we considered him plagued, struck by God, and afflicted.

JFA.text: Mas Deus dá prova do seu amor para conosco, em que, quando éramos ainda pecadores, Cristo morreu por nós.

RVA.text: Mas Dios encarece su caridad para con nosotros, porque siendo aún pecadores, Cristo murió por nosotros.

KJV.text: But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

WEBM.text: But God commends his own love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

JFA.text: Criou, pois, Deus o homem à sua imagem; à imagem de Deus o criou; homem e mulher os criou.

RVA.text: Y crió Dios al hombre á su imagen, á imagen de Dios lo crió; varón y hembra los crió.

KJV.text: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.

WEBM.text: God created man in his own image. In God’s image he created him; male and female he created them.

JFA.text: Mas, ajuntai para vós tesouros no céu, onde nem a traça nem a ferrugem os consumem, e onde os ladrões não minam nem roubam.

RVA.text: Mas haceos tesoros en el cielo, donde ni polilla ni orín corrompe, y donde ladrones no minan ni hurtan.

KJV.text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal.

WEBM.text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don’t break through and steal.

JFA.text: Meu Deus suprirá todas as vossas necessidades segundo as suas riquezas na glória em Cristo Jesus.

RVA.text: Mi Dios, pues, suplirá todo lo que os falta conforme á sus riquezas en gloria en Cristo Jesús.

KJV.text: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

WEBM.text: My God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

JFA.text: Ó Senhor, quão multiformes são as tuas obras! Todas elas as fizeste com sabedoria; a terra está cheia das tuas riquezas.

RVA.text: Cuán muchas son tus obras, oh Jehová! Hiciste todas ellas con sabiduría: La tierra está llena de tus beneficios.

KJV.text: O Lord, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

WEBM.text: The Lord, how many are your works! In wisdom have you made them all. The earth is full of your riches.

JFA.text: Mas agora fomos libertos da lei, havendo morrido para aquilo em que estávamos retidos, para servirmos em novidade de espírito, e não na velhice da letra.

RVA.text: Mas ahora estamos libres de la ley, habiendo muerto á aquella en la cual estábamos detenidos, para que sirvamos en novedad de espíritu, y no en vejez de letra.

KJV.text: But now we are delivered from the law, that being dead wherein we were held; that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in the oldness of the letter.

WEBM.text: But now we have been discharged from the law, having died to that in which we were held; so that we serve in newness of the spirit, and not in oldness of the letter.

JFA.text: Não prosperará nenhuma arma forjada contra ti; e toda língua que se levantar contra ti em juízo, tu a condenarás; esta é a herança dos servos do Senhor, e a sua justificação que de mim procede, diz o Senhor.

RVA.text: Toda herramienta que fuere fabricada contra ti, no prosperará; y tú condenarás toda lengua que se levantare contra ti en juicio. Esta es la heredad de los siervos de Jehová, y su justicia de por mí, dijo Jehová.

KJV.text: No weapon that is formed against thee shall prosper; and every tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and their righteousness is of me, saith the Lord.

WEBM.text: No weapon that is formed against you will prevail; and you will condemn every tongue that rises against you in judgment. This is the heritage of the Lord’s servants, and their righteousness is of me.

JFA.text: Antes santificai em vossos corações a Cristo como Senhor; e estai sempre preparados para responder com mansidão e temor a todo aquele que vos pedir a razão da esperança que há em vós.

RVA.text: Sino santificad al Señor Dios en vuestros corazones, y estad siempre aparejados para responder con masedumbre y reverencia á cada uno que os demande razón de la esperanza que hay en vosotros.

KJV.text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

WEBM.text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts; and always be ready to give an answer to everyone who asks you a reason concerning the hope that is in you, with humility and fear.

JFA.text: Tu, Senhor, ouvirás os desejos dos mansos; confortarás o seu coração; inclinarás o teu ouvido.

RVA.text: El deseo de los humildes oíste, oh Jehová: Tú dispones su corazón, y haces atento tu oído.

KJV.text: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

WEBM.text: Lord, you have heard the desire of the humble. You will prepare their heart. You will cause your ear to hear.

JFA.text: Sejam agradáveis as palavras da minha boca e a meditação do meu coração perante a tua face, Senhor, Rocha minha e Redentor meu!

RVA.text: Sean gratos los dichos de mi boca y la meditación de mi corazón delante de ti, Oh Jehová, roca mía, y redentor mío.

KJV.text: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.

WEBM.text: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your sight, Lord, my rock, and my redeemer.

JFA.text: Virá, pois, como ladrão o dia do Senhor, no qual os céus passarão com grande estrondo, e os elementos, ardendo, se dissolverão, e a terra, e as obras que nela há, serão descobertas.

RVA.text: Mas el día del Señor vendrá como ladrón en la noche; en el cual los cielos pasarán con grande estruendo, y los elementos ardiendo serán deshechos, y la tierra y las obras que en ella están serán quemadas.

KJV.text: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.

WEBM.text: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in which the heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the elements will be dissolved with fervent heat, and the earth and the works that are in it will be burned up.

JFA.text: A benignidade do Senhor jamais acaba, as suas misericórdias não têm fim.

RVA.text: Es por la misericordia de Jehová que no somos consumidos, porque nunca decayeron sus misericordias.

KJV.text: It is of the Lord's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

WEBM.text: It is because of the Lord’s loving kindnesses that we are not consumed, because his compassion doesn’t fail.

JFA.text: Mas o fruto do Espírito é: o amor, o gozo, a paz, a longanimidade, a benignidade, a bondade, a fidelidade.

RVA.text: Mas el fruto del Espíritu es: caridad, gozo, paz, tolerancia, benignidad, bondad, fe.

KJV.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,

WEBM.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faith.

JFA.text: No princípio criou Deus os céus e a terra.

RVA.text: En el principio crió Dios los cielos y la tierra.

KJV.text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

WEBM.text: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.

JFA.text: Mas todos nós, com rosto descoberto, refletindo como um espelho a glória do Senhor, somos transformados de glória em glória na mesma imagem, como pelo Espírito do Senhor.

RVA.text: Por tanto, nosotros todos, mirando á cara descubierta como en un espejo la gloria del Señor, somos transformados de gloria en gloria en la misma semejanza, como por el Espíritu del Señor.

KJV.text: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the Lord.

WEBM.text: But we all, with unveiled face seeing the glory of the Lord as in a mirror, are transformed into the same image from glory to glory, even as from the Lord, the Spirit.

JFA.text: Ora, sem fé é impossível agradar a Deus; porque é necessário que aquele que se aproxima de Deus creia que ele existe, e que é galardoador dos que o buscam.

RVA.text: Empero sin fe es imposible agradar á Dios; porque es menester que el que á Dios se allega, crea que le hay, y que es galardonador de los que le buscan.

KJV.text: But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.

WEBM.text: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him, for he who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

JFA.text: E se o meu povo, que se chama pelo meu nome, se humilhar, e orar, e buscar a minha face, e se desviar dos seus maus caminhos, então eu ouvirei do céu, e perdoarei os seus pecados, e sararei a sua terra.

RVA.text: Si se humillare mi pueblo, sobre los cuales ni nombre es invocado, y oraren, y buscaren mi rostro, y se convirtieren de sus malos caminos; entonces yo oiré desde los cielos, y perdonaré sus pecados, y sanaré su tierra.

KJV.text: If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.

WEBM.text: If my people, who are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then I will hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.

JFA.text: Mas recebereis poder, ao descer sobre vós o Espírito Santo, e ser-me-eis testemunhas, tanto em Jerusalém, como em toda a Judéia e Samária, e até os confins da terra.

RVA.text: Mas recibiréis la virtud del Espíritu Santo que vendrá sobre vosotros; y me sereís testigos en Jerusalem, en toda Judea, y Samaria, y hasta lo último de la tierra.

KJV.text: But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

WEBM.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. You will be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the uttermost parts of the earth.

JFA.text: Cantarei para sempre as benignidades do Senhor; com a minha boca proclamarei a todas as gerações a tua fidelidade.

RVA.text: Masquil de Ethán Ezrahita. Las misericordias de Jehová cantaré perpetuamente; En generación y generación haré notoria tu verdad con mi boca.

KJV.text: I will sing of the mercies of the Lord for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

WEBM.text: I will sing of the loving kindness of the Lord forever. With my mouth, I will make known your faithfulness to all generations.

JFA.text: Nisto conhecerão todos que sois meus discípulos, se tiverdes amor uns aos outros.

RVA.text: En esto conocerán todos que sois mis discípulos, si tuviereis amor los unos con los otros.

KJV.text: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.

WEBM.text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.

JFA.text: Louvar-te-ei entre os povos, Senhor, cantar-te-ei louvores entre as nações.

RVA.text: Te alabaré, oh Jehová, entre los pueblos; A ti cantaré salmos entre las naciones.

KJV.text: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

WEBM.text: I will give thanks to you, Lord, among the nations. I will sing praises to you among the peoples.

JFA.text: Tenho posto o Senhor continuamente diante de mim; porquanto ele está à minha mão direita, não serei abalado.

RVA.text: A Jehová he puesto siempre delante de mí: Porque está á mi diestra no seré conmovido.

KJV.text: I have set the Lord always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

WEBM.text: I have set the Lord always before me. Because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

JFA.text: Cristo nos resgatou da maldição da lei, fazendo-se maldição por nós; porque está escrito: Maldito todo aquele que for pendurado no madeiro.

RVA.text: Cristo nos redimió de la maldición de la ley, hecho por nosotros maldición; (porque está escrito: Maldito cualquiera que es colgado en madero:)

KJV.text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree:

WEBM.text: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us. For it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”

JFA.text: Ele te declarou, ó homem, o que é bom; e que é o que o Senhor requer de ti, senão que pratiques a justiça, e ames a benevolência, e andes humildemente com o teu Deus?

RVA.text: Oh hombre, él te ha declarado qué sea lo bueno, y qué pida de ti Jehová: solamente hacer juicio, y amar misericordia, y humillarte para andar con tu Dios.

KJV.text: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?

WEBM.text: He has shown you, O man, what is good. What does the Lord require of you, but to act justly, to love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God?

JFA.text: Vinde a mim, todos os que estai cansados e oprimidos, e eu vos aliviarei.

RVA.text: Venid á mí todos los que estáis trabajados y cargados, que yo os haré descansar.

KJV.text: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

WEBM.text: Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.

JFA.text: Confessai, portanto, os vossos pecados uns aos outros, e orai uns pelos outros, para serdes curados. A súplica de um justo pode muito na sua atuação.

RVA.text: Confesaos vuestras faltas unos á otros, y rogad los unos por los otros, para que seáis sanos; la oración del justo, obrando eficazmente, puede mucho.

KJV.text: Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

WEBM.text: Confess your offenses to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The insistent prayer of a righteous person is powerfully effective.

JFA.text: Desde a extremidade da terra clamo a ti, estando abatido o meu coração; leva-me para a rocha que é mais alta do que eu.

RVA.text: Desde el cabo de la tierra clamaré á ti, cuando mi corazón desmayare: A la peña más alta que yo me conduzcas.

KJV.text: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

WEBM.text: From the end of the earth, I will call to you, when my heart is overwhelmed. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

JFA.text: Considerai os lírios, como crescem; não trabalham, nem fiam; contudo vos digo que nem mesmo Salomão, em toda a sua glória, se vestiu como um deles.

RVA.text: Considerad los lirios, cómo crecen: no labran, ni hilan; y os digo, que ni Salomón con toda su gloria se vistió como uno de ellos.

KJV.text: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

WEBM.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

JFA.text: Porque um menino nos nasceu, um filho se nos deu; e o governo estará sobre os seus ombros; e o seu nome será: Maravilhoso Conselheiro, Deus Forte, Pai Eterno, Príncipe da Paz.

RVA.text: Porque un niño nos es nacido, hijo nos es dado; y el principado sobre su hombro: y llamaráse su nombre Admirable, Consejero, Dios fuerte, Padre eterno, Príncipe de paz.

KJV.text: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given: and the government shall be upon his shoulder: and his name shall be called Wonderful, Counsellor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.

WEBM.text: For to us a child is born. To us a son is given; and the government will be on his shoulders. His name will be called Wonderful, Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.

JFA.text: Considerai os corvos, que não semeiam nem ceifam; não têm despensa nem celeiro; contudo, Deus os alimenta. Quanto mais não valeis vós do que as aves!

RVA.text: Considerad los cuervos, que ni siembran, ni siegan; que ni tienen cillero, ni alfolí; y Dios los alimenta. ¿Cuánto de más estima sois vosotros que las aves?

KJV.text: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?

WEBM.text: Consider the ravens: they don’t sow, they don’t reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!

JFA.text: Pois tu, Senhor, abençoas o justo; tu o circundas do teu favor como de um escudo.

RVA.text: Porque tú, oh Jehová, bendecirás al justo; Lo cercarás de benevolencia como con un escudo.

KJV.text: For thou, Lord, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.

WEBM.text: For you will bless the righteous. Lord, you will surround him with favor as with a shield.

JFA.text: Quanto ao mais, irmãos, tudo o que é verdadeiro, tudo o que é honesto, tudo o que é justo, tudo o que é puro, tudo o que é amável, tudo o que é de boa fama, se há alguma virtude, e se há algum louvor, nisso pensai.

RVA.text: Por lo demás, hermanos, todo lo que es verdadero, todo lo honesto, todo lo justo, todo lo puro, todo lo amable, todo lo que es de buen nombre; si hay virtud alguna, si alguna alabanza, en esto pensad.

KJV.text: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things.

WEBM.text: Finally, brothers, whatever things are true, whatever things are honorable, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report; if there is any virtue, and if there is any praise, think about these things.

JFA.text: Porque o cetro da impiedade não repousará sobre a sorte dos justos, para que os justos não estendam as suas mãos para cometer a iniquidade.

RVA.text: Porque no reposará la vara de la impiedad sobre la suerte de los justos; Porque no extiendan los justos sus manos á la iniquidad.

KJV.text: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.

WEBM.text: For the scepter of wickedness won’t remain over the allotment of the righteous; so that the righteous won’t use their hands to do evil.

JFA.text: Porque todos pecaram e destituídos estão da glória de Deus.

RVA.text: Por cuanto todos pecaron, y están distituídos de la gloria de Dios.

KJV.text: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

WEBM.text: For all have sinned, and fall short of the glory of God.

JFA.text: Porque o Senhor é justo; ele ama a justiça; os retos, pois, verão o seu rosto.

RVA.text: Porque el justo Jehová ama la justicia: Al recto mirará su rostro.

KJV.text: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

WEBM.text: For the Lord is righteous. He loves righteousness. The upright shall see his face.

JFA.text: Porque pela graça sois salvos, por meio da fé; e isto não vem de vós, é dom de Deus.

RVA.text: Porque por gracia sois salvos por la fe; y esto no de vosotros, pues es don de Dios.

KJV.text: For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:

WEBM.text: For by grace you have been saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God.

JFA.text: Por causa da opressão dos pobres, e do gemido dos necessitados, levantar-me-ei agora, diz o Senhor; porei em segurança quem por ela suspira.

RVA.text: Por la opresión de los pobres, por el gemido de los menesterosos, Ahora me levantaré, dice Jehová: Pondrélos en salvo del que contra ellos se engríe.

KJV.text: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the Lord; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.

WEBM.text: “Because of the oppression of the weak and because of the groaning of the needy, I will now arise,” says the Lord; “I will set him in safety from those who malign him.”

JFA.text: Porque nele foram criadas todas as coisas nos céus e na terra, as visíveis e as invisíveis, sejam tronos, sejam dominações, sejam principados, sejam potestades; tudo foi criado por ele e para ele.

RVA.text: Porque por él fueron criadas todas las cosas que están en los cielos, y que están en la tierra, visibles é invisibles; sean tronos, sean dominios, sean principados, sean potestades; todo fué criado por él y para él.

KJV.text: For by him were all things created, that are in heaven, and that are in earth, visible and invisible, whether they be thrones, or dominions, or principalities, or powers: all things were created by him, and for him:

WEBM.text: For by him all things were created, in the heavens and on the earth, things visible and things invisible, whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers; all things have been created through him, and for him.

JFA.text: Porquanto o Senhor Deus é sol e escudo; o Senhor dará graça e glória; não negará bem algum aos que andam na retidão.

RVA.text: Porque sol y escudo es Jehová Dios: Gracia y gloria dará Jehová: No quitará el bien á los que en integridad andan.

KJV.text: For the Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

WEBM.text: For the Lord God is a sun and a shield. The Lord will give grace and glory. He withholds no good thing from those who walk blamelessly.

JFA.text: Porque Deus não nos deu o espírito de covardia, mas de poder, de amor e de moderação.

RVA.text: Porque no nos ha dado Dios el espíritu de temor, sino el de fortaleza, y de amor, y de templanza.

KJV.text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

WEBM.text: For God didn’t give us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and self-control.

JFA.text: Porque os meus pensamentos não são os vossos pensamentos, nem os vossos caminhos os meus caminhos, diz o Senhor.

RVA.text: Porque mis pensamientos no son vuestros pensamientos, ni vuestros caminos mis caminos, dijo Jehová.

KJV.text: For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, saith the Lord.

WEBM.text: “For my thoughts are not your thoughts, and your ways are not my ways,” says the Lord.

JFA.text: Porque Deus não é injusto, para se esquecer da vossa obra, e do amor que para com o seu nome mostrastes, porquanto servistes aos santos, e ainda os servis.

RVA.text: Porque Dios no es injusto para olvidar vuestra obra y el trabajo de amor que habéis mostrado á su nombre, habiendo asistido y asistiendo aún á los santos.

KJV.text: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.

WEBM.text: For God is not unrighteous, so as to forget your work and the labor of love which you showed toward his name, in that you served the saints, and still do serve them.

JFA.text: Porque derramarei água sobre o sedento, e correntes sobre a terra seca; derramarei o meu Espírito sobre a tua posteridade, e a minha bênção sobre a tua descendência.

RVA.text: Porque yo derramaré aguas sobre el secadal, y ríos sobre la tierra árida: mi espíritu derramaré sobre tu generación, y mi bendición sobre tus renuevos.

KJV.text: For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty, and floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my spirit upon thy seed, and my blessing upon thine offspring:

WEBM.text: For I will pour water on him who is thirsty, and streams on the dry ground. I will pour my Spirit on your descendants, and my blessing on your offspring.

JFA.text: Porque Deus enviou o seu Filho ao mundo, não para que julgasse o mundo, mas para que o mundo fosse salvo por ele.

RVA.text: Porque no envió Dios á su Hijo al mundo, para que condene al mundo, mas para que el mundo sea salvo por él.

KJV.text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.

WEBM.text: For God didn’t send his Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world should be saved through him.

JFA.text: Pois eu sei que o meu Redentor vive, e que por fim se levantará sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Yo sé que mi Redentor vive, Y al fin se levantará sobre el polvo.

KJV.text: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:

WEBM.text: But as for me, I know that my Redeemer lives. In the end, he will stand upon the earth.

JFA.text: Âquele que não conheceu pecado, Deus o fez pecado por nós; para que nele fôssemos feitos justiça de Deus.

RVA.text: Al que no conoció pecado, hizo pecado por nosotros, para que nosotros fuésemos hechos justicia de Dios en él.

KJV.text: For he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.

WEBM.text: For him who knew no sin he made to be sin on our behalf; so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

JFA.text: Porque a sua ira dura só um momento; no seu favor está a vida. O choro pode durar uma noite; pela manhã, porém, vem o cântico de júbilo.

RVA.text: Porque un momento será su furor; Mas en su voluntad está la vida: Por la tarde durará el lloró, Y á la mañana vendrá la alegría.

KJV.text: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

WEBM.text: For his anger is but for a moment. His favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may stay for the night, but joy comes in the morning.

JFA.text: Porque estou certo de que, nem a morte, nem a vida, nem anjos, nem principados, nem coisas presentes, nem futuras, nem potestades.

RVA.text: Por lo cual estoy cierto que ni la muerte, ni la vida, ni ángeles, ni principados, ni potestades, ni lo presente, ni lo por venir.

KJV.text: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,

WEBM.text: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers.

JFA.text: Porque aos seus anjos dará ordem a teu respeito, para te guardarem em todos os teus caminhos.

RVA.text: Pues que á sus ángeles mandará acerca de ti, Que te guarden en todos tus caminos.

KJV.text: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

WEBM.text: For he will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you in all your ways.

JFA.text: Porque vale mais um dia nos teus átrios do que em outra parte mil. Preferiria estar à porta da casa do meu Deus, a habitar nas tendas da perversidade.

RVA.text: Porque mejor es un día en tus atrios que mil fuera de ellos: Escogería antes estar á la puerta de la casa de mi Dios, Que habitar en las moradas de maldad.

KJV.text: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

WEBM.text: For a day in your courts is better than a thousand. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

JFA.text: Não temas, porque eu sou contigo; não te assombres, porque eu sou teu Deus; eu te fortaleço, e te ajudo, e te sustento com a destra da minha justiça.

RVA.text: No temas, que yo soy contigo; no desmayes, que yo soy tu Dios que te esfuerzo: siempre te ayudaré, siempre te sustentaré con la diestra de mi justicia.

KJV.text: Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.

WEBM.text: Don’t you be afraid, for I am with you. Don’t be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you. Yes, I will help you. Yes, I will uphold you with the right hand of my righteousness.

JFA.text: Porque o meu jugo é suave, e o meu fardo e leve.

RVA.text: Porque mi yugo es fácil, y ligera mi carga.

KJV.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.

WEBM.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.

JFA.text: Porque a sua ira dura só um momento; no seu favor está a vida. O choro pode durar uma noite; pela manhã, porém, vem o cântico de júbilo.

RVA.text: Pon asimismo tu delicia en Jehová, Y él te dará las peticiones de tu corazón.

KJV.text: Delight thyself also in the Lord: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.

WEBM.text: Also delight yourself in the Lord, and he will give you the desires of your heart.

JFA.text: Porque o nosso evangelho não foi a vós somente em palavras, mas também em poder, e no Espírito Santo e em plena convicção, como bem sabeis quais fomos entre vós por amor de vós.

RVA.text: Por cuanto nuestro evangelio no fué á vosotros en palabra solamente, mas también en potencia, y en Espíritu Santo, y en gran plenitud; como sabéis cuáles fuimos entre vosotros por amor de vosotros.

KJV.text: For our gospel came not unto you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Ghost, and in much assurance; as ye know what manner of men we were among you for your sake.

WEBM.text: And that our Good News came to you not in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Spirit, and with much assurance. You know what kind of men we showed ourselves to be among you for your sake.

JFA.text: Mas os que esperam no Senhor renovarão as suas forças; subirão com asas como águias; correrão, e não se cansarão; andarão, e não se fatigarão.

RVA.text: Mas los que esperan á Jehová tendrán nuevas fuerzas; levantarán las alas como águilas, correrán, y no se cansarán, caminarán, y no se fatigarán.

KJV.text: But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.

WEBM.text: But those who wait for the Lord will renew their strength. They will mount up with wings like eagles. They will run, and not be weary. They will walk, and not faint.

JFA.text: Pois os seus atributos invisíveis, o seu eterno poder e divindade, são claramente vistos desde a criação do mundo, sendo percebidos mediante as coisas criadas, de modo que eles são inescusáveis.

RVA.text: Porque las cosas invisibles de él, su eterna potencia y divinidad, se echan de ver desde la creación del mundo, siendo entendidas por las cosas que son hechas; de modo que son inexcusables.

KJV.text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

WEBM.text: For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse.

JFA.text: Mas agora, ó Senhor, tu és nosso Pai; nós somos o barro, e tu o nosso oleiro; e todos nós obra das tuas mãos.

RVA.text: Ahora pues, Jehová, tú eres nuestro padre; nosotros lodo, y tú el que nos formaste; así que obra de tus manos, todos nosotros.

KJV.text: But now, O Lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.

WEBM.text: But now, Lord, you are our Father. We are the clay, and you our potter. We all are the work of your hand.

JFA.text: Porque o amor ao dinheiro é raiz de todos os males; e nessa cobiça alguns se desviaram da fé, e se traspassaram a si mesmos com muitas dores.

RVA.text: Porque el amor del dinero es la raíz de todos los males: el cual codiciando algunos, se descaminaron de la fe, y fueron traspasados de muchos dolores.

KJV.text: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

WEBM.text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some have been led astray from the faith in their greed, and have pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

JFA.text: Mas alegrem-se todos os que confiam em ti; exultem eternamente, porquanto tu os defendes; sim, gloriem-se em ti os que amam o teu nome.

RVA.text: Y alegrarse han todos los que en ti confían; Para siempre darán voces de júbilo, porque tú los defiendes: Y en ti se regocijarán los que aman tu nombre.

KJV.text: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

WEBM.text: But let all those who take refuge in you rejoice, Let them always shout for joy, because you defend them. Let them also who love your name be joyful in you.

JFA.text: Porque o salário do pecado é a morte, mas o dom gratuito de Deus é a vida eterna em Cristo Jesus nosso Senhor.

RVA.text: Porque la paga del pecado es muerte: mas la dádiva de Dios es vida eterna en Cristo Jesús Señor nuestro.

KJV.text: For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

WEBM.text: For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

JFA.text: Mas eu confio na tua benignidade; o meu coração se regozija na tua salvação.

RVA.text: Mas yo en tu misericordia he confiado: Alegraráse mi corazón en tu salud.

KJV.text: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.

WEBM.text: But I trust in your loving kindness. My heart rejoices in your salvation.

JFA.text: Porque a palavra de Deus é viva e eficaz, e mais cortante do que qualquer espada de dois gumes, e penetra até a divisão de alma e espírito, e de juntas e medulas, e é apta para discernir os pensamentos e intenções do coração.

RVA.text: Porque la palabra de Dios es viva y eficaz, y más penetrante que toda espada de dos filos: y que alcanza hasta partir el alma, y aun el espíritu, y las coyunturas y tuétanos, y discierne los pensamientos y las intenciones del corazón.

KJV.text: For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

WEBM.text: For the word of God is living and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the dividing of soul and spirit, of both joints and marrow, and is able to discern the thoughts and intentions of the heart.

JFA.text: Mas ele foi ferido por causa das nossas transgressões, e esmagado por causa das nossas iniqüidades; o castigo que nos traz a paz estava sobre ele, e pelas suas pisaduras fomos sarados.

RVA.text: Mas él herido fué por nuestras rebeliones, molido por nuestros pecados: el castigo de nuestra paz sobre él; y por su llaga fuimos nosotros curados.

KJV.text: But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.

WEBM.text: But he was pierced for our transgressions. He was crushed for our iniquities. The punishment that brought our peace was on him; and by his wounds we are healed.

JFA.text: Porque somos feitura sua, criados em Cristo Jesus para boas obras, as quais Deus antes preparou para que andássemos nelas.

RVA.text: Porque somos hechura suya, criados en Cristo Jesús para buenas obras, las cuales Dios preparó para que anduviésemos en ellas.

KJV.text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath before ordained that we should walk in them.

WEBM.text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared before that we would walk in them.

JFA.text: Porque nos temos tornado participantes de Cristo, se é que guardamos firme até o fim a nossa confiança inicial.

RVA.text: Porque participantes de Cristo somos hechos, con tal que conservemos firme hasta el fin el principio de nuestra confianza.

KJV.text: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;

WEBM.text: For we have become partakers of Christ, if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm to the end.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurado o homem que não anda segundo o conselho dos ímpios, nem se detém no caminho dos pecadores, nem se assenta na roda dos escarnecedores.

RVA.text: Bienaventurado el varón que no anduvo en consejo de malos, Ni estuvo en camino de pecadores, Ni en silla de escarnecedores se ha sentado.

KJV.text: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.

WEBM.text: Blessed is the man who doesn’t walk in the counsel of the wicked, nor stand on the path of sinners, nor sit in the seat of scoffers.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados os que guardam os seus testemunhos, que o buscam de todo o coração.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los que guardan sus testimonios, Y con todo el corazón le buscan.

KJV.text: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

WEBM.text: Blessed are those who keep his statutes, who seek him with their whole heart.

JFA.text: Porque andamos por fé, e não por vista.

RVA.text: Porque por fe andamos, no por vista.

KJV.text: For we walk by faith, not by sight:

WEBM.text: For we walk by faith, not by sight.

JFA.text: Oh! quão bom e quão suave é que os irmãos vivam em união!

RVA.text: Cántico gradual: de David. ­Mirad cuán bueno y cuán delicioso es Habitar los hermanos igualmente en uno!

KJV.text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

WEBM.text: See how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to live together in unity!

JFA.text: Pois não é contra carne e sangue que temos que lutar, mas sim contra os principados, contra as potestades, conta os príncipes do mundo destas trevas, contra as hostes espirituais da iniquidade nas regiões celestes.

RVA.text: Porque no tenemos lucha contra sangre y carne; sino contra principados, contra potestades, contra señores del mundo, gobernadores de estas tinieblas, contra malicias espirituales en los aires.
