KJV.text: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.

WEBM.text: For our wrestling is not against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, against the powers, against the world’s rulers of the darkness of this age, and against the spiritual forces of wickedness in the heavenly places.

JFA.text: Sede fortes e corajosos; não temais, nem vos atemorizeis diante deles; porque o Senhor vosso Deus é quem vai convosco. Não vos deixará, nem vos desamparará.

RVA.text: Esforzaos y cobrad ánimo; no temáis, ni tengáis miedo de ellos: que Jehová tu Dios es el que va contigo: no te dejará ni te desamparará.

KJV.text: Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the Lord thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.

WEBM.text: Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid or scared of them; for the Lord your God himself is who goes with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you.

JFA.text: Pois que aproveita ao homem se ganhar o mundo inteiro e perder a sua vida? ou que dará o homem em troca da sua vida?

RVA.text: Porque ¿de qué aprovecha al hombre, si granjeare todo el mundo, y perdiere su alma? O ¿qué recompensa dará el hombre por su alma?

KJV.text: For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

WEBM.text: For what will it profit a man, if he gains the whole world, and forfeits his life? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?

JFA.text: Aquietai-vos, e sabei que eu sou Deus; sou exaltado entre as nações, sou exaltado na terra.

RVA.text: Estad quietos, y conoced que yo soy Dios: Ensalzado he de ser entre las gentes, ensalzado seré en la tierra.

KJV.text: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

WEBM.text: Be still, and know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations. I will be exalted in the earth.

JFA.text: Porque todo o que é nascido de Deus vence o mundo; e esta é a vitória que vence o mundo: a nossa fé.

RVA.text: Porque todo aquello que es nacido de Dios vence al mundo: y esta es la victoria que vence al mundo, nuestra fe.

KJV.text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith.

WEBM.text: For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. This is the victory that has overcome the world: your faith.

JFA.text: Levanta-te, resplandece, porque é chegada a tua luz, e é nascida sobre ti a glória do Senhor.

RVA.text: Levantate, resplandece; que ha venido tu lumbre, y la gloria de Jehová ha nacido sobre ti.

KJV.text: Arise, shine; for thy light is come, and the glory of the Lord is risen upon thee.

WEBM.text: Arise, shine; for your light has come, and the Lord’s glory has risen on you.

JFA.text: Em ti confiam os que conhecem o teu nome; porque tu, Senhor, não abandonas aqueles que te buscam.

RVA.text: Y en ti confiarán los que conocen tu nombre; Por cuanto tú, oh Jehová, no desamparaste á los que te buscaron.

KJV.text: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

WEBM.text: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, for you, Lord, have not forsaken those who seek you.

JFA.text: Porque vós, irmãos, fostes chamados à liberdade. Mas não useis da liberdade para dar ocasião à carne, antes pelo amor servi-vos uns aos outros.

RVA.text: Porque vosotros, hermanos, á libertad habéis sido llamados; solamente que no uséis la libertad como ocasión á la carne, sino servíos por amor los unos á los otros.

KJV.text: For, brethren, ye have been called unto liberty; only use not liberty for an occasion to the flesh, but by love serve one another.

WEBM.text: For you, brothers, were called for freedom. Only don’t use your freedom for gain to the flesh, but through love be servants to one another.

JFA.text: E quando a minha glória passar, eu te porei numa fenda da penha, e te cobrirei com a minha mão, até que eu haja passado.

RVA.text: Y será que, cuando pasare mi gloria, yo te pondré en una hendidura de la peña, y te cubriré con mi mano hasta que haya pasado.

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a clift of the rock, and will cover thee with my hand while I pass by:

WEBM.text: It will happen, while my glory passes by, that I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and will cover you with my hand until I have passed by.

JFA.text: Portanto ide, fazei discípulos de todas as nações, batizando-os em nome do Pai, e do Filho, e do Espírito Santo.

RVA.text: Por tanto, id, y doctrinad á todos los Gentiles, bautizándolos en el nombre del Padre, y del Hijo, y del Espíritu Santo.

KJV.text: Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost:

WEBM.text: Go, and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

JFA.text: Mas, se vos parece mal o servirdes ao Senhor, escolhei hoje a quem haveis de servir; se aos deuses a quem serviram vossos pais, que estavam além do Rio, ou aos deuses dos amorreus, em cuja terra habitais. Porém eu e a minha casa serviremos ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Y si mal os parece servir á Jehová, escogeos hoy á quién sirváis; si á los dioses á quienes siervieron vuestros padres, cuando estuvieron de esotra parte del río, ó á los dioses de los Amorrheos en cuya tierra habitáis: que yo y mi casa serviremos á Jehová.

KJV.text: And if it seem evil unto you to serve the Lord, choose you this day whom ye will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were on the other side of the flood, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.

WEBM.text: If it seems evil to you to serve the Lord, choose today whom you will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell; but as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.

JFA.text: Ninguém tem maior amor do que este, de dar alguém a sua vida pelos seus amigos.

RVA.text: Nadie tiene mayor amor que este, que ponga alguno su vida por sus amigos.

KJV.text: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

WEBM.text: Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.

JFA.text: Pois será como a árvore plantada junto às correntes de águas, a qual dá o seu fruto na estação própria, e cuja folha não cai; e tudo quanto fizer prosperará.

RVA.text: Y será como el árbol plantado junto á arroyos de aguas, Que da su fruto en su tiempo, Y su hoja no cae; Y todo lo que hace, prosperará.

KJV.text: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

WEBM.text: He will be like a tree planted by the streams of water, that produces its fruit in its season, whose leaf also does not wither. Whatever he does shall prosper.

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: Se é pecador, não sei; uma coisa sei: eu era cego, e agora vejo.

RVA.text: Entonces él respondió, y dijo: Si es pecador, no lo sé: una cosa sé, que habiendo yo sido ciego, ahora veo.

KJV.text: He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner or no, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.

WEBM.text: He therefore answered, “I don’t know if he is a sinner. One thing I do know: that though I was blind, now I see.”

JFA.text: E disse Deus: Façamos o homem à nossa imagem, conforme a nossa semelhança; domine ele sobre os peixes do mar, sobre as aves do céu, sobre os animais domésticos, e sobre toda a terra, e sobre todo réptil que se arrasta sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Hagamos al hombre á nuestra imagen, conforme á nuestra semejanza; y señoree en los peces de la mar, y en las aves de los cielos, y en las bestias, y en toda la tierra, y en todo animal que anda arrastrando sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let’s make man in our image, after our likeness. Let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the sky, and over the livestock, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth.”

JFA.text: Nisto conhecemos o amor: que Cristo deu a sua vida por nós; e nós devemos dar a vida pelos irmãos.

RVA.text: En esto hemos conocido el amor, porque él puso su vida por nosotros: también nosotros debemos poner nuestras vidas por los hermanos.

KJV.text: Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.

WEBM.text: By this we know love, because he laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

JFA.text: Disse Deus: haja luz. E houve luz.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Sea la luz: y fué la luz.

KJV.text: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.

JFA.text: Conserva o modelo das sãs palavras que de mim tens ouvido na fé e no amor que há em Cristo Jesus.

RVA.text: Retén la forma de las sanas palabras que de mi oíste, en la fe y amor que es en Cristo Jesús.

KJV.text: Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

WEBM.text: Hold the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

JFA.text: Honra a teu pai e a tua mãe; e amarás o teu próximo como a ti mesmo.

RVA.text: Honra á tu padre y á tu madre: y, Amarás á tu prójimo como á ti mismo.

KJV.text: Honour thy father and thy mother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

WEBM.text: ‘Honor your father and mother.’ And, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’

JFA.text: Um varão servirá de abrigo contra o vento, e um refúgio contra a tempestade, como ribeiros de águas em lugares secos, e como a sombra duma grande penha em terra sedenta.

RVA.text: Y será aquel varón como escondedero contra el viento, y como acogida contra el turbión; como arroyos de aguas en tierra de sequedad, como sombra de gran peñasco en tierra calurosa.

KJV.text: And a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place, as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.

WEBM.text: A man shall be as a hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the storm, as streams of water in a dry place, as the shade of a large rock in a weary land.

JFA.text: Humilhai-vos, pois, debaixo da potente mão de Deus, para que a seu tempo vos exalte.

RVA.text: Humillaos pues bajo la poderosa mano de Dios, para que él os ensalce cuando fuere tiempo.

KJV.text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:

WEBM.text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time.

JFA.text: Todos nós andávamos desgarrados como ovelhas, cada um se desviava pelo seu caminho; mas o Senhor fez cair sobre ele a iniqüidade de todos nós.

RVA.text: Todos nosotros nos descarriamos como ovejas, cada cual se apartó por su camino: mas Jehová cargó en él el pecado de todos nosotros.

KJV.text: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to his own way; and the Lord hath laid on him the iniquity of us all.

WEBM.text: All we like sheep have gone astray. Everyone has turned to his own way; and the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.

JFA.text: Vós, maridos, amai a vossas mulheres, como também Cristo amou a igreja, e a si mesmo se entregou por ela.

RVA.text: Maridos, amad á vuestras mujeres, así como Cristo amó á la iglesia, y se entregó á sí mismo por ella.

KJV.text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

WEBM.text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the assembly, and gave himself up for it.

JFA.text: O coração alegre serve de bom remédio; mas o espírito abatido seca os ossos.

RVA.text: El corazón alegre produce buena disposición: Mas el espíritu triste seca los huesos.

KJV.text: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

WEBM.text: A cheerful heart makes good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

JFA.text: Já estou crucificado com Cristo; e vivo, não mais eu, mas Cristo vive em mim; e a vida que agora vivo na carne, vivo-a na fé no filho de Deus, o qual me amou, e se entregou a si mesmo por mim.

RVA.text: Con Cristo estoy juntamente crucificado, y vivo, no ya yo, mas vive Cristo en mí: y lo que ahora vivo en la carne, lo vivo en la fe del Hijo de Dios, el cual me amó, y se entregó á sí mismo por mí.

KJV.text: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.

WEBM.text: I have been crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I that live, but Christ living in me. That life which I now live in the flesh, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself up for me.

JFA.text: Pois será como a árvore plantada junto às correntes de águas, a qual dá o seu fruto na estação própria, e cuja folha não cai; e tudo quanto fizer prosperará.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: sobre Muth-labben: Salmo de David. Te alabaré, oh Jehová, con todo mi corazón; Contaré todas tus maravillas.

KJV.text: I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

WEBM.text: I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart. I will tell of all your marvelous works.

JFA.text: Rogo-vos pois, irmãos, pela compaixão de Deus, que apresenteis os vossos corpos como um sacrifício vivo, santo e agradável a Deus, que é o vosso culto racional.

RVA.text: Asi que, hermanos, os ruego por las misericordias de Dios, que presentéis vuestros cuerpos en sacrificio vivo, santo, agradable á Dios, que es vuestro racional culto.

KJV.text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.

WEBM.text: Therefore I urge you, brothers, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your spiritual service.

JFA.text: Disse-lhes mais: Ide, comei as gorduras, e bebei as doçuras, e enviai porções aos que não têm nada preparado para si; porque este dia é consagrado ao nosso Senhor. Portanto não vos entristeçais, pois a alegria do Senhor é a vossa força.

RVA.text: Díjoles luego: Id, comed grosuras, y bebed vino dulce, y enviad porciones á los que no tienen prevenido; porque día santo es á nuestro Señor: y no os entristezcáis, porque el gozo de Jehová es vuestra fortaleza.

KJV.text: Then he said unto them, Go your way, eat the fat, and drink the sweet, and send portions unto them for whom nothing is prepared: for this day is holy unto our Lord: neither be ye sorry; for the joy of the Lord is your strength.

WEBM.text: Then he said to them, “Go your way. Eat the fat, drink the sweet, and send portions to him for whom nothing is prepared; for today is holy to our Lord. Don’t be grieved; for the joy of the Lord is your strength.”

JFA.text: Combati o bom combate, acabei a carreira, guardei a fé.

RVA.text: He peleado la buena batalla, he acabado la carrera, he guardado la fe.

KJV.text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:

WEBM.text: I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith.

JFA.text: Em tudo vos dei o exemplo de que assim trabalhando, é necessário socorrer os enfermos, recordando as palavras do Senhor Jesus, porquanto ele mesmo disse: Coisa mais bem-aventurada é dar do que receber.

RVA.text: En todo os he enseñado que, trabajando así, es necesario sobrellevar á los enfermos, y tener presente las palabras del Señor Jesús, el cual dijo: Más bienaventurada cosa es dar que recibir.

KJV.text: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

WEBM.text: In all things I gave you an example, that so laboring you ought to help the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, that he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’

JFA.text: Dou graças ao meu Deus todas as vezes que me lembro de vós.

RVA.text: Doy gracias á mi Dios en toda memoria de vosotros.

KJV.text: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,

WEBM.text: I thank my God whenever I remember you.

JFA.text: Se confessarmos os nossos pecados, ele é fiel e justo para nos perdoar os pecados e nos purificar de toda injustiça.

RVA.text: Si confesamos nuestros pecados, él es fiel y justo para que nos perdone nuestros pecados, y nos limpie de toda maldad.

KJV.text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

WEBM.text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and righteous to forgive us the sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

JFA.text: Na casa de meu Pai há muitas moradas; se não fosse assim, eu vo-lo teria dito; vou preparar-vos lugar.

RVA.text: En la casa de mi Padre muchas moradas hay: de otra manera os lo hubiera dicho: voy, pues, á preparar lugar para vosotros.

KJV.text: In my Father's house are many mansions: if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.

WEBM.text: In my Father’s house are many homes. If it weren’t so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.

JFA.text: No princípio era o Verbo, e o Verbo estava com Deus, e o Verbo era Deus.

RVA.text: En el principio era el Verbo, y el Verbo era con Dios, y el Verbo era Dios.

KJV.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

WEBM.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

JFA.text: Declarou-lhe Jesus: Eu sou a ressurreição e a vida; quem crê em mim, ainda que morra, viverá.

RVA.text: Dícele Jesús: Yo soy la resurrección y la vida: el que cree en mí, aunque esté muerto, vivirá.

KJV.text: Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:

WEBM.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will still live, even if he dies.”

JFA.text: Ao que lhe disse Jesus: Se podes! - tudo é possível ao que crê.

RVA.text: Y Jesús le dijo: Si puedes creer, al que cree todo es posible.

KJV.text: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Jesus: Amarás ao Senhor teu Deus de todo o teu coração, de toda a tua alma, e de todo o teu entendimento.

RVA.text: Y Jesús le dijo: Amarás al Señor tu Dios de todo tu corazón, y de toda tu alma, y de toda tu mente.

KJV.text: Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Jesus: Eu sou o caminho, e a verdade, e a vida; ninguém vem ao Pai, senão por mim.

RVA.text: Jesús le dice: Yo soy el camino, y la verdad, y la vida: nadie viene al Padre, sino por mí.

KJV.text: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.”

JFA.text: A palavra de Cristo habite em vós ricamente, em toda a sabedoria; ensinai-vos e admoestai-vos uns aos outros, com salmos, hinos e cânticos espirituais, louvando a Deus com gratidão em vossos corações.

RVA.text: La palabra de Cristo habite en vosotros en abundancia en toda sabiduría, enseñándoos y exhortándoos los unos á los otros con salmos é himnos y canciones espirituales, con gracia cantando en vuestros corazones al Señor.

KJV.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

WEBM.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly; in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your heart to the Lord.

JFA.text: Cheguemo-nos, pois, confiadamente ao trono da graça, para que recebamos misericórdia e achemos graça, a fim de sermos socorridos no momento oportuno.

RVA.text: Lleguémonos pues confiadamente al trono de la gracia, para alcanzar misericordia, y hallar gracia para el oportuno socorro.

KJV.text: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.

WEBM.text: Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy, and may find grace for help in time of need.

JFA.text: Seja a vossa vida isenta de ganância, contentando-vos com o que tendes; porque ele mesmo disse: Não te deixarei, nem te desampararei.

RVA.text: Sean las costumbres vuestras sin avaricia; contentos de lo presente; porque él dijo: No te desampararé, ni te dejaré.

KJV.text: Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

WEBM.text: Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said, “I will in no way leave you, neither will I in any way forsake you.”

JFA.text: Fitando os olhos em Jesus, autor e consumador da nossa fé, o qual, pelo gozo que lhe está proposto, suportou a cruz, desprezando a ignomínia, e está assentado à direita do trono de Deus.

RVA.text: Puestos los ojos en al autor y consumador de la fe, en Jesús; el cual, habiéndole sido propuesto gozo, sufrió la cruz, menospreciando la vergüenza, y sentóse á la diestra del trono de Dios.

KJV.text: Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

WEBM.text: Looking to Jesus, the author and perfecter of faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising its shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.

JFA.text: E em nenhum outro há salvação; porque debaixo do céu nenhum outro nome há, dado entre os homens, em que devamos ser salvos.

RVA.text: Y en ningún otro hay salud; porque no hay otro nombre debajo del cielo, dado á los hombres, en que podamos ser salvos.

KJV.text: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.

WEBM.text: There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!

JFA.text: Todavia o firme fundamento de Deus permanece, tendo este selo: O Senhor conhece os seus, e: Aparte-se da injustiça todo aquele que profere o nome do Senhor.

RVA.text: Pero el fundamento de Dios está firme, teniendo este sello: Conoce el Señor á los que son suyos; y: Apártese de iniquidad todo aquel que invoca el nombre de Cristo.

KJV.text: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

WEBM.text: However God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”

JFA.text: Ninguém pode servir a dois senhores; porque ou há de odiar a um e amar o outro, ou há de dedicar-se a um e desprezar o outro. Não podeis servir a Deus e às riquezas.

RVA.text: Ninguno puede servir á dos señores; porque ó aborrecerá al uno y amará al otro, ó se llegará al uno y menospreciará al otro: no podéis servir á Dios y á Mammón.

KJV.text: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

WEBM.text: No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can’t serve both God and Mammon.

JFA.text: Ninguém jamais viu a Deus; e nos amamos uns aos outros, Deus permanece em nós, e o seu amor é em nós aperfeiçoado.

RVA.text: Ninguno vió jamás á Dios. Si nos amamos unos á otros, Dios está en nosotros, y su amor es perfecto en nosotros.

KJV.text: No man hath seen God at any time. If we love one another, God dwelleth in us, and his love is perfected in us.

WEBM.text: No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God remains in us, and his love has been perfected in us.

JFA.text: Não abandonando a nossa congregação, como é costume de alguns, antes admoestando-nos uns aos outros; e tanto mais, quanto vedes que se vai aproximando aquele dia.

RVA.text: No dejando nuestra congregación, como algunos tienen por costumbre, mas exhortándonos; y tanto más, cuanto veis que aquel día se acerca.

KJV.text: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

WEBM.text: Not forsaking our own assembling together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another; and so much the more, as you see the Day approaching.

JFA.text: Ora, a fé é o firme fundamento das coisas que se esperam, e a prova das coisas que não se vêem.

RVA.text: Es pues la fe la sustancia de las cosas que se esperan, la demostración de las cosas que no se ven.

KJV.text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

WEBM.text: Now faith is assurance of things hoped for, proof of things not seen.

JFA.text: Graças, porém, a Deus que em Cristo sempre nos conduz em triunfo, e por meio de nós difunde em todo lugar o cheiro do seu conhecimento.

RVA.text: Mas á Dios gracias, el cual hace que siempre triunfemos en Cristo Jesús, y manifiesta el olor de su conocimiento por nosotros en todo lugar.

KJV.text: Now thanks be unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.

WEBM.text: Now thanks be to God, who always leads us in triumph in Christ, and reveals through us the sweet aroma of his knowledge in every place.

JFA.text: Ora, o Deus de esperança vos encha de todo o gozo e paz na vossa fé, para que abundeis na esperança pelo poder do Espírito Santo.

RVA.text: Y el Dios de esperanza os llene de todo gozo y paz creyendo, para que abundéis en esperanza por la virtud del Espíritu Santo.

KJV.text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost

WEBM.text: Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope, in the power of the Holy Spirit.

JFA.text: Ora, àquele que é poderoso para fazer tudo muito mais abundantemente além daquilo que pedimos ou pensamos, segundo o poder que em nós opera.

RVA.text: Y á Aquel que es poderoso para hacer todas las cosas mucho más abundantemente de lo que pedimos ó entendemos, por la potencia que obra en nosotros.

KJV.text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,

WEBM.text: Now to him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us,

JFA.text: Ó profundidade das riquezas, tanto da sabedoria, como da ciência de Deus! Quão insondáveis são os seus juízos, e quão inescrutáveis os seus caminhos!

RVA.text: Oh profundidad de las riquezas de la sabiduría y de la ciencia de Dios! ­Cuán incomprensibles son sus juicios, e inescrutables sus caminos!

KJV.text: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!

WEBM.text: Oh the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God! How unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past tracing out!

JFA.text: Deixo-vos a paz, a minha paz vos dou; eu não vo-la dou como o mundo a dá. Não se turbe o vosso coração, nem se atemorize.

RVA.text: La paz os dejo, mi paz os doy: no como el mundo la da, yo os la doy. No se turbe vuestro corazón, ni tenga miedo.

KJV.text: Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

WEBM.text: Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, give I to you. Don’t let your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.

JFA.text: Revesti-vos de toda a armadura de Deus, para poderdes permanecer firmes contra as ciladas do Diabo.

RVA.text: Vestíos de toda la armadura de Dios, para que podáis estar firmes contra las asechanzas del diablo.

KJV.text: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

WEBM.text: Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

JFA.text: Revestí-vos, pois, como eleitos de Deus, santos e amados, de coração compassivo, de benignidade, humildade, mansidão, longanimidade.

RVA.text: Vestíos pues, como escogidos de Dios, santos y amados, de entrañas de misericordia, de benignidad, de humildad, de mansedumbre, de tolerancia.

KJV.text: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;

WEBM.text: Put on therefore, as God’s chosen ones, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, humility, and perseverance.

JFA.text: Lembrai-vos da palavra que eu vos disse: Não é o servo maior do que o seu senhor. Se a mim me perseguiram, também vos perseguirão a vós; se guardaram a minha palavra, guardarão também a vossa.

RVA.text: Acordaos de la palabra que yo os he dicho: No es el siervo mayor que su señor. Si á mí mé han perseguido, también á vosotros perseguirán: si han guardado mi palabra, también guardarán la vuestra.

KJV.text: Remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep yours also.

WEBM.text: Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A servant is not greater than his lord.’If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will keep yours also.

JFA.text: Logo a fé é pelo ouvir, e o ouvir pela palavra de Cristo.

RVA.text: Luego la fe es por el oir; y el oir por la palabra de Dios.

KJV.text: So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

WEBM.text: So faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

JFA.text: Procura apresentar-te diante de Deus aprovado, como obreiro que não tem de que se envergonhar, que maneja bem a palavra da verdade.

RVA.text: Procura con diligencia presentarte á Dios aprobado, como obrero que no tiene de qué avergonzarse, que traza bien la palabra de verdad.

KJV.text: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

WEBM.text: Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.

JFA.text: Sujeitai-vos, pois, a Deus; mas resisti ao Diabo, e ele fugirá de vós.

RVA.text: Someteos pues á Dios; resistid al diablo, y de vosotros huirá.

KJV.text: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

WEBM.text: Be subject therefore to God. But resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

JFA.text: Tomai sobre vós o meu jugo, e aprendei de mim, que sou manso e humilde de coração; e achareis descanso para as vossas almas.

RVA.text: Llevad mi yugo sobre vosotros, y aprended de mí, que soy manso y humilde de corazón; y hallaréis descanso para vuestras almas.

KJV.text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

WEBM.text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.

JFA.text: Ensinando-os a observar todas as coisas que eu vos tenho mandado; e eis que eu estou convosco todos os dias, até a consumação dos séculos.

RVA.text: Enseñándoles que guarden todas las cosas que os he mandado: y he aquí, yo estoy con vosotros todos los días, hasta el fin del mundo. Amén.

KJV.text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you always, even unto the end of the world. Amen.

WEBM.text: Teaching them to observe all things that I commanded you. Behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.

JFA.text: Porque, se com a tua boca confessares a Jesus como Senhor, e em teu coração creres que Deus o ressuscitou dentre os mortos, será salvo.

RVA.text: Que si confesares con tu boca al Señor Jesús, y creyeres en tu corazón que Dios le levantó de los muertos, serás salvo.

KJV.text: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.

WEBM.text: If you will confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord, and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

JFA.text: O ladrão não vem senão para roubar, matar e destruir; eu vim para que tenham vida e a tenham em abundância.

RVA.text: El ladrón no viene sino para hurtar, y matar, y destruir: yo he venido para que tengan vida, y para que la tengan en abundancia.

KJV.text: The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.

WEBM.text: The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.

JFA.text: E de noite disse o Senhor em visão a Paulo: Não temas, mas fala e não te cales.

RVA.text: Entonces él Señor dijo de noche en visión á Pablo: No temas, sino habla, y no calles.

KJV.text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:

WEBM.text: The Lord said to Paul in the night by a vision, “Don’t be afraid, but speak and don’t be silent.”

JFA.text: Não vos sobreveio nenhuma tentação, senão humana; mas fiel é Deus, o qual não deixará que sejais tentados acima do que podeis resistir, antes com a tentação dará também o meio de saída, para que a possais suportar.

RVA.text: No os ha tomado tentación, sino humana: mas fiel es Dios, que no os dejará ser tentados más de lo que podeís llevar; antes dará también juntamente con la tentación la salida, para que podáis aguantar.

KJV.text: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.

WEBM.text: No temptation has taken you except what is common to man. God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted above what you are able, but will with the temptation also make the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.

JFA.text: No amor não há medo antes o perfeito amor lança fora o medo; porque o medo envolve castigo; e quem tem medo não está aperfeiçoado no amor.

RVA.text: En amor no hay temor; mas el perfecto amor echa fuera el temor: porque el temor tiene pena. De donde el que teme, no está perfecto en el amor.

KJV.text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in love.

WEBM.text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear, because fear has punishment. He who fears is not made perfect in love.

JFA.text: Portanto, tudo o que vós quereis que os homens vos façam, fazei-lho também vós a eles; porque esta é a lei e os profetas.

RVA.text: Así que, todas las cosas que quisierais que los hombres hiciesen con vosotros, así también haced vosotros con ellos; porque esta es la ley y los profetas.

KJV.text: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.

WEBM.text: Therefore whatever you desire for men to do to you, you shall also do to them; for this is the law and the prophets.

JFA.text: Justificados, pois, pela fé, tenhamos paz com Deus, por nosso Senhor Jesus Cristo.

RVA.text: Justificados pues por la fe, tenemos paz para con Dios por medio de nuestro Señor Jesucristo:

KJV.text: Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:

WEBM.text: Being therefore justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ;

JFA.text: Pelo que, se alguém está em Cristo, nova criatura é; as coisas velhas já passaram; eis que tudo se fez novo.

RVA.text: De modo que si alguno está en Cristo, nueva criatura es: las cosas viejas pasaron; he aquí todas son hechas nuevas.

KJV.text: Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

WEBM.text: Therefore if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old things have passed away. Behold, all things have become new.

JFA.text: Tenho-vos dito estas coisas, para que em mim tenhais paz. No mundo tereis tribulações; mas tende bom ânimo, eu venci o mundo.

RVA.text: Estas cosas os he hablado, para que en mí tengáis paz. En el mundo tendréis aflicción: mas confiad, yo he vencido al mundo.

KJV.text: These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.

WEBM.text: I have told you these things, that in me you may have peace. In the world you have oppression; but cheer up! I have overcome the world.

JFA.text: Em verdade, em verdade vos digo que quem ouve a minha palavra, e crê naquele que me enviou, tem a vida eterna e não entra em juízo, mas já passou da morte para a vida.

RVA.text: De cierto, de cierto os digo: El que oye mi palabra, y cree al que me ha enviado, tiene vida eterna; y no vendrá á condenación, mas pasó de muerte á vida.

KJV.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.

WEBM.text: Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn’t come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.

JFA.text: Vigiai e orai, para que não entreis em tentação; o espírito, na verdade, está pronto, mas a carne é fraca.

RVA.text: Velad y orad, para que no entréis en tentación: el espíritu á la verdad es presto, mas la carne enferma.

KJV.text: Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. The spirit truly is ready, but the flesh is weak.

WEBM.text: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

JFA.text: Quando eu era menino, pensava como menino; mas, logo que cheguei a ser homem, acabei com as coisas de menino.

RVA.text: Cuando yo era niño, hablaba como niño, pensaba como niño, juzgaba como niño, mas cuando ya fuí hombre hecho, dejé lo que era de niño.

KJV.text: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.

WEBM.text: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become a man, I have put away childish things.

JFA.text: Pelas quais ele nos tem dado as suas preciosas e grandíssimas promessas, para que por elas vos torneis participantes da natureza divina, havendo escapado da corrupção, que pela concupiscência há no mundo.

RVA.text: Por las cuales nos son dadas preciosas y grandísimas promesas, para que por ellas fueseis hechos participantes de la naturaleza divina, habiendo huído de la corrupción que está en el mundo por concupiscencia.

KJV.text: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

WEBM.text: By which he has granted to us his precious and exceedingly great promises; that through these you may become partakers of the divine nature, having escaped from the corruption that is in the world by lust.

JFA.text: Pelo que, recebendo nós um reino que não pode ser abalado, retenhamos a graça, pela qual sirvamos a Deus agradavelmente, com reverência e temor.

RVA.text: Así que, tomando el reino inmóvil, vamos á Dios agradándole con temor y reverencia.

KJV.text: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

WEBM.text: Therefore, receiving a Kingdom that can’t be shaken, let us have grace, through which we serve God acceptably, with reverence and awe.

JFA.text: A quem, sem o terdes visto, amais; no qual, sem agora o verdes, mas crendo, exultais com gozo inefável e cheio de glória.

RVA.text: Al cual, no habiendo visto, le amáis; en el cual creyendo, aunque al presente no lo veáis, os alegráis con gozo inefable y glorificado.

KJV.text: Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

WEBM.text: Whom not having known you love; in whom, though now you don’t see him, yet believing, you rejoice greatly with joy unspeakable and full of glory.

JFA.text: Vós não me escolhestes a mim mas eu vos escolhi a vós, e vos designei, para que vades e deis frutos, e o vosso fruto permaneça, a fim de que tudo quanto pedirdes ao Pai em meu nome, ele vo-lo conceda.

RVA.text: No me elegisteis vosotros á mí, mas yo os elegí á vosotros; y os he puesto para que vayáis y llevéis fruto, y vuestro fruto permanezca: para que todo lo que pidiereis del Padre en mi nombre, él os lo dé.

KJV.text: Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

WEBM.text: You didn’t choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain; that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name, he may give it to you.

JFA.text: O Senhor é a minha luz e a minha salvação; a quem temerei? O Senhor é a força da minha vida; de quem me recearei?

RVA.text: Salmo de David. JEHOVA es mi luz y mi salvación: ¿de quién temeré? Jehová es la fortaleza de mi vida: ¿de quién he de atemorizarme?

KJV.text: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

WEBM.text: The Lord is my light and my salvation. Whom shall I fear? The Lord is the strength of my life. Of whom shall I be afraid?

JFA.text: Em verdade vos digo: Tudo quanto ligardes na terra será ligado no céu; e tudo quanto desligardes na terra será desligado no céu.

RVA.text: De cierto os digo que todo lo que ligareis en la tierra, será ligado en el cielo; y todo lo que desatareis en la tierra, será desatado en el cielo.

KJV.text: Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

WEBM.text: Most certainly I tell you, whatever things you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you release on earth will have been released in heaven.

JFA.text: Porque o Filho do homem veio salvar o que se havia perdido.

RVA.text: Porque el Hijo del hombre ha venido para salvar lo que se había perdido.

KJV.text: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.

WEBM.text: For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.

JFA.text: Filhinhos, vós sois de Deus, e já os tendes vencido; porque maior é aquele que está em vós do que aquele que está no mundo.

RVA.text: Hijitos, vosotros sois de Dios, y los habéis vencido; porque el que en vosotros está, es mayor que el que está en el mundo.

KJV.text: Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

WEBM.text: You are of God, little children, and have overcome them; because greater is he who is in you than he who is in the world.

JFA.text: Porque nele vivemos, e nos movemos, e existimos; como também alguns dos vossos poetas disseram: Pois dele também somos geração.

RVA.text: Porque en él vivimos, y nos movemos, y somos; como también algunos de vuestros poetas dijeron: Porque linaje de éste somos también.

KJV.text: For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.

WEBM.text: ‘For in him we live, and move, and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘For we are also his offspring.’

JFA.text: Humilhai-vos perante o Senhor, e ele vos exaltará.

RVA.text: Humillaos delante del Señor, y él os ensalzará.

KJV.text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

WEBM.text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you.

JFA.text: Nem a altura, nem a profundidade, nem qualquer outra criatura nos poderá separar do amor de Deus, que está em Cristo Jesus nosso Senhor.

RVA.text: Ni lo alto, ni lo bajo, ni ninguna criatura nos podrá apartar del amor de Dios, que es en Cristo Jesús Señor nuestro.

KJV.text: Nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

WEBM.text: Nor height, nor depth, nor any other created thing, will be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

JFA.text: Disse-lhes ele: Por causa da vossa pouca fé; pois em verdade vos digo que, se tiverdes fé como um grão de mostarda direis a este monte: Passa daqui para acolá, e ele há de passar; e nada vos será impossível.

RVA.text: Y Jesús les dijo: Por vuestra incredulidad; porque de cierto os digo, que si tuviereis fe como un grano de mostaza, diréis á este monte: Pásate de aquí allá: y se pasará: y nada os será imposible.

KJV.text: And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.

WEBM.text: He said to them, Because of your unbelief. For most certainly I tell you, if you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will tell this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.

JFA.text: Quem tem o Filho tem a vida; quem não tem o Filho de Deus não tem a vida.

RVA.text: El que tiene al Hijo, tiene al vida: el que no tiene la Hijo de Dios, no tiene la vida.

KJV.text: He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

WEBM.text: He who has the Son has the life. He who doesn’t have God’s Son doesn’t have the life.

JFA.text: Lança o teu fardo sobre o Senhor, e ele te susterá; nunca permitirá que o justo seja abalado.

RVA.text: Echa sobre Jehová tu carga, y él te sustentará; No dejará para siempre caído al justo.

KJV.text: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.

WEBM.text: Cast your burden on the Lord, and he will sustain you. He will never allow the righteous to be moved.

JFA.text: Bendito seja o Deus e Pai de nosso Senhor Jesus Cristo, que, segundo a sua grande misericórdia, nos regenerou para uma viva esperança, pela ressurreição de Jesus Cristo dentre os mortos.

RVA.text: Bendito el Dios y Padre de nuestro Señor Jesucristo, que según su grande misericordia nos ha regenerado en esperanza viva, por la resurrección de Jesucristo de los muertos.

KJV.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

WEBM.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy became our father again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.

JFA.text: E as ensinarás a teus filhos, e delas falarás sentado em tua casa e andando pelo caminho, ao deitar-te e ao levantar-te.

RVA.text: Y las repetirás á tus hijos, y hablarás de ellas estando en tu casa, y andando por el camino, y al acostarte, y cuando te levantes.

KJV.text: And thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.

WEBM.text: And you shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up.

JFA.text: Sempre dando graças por tudo a Deus, o Pai, em nome de nosso Senhor Jesus Cristo.

RVA.text: Dando gracias siempre de todo al Dios y Padre en el nombre de nuestro Señor Jesucristo.

KJV.text: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

WEBM.text: Giving thanks always concerning all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God, even the Father;

JFA.text: Levando ele mesmo os nossos pecados em seu corpo sobre o madeiro, para que mortos para os pecados, pudéssemos viver para a justiça; e pelas suas feridas fostes sarados.

RVA.text: El cual mismo llevó nuestros pecados en su cuerpo sobre el madero, para que nosotros siendo muertos á los pecados, vivamos á la justicia: por la herida del cual habéis sido sanados.

KJV.text: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

WEBM.text: Who his own self bore our sins in his body on the tree, that we, having died to sins, might live to righteousness; by whose stripes you were healed.

JFA.text: Disse-lhe o seu senhor: Muito bem, servo bom e fiel; sobre o pouco foste fiel, sobre muito te colocarei; entra no gozo do teu senhor.

RVA.text: Su señor le dijo: Bien, buen siervo y fiel; sobre poco has sido fiel, sobre mucho te pondré: entra en el gozo de tu señor.

KJV.text: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

WEBM.text: His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’

JFA.text: O temor do Senhor é o princípio do conhecimento; mas os insensatos desprezam a sabedoria e a instrução.

RVA.text: El principio de la sabiduría es el temor de Jehová: Los insensatos desprecian la sabiduría y la enseñanza.

KJV.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

WEBM.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge; but the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.

JFA.text: Entrai pelas suas portas com ação de graças, e em seus átrios com louvor; dai-lhe graças e bendizei o seu nome.

RVA.text: Entrad por sus puertas con reconocimiento, Por sus atrios con alabanza: Alabadle, bendecid su nombre.

KJV.text: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, and bless his name.

WEBM.text: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, into his courts with praise. Give thanks to him, and bless his name.

JFA.text: No dia em que eu temer, hei de confiar em ti.

RVA.text: En el día que temo, Yo en ti confío.

KJV.text: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

WEBM.text: When I am afraid, I will put my trust in you.

JFA.text: Jesus, fixando os olhos neles, respondeu: Para os homens é impossível, mas não para Deus; porque para Deus tudo é possível.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús mirándolos, dice: Para los hombres es imposible; mas para Dios, no; porque todas las cosas son posibles para Dios.

KJV.text: And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.

WEBM.text: Jesus, looking at them, said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.”

JFA.text: Eis que estou contigo, e te guardarei por onde quer que fores, e te farei tornar a esta terra; pois não te deixarei até que haja cumprido aquilo de que te tenho falado.

RVA.text: Y he aquí, yo soy contigo, y te guardaré por donde quiera que fueres, y te volveré á esta tierra; porque no te dejaré hasta tanto que haya hecho lo que te he dicho.

KJV.text: And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.

WEBM.text: Behold, I am with you, and will keep you, wherever you go, and will bring you again into this land. For I will not leave you, until I have done that which I have spoken of to you.

JFA.text: Porque não me envergonho do evangelho, pois é o poder de Deus para salvação de todo aquele que crê; primeiro do judeu, e também do grego.

RVA.text: Porque no me avergüenzo del evangelio: porque es potencia de Dios para salud á todo aquel que cree; al Judío primeramente y también al Griego.

KJV.text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

WEBM.text: For I am not ashamed of the Good News of Christ, for it is the power of God for salvation for everyone who believes; for the Jew first, and also for the Greek.

JFA.text: Orai sem cessar.

RVA.text: Orad sin cesar.

KJV.text: Pray without ceasing.

WEBM.text: Pray without ceasing.

JFA.text: Porque o Senhor é bom; a sua benignidade dura para sempre, e a sua fidelidade de geração em geração.

RVA.text: Porque Jehová es bueno: para siempre es su misericordia, Y su verdad por todas las generaciones.

KJV.text: For the Lord is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.

WEBM.text: For the Lord is good. His loving kindness endures forever, his faithfulness to all generations.

JFA.text: E nós conhecemos, e cremos no amor que Deus nos tem. Deus é amor; e quem permanece em amor, permanece em Deus, e Deus nele.

RVA.text: Y nosotros hemos conocido y creído el amor que Dios tiene para con nosotros. Dios es amor; y el que vive en amor, vive en Dios, y Dios en él.

KJV.text: And we have known and believed the love that God hath to us. God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.

WEBM.text: We know and have believed the love which God has for us. God is love, and he who remains in love remains in God, and God remains in him.

JFA.text: Porque: Todo aquele que invocar o nome do Senhor será salvo.

RVA.text: Porque todo aquel que invocare el nombre del Señor, será salvo.

KJV.text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

WEBM.text: For, “Whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.”

JFA.text: Paulo, chamado para ser apóstolo de Jesus Cristo pela vontade de Deus, e o irmão Sóstenes.

RVA.text: Porque la palabra de la cruz es locura á los que se pierden; mas á los que se salvan, es á saber, á nosotros, es potencia de Dios.

KJV.text: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.

WEBM.text: For the word of the cross is foolishness to those who are dying, but to us who are saved it is the power of God.

JFA.text: Porque eu, o Senhor teu Deus, te seguro pela tua mão direita, e te digo: Não temas; eu te ajudarei.

RVA.text: Porque yo Jehová soy tu Dios, que te ase de tu mano derecha, y te dice: No temas, yo te ayudé.

KJV.text: For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.

WEBM.text: For I, the Lord your God, will hold your right hand, saying to you, ‘Don’t be afraid. I will help you.’

JFA.text: Lâmpada para os meus pés é a tua palavra, e luz para o meu caminho.

RVA.text: Lámpara es á mis pies tu palabra, Y lumbrera á mi camino.

KJV.text: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

WEBM.text: Your word is a lamp to my feet, and a light for my path.

JFA.text: E esta é a confiança que temos nele, que se pedirmos alguma coisa segundo a sua vontade, ele nos ouve.

RVA.text: Y esta es la confianza que tenemos en él, que si demandáremos alguna cosa conforme á su voluntad, él nos oye.

KJV.text: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

WEBM.text: This is the boldness which we have toward him, that, if we ask anything according to his will, he listens to us.

JFA.text: Digno és, Senhor nosso e Deus nosso, de receber a glória e a honra e o poder; porque tu criaste todas as coisas, e por tua vontade existiram e foram criadas.

RVA.text: Señor, digno eres de recibir gloria y honra y virtud: porque tú criaste todas las cosas, y por tu voluntad tienen ser y fueron criadas.

KJV.text: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.

WEBM.text: “Worthy are you, our Lord and God, the Holy One, to receive the glory, the honor, and the power, for you created all things, and because of your desire they existed, and were created!”

JFA.text: Amados, amemo-nos uns aos outros, porque o amor é de Deus; e todo o que ama é nascido de Deus e conhece a Deus.

RVA.text: Carísimos, amémonos unos á otros; porque el amor es de Dios. Cualquiera que ama, es nacido de Dios, y conoce á Dios.

KJV.text: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

WEBM.text: Beloved, let us love one another, for love is of God; and everyone who loves has been born of God, and knows God.

JFA.text: Vai ter com a formiga, ó preguiçoso, considera os seus caminhos, e sê sábio.

RVA.text: Ve á la hormiga, oh perezoso Mira sus caminos, y sé sabio.

KJV.text: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

WEBM.text: Go to the ant, you sluggard. Consider her ways, and be wise;

JFA.text: Apagai as tuas transgressões como a névoa, e os teus pecados como a nuvem; torna-te para mim, porque eu te remi.

RVA.text: Yo deshice como á nube tus rebeliones, y como á niebla tus pecados: tórnate á mí, porque yo te redimí.

KJV.text: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins: return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.

WEBM.text: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.

JFA.text: Ah! Senhor Deus! És tu que fizeste os céus e a terra com o teu grande poder, e com o teu braço estendido! Nada há que te seja demasiado difícil!

RVA.text: Oh Señor Jehová! he aquí que tú hiciste el cielo y la tierra con tu gran poder, y con tu brazo extendido, ni hay nada que sea difícil para ti.

KJV.text: Ah Lord God! behold, thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thy great power and stretched out arm, and there is nothing too hard for thee:

WEBM.text: Ah Lord! Behold, you have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm; there is nothing too hard for you,

JFA.text: Pois atrai a si as gotas de água, e do seu vapor as destila em chuva.

RVA.text: El reduce las gotas de las aguas, Al derramarse la lluvia según el vapor.

KJV.text: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:

WEBM.text: For he draws up the drops of water, which distill in rain from his vapor.

JFA.text: Do Senhor é a terra e a sua plenitude; o mundo e aqueles que nele habitam.

RVA.text: Salmo de David. De Jehová es la tierra y su plenitud; El mundo, y los que en él habitan.

KJV.text: The earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

WEBM.text: The earth is the Lord’s, with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

JFA.text: Este é o fim do discurso; tudo já foi ouvido: Teme a Deus, e guarda os seus mandamentos; porque isto é todo o dever do homem.

RVA.text: El fin de todo el discurso oído es este: Teme á Dios, y guarda sus mandamientos; porque esto es el todo del hombre.

KJV.text: Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.

WEBM.text: This is the end of the matter. All has been heard. Fear God, and keep his commandments; for this is the whole duty of man.

JFA.text: Portanto, meus amados irmãos, sede firmes e constantes, sempre abundantes na obra do Senhor, sabendo que o vosso trabalho não é vão no Senhor.

RVA.text: Así que, hermanos míos amados, estad firmes y constantes, creciendo en la obra del Señor siempre, sabiendo que vuestro trabajo en el Señor no es vano.

KJV.text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

WEBM.text: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the Lord’s work, because you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

JFA.text: O tolo derrama toda a sua ira; mas o sábio a reprime e aplaca.

RVA.text: El necio da suelta á todo su espíritu; Mas el sabio al fin le sosiega.

KJV.text: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

WEBM.text: A fool vents all of his anger, but a wise man brings himself under control.

JFA.text: Responderam eles: Crê no Senhor Jesus e serás salvo, tu e tua casa.

RVA.text: Y ellos dijeron: Cree en el Señor Jesucristo, y serás salvo tú, y tu casa.

KJV.text: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.

WEBM.text: They said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved, you and your household.”

JFA.text: O coração do homem propõe o seu caminho; mas o Senhor lhe dirige os passos.

RVA.text: El corazón del hombre piensa su camino: Mas Jehová endereza sus pasos.

KJV.text: A man's heart deviseth his way: but the Lord directeth his steps.

WEBM.text: A man’s heart plans his course, but the Lord directs his steps.

JFA.text: Que diremos, pois, a estas coisas? Se Deus é por nós, quem será contra nós?

RVA.text: ¿Pues qué diremos á esto? Si Dios por nosotros, ¿quién contra nosotros?

KJV.text: What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?

WEBM.text: What then shall we say about these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?

JFA.text: Também vos darei um coração novo, e porei dentro de vós um espírito novo; e tirarei da vossa carne o coração de pedra, e vos darei um coração de carne.

RVA.text: Y os daré corazón nuevo, y pondré espíritu nuevo dentro de vosotros; y quitaré de vuestra carne el corazón de piedra, y os daré corazón de carne.

KJV.text: A new heart also will I give you, and a new spirit will I put within you: and I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you an heart of flesh.

WEBM.text: I will also give you a new heart, and I will put a new spirit within you; and I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you a heart of flesh.

JFA.text: E tudo o que pedirdes na oração, crendo, recebereis.

RVA.text: Y todo lo que pidiereis en oración, creyendo, lo recibiréis.

KJV.text: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.

WEBM.text: All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.

JFA.text: Apega-te, pois, a Deus, e tem paz, e assim te sobrevirá o bem.

RVA.text: Amístate ahora con él, y tendrás paz; Y por ello te vendrá bien.

KJV.text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

WEBM.text: Acquaint yourself with him, now, and be at peace. Thereby good shall come to you.

JFA.text: Antes sede bondosos uns para com os outros, compassivos, perdoando-vos uns aos outros, como também Deus vos perdoou em Cristo.

RVA.text: Antes sed los unos con los otros benignos, misericordiosos, perdónandoos los unos á los otros, como también Dios os perdonó en Cristo.

KJV.text: And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.

WEBM.text: And be kind to one another, tender hearted, forgiving each other, just as God also in Christ forgave you.

JFA.text: E invoca-me no dia da angústia; eu te livrarei, e tu me glorificarás.

RVA.text: E invócame en el día de la angustia: Te libraré, y tú me honrarás.

KJV.text: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

WEBM.text: Call on me in the day of trouble. I will deliver you, and you will honor me.

JFA.text: E viu Deus tudo quanto fizera, e eis que era muito bom. E foi a tarde e a manhã, o dia sexto.

RVA.text: Y vió Dios todo lo que había hecho, y he aquí que era bueno en gran manera. Y fué la tarde y la mañana el día sexto.

KJV.text: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.

WEBM.text: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, a sixth day.

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe o Senhor: Eu mesmo irei contigo, e eu te darei descanso.

RVA.text: Y él dijo: Mi rostro irá contigo, y te haré descansar.

KJV.text: And he said, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.

WEBM.text: He said, “My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”

JFA.text: E disse-lhes: Ide por todo o mundo, e pregai o evangelho a toda criatura.

RVA.text: Y les dijo: Id por todo el mundo; predicad el evangelio á toda criatura.

KJV.text: And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.

WEBM.text: He said to them, “Go into all the world, and preach the Good News to the whole creation.”

JFA.text: Amarás, pois, ao Senhor teu Deus de todo o teu coração, de toda a tua alma e de todas as tuas forças.

RVA.text: Y Amarás á Jehová tu Dios de todo tu corazón, y de toda tu alma, y con todo tu poder.

KJV.text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.

WEBM.text: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your might.

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhes: As coisas que são impossíveis aos homens são possíveis a Deus.

RVA.text: Y él les dijo: Lo que es imposible para con los hombres, posible es para Dios.

KJV.text: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

WEBM.text: But he said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”

JFA.text: Quanto o oriente está longe do ocidente, tanto tem ele afastado de nós as nossas transgressões.

RVA.text: Cuanto está lejos el oriente del occidente, Hizo alejar de nosotros nuestras rebeliones.

KJV.text: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

WEBM.text: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.

JFA.text: Disse-lhes: Vinde após mim, e eu vos farei pescadores de homens.

RVA.text: Y díceles: Venid en pos de mí, y os haré pescadores de hombres.

KJV.text: And he saith unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.

WEBM.text: He said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you fishers for men.”

JFA.text: Esforçai-vos, e fortaleça-se o vosso coração, vós todos os que esperais no Senhor.

RVA.text: Esforzaos todos vosotros los que esperáis en Jehová, Y tome vuestro corazón aliento.

KJV.text: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.

WEBM.text: Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who hope in the Lord.

JFA.text: Pelo que eu vos digo: Pedi, e dar-se-vos-á; buscai e achareis; batei, e abrir-se-vos-á.

RVA.text: Y yo os digo: Pedid, y se os dará; buscad, y hallaréis; llamad, y os será abierto.

KJV.text: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

WEBM.text: I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.

JFA.text: Vós, porém, esforçai-vos, e não desfaleçam as vossas mãos; porque a vossa obra terá uma recompensa.

RVA.text: Esforzaos empero vosotros, y no desfallezcan vuestras manos; que salario hay para vuestra obra.

KJV.text: Be ye strong therefore, and let not your hands be weak: for your work shall be rewarded.

WEBM.text: But you be strong, and don’t let your hands be slack; for your work shall be rewarded.

JFA.text: E eu rogarei ao Pai, e ele vos dará outro Ajudador, para que fique convosco para sempre.

RVA.text: Y yo rogaré al Padre, y os dará otro Consolador, para que esté con vosotros para siempre.

KJV.text: And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever;

WEBM.text: I will pray to the Father, and he will give you another Counselor, that he may be with you forever.

JFA.text: Porquanto a tua benignidade é melhor do que a vida, os meus lábios te louvarão.

RVA.text: Porque mejor es tu misericordia que la vida: Mis labios te alabarán.

KJV.text: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.

WEBM.text: Because your loving kindness is better than life, my lips shall praise you.

JFA.text: E, se eu for e vos preparar lugar, virei outra vez, e vos tomarei para mim mesmo, para que onde eu estiver estejais vós também.

RVA.text: Y si me fuere, y os aparejare lugar, vendré otra vez, y os tomaré á mí mismo: para que donde yo estoy, vosotros también estéis.

KJV.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.

WEBM.text: If I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and will receive you to myself; that where I am, you may be there also.

JFA.text: Antes que eu te formasse no ventre te conheci, e antes que saísses da madre te santifiquei; às nações te dei por profeta.

RVA.text: Antes que te formase en el vientre te conocí, y antes que salieses de la matriz te santifiqué, te dí por profeta á las gentes.

KJV.text: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations.

WEBM.text: “Before I formed you in the womb, I knew you. Before you were born, I sanctified you. I have appointed you a prophet to the nations.”

JFA.text: E acontecerá que todo aquele que invocar o nome do Senhor será salvo.

RVA.text: Y será que todo aquel que invocare el nombre del Señor, será salvo.

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

WEBM.text: It will be that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.

JFA.text: Eis que eu sou o Senhor, o Deus de toda a carne; acaso há alguma coisa demasiado difícil para mim?

RVA.text: He aquí que yo soy Jehová, Dios de toda carne; ¿encubriráseme á mí alguna cosa?

KJV.text: Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all flesh: is there any thing too hard for me?

WEBM.text: “Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all flesh. Is there anything too hard for me?

JFA.text: Declarou-lhes Jesus. Eu sou o pão da vida; aquele que vem a mim, de modo algum terá fome, e quem crê em mim jamais tará sede.

RVA.text: Y Jesús les dijo: Yo soy el pan de vida: el que á mí viene, nunca tendrá hambre; y el que en mí cree, no tendrá sed jamás.

KJV.text: And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.”

JFA.text: Bendito o varão que confia no Senhor, e cuja esperança é o Senhor.

RVA.text: Bendito el varón que se fía en Jehová, y cuya confianza es Jehová.

KJV.text: Blessed is the man that trusteth in the Lord, and whose hope the Lord is.

WEBM.text: Blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord, and whose trust the Lord is.

JFA.text: E consideremo-nos uns aos outros, para nos estimularmos ao amor e às boas obras.

RVA.text: Y considerémonos los unos á los otros para provocarnos al amor y á las buenas obras.

KJV.text: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:

WEBM.text: Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works.

JFA.text: Mas os mansos herdarão a terra, e se deleitarão na abundância de paz.

RVA.text: Pero los mansos heredarán la tierra, Y se recrearán con abundancia de paz.

KJV.text: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

WEBM.text: But the humble shall inherit the land, and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

JFA.text: E eis que uma voz dos céus dizia: Este é o meu Filho amado, em quem me comprazo.

RVA.text: Y he aquí una voz de los cielos que decía: Este es mi Hijo amado, en el cual tengo contentamiento.

KJV.text: And lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

WEBM.text: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”

JFA.text: Mas tu, Senhor, és um escudo ao redor de mim, a minha glória, e aquele que exulta a minha cabeça.

RVA.text: Mas tú, Jehová, eres escudo alrededor de mí: Mi gloria, y el que ensalza mi cabeza.

KJV.text: But thou, O Lord, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

WEBM.text: But you, Lord, are a shield around me, my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.

JFA.text: Ela dará à luz um filho, a quem chamarás JESUS; porque ele salvará o seu povo dos seus pecados.

RVA.text: Y parirá un hijo, y llamarás su nombre JESUS, porque él salvará á su pueblo de sus pecados.

KJV.text: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus: for he shall save his people from their sins.

WEBM.text: She shall give birth to a son. You shall call his name Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins.

JFA.text: Clama a mim, e responder-te-ei, e anunciar-te-ei coisas grandes e ocultas, que não sabes.

RVA.text: Clama á mí, y te responderé, y te enseñaré cosas grandes y dificultosas que tú no sabes.

KJV.text: Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and show thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.

WEBM.text: Call to me, and I will answer you, and will show you great things, and difficult, which you don’t know.

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe o anjo: Virá sobre ti o Espírito Santo, e o poder do Altíssimo te cobrirá com a sua sombra; por isso o que há de nascer será chamado santo, Filho de Deus.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo el ángel le dijo: El Espíritu Santo vendrá sobre ti, y la virtud del Altísimo te hará sombra; por lo cual también lo Santo que nacerá, será llamado Hijo de Dios.

KJV.text: And the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee: therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.

WEBM.text: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore also the holy one who is born from you will be called the Son of God.”

JFA.text: Não me lances fora da tua presença, e não retire de mim o teu santo Espírito.

RVA.text: No me eches de delante de ti; Y no quites de mí tu santo espíritu.

KJV.text: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

WEBM.text: Don’t throw me from your presence, and don’t take your holy Spirit from me.

JFA.text: A luz resplandece nas trevas, e as trevas não prevaleceram contra ela.

RVA.text: Y la luz en las tinieblas resplandece; mas las tinieblas no la comprendieron.

KJV.text: And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.

WEBM.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn’t overcome it.

JFA.text: Entrega o teu caminho ao Senhor; confia nele, e ele tudo fará.

RVA.text: Encomienda á Jehová tu camino, Y espera en él; y él hará.

KJV.text: Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.

WEBM.text: Commit your way to the Lord. Trust also in him, and he will do this.

JFA.text: E a vida eterna é esta: que te conheçam a ti, como o único Deus verdadeiro, e a Jesus Cristo, aquele que tu enviaste.

RVA.text: Esta empero es la vida eterna: que te conozcan el solo Dios verdadero, y á Jesucristo, al cual has enviado.

KJV.text: And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.

WEBM.text: This is eternal life, that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you sent, Jesus Christ.

JFA.text: Entrega ao Senhor as tuas obras, e teus desígnios serão estabelecidos.

RVA.text: Encomienda á Jehová tus obras, Y tus pensamientos serán afirmados.

KJV.text: Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.

WEBM.text: Commit your deeds to the Lord, and your plans shall succeed.

JFA.text: E todo aquele que vive, e crê em mim, jamais morrerá. Crês isto?

RVA.text: Y todo aquel que vive y cree en mí, no morirá eternamente. ¿Crees esto?

KJV.text: And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Believest thou this?

WEBM.text: Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?

JFA.text: Cria em mim, ó Deus, um coração puro, e renova em mim um espírito estável.

RVA.text: Crea en mí, oh Dios, un corazón limpio; Y renueva un espíritu recto dentro de mí.

KJV.text: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.

WEBM.text: Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a right spirit within me.

JFA.text: De tarde, de manhã e ao meio-dia me queixarei e me lamentarei; e ele ouvirá a minha voz.

RVA.text: Tarde y mañana y á medio día oraré y clamaré; Y él oirá mi voz.

KJV.text: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.

WEBM.text: Evening, morning, and at noon, I will cry out in distress. He will hear my voice.

JFA.text: Eis que cedo venho e está comigo a minha recompensa, para retribuir a cada um segundo a sua obra.
