WEBM.text: For as the body is one, and has many members, and all the members of the body, being many, are one body; so also is Christ.

JFA.text: Pois em um só Espírito fomos todos nós batizados em um só corpo, quer judeus, quer gregos, quer escravos quer livres; e a todos nós foi dado beber de um só Espírito.

RVA.text: Porque por un Espíritu somos todos bautizados en un cuerpo, ora Judíos ó Griegos, ora siervos ó libres; y todos hemos bebido de un mismo Espíritu.

KJV.text: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether we be Jews or Gentiles, whether we be bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.

WEBM.text: For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bond or free; and were all given to drink into one Spirit.

JFA.text: Ora, há diversidade de dons, mas o Espírito é o mesmo.

RVA.text: Empero hay repartimiento de dones; mas el mismo Espíritu es.

KJV.text: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.

WEBM.text: Now there are various kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit.

JFA.text: Ainda que eu falasse as línguas dos homens e dos anjos, e não tivesse amor, seria como o metal que soa ou como o címbalo que retine.

RVA.text: Si yo hablase lenguas humanas y angélicas, y no tengo caridad, vengo á ser como metal que resuena, ó címbalo que retiñe.

KJV.text: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become as sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.

WEBM.text: If I speak with the languages of men and of angels, but don’t have love, I have become sounding brass, or a clanging cymbal.

JFA.text: Mas digo isto, irmãos, que carne e sangue não podem herdar o reino de Deus; nem a corrupção herda a incorrupção.

RVA.text: Esto empero digo, hermanos: que la carne y la sangre no pueden heredar el reino de Dios; ni la corrupción hereda la incorrupción.

KJV.text: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.

WEBM.text: Now I say this, brothers, that flesh and blood can’t inherit God’s Kingdom; neither does the perishable inherit imperishable.

JFA.text: Ora, o homem natural não aceita as coisas do Espírito de Deus, porque para ele são loucura; e não pode entendê-las, porque elas se discernem espiritualmente.

RVA.text: Mas el hombre animal no percibe las cosas que son del Espíritu de Dios, porque le son locura: y no las puede entender, porque se han de examinar espiritualmente.

KJV.text: But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.

WEBM.text: Now the natural man doesn’t receive the things of God’s Spirit, for they are foolishness to him, and he can’t know them, because they are spiritually discerned.

JFA.text: Graça a vós, e paz da parte de Deus nosso Pai, e do Senhor Jesus Cristo.

RVA.text: Gracia y paz á vosotros de Dios nuestro Padre, y del Señor Jesucristo.

KJV.text: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

WEBM.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

JFA.text: Bendito seja o Deus e Pai de nosso Senhor Jesus Cristo, o Pai das misericórdias e Deus de toda a consolação.

RVA.text: Bendito sea el Dios y Padre del Señor Jesucristo, el Padre de misericordias, y el Dios de toda consolación.

KJV.text: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;

WEBM.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort;

JFA.text: A graça do Senhor Jesus Cristo, e o amor de Deus, e a comunhão do Espírito Santo sejam com todos vós.

RVA.text: La gracia del Señor Jesucristo, y el amor de Dios, y la participación del Espíritu Santo sea con vosotros todos. Amén. Epístola á los Corintios fué enviada de Filipos de Macedonia con Tito y Lucas.

KJV.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with you all. Amen.

WEBM.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit, be with you all. Amen.

JFA.text: E é por Cristo que temos tal confiança em Deus.

RVA.text: Y tal confianza tenemos por Cristo para con Dios.

KJV.text: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

WEBM.text: Such confidence we have through Christ toward God

JFA.text: Porque é necessário que todos nós sejamos manifestos diante do tribunal de Cristo, para que cada um receba o que fez por meio do corpo, segundo o que praticou, o bem ou o mal.

RVA.text: Porque es menester que todos nosotros parezcamos ante el tribunal de Cristo, para que cada uno reciba según lo que hubiere hecho por medio del cuerpo, ora sea bueno ó malo.

KJV.text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad.

WEBM.text: For we must all be revealed before the judgment seat of Christ; that each one may receive the things in the body, according to what he has done, whether good or bad.

JFA.text: Não vos prendais a um jugo desigual com os incrédulos; pois que sociedade tem a justiça com a injustiça? ou que comunhão tem a luz com as trevas?

RVA.text: No os juntéis en yugo con los infieles: porque ¿qué compañía tienes la justicia con la injusticia? ¿y qué comunión la luz con las tinieblas?

KJV.text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?

WEBM.text: Don’t be unequally yoked with unbelievers, for what fellowship have righteousness and iniquity? Or what fellowship has light with darkness?

JFA.text: Ora, aquele que dá a semente ao que semeia, e pão para comer, também dará e multiplicará a vossa sementeira, e aumentará os frutos da vossa justiça.

RVA.text: Y el que da simiente al que siembra, también dará pan para comer, y multiplicará vuestra sementera, y aumentará los crecimientos de los frutos de vuestra justicia.

KJV.text: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for your food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)

WEBM.text: Now may he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food, supply and multiply your seed for sowing, and increase the fruits of your righteousness

JFA.text: Não queremos, porém, irmãos, que sejais ignorantes acerca dos que já dormem, para que não vos entristeçais como os outros que não têm esperança.

RVA.text: Tampoco, hermanos, queremos que ignoréis acerca de los que duermen, que no os entristezcáis como los otros que no tienen esperanza.

KJV.text: But I would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning them which are asleep, that ye sorrow not, even as others which have no hope.

WEBM.text: But we don’t want you to be ignorant, brothers, concerning those who have fallen asleep, so that you don’t grieve like the rest, who have no hope.

JFA.text: E o próprio Deus de paz vos santifique completamente; e o vosso espírito, e alma e corpo sejam plenamente conservados irrepreensíveis para a vinda de nosso Senhor Jesus Cristo.

RVA.text: Y el Dios de paz os santifique en todo; para que vuestro espíritu y alma y cuerpo sea guardado entero sin reprensión para la venida de nuestro Señor Jesucristo.

KJV.text: And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

WEBM.text: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

JFA.text: Não durmamos, pois, como os demais, antes vigiemos e sejamos sóbrios.

RVA.text: Por tanto, no durmamos como los demás; antes velemos y seamos sobrios.

KJV.text: Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.

WEBM.text: So then let’s not sleep, as the rest do, but let’s watch and be sober.

JFA.text: Vinde, pois, e arrazoemos, diz o Senhor: ainda que os vossos pecados são como a escarlata, eles se tornarão brancos como a neve; ainda que são vermelhos como o carmesim, tornar-se-ão como a lã.

RVA.text: Venid luego, dirá Jehová, y estemos á cuenta: si vuestros pecados fueren como la grana, como la nieve serán emblanquecidos: si fueren rojos como el carmesí, vendrán á ser como blanca lana.

KJV.text: Come now, and let us reason together, saith the Lord: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

WEBM.text: Come now, and let’s reason together,” says the Lord: “Though your sins are as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow. Though they are red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

JFA.text: Pois o sol se levanta em seu ardor e faz secar a erva; a sua flor cai e a beleza do seu aspecto perece; assim murchará também o rico em seus caminhos.

RVA.text: Porque salido el sol con ardor, la hierba se secó, y su flor se cayó, y pereció su hermosa apariencia: así también se marchitará el rico en todos sus caminos.

KJV.text: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.

WEBM.text: For the sun arises with the scorching wind, and withers the grass, and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes. So also will the rich man fade away in his pursuits.

JFA.text: Ninguém, sendo tentado, diga: Sou tentado por Deus; porque Deus não pode ser tentado pelo mal e ele a ninguém tenta.

RVA.text: Cuando alguno es tentado, no diga que es tentado de Dios: porque Dios no puede ser tentado de los malos, ni él tienta á alguno.

KJV.text: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

WEBM.text: Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God can’t be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.

JFA.text: A religião pura e imaculada diante de nosso Deus e Pai é esta: Visitar os órfãos e as viúvas nas suas aflições e guardar-se isento da corrupção do mundo.

RVA.text: La religión pura y sin mácula delante de Dios y Padre es esta: Visitar los huérfanos y las viudas en sus tribulaciones, y guardarse sin mancha de este mundo.

KJV.text: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

WEBM.text: Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world.

JFA.text: Não pense tal homem que receberá do Senhor alguma coisa.

RVA.text: No piense pues el tal hombre que recibirá ninguna cosa del Señor.

KJV.text: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.

WEBM.text: For let that man not think that he will receive anything from the Lord.

JFA.text: Meus irmãos, não tenhais a fé em nosso Senhor Jesus Cristo, Senhor da glória, em acepção de pessoas.

RVA.text: Hermanos míos, no tengáis la fe de nuestro Señor Jesucristo glorioso en acepción de personas.

KJV.text: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with respect of persons.

WEBM.text: My brothers, don’t hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with partiality.

JFA.text: Pois qualquer que guardar toda a lei, mas tropeçar em um só ponto, tem-se tornado culpado de todos.

RVA.text: Porque cualquiera que hubiere guardado toda la ley, y ofendiere en un punto, es hecho culpado de todos.

KJV.text: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.

WEBM.text: For whoever keeps the whole law, and yet stumbles in one point, he has become guilty of all.

JFA.text: Que proveito há, meus irmãos se alguém disser que tem fé e não tiver obras? Porventura essa fé pode salvá-lo?

RVA.text: Hermanos míos, ¿qué aprovechará si alguno dice que tiene fe, y no tiene obras? ¿Podrá la fe salvarle?

KJV.text: What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?

WEBM.text: What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him?

JFA.text: Assim também a fé, se não tiver obras, é morta em si mesma.

RVA.text: Así también la fe, si no tuviere obras, es muerta en sí misma.

KJV.text: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

WEBM.text: Even so faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself.

JFA.text: Crês tu que Deus é um só? Fazes bem; os demônios também o crêem, e estremecem.

RVA.text: Tú crees que Dios es uno; bien haces: también los demonios creen, y tiemblan.

KJV.text: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.

WEBM.text: You believe that God is one. You do well. The demons also believe, and shudder.

JFA.text: Meus irmãos, não sejais muitos de vós mestres, sabendo que receberemos um juízo mais severo.

RVA.text: Hermanos míos, no os hagáis muchos maestros, sabiendo que recibiremos mayor condenación.

KJV.text: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.

WEBM.text: Let not many of you be teachers, my brothers, knowing that we will receive heavier judgment.

JFA.text: Vede também os navios que, embora tão grandes e levados por impetuosos ventos, com um pequenino leme se voltam para onde quer o impulso do timoneiro.

RVA.text: Mirad también las naves: aunque tan grandes, y llevadas de impetuosos vientos, son gobernadas con un muy pequeño timón por donde quisiere el que las gobierna.

KJV.text: Behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.

WEBM.text: Behold, the ships also, though they are so big and are driven by fierce winds, are yet guided by a very small rudder, wherever the pilot desires.

JFA.text: Donde vêm as guerras e contendas entre vós? Porventura não vêm disto, dos vossos deleites, que nos vossos membros guerreiam?

RVA.text: ¿De dónde vienen las guerras y los pleitos entre vosotros? ¿No son de vuestras concupiscencias, las cuales combaten en vuestros miembros?

KJV.text: From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?

WEBM.text: Where do wars and fightings among you come from? Don’t they come from your pleasures that war in your members?

JFA.text: Aquele, pois, que sabe fazer o bem e não o faz, comete pecado.

RVA.text: El pecado, pues, está en aquel que sabe hacer lo bueno, y no lo hace.

KJV.text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.

WEBM.text: To him therefore who knows to do good, and doesn’t do it, to him it is sin.

JFA.text: Todavia, dá maior graça. Portanto diz: Deus resiste aos soberbos; dá, porém, graça aos humildes.

RVA.text: Mas él da mayor gracia. Por esto dice: Dios resiste á los soberbios, y da gracia á los humildes.

KJV.text: But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

WEBM.text: But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.”

JFA.text: Chegai-vos para Deus, e ele se chegará para vós. Limpai as mãos, pecadores; e, vós de espírito vacilante, purificai os corações.

RVA.text: Allegaos á Dios, y él se allegará á vosotros. Pecadores, limpiad las manos; y vosotros de doblado ánimo, purificad los corazones.

KJV.text: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.

WEBM.text: Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double-minded.

JFA.text: Está aflito alguém entre vós? Ore. Está alguém contente? Cante louvores.

RVA.text: ¿Está alguno entre vosotros afligido? haga oración. ¿Está alguno alegre? cante salmos.

KJV.text: Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.

WEBM.text: Is any among you suffering? Let him pray. Is any cheerful? Let him sing praises.

JFA.text: Está doente algum de vós? Chame os anciãos da igreja, e estes orem sobre ele, ungido-o com óleo em nome do Senhor.

RVA.text: ¿Está alguno enfermo entre vosotros? llame á los ancianos de la iglesia, y oren por él, ungiéndole con aceite en el nombre del Señor.

KJV.text: Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:

WEBM.text: Is any among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord,

JFA.text: Condenastes e matastes o justo; ele não vos resiste.

RVA.text: Habéis condenado y muerto al justo; y él no os resiste.

KJV.text: Ye have condemned and killed the just; and he doth not resist you.

WEBM.text: You have condemned, you have murdered the righteous one. He doesn’t resist you.

JFA.text: Portanto, irmãos, sede pacientes até a vinda do Senhor. Eis que o lavrador espera o precioso fruto da terra, aguardando-o com paciência, até que receba as primeiras e as últimas chuvas.

RVA.text: Pues, hermanos, tened paciencia hasta la venida del Señor. Mirad cómo el labrador espera el precioso fruto de la tierra, aguardando con paciencia, hasta que reciba la lluvia temprana y tardía.

KJV.text: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

WEBM.text: Be patient therefore, brothers, until the coming of the Lord. Behold, the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, being patient over it, until it receives the early and late rain.

JFA.text: Eis que vem com as nuvens, e todo olho o verá, até mesmo aqueles que o traspassaram; e todas as tribos da terra se lamentarão sobre ele. Sim. Amém.

RVA.text: He aquí que viene con las nubes, y todo ojo le verá, y los que le traspasaron; y todos los linajes de la tierra se lamentarán sobre él. Así sea. Amén.

KJV.text: Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they also which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him. Even so, Amen.

WEBM.text: Behold, he is coming with the clouds, and every eye will see him, including those who pierced him. All the tribes of the earth will mourn over him. Even so, Amen.

JFA.text: E vi outro anjo voando pelo meio do céu, e tinha um evangelho eterno para proclamar aos que habitam sobre a terra e a toda nação, e tribo, e língua, e povo.

RVA.text: Y vi otro ángel volar por en medio del cielo, que tenía el evangelio eterno para predicarlo á los que moran en la tierra, y á toda nación y tribu y lengua y pueblo.

KJV.text: And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people,

WEBM.text: I saw an angel flying in mid heaven, having an eternal Good News to proclaim to those who dwell on the earth, and to every nation, tribe, language, and people.

JFA.text: E vi o céu aberto, e eis um cavalo branco; e o que estava montado nele chama-se Fiel e Verdadeiro; e julga a peleja com justiça.

RVA.text: Y vi el cielo abierto; y he aquí un caballo blanco, y el que estaba sentado sobre él, era llamado Fiel y Verdadero, el cual con justicia juzga y pelea.

KJV.text: And I saw heaven opened, and behold a white horse; and he that sat upon him was called Faithful and True, and in righteousness he doth judge and make war.

WEBM.text: I saw the heaven opened, and behold, a white horse, and he who sat on it is called Faithful and True. In righteousness he judges and makes war.

JFA.text: E tens perseverança e por amor do meu nome sofreste, e não desfaleceste.

RVA.text: Y has sufrido, y has tenido paciencia, y has trabajado por mi nombre, y no has desfallecido.

KJV.text: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.

WEBM.text: You have perseverance and have endured for my name’s sake, and have not grown weary.

JFA.text: E vi descer do céu um anjo, que tinha a chave do abismo e uma grande cadeia na sua mão.

RVA.text: Y vi un ángel descender del cielo, que tenía la llave del abismo, y una grande cadena en su mano.

KJV.text: And I saw an angel come down from heaven, having the key of the bottomless pit and a great chain in his hand.

WEBM.text: I saw an angel coming down out of heaven, having the key of the abyss and a great chain in his hand.

JFA.text: E o Diabo, que os enganava, foi lançado no lago de fogo e enxofre, onde estão a besta e o falso profeta; e de dia e de noite serão atormentados pelos séculos dos séculos.

RVA.text: Y el diablo que los engañaba, fué lanzado en el lago de fuego y azufre, donde está la bestia y el falso profeta; y serán atormentados día y noche para siempre jamás.

KJV.text: And the devil that deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are, and shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.

WEBM.text: The devil who deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet are also. They will be tormented day and night forever and ever.

JFA.text: E vi um grande trono branco e o que estava assentado sobre ele, de cuja presença fugiram a terra e o céu; e não foi achado lugar para eles.

RVA.text: Y vi un gran trono blanco y al que estaba sentado sobre él, de delante del cual huyó la tierra y el cielo; y no fué hallado el lugar de ellos.

KJV.text: And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.

WEBM.text: I saw a great white throne, and him who sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away. There was found no place for them.

JFA.text: E todo aquele que não foi achado inscrito no livro da vida, foi lançado no lago de fogo.

RVA.text: Y el que no fué hallado escrito en el libro de la vida, fué lanzado en el lago de fuego.

KJV.text: And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire.

WEBM.text: If anyone was not found written in the book of life, he was cast into the lake of fire.

JFA.text: Então vi uns tronos; e aos que se assentaram sobre eles foi dado o poder de julgar; e vi as almas daqueles que foram degolados por causa do testemunho de Jesus e da palavra de Deus, e que não adoraram a besta nem a sua imagem, e não receberam o sinal na fronte nem nas mãos; e reviveram, e reinaram com Cristo durante mil anos.

RVA.text: Y vi tronos, y se sentaron sobre ellos, y les fué dado juicio; y vi las almas de los degollados por el testimonio de Jesús, y por la palabra de Dios, y que no habían adorado la bestia, ni á su imagen, y que no recibieron la señal en sus frentes, ni en sus manos, y vivieron y reinaron con Cristo mil años.

KJV.text: And I saw thrones, and they sat upon them, and judgment was given unto them: and I saw the souls of them that were beheaded for the witness of Jesus, and for the word of God, and which had not worshipped the beast, neither his image, neither had received his mark upon their foreheads, or in their hands; and they lived and reigned with Christ a thousand years.

WEBM.text: I saw thrones, and they sat on them, and judgment was given to them. I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for the testimony of Jesus, and for the word of God, and such as didn’t worship the beast nor his image, and didn’t receive the mark on their forehead and on their hand. They lived and reigned with Christ for a thousand years.

JFA.text: E vi um novo céu e uma nova terra. Porque já se foram o primeiro céu e a primeira terra, e o mar já não existe.

RVA.text: Y vi un cielo nuevo, y una tierra nueva: porque el primer cielo y la primera tierra se fueron, y el mar ya no es.

KJV.text: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away; and there was no more sea.

WEBM.text: I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth have passed away, and the sea is no more.

JFA.text: E o Espírito e a noiva dizem: Vem. E quem ouve, diga: Vem. E quem tem sede, venha; e quem quiser, receba de graça a água da vida.

RVA.text: Y el Espíritu y la Esposa dicen: Ven. Y el que oye, diga: Ven. Y el que tiene sed, venga: y el que quiere, tome del agua de la vida de balde.

KJV.text: And the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And let him that heareth say, Come. And let him that is athirst come. And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely.

WEBM.text: The Spirit and the bride say, “Come!” He who hears, let him say, “Come!” He who is thirsty, let him come. He who desires, let him take the water of life freely.

JFA.text: Eu testifico a todo aquele que ouvir as palavras da profecia deste livro: Se alguém lhes acrescentar alguma coisa, Deus lhe acrescentará as pragas que estão escritas neste livro.

RVA.text: Porque yo protesto á cualquiera que oye las palabras de la profecía de este libro: Si alguno añadiere á estas cosas, Dios pondrá sobre él las plagas que están escritas en este libro.

KJV.text: For I testify unto every man that heareth the words of the prophecy of this book, If any man shall add unto these things, God shall add unto him the plagues that are written in this book:

WEBM.text: I testify to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book, if anyone adds to them, may God add to him the plagues which are written in this book.

JFA.text: Enganoso é o coração, mais do que todas as coisas, e perverso; quem o poderá conhecer?

RVA.text: Engañoso es el corazón más que todas las cosas, y perverso; ¿quién lo conocerá?

KJV.text: The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?

WEBM.text: The heart is deceitful above all things, and it is exceedingly corrupt: who can know it?

JFA.text: Estou admirado de que tão depressa estejais desertando daquele que vos chamou na graça de Cristo, para outro evangelho.

RVA.text: Estoy maravillado de que tan pronto os hayáis traspasado del que os llamó á la gracia de Cristo, á otro evangelio.

KJV.text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:

WEBM.text: I marvel that you are so quickly deserting him who called you in the grace of Christ to a different “good news”;

JFA.text: Mas, ainda que nós mesmos ou um anjo do céu vos pregasse outro evangelho além do que já vos pregamos, seja anátema.

RVA.text: Mas aun si nosotros ó un ángel del cielo os anunciare otro evangelio del que os hemos anunciado, sea anatema.

KJV.text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

WEBM.text: But even though we, or an angel from heaven, should preach to you any “good news” other than that which we preached to you, let him be cursed.

JFA.text: Será que padecestes tantas coisas em vão? Se é que isso foi em vão.

RVA.text: ¿Tantas cosas habéis padecido en vano? si empero en vano.

KJV.text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.

WEBM.text: Did you suffer so many things in vain, if it is indeed in vain?

JFA.text: Sabe, porém, isto, que nos últimos dias sobrevirão tempos penosos.

RVA.text: Esto también sepas, que en los postreros días vendrán tiempos peligrosos.

KJV.text: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

WEBM.text: But know this, that in the last days, grievous times will come.

JFA.text: Prega a palavra, insta a tempo e fora de tempo, admoesta, repreende, exorta, com toda longanimidade e ensino.

RVA.text: Que prediques la palabra; que instes á tiempo y fuera de tiempo; redarguye, reprende; exhorta con toda paciencia y doctrina.

KJV.text: Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all long suffering and doctrine.

WEBM.text: Preach the word; be urgent in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with all patience and teaching.

JFA.text: Porque virá tempo em que não suportarão a sã doutrina; mas, tendo grande desejo de ouvir coisas agradáveis, ajuntarão para si mestres segundo os seus próprios desejos.

RVA.text: Porque vendrá tiempo cuando ni sufrirán la sana doctrina; antes, teniendo comezón de oir, se amotonarán maestros conforme á sus concupiscencias.

KJV.text: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

WEBM.text: For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine, but, having itching ears, will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts.

JFA.text: E muitos dos que dormem no pó da terra ressuscitarão, uns para a vida eterna, e outros para vergonha e desprezo eterno.

RVA.text: Y muchos de los que duermen en el polvo de la tierra serán despertados, unos para vida eterna, y otros para vergüenza y confusión perpetua.

KJV.text: And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt.

WEBM.text: Many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt.

JFA.text: Mas, nos dias desses reis, o Deus do céu suscitará um reino que não será jamais destruído; nem passará a soberania deste reino a outro povo; mas esmiuçará e consumirá todos esses reinos, e subsistirá para sempre.

RVA.text: Y en los días de estos reyes, levantará el Dios del cielo un reino que nunca jamás se corromperá: y no será dejado á otro pueblo este reino; el cual desmenuzará y consumirá todos estos reinos, y él permanecerá para siempre.

KJV.text: And in the days of these kings shall the God of heaven set up a kingdom, which shall never be destroyed: and the kingdom shall not be left to other people, but it shall break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms, and it shall stand for ever.

WEBM.text: In the days of those kings shall the God of heaven set up a kingdom which shall never be destroyed, nor shall its sovereignty be left to another people; but it shall break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms, and it shall stand forever.

JFA.text: Eu estava olhando nas minhas visões noturnas, e eis que vinha com as nuvens do céu um como filho de homem; e dirigiu-se ao ancião de dias, e foi apresentado diante dele.

RVA.text: Miraba yo en la visión de la noche, y he aquí en las nubes del cielo como un hijo de hombre que venía, y llegó hasta el Anciano de grande edad, é hiciéronle llegar delante de él.

KJV.text: I saw in the night visions, and, behold, one like the Son of man came with the clouds of heaven, and came to the Ancient of days, and they brought him near before him.

WEBM.text: I saw in the night visions, and behold, there came with the clouds of the sky one like a son of man, and he came even to the ancient of days, and they brought him near before him.

JFA.text: Fiel é esta palavra: Se alguém aspira ao episcopado, excelente obra deseja.

RVA.text: Palabra fiel: Si alguno apetece obispado, buena obra desea.

KJV.text: his is a true saying, if a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

WEBM.text: This is a faithful saying: if a man seeks the office of an overseer, he desires a good work.

JFA.text: Pois, se alguém não sabe governar a sua própria casa, como cuidará da igreja de Deus?

RVA.text: Porque el que no sabe gobernar su casa, ¿cómo cuidará de la iglesia de Dios?

KJV.text: For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?

WEBM.text: But if a man doesn’t know how to rule his own house, how will he take care of the assembly of God?

JFA.text: Ninguém despreze a tua mocidade, mas sê um exemplo para os fiéis na palavra, no procedimento, no amor, na fé, na pureza.

RVA.text: Ninguno tenga en poco tu juventud; pero sé ejemplo de los fieles en palabra, en conversación, en caridad, en espíritu, en fe, en limpieza.

KJV.text: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

WEBM.text: Let no man despise your youth; but be an example to those who believe, in word, in your way of life, in love, in spirit, in faith, and in purity.

JFA.text: Porque nada trouxe para este mundo, e nada podemos daqui levar.

RVA.text: Porque nada hemos traído á este mundo, y sin duda nada podremos sacar.

KJV.text: For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.

WEBM.text: For we brought nothing into the world, and we certainly can’t carry anything out.

JFA.text: O meu povo está sendo destruído, porque lhe falta o conhecimento. Porquanto rejeitaste o conhecimento, também eu te rejeitarei, para que não sejas sacerdote diante de mim; visto que te esqueceste da lei do teu Deus, também eu me esquecerei de teus filhos.

RVA.text: Mi pueblo fué talado, porque le faltó sabiduría. Porque tú desechaste la sabiduría, yo te echaré del sacerdocio: y pues que olvidaste la ley de tu Dios, también yo me olvidaré de tus hijos.

KJV.text: My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no priest to me: seeing thou hast forgotten the law of thy God, I will also forget thy children.

WEBM.text: My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. Because you have rejected knowledge, I will also reject you, that you may be no priest to me. Because you have forgotten your God’s law, I will also forget your children.

JFA.text: Senhor, tu me sondas, e me conheces.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: Salmo de David. OH Jehová, tú me has examinado y conocido.

KJV.text: O lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.

WEBM.text: Lord, you have searched me, and you know me.

JFA.text: Pois tu formaste os meus rins; entreteceste-me no ventre de minha mãe.

RVA.text: Porque tú poseiste mis riñones; Cubrísteme en el vientre de mi madre.

KJV.text: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

WEBM.text: For you formed my inmost being. You knit me together in my mother’s womb

JFA.text: Diz o néscio no seu coração: Não há Deus. Os homens têm-se corrompido, fazem-se abomináveis em suas obras; não há quem faça o bem.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: Salmo de David. Dijo el necio en su corazón: No hay Dios. Corrompiéronse, hicieron obras abominables; No hay quien haga bien.

KJV.text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.

WEBM.text: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt. They have done abominable deeds. There is no one who does good.

JFA.text: A lei do Senhor é perfeita, e refrigera a alma; o testemunho do Senhor é fiel, e dá sabedoria aos simples.

RVA.text: La ley de Jehová es perfecta, que vuelve el alma: El testimonio de Jehová, fiel, que hace sabio al pequeño.

KJV.text: The law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.

WEBM.text: The Lord’s law is perfect, restoring the soul. The Lord’s testimony is sure, making wise the simple.

JFA.text: Deus é o nosso refúgio e fortaleza, socorro bem presente na angústia.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: de los hijos de Coré: Salmo sobre Alamoth. DIOS es nuestro amparo y fortaleza, Nuestro pronto auxilio en las tribulaciones.

KJV.text: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

WEBM.text: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

JFA.text: Álefe. Mulher virtuosa, quem a pode achar? Pois o seu valor muito excede ao de jóias preciosas.

RVA.text: Mujer fuerte, ¿quién la hallará? Porque su estima sobrepuja largamente á la de piedras preciosas.

KJV.text: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.

WEBM.text: Who can find a worthy woman? For her price is far above rubies.

JFA.text: Há um caminho que ao homem parece direito, mas o fim dele conduz à morte.

RVA.text: Hay camino que al hombre parece derecho; Empero su fin son caminos de muerte.

KJV.text: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

WEBM.text: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

JFA.text: Afia-se o ferro com o ferro; assim o homem afia o rosto do seu amigo.

RVA.text: Hierro con hierro se aguza; Y el hombre aguza el rostro de su amigo.

KJV.text: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

WEBM.text: Iron sharpens iron; so a man sharpens his friend’s countenance.

JFA.text: Roubará o homem a Deus? Todavia vós me roubais, e dizeis: Em que te roubamos? Nos dízimos e nas ofertas alçadas.

RVA.text: ¿Robará el hombre á Dios? Pues vosotros me habéis robado. Y dijisteis: ¿En qué te hemos robado? Los diezmos y las primicias.

KJV.text: Will a man rob God? Yet ye have robbed me. But ye say, Wherein have we robbed thee? In tithes and offerings.

WEBM.text: Will a man rob God? Yet you rob me! But you say, ‘How have we robbed you?’ In tithes and offerings.

JFA.text: O Senhor te abençoe e te guarde.

RVA.text: Jehová te bendiga, y te guarde.

KJV.text: The Lord bless thee, and keep thee:

WEBM.text: The Lord bless you, and keep you.

JFA.text: Deus não é homem, para que minta; nem filho do homem, para que se arrependa. Porventura, tendo ele dito, não o fará? ou, havendo falado, não o cumprirá?

RVA.text: Dios no es hombre, para que mienta; Ni hijo de hombre para que se arrepienta: El dijo, ¿y no hará?; Habló, ¿y no lo ejecutará?

KJV.text: God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

WEBM.text: God is not a man, that he should lie, nor the son of man, that he should repent. Has he said, and will he not do it? Or has he spoken, and will he not make it good?

JFA.text: Agora, pois, temei ao Senhor, e servi-o com sinceridade e com verdade; deitai fora os deuses a que serviram vossos pais dalém do Rio, e no Egito, e servi ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Ahora pues, temed á Jehová, y servidle con integridad y en verdad; y quitad de en medio los dioses á los cuales sirvieron vuestros padres de esotra parte del río, y en Egipto; y servid á Jehová.

KJV.text: Now therefore fear the Lord, and serve him in sincerity and in truth: and put away the gods which your fathers served on the other side of the flood, and in Egypt; and serve ye the Lord.

WEBM.text: Now therefore fear the Lord, and serve him in sincerity and in truth. Put away the gods which your fathers served beyond the River, in Egypt; and serve the Lord.

JFA.text: Ninguém de modo algum vos engane; porque isto não sucederá sem que venha primeiro a apostasia e seja revelado o homem do pecado, o filho da perdição.

RVA.text: No os engañe nadie en ninguna manera; porque no vendrá sin que venga antes la apostasía, y se manifieste el hombre de pecado, el hijo de perdición.

KJV.text: Let no man deceive you by any means: for that day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;

WEBM.text: Let no one deceive you in any way. For it will not be, unless the departure comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of destruction

JFA.text: Estava ele no mundo, e o mundo foi feito por intermédio dele, e o mundo não o conheceu.

RVA.text: En el mundo estaba, y el mundo fué hecho por él; y el mundo no le conoció.

KJV.text: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.

WEBM.text: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn’t recognize him.

JFA.text: Veio para o que era seu, e os seus não o receberam.

RVA.text: A lo suyo vino, y los suyos no le recibieron.

KJV.text: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.

WEBM.text: He came to his own, and those who were his own didn’t receive him.

JFA.text: Ninguém jamais viu a Deus. O Deus unigênito, que está no seio do Pai, esse o deu a conhecer.

RVA.text: A Dios nadie le vió jamás: el unigénito Hijo, que está en el seno del Padre, él le declaró.

KJV.text: No man hath seen God at any time, the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared him.

WEBM.text: No one has seen God at any time. The one and only Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared him.

JFA.text: Ele, pois, confessou e não negou; sim, confessou: Eu não sou o Cristo.

RVA.text: Y confesó, y no negó; mas declaró: No soy yo el Cristo.

KJV.text: And he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.

WEBM.text: He declared, and didn’t deny, but he declared, “I am not the Christ.”

JFA.text: No dia seguinte João viu a Jesus, que vinha para ele, e disse: Eis o Cordeiro de Deus, que tira o pecado do mundo.

RVA.text: El siguiente día ve Juan á Jesús que venía á él, y dice: He aquí el Cordero de Dios, que quita el pecado del mundo.

KJV.text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.

WEBM.text: The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him, and said, Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

JFA.text: Nele estava a vida, e a vida era a luz dos homens.

RVA.text: En él estaba la vida, y la vida era la luz de los hombres.

KJV.text: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.

WEBM.text: In him was life, and the life was the light of men.

JFA.text: Ele não era a luz, mas veio para dar testemunho da luz.

RVA.text: No era él la luz, sino para que diese testimonio de la luz.

KJV.text: He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.

WEBM.text: He was not the light, but was sent that he might testify about the light.

JFA.text: As minhas ovelhas ouvem a minha voz, e eu as conheço, e elas me seguem.

RVA.text: Mis ovejas oyen mi voz, y yo las conozco, y me siguen.

KJV.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

WEBM.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

JFA.text: Eu lhes dou a vida eterna, e jamais perecerão; e ninguém as arrebatará da minha mão.

RVA.text: Y yo les doy vida eterna y no perecerán para siempre, ni nadie las arrebatará de mi mano.

KJV.text: And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.

WEBM.text: I give eternal life to them. They will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.

JFA.text: Eu e o Pai somos um.

RVA.text: Yo y el Padre una cosa somos.

KJV.text: I and my Father are one.

WEBM.text: I and the Father are one.

JFA.text: Em verdade, em verdade vos digo: Aquele que crê em mim, esse também fará as obras que eu faço, e as fará maiores do que estas; porque eu vou para o Pai.

RVA.text: De cierto, de cierto os digo: El que en mí cree, las obras que yo hago también él las hará; y mayores que éstas hará; porque yo voy al Padre.

KJV.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater works than these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.

WEBM.text: Most certainly I tell you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, he will do also; and he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Jesus: Se alguém me amar, guardará a minha palavra; e meu Pai o amará, e viremos a ele, e faremos nele morada.

RVA.text: Respondió Jesús, y díjole: El que me ama, mi palabra guardará; y mi Padre le amará, y vendremos á él, y haremos con él morada.

KJV.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my words: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.

WEBM.text: Jesus answered him, “If a man loves me, he will keep my word. My Father will love him, and we will come to him, and make our home with him.”

JFA.text: Ouvistes que eu vos disse: Vou, e voltarei a vós. Se me amásseis, alegrar-vos-íeis de que eu vá para o Pai; porque o Pai é maior do que eu.

RVA.text: Habéis oído cómo yo os he dicho: Voy, y vengo á vosotros. Si me amaseis, ciertamente os gozaríais, porque he dicho que voy al Padre: porque el Padre mayor es que yo.

KJV.text: Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and come again unto you. If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father: for my Father is greater than I.

WEBM.text: You heard how I told you, ‘I go away, and I come to you.’ If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I said ‘I am going to my Father;’ for the Father is greater than I.

JFA.text: Eu sou a videira verdadeira, e meu Pai é o viticultor.

RVA.text: Yo soy la vid verdadera, y mi Padre es el labrador.

KJV.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

WEBM.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.

JFA.text: Permanecei em mim, e eu permanecerei em vós; como a vara de si mesma não pode dar fruto, se não permanecer na videira, assim também vós, se não permanecerdes em mim.

RVA.text: Estad en mí, y yo en vosotros. Como el pámpano no puede llevar fruto de sí mismo, si no estuviere en la vid; así ni vosotros, si no estuviereis en mí.

KJV.text: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.

WEBM.text: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can’t bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.

JFA.text: Eu sou a videira; vós sois as varas. Quem permanece em mim e eu nele, esse dá muito fruto; porque sem mim nada podeis fazer.

RVA.text: Yo soy la vid, vosotros los pámpanos: el que está en mí, y yo en él, éste lleva mucho fruto; porque sin mí nada podéis hacer.

KJV.text: I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.

WEBM.text: I am the vine. You are the branches. He who remains in me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.

JFA.text: Ainda tenho muito que vos dizer; mas vós não o podeis suportar agora.

RVA.text: Aun tengo muchas cosas que deciros, mas ahora no las podéis llevar.

KJV.text: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

WEBM.text: I have yet many things to tell you, but you can’t bear them now.

JFA.text: Eu não estou mais no mundo; mas eles estão no mundo, e eu vou para ti. Pai santo, guarda-os no teu nome, o qual me deste, para que eles sejam um, assim como nós.

RVA.text: Y ya no estoy en el mundo; mas éstos están en el mundo, y yo á ti vengo. Padre santo, á los que me has dado, guárdalos por tu nombre, para que sean una cosa, como también nosotros.

KJV.text: And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we are.

WEBM.text: I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your name which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are.

JFA.text: Santifica-os na verdade, a tua palavra é a verdade.

RVA.text: Santifícalos en tu verdad: tu palabra es verdad.

KJV.text: Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

WEBM.text: Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.

JFA.text: E rogo não somente por estes, mas também por aqueles que pela sua palavra hão de crer em mim.

RVA.text: Mas no ruego solamente por éstos, sino también por los que han de creer en mí por la palabra de ellos.

KJV.text: Neither pray I for these alone, but for them also which shall believe on me through their word;

WEBM.text: Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who believe in me through their word.

JFA.text: Respondeu Jesus: O meu reino não é deste mundo; se o meu reino fosse deste mundo, pelejariam os meus servos, para que eu não fosse entregue aos judeus; entretanto o meu reino não é daqui.

RVA.text: Respondió Jesús: Mi reino no es de este mundo: si de este mundo fuera mi reino, mis servidores pelearían para que yo no fuera entregado á los Judíos: ahora, pues, mi reino no es de aquí.

KJV.text: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.

WEBM.text: Jesus answered, “My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn’t be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here.”

JFA.text: Então Jesus, depois de ter tomado o vinagre, disse: está consumado. E, inclinando a cabeça, entregou o espírito.

RVA.text: Y como Jesús tomó el vinagre, dijo: Consumado es. Y habiendo inclinado la cabeza, dió el espíritu.

KJV.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

WEBM.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, “It is finished.” He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

JFA.text: E tendo feito um azorrague de cordas, lançou todos fora do templo, bem como as ovelhas e os bois; e espalhou o dinheiro dos cambistas, e virou-lhes as mesas.

RVA.text: Y hecho un azote de cuerdas, echólos á todos del templo, y las ovejas, y los bueyes; y derramó los dineros de los cambiadores, y trastornó las mesas.

KJV.text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers' money, and overthrew the tables;

WEBM.text: He made a whip of cords, and threw all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables.

JFA.text: E disse aos que vendiam as pombas: Tirai daqui estas coisas; não façais da casa de meu Pai casa de negócio.

RVA.text: Y á los que vendían las palomas, dijo: Quitad de aquí esto, y no hagáis la casa de mi Padre casa de mercado.

KJV.text: And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father's house an house of merchandise.

WEBM.text: To those who sold the doves, he said, “Take these things out of here! Don’t make my Father’s house a marketplace!”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhes Jesus: Mulher, que tenho eu contigo? Ainda não é chegada a minha hora.

RVA.text: Y dícele Jesús: ¿Qué tengo yo contigo, mujer? aun no ha venido mi hora.

KJV.text: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My hour has not yet come.”

JFA.text: Ora, ninguém subiu ao céu, senão o que desceu do céu, o Filho do homem.

RVA.text: Y nadie subió al cielo, sino el que descendió del cielo, el Hijo del hombre, que está en el cielo.

KJV.text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, even the Son of man which is in heaven.

WEBM.text: No one has ascended into heaven, but he who descended out of heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.

JFA.text: Quem crê nele não é julgado; mas quem não crê, já está julgado; porquanto não crê no nome do unigênito Filho de Deus.

RVA.text: El que en él cree, no es condenado; mas el que no cree, ya es condenado, porque no creyó en el nombre del unigénito Hijo de Dios.

KJV.text: He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

WEBM.text: He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn’t believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.

JFA.text: E o julgamento é este: A luz veio ao mundo, e os homens amaram antes as trevas que a luz, porque as suas obras eram más.

RVA.text: Y esta es la condenación: porque la luz vino al mundo, y los hombres amaron más las tinieblas que la luz; porque sus obras eran malas.

KJV.text: And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

WEBM.text: This is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.

JFA.text: O que é nascido da carne é carne, e o que é nascido do Espírito é espírito.

RVA.text: Lo que es nacido de la carne, carne es; y lo que es nacido del Espíritu, espíritu es.

KJV.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

WEBM.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh. That which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

JFA.text: Não te admires de eu te haver dito: Necessário vos é nascer de novo.

RVA.text: No te maravilles de que te dije: Os es necesario nacer otra vez.

KJV.text: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

WEBM.text: Don’t marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’

JFA.text: O vento sopra onde quer, e ouves a sua voz; mas não sabes donde vem, nem para onde vai; assim é todo aquele que é nascido do Espírito.

RVA.text: El viento de donde quiere sopla, y oyes su sonido; mas ni sabes de dónde viene, ni á dónde vaya: así es todo aquel que es nacido del Espíritu.

KJV.text: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.

WEBM.text: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don’t know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.

JFA.text: Mas a hora vem, e agora é, em que os verdadeiros adoradores adorarão o Pai em espírito e em verdade; porque o Pai procura a tais que assim o adorem.

RVA.text: Mas la hora viene, y ahora es, cuando los verdaderos adoradores adorarán al Padre en espíritu y en verdad; porque también el Padre tales adoradores busca que adoren.

KJV.text: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.

WEBM.text: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such to be his worshipers.

JFA.text: Disse-lhe então a mulher samaritana: Como, sendo tu judeu, me pedes de beber a mim, que sou mulher samaritana? (Porque os judeus não se comunicavam com os samaritanos.)

RVA.text: Y la mujer Samaritana le dice: ¿Cómo tú, siendo Judío, me pides á mí de beber, que soy mujer Samaritana? porque los Judíos no se tratan con los Samaritanos.

KJV.text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

WEBM.text: The Samaritan woman therefore said to him, “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)

JFA.text: Por isso os judeus perseguiram a Jesus, porque fazia estas coisas no sábado. Mas Jesus lhes respondeu: Meu Pai trabalha até agora, e eu trabalho também.

RVA.text: Y por esta causa los Judíos perseguían á Jesús, y procuraban matarle, porque hacía estas cosas en sábado. Y Jesús les respondió: Mi Padre hasta ahora obra, y yo obro.

KJV.text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day. But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.

WEBM.text: For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath. But Jesus answered them, “My Father is still working, so I am working, too.”

JFA.text: Por isso, pois, os judeus ainda mais procuravam matá-lo, porque não só violava o sábado, mas também dizia que Deus era seu próprio Pai, fazendo-se igual a Deus.

RVA.text: Entonces, por tanto, más procuraban los Judíos matarle, porque no sólo quebrantaba el sábado, sino que también á su Padre llamaba Dios, haciéndose igual á Dios.

KJV.text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.

WEBM.text: For this cause therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.

JFA.text: Disse-lhes, pois, Jesus: Em verdade, em verdade vos digo que o Filho de si mesmo nada pode fazer, senão o que vir o Pai fazer; porque tudo quanto ele faz, o Filho o faz igualmente.

RVA.text: Respondió entonces Jesús, y díjoles: De cierto, de cierto os digo: No puede el Hijo hacer nada de sí mismo, sino lo que viere hacer al Padre: porque todo lo que él hace, esto también hace el Hijo juntamente.

KJV.text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.

WEBM.text: Jesus therefore answered them, Most certainly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father doing. For whatever things he does, these the Son also does likewise.

JFA.text: Ora, no seu último dia, o grande dia da festa, Jesus pôs-se em pé e clamou, dizendo: Se alguém tem sede, venha a mim e beba.

RVA.text: Mas en el postrer día grande de la fiesta, Jesús se ponía en pie y clamaba, diciendo: Si alguno tiene sed, venga á mí y beba.

KJV.text: In the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.

WEBM.text: Now on the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!”

JFA.text: Vós tendes por pai o Diabo, e quereis satisfazer os desejos de vosso pai; ele é homicida desde o princípio, e nunca se firmou na verdade, porque nele não há verdade; quando ele profere mentira, fala do que lhe é próprio; porque é mentiroso, e pai da mentira.

RVA.text: Vosotros de vuestro padre el diablo sois, y los deseos de vuestro padre queréis cumplir. Él, homicida ha sido desde el principio, y no permaneció en la verdad, porque no hay verdad en él. Cuando habla mentira, de suyo habla; porque es mentiroso, y padre de mentira.

KJV.text: Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.

WEBM.text: You are of your father, the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and doesn’t stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks on his own; for he is a liar, and its father.

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhes Jesus: Em verdade, em verdade vos digo que antes que Abraão existisse, eu sou.

RVA.text: Díjoles Jesús: De cierto, de cierto os digo: Antes que Abraham fuese, yo soy.

KJV.text: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to them, “Most certainly, I tell you, before Abraham came into existence, I AM.”

JFA.text: Misericórdia, paz e amor vos sejam multiplicados.

RVA.text: Misericordia, y paz, y amor os sean multiplicados.

KJV.text: Mercy unto you, and peace, and love, be multiplied.

WEBM.text: Mercy to you and peace and love be multiplied.

JFA.text: O que era desde o princípio, o que ouvimos, o que vimos com os nossos olhos, o que contemplamos e as nossas mãos apalparam, a respeito do Verbo da vida.

RVA.text: Lo que era desde el principio, lo que hemos oído, lo que hemos visto con nuestros ojos, lo que hemos mirado, y palparon nuestras manos tocante al Verbo de vida.

KJV.text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life;

WEBM.text: That which was from the beginning, that which we have heard, that which we have seen with our eyes, that which we saw, and our hands touched, concerning the Word of life

JFA.text: E esta é a mensagem que dele ouvimos, e vos anunciamos: que Deus é luz, e nele não há trevas nenhumas.

RVA.text: Y este es el mensaje que oímos de él, y os anunciamos: Que Dios es luz, y en él no hay ningunas tinieblas.

KJV.text: This then is the message which we have heard of him, and declare unto you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.

WEBM.text: This is the message which we have heard from him and announce to you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.

JFA.text: Meus filhinhos, estas coisas vos escrevo, para que não pequeis; mas, se alguém pecar, temos um Advogado para com o Pai, Jesus Cristo, o justo.

RVA.text: Hijitos míos, estas cosas os escribo, para que no pequéis; y si alguno hubiere pecado, abogado tenemos para con el Padre, á Jesucristo el justo.

KJV.text: My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not. And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:

WEBM.text: My little children, I write these things to you so that you may not sin. If anyone sins, we have a Counselor with the Father, Jesus Christ, the righteous.

JFA.text: Não ameis o mundo, nem o que há no mundo. Se alguém ama o mundo, o amor do Pai não está nele.

RVA.text: No améis al mundo, ni las cosas que están en el mundo. Si alguno ama al mundo, el amor del Padre no está en él.

KJV.text: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

WEBM.text: Don’t love the world or the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the Father’s love isn’t in him.

JFA.text: E ele é a propiciação pelos nossos pecados, e não somente pelos nossos, mas também pelos de todo o mundo.

RVA.text: Y él es la propiciación por nuestros pecados: y no solamente por los nuestros, sino también por los de todo el mundo.

KJV.text: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for the sins of the whole world.

WEBM.text: And he is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for the whole world.

JFA.text: E nisto sabemos que o conhecemos; se guardamos os seus mandamentos.

RVA.text: Y en esto sabemos que nosotros le hemos conocido, si guardamos sus mandamientos.

KJV.text: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.

WEBM.text: This is how we know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.

JFA.text: Vede que grande amor nos tem concedido o Pai: que fôssemos chamados filhos de Deus; e nós o somos. Por isso o mundo não nos conhece; porque não conheceu a ele.

RVA.text: Mirad cuál amor nos ha dado el Padre, que seamos llamados hijos de Dios: por esto el mundo no nos conoce, porque no le conoce á él.

KJV.text: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.

WEBM.text: See how great a love the Father has given to us, that we should be called children of God! For this cause the world doesn’t know us, because it didn’t know him.

JFA.text: Amados, agora somos filhos de Deus, e ainda não é manifesto o que havemos de ser. Mas sabemos que, quando ele se manifestar, seremos semelhantes a ele; porque assim como é, o veremos.

RVA.text: Muy amados, ahora somos hijos de Dios, y aun no se ha manifestado lo que hemos de ser; pero sabemos que cuando él apareciere, seremos semejantes á él, porque le veremos como él es.

KJV.text: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.

WEBM.text: Beloved, now we are children of God, and it is not yet revealed what we will be. But we know that, when he is revealed, we will be like him; for we will see him just as he is.

JFA.text: Todo aquele que vive habitualmente no pecado também vive na rebeldia, pois o pecado é rebeldia.

RVA.text: Cualquiera que hace pecado, traspasa también la ley; pues el pecado es transgresión de la ley.

KJV.text: Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.

WEBM.text: Everyone who sins also commits lawlessness. Sin is lawlessness.

JFA.text: Quem comete pecado é do Diabo; porque o Diabo peca desde o princípio. Para isto o Filho de Deus se manifestou: para destruir as obras do Diabo.

RVA.text: El que hace pecado, es del diablo; porque el diablo peca desde el principio. Para esto apareció el Hijo de Dios, para deshacer las obras del diablo.

KJV.text: He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

WEBM.text: He who sins is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. To this end the Son of God was revealed: that he might destroy the works of the devil.

JFA.text: Amados, não creiais a todo espírito, mas provai se os espíritos vêm de Deus; porque muitos falsos profetas têm saído pelo mundo.

RVA.text: Amados, no creáis á todo espíritu, sino probad los espíritus si son de Dios; porque muchos falsos profetas son salidos en el mundo.

KJV.text: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

WEBM.text: Beloved, don’t believe every spirit, but test the spirits, whether they are of God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.

JFA.text: Nisto está o amor: não em que nós tenhamos amado a Deus, mas em que ele nos amou a nós, e enviou seu Filho como propiciação pelos nossos pecados.

RVA.text: En esto consiste el amor: no que nosotros hayamos amado á Dios, sino que él nos amó á nosotros, y ha enviado á su Hijo en propiciación por nuestros pecados.

KJV.text: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.

WEBM.text: In this is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son as the atoning sacrifice for our sins.

JFA.text: Nós amamos, porque ele nos amou primeiro.

RVA.text: Nosotros le amamos á él, porque él nos amó primero.

KJV.text: We love him, because he first loved us.

WEBM.text: We love him, because he first loved us.

JFA.text: Eles são do mundo, por isso falam como quem é do mundo, e o mundo os ouve.

RVA.text: Ellos son del mundo; por eso hablan del mundo, y el mundo los oye.

KJV.text: They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world, and the world heareth them.

WEBM.text: They are of the world. Therefore they speak of the world, and the world hears them.

JFA.text: Aquele que não ama não conhece a Deus; porque Deus é amor.

RVA.text: El que no ama, no conoce á Dios; porque Dios es amor.

KJV.text: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.

WEBM.text: He who doesn’t love doesn’t know God, for God is love.

JFA.text: Todo aquele que crê que Jesus é o Cristo, é o nascido de Deus; e todo aquele que ama ao que o gerou, ama também ao que dele é nascido.

RVA.text: Todo aquel que cree que Jesús es el Cristo, es nacido de Dios: y cualquiera que ama al que ha engendrado, ama también al que es nacido de él.

KJV.text: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten of him.

WEBM.text: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ has been born of God. Whoever loves the Father also loves the child who is born of him.

JFA.text: Porque muito me alegrei quando os irmãos vieram e testificaram da tua verdade, como tu andas na verdade.

RVA.text: Ciertamente me gocé mucho cuando vinieron los hermanos y dieron testimonio de tu verdad, así como tú andas en la verdad.

KJV.text: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

WEBM.text: For I rejoiced greatly, when brothers came and testified about your truth, even as you walk in truth.

JFA.text: Ora, chegado o dia em que os filhos de Deus vieram apresentar-se perante o Senhor, veio também Satanás entre eles.

RVA.text: Y un día vinieron los hijos de Dios á presentarse delante de Jehová, entre los cuales vino también Satán.

KJV.text: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan came also among them.

WEBM.text: Now on the day when God’s sons came to present themselves before the Lord, Satan also came among them.

JFA.text: Havia um homem na terra de Uz, cujo nome era Jó. Era homem íntegro e reto, que temia a Deus e se desviava do mal.

RVA.text: Hubo un varón en tierra de Hus, llamado Job; y era este hombre perfecto y recto, y temeroso de Dios, y apartado del mal.

KJV.text: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and eschewed evil.

WEBM.text: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job. That man was blameless and upright, and one who feared God, and turned away from evil.

JFA.text: Eis que os filhos são herança da parte do Senhor, e o fruto do ventre o seu galardão.

RVA.text: He aquí, heredad de Jehová son los hijos: Cosa de estima el fruto del vientre.

KJV.text: Lo, children are an heritage of the Lord: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.

WEBM.text: Behold, children are a heritage of the Lord. The fruit of the womb is his reward.

JFA.text: Eu me deito e durmo; acordo, pois o Senhor me sustenta.

RVA.text: Yo me acosté, y dormí, Y desperté; porque Jehová me sostuvo.

KJV.text: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the Lord sustained me.

WEBM.text: I lie down and sleep; I wake again, because the Lord sustains me.

JFA.text: Ora, o mundo passa, e a sua concupiscência; mas aquele que faz a vontade de Deus, permanece para sempre.

RVA.text: Y el mundo se pasa, y su concupiscencia; mas el que hace la voluntad de Dios, permanece para siempre.

KJV.text: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.

WEBM.text: The world is passing away with its lusts, but he who does God’s will remains forever.

JFA.text: O coração alegre aformoseia o rosto; mas pela dor do coração o espírito se abate.

RVA.text: El corazón alegre hermosea el rostro: Mas por el dolor de corazón el espíritu se abate.

KJV.text: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.

WEBM.text: Happiness makes you smile; sorrow can crush you.

JFA.text: Porque melhor é a sabedoria do que as jóias; e de tudo o que se deseja nada se pode comparar com ela.

RVA.text: Porque mejor es la sabiduría que las piedras preciosas; Y todas las cosas que se pueden desear, no son de comparar con ella.

KJV.text: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

WEBM.text: For wisdom is far more valuable than rubies. Nothing you desire can compare with it.

JFA.text: Fazer justiça e julgar com retidão é mais aceitável ao Senhor do que oferecer-lhe sacrifício.

RVA.text: Hacer justicia y juicio es á Jehová Más agradable que sacrificio.

KJV.text: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.

WEBM.text: To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to Lord than sacrifice.

JFA.text: Não se afastem de ti a benignidade e a fidelidade; ata-as ao teu pescoço, escreve-as na tábua do teu coração.

RVA.text: Misericordia y verdad no te desamparen; Atalas á tu cuello, Escríbelas en la tabla de tu corazón.

KJV.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart.

WEBM.text: Don’t let kindness and truth forsake you. Bind them around your neck. Write them on the tablet of your heart.

JFA.text: Nisto são manifestos os filhos de Deus, e os filhos do Diabo: quem não pratica a justiça não é de Deus, nem o que não ama a seu irmão.

RVA.text: En esto son manifiestos los hijos de Dios, y los hijos del diablo: cualquiera que no hace justicia, y que no ama á su hermano, no es de Dios.

KJV.text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whosoever doeth not righteousness is not of God, neither he that loveth not his brother.

WEBM.text: Anyone who does not do what is right is not a child of God; nor is anyone who does not love his brother.

JFA.text: Os que forem sábios, pois, resplandecerão como o fulgor do firmamento; e os que converterem a muitos para a justiça, como as estrelas sempre e eternamente.

RVA.text: Y los entendidos resplandecerán como el resplandor del firmamento; y los que enseñan á justicia la multitud, como las estrellas á perpetua eternidad.

KJV.text: And they that be wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament; and they that turn many to righteousness as the stars for ever and ever.

WEBM.text: Those who are wise will shine as the brightness of the expanse. Those who turn many to righteousness will shine as the stars forever and ever.

JFA.text: Mas a vós que ouvis, digo: Amai a vossos inimigos, fazei bem aos que vos odeiam, bendizei aos que vos maldizem, e orai pelos que vos caluniam.

RVA.text: Mas á vosotros los que oís, digo: Amad á vuestros enemigos, haced bien á los que os aborrecen; Bendecid á los que os maldicen, y orad por los que os calumnian.

KJV.text: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you, bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.

WEBM.text: Love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you. Speak well of those who curse you.

JFA.text: O malfazejo atenta para o lábio iníquo; o mentiroso inclina os ouvidos para a língua maligna.

RVA.text: El malo está atento al labio inicuo; Y el mentiroso escucha á la lengua detractora.

KJV.text: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.

WEBM.text: Wrong doers eagerly listen to gossip; liars pay close attention to slander.

JFA.text: O justo toma conhecimento da causa dos pobres; mas o ímpio não tem entendimento para a conhecer.

RVA.text: Conoce el justo la causa de los pobres: Mas el impío no entiende sabiduría.

KJV.text: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

WEBM.text: The good-hearted understand what it's like to be poor; the hardhearted haven't the faintest idea.

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Jesus: O que eu faço, tu não o sabes agora; mas depois o entenderás.

RVA.text: Respondió Jesús, y díjole: Lo que yo hago, tú no entiendes ahora; mas lo entenderás después.

KJV.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.

WEBM.text: Jesus replied, "You do not realize now what I am doing, but later you will understand."

JFA.text: E terás confiança, porque haverá esperança; olharás ao redor de ti e repousarás seguro.

RVA.text: Y confiarás, que habrá esperanza; Y cavarás, y dormirás seguro.

KJV.text: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest in safety.

WEBM.text: You will be secure, because there is hope; you will look about you and take your rest in safety.

JFA.text: Porque quando estou fraco, então é que sou forte.

RVA.text: Porque cuando soy flaco, entonces soy poderoso.

KJV.text: For when I am weak, then am I strong.

WEBM.text: For when I am weak, then I am strong.

JFA.text: Sejam agradáveis as palavras da minha boca e a meditação do meu coração perante a tua face, Senhor, Rocha minha e Redentor meu!

RVA.text: Sean gratos los dichos de mi boca y la meditación de mi corazón delante de ti, Oh Jehová, roca mía, y redentor mío.

KJV.text: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.

WEBM.text: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your sight, O Lord, my rock, and my redeemer.

JFA.text: Não respondas ao tolo segundo a sua estultícia, para que também não te faças semelhante a ele.

RVA.text: Nunca respondas al necio en conformidad á su necedad, Para que no seas tú también como él.

KJV.text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

WEBM.text: Do not answer a fool according to his folly, Lest you also be like him.

JFA.text: Se achaste mel, come somente o que te basta, para que porventura não te fartes dele, e o venhas a vomitar.

RVA.text: ¿Hallaste la miel? come lo que te basta; No sea que te hartes de ella, y la vomites.

KJV.text: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

WEBM.text: Have you found honey? Eat as much as is sufficient for you, lest you eat too much, and vomit it.

JFA.text: O justo anda na sua integridade; bem-aventurados serão os seus filhos depois dele.

RVA.text: El justo que camina en su integridad, Bienaventurados serán sus hijos después de él.

KJV.text: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.

WEBM.text: God-loyal people, living honest lives, make it much easier for their children.

JFA.text: Seja outro o que te louve, e não a tua boca; o estranho, e não os teus lábios.

RVA.text: Alábete el extraño, y no tu boca; El ajeno, y no tus labios.

KJV.text: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

WEBM.text: Don't brag about yourself - let others praise you.

JFA.text: Se o teu inimigo tiver fome, dá-lhe pão para comer, e se tiver sede, dá-lhe água para beber.

RVA.text: Si el que te aborrece tuviere hambre, dale de comer pan; Y si tuviere sed, dale de beber agua.

KJV.text: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink.

WEBM.text: If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat. If he is thirsty, give him water to drink;

JFA.text: O que faz um homem desejável é a sua benignidade; e o pobre é melhor do que o mentiroso.

RVA.text: Contentamiento es á los hombres hacer misericordia: Pero mejor es el pobre que el mentiroso.

KJV.text: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.

WEBM.text: That which makes a man to be desired is his kindness. A poor man is better than a liar.

JFA.text: Honroso é para o homem o desviar-se de questões; mas todo insensato se entremete nelas.

RVA.text: Honra es del hombre dejarse de contienda: Mas todo insensato se envolverá en ella.

KJV.text: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

WEBM.text: It makes you look good when you avoid a fight only fools love to quarrel.

JFA.text: O justo olha pela vida dos seus animais; porém as entranhas dos ímpios são crueis.

RVA.text: El justo atiende á la vida de su bestia: Mas las entrañas de los impíos son crueles.
