KJV.text: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

WEBM.text: A righteous man cares for the needs of his animal, but the kindest acts of the wicked are cruel.

JFA.text: Ouça também, o sábio e cresça em ciência, e o entendido adquira habilidade.

RVA.text: Oirá el sabio, y aumentará el saber; Y el entendido adquirirá consejo.

KJV.text: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels.

WEBM.text: that the wise man may hear, and increase in learning; that the man of understanding may attain to sound counsel:

JFA.text: Mais digno de ser escolhido é o bom nome do que as muitas riquezas; e o favor é melhor do que a prata e o ouro.

RVA.text: De más estima es la buena fama que las muchas riquezas; Y la buena gracia más que la plata y el oro.

KJV.text: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

WEBM.text: A good name is more desirable than great riches, and loving favor is better than silver and gold.

JFA.text: Refreia as suas palavras aquele que possui o conhecimento; e o homem de entendimento é de espírito sereno.

RVA.text: Detiene sus dichos el que tiene sabiduría: De prudente espíritu es el hombre entendido.

KJV.text: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

WEBM.text: A man of knowledge uses words with restraint, and a man of understanding is even-tempered.

JFA.text: O justo odeia a palavra mentirosa, mas o ímpio se faz odioso e se cobre de vergonha.

RVA.text: El justo aborrece la palabra de mentira: Mas el impío se hace odioso é infame.

KJV.text: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.

WEBM.text: A righteous man hates lies, but a wicked man brings shame and disgrace.

JFA.text: Até o tolo, estando calado, é tido por sábio; e o que cerra os seus lábios, por entendido.

RVA.text: Aun el necio cuando calla, es contado por sabio: El que cierra sus labios es entendido.

KJV.text: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.

WEBM.text: Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise; when he closes his lips, he is deemed intelligent.

JFA.text: O caminho do preguiçoso é como a sebe de espinhos; porém a vereda dos justos é uma estrada real.

RVA.text: El camino del perezoso es como seto de espinos: Mas la vereda de los rectos como una calzada.

KJV.text: The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.

WEBM.text: The path of lazy people is overgrown with briers; the diligent walk down a smooth road.

JFA.text: Ora, havendo Deus completado no dia sétimo a obra que tinha feito, descansou nesse dia de toda a obra que fizera.

RVA.text: Y acabó Dios en el día séptimo su obra que hizo, y reposó el día séptimo de toda su obra que había hecho.

KJV.text: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

WEBM.text: By the seventh day God had finished the work he had been doing; so on the seventh day he rested from all his work.

JFA.text: E ambos estavam nus, o homem e sua mulher; e não se envergonhavam.

RVA.text: Y estaban ambos desnudos, Adam y su mujer, y no se avergonzaban.

KJV.text: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

WEBM.text: The man and his wife were both naked, and they felt no shame.

JFA.text: Porque o Senhor conhece o caminho dos justos, mas o caminho dos ímpios conduz à ruína.

RVA.text: Porque Jehová conoce el camino de los justos; Mas la senda de los malos perecerá.

KJV.text: For the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

WEBM.text: For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked leads to destruction.

JFA.text: Então foram abertos os olhos de ambos, e conheceram que estavam nus; pelo que coseram folhas de figueira, e fizeram para si aventais.

RVA.text: Y fueron abiertos los ojos de entrambos, y conocieron que estaban desnudos: entonces cosieron hojas de higuera, y se hicieron delantales.

KJV.text: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

WEBM.text: Then the eyes of Adam and Eve were opened, and they realized they were naked.

JFA.text: Então o Senhor perguntou a Caim: Por que te iraste? e por que está descaído o teu semblante? Porventura se procederes bem, não se há de levantar o teu semblante?

RVA.text: Entonces Jehová dijo á Caín: ¿Por qué te has ensañado, y por qué se ha inmutado tu rostro? Si bien hicieres, ¿no serás ensalzado?

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen? If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted?

WEBM.text: Then the Lord said to Cain, "Why are you angry? Why is your face downcast? If you do what is right, will you not be accepted?"

JFA.text: Filho meu, ouve a instrução de teu pai, e não deixes o ensino de tua mãe.

RVA.text: Oye, hijo mío, la doctrina de tu padre, Y no desprecies la dirección de tu madre.

KJV.text: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother.

WEBM.text: Listen to your father's instruction and do not forsake your mother's teaching.

JFA.text: Agora, pois, ó reis, sede prudentes; deixai-vos instruir, juízes da terra.

RVA.text: Y ahora, reyes, entended: Admitid corrección, jueces de la tierra.

KJV.text: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

WEBM.text: Therefore, you kings, be wise; be warned, you rulers of the earth. Serve the Lord with fear and rejoice with trembling.

JFA.text: E caiu chuva sobre a terra quarenta dias e quarenta noites.

RVA.text: Y hubo lluvia sobre la tierra cuarenta días y cuarenta noches.

KJV.text: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.

WEBM.text: And rain fell on the earth forty days and forty nights.

JFA.text: E prevaleceram as águas sobre a terra cento e cinquenta dias.

RVA.text: Y prevalecieron las aguas sobre la tierra ciento y cincuenta días.

KJV.text: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.

WEBM.text: The waters flooded the earth for a hundred and fifty days.

JFA.text: E já está posto o machado á raiz das árvores; toda árvore, pois que não produz bom fruto, é cortada e lançada no fogo.

RVA.text: Ahora, ya también la segur está puesta á la raíz de los árboles; y todo árbol que no hace buen fruto, es cortado y echado en el fuego.

KJV.text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

WEBM.text: The ax is already at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.

JFA.text: E, tendo jejuado quarenta dias e quarenta noites, depois teve fome.

RVA.text: Y habiendo ayunado cuarenta días y cuarenta noches, después tuvo hambre.

KJV.text: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.

WEBM.text: After fasting forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.

JFA.text: Então ordenou-lhe Jesus: Vai-te, Satanás; porque está escrito: Ao Senhor teu Deus adorarás, e só a ele servirás.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús le dice: Vete, Satanás, que escrito está: Al Señor tu Dios adorarás y á él solo servirás.

KJV.text: Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, "Away from me, Satan! For it is written: ‘Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only.’"

JFA.text: Filho meu, se os pecadores te quiserem seduzir, não consintas.

RVA.text: Hijo mío, si los pecadores te quisieren engañar, No consientas.

KJV.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

WEBM.text: My son, if sinful men entice you, do not give in to them.

JFA.text: Filho meu, não andes no caminho com eles; guarda da sua vereda o teu pé.

RVA.text: Hijo mío, no andes en camino con ellos; Aparta tu pie de sus veredas.

KJV.text: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path.

WEBM.text: My son, do not go along with them, do not set foot on their paths; for their feet rush into evil, they are swift to shed blood.

JFA.text: Mas estes se põem em emboscadas contra o seu próprio sangue, e as suas próprias vidas espreitam.

RVA.text: Mas ellos á su propia sangre ponen asechanzas, Y á sus almas tienden lazo.

KJV.text: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

WEBM.text: These (sinful) men lie in wait for their own blood; they ambush only themselves!

JFA.text: Tais são as veredas de todo aquele que se entrega à cobiça; ela tira a vida dos que a possuem.

RVA.text: Tales son las sendas de todo el que es dado á la codicia, La cual prenderá el alma de sus poseedores.

KJV.text: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

WEBM.text: Such is the end of all who go after ill-gotten gain; it takes away the lives of those who get it.

JFA.text: O amor é sofredor, é benigno; o amor não é invejoso; o amor não se vangloria, não se ensoberbece, não se porta inconvenientemente, não busca os seus próprios interesses, não se irrita, não suspeita mal.

RVA.text: La caridad es sufrida, es benigna; la caridad no tiene envidia, la caridad no hace sinrazón, no se ensancha; No es injuriosa, no busca lo suyo, no se irrita, no piensa el mal.

KJV.text: Charity suffereth long, and is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up, Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil.

WEBM.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.

JFA.text: E o anjo lhes disse: Não temais, porque eis aqui vos trago novas de grande alegria, que será para todo o povo

RVA.text: Mas el ángel les dijo: No temáis; porque he aquí os doy nuevas de gran gozo, que será para todo el pueblo

KJV.text: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

WEBM.text: The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be to all the people."

JFA.text: E isto vos será por sinal: Achareis o menino envolto em panos, e deitado numa manjedoura.

RVA.text: Y esto os será por señal: hallaréis al niño envuelto en pañales, echado en un pesebre.

KJV.text: And this shall be a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.

WEBM.text: This is the sign to you: you will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a feeding trough.

JFA.text: Os quais lhes disseram: Varões galileus, porque estais olhando para o céu? Esse Jesus, que de entre vós foi recebido em cima no céu, há-de vir assim como para o céu o vistes ir.

RVA.text: Los cuales también les dijeron: Varones Galileos, ¿qué estáis mirando al cielo? este mismo Jesús que ha sido tomado desde vosotros arriba en el cielo, así vendrá como le habéis visto ir al cielo.

KJV.text: Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

WEBM.text: who also said, “You men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who was received up from you into the sky will come back in the same way as you saw him going into the sky.

JFA.text: E eu, João, vi a santa cidade, a nova Jerusalém, que de Deus descia do céu, adereçada como uma esposa ataviada para o seu marido.

RVA.text: Y yo Juan vi la santa ciudad, Jerusalem nueva, que descendía del cielo, de Dios, dispuesta como una esposa ataviada para su marido.

KJV.text: And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

WEBM.text: I saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared like a bride adorned for her husband.

JFA.text: Aquele que testifica estas coisas diz: Certamente cedo venho. Amen. Ora vem, Senhor Jesus.

RVA.text: El que da testimonio de estas cosas, dice: Ciertamente, vengo en breve. Amén, sea así. Ven: Señor Jesús.

KJV.text: He which testifieth these things saith, Surely I come quickly. Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus.

WEBM.text: He who testifies these things says, “Yes, I come quickly.” Amen! Yes, come, Lord Jesus.

JFA.text: Escondi a tua palavra no meu coração, para eu não pecar contra ti.

RVA.text: En mi corazón he guardado tus dichos, Para no pecar contra ti.

KJV.text: Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

WEBM.text: I have hidden your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you.

JFA.text: E estas palavras que hoje te ordeno estarão no teu coração;

RVA.text: Y estas palabras que yo te mando hoy, estarán sobre tu corazón:

KJV.text: And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be in thine heart:

WEBM.text: These words, which I command you today, shall be on your heart;

JFA.text: E se sabemos que nos ouve em tudo o que pedirmos, sabemos que alcançamos as petições que lhe fizermos.

RVA.text: Y si sabemos que él nos oye en cualquiera cosa que demandáremos, sabemos que tenemos las peticiones que le hubiéremos demandado.

KJV.text: And if we know that he hear us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired of him.

WEBM.text: And if we know that he listens to us, whatever we ask, we know that we have the petitions which we have asked of him.

JFA.text: Não sejais vagarosos no cuidado: sede fervorosos no espírito, servindo ao Senhor;

RVA.text: En el cuidado no perezosos; ardientes en espíritu; sirviendo al Señor;

KJV.text: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

WEBM.text: not lagging in diligence; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord

JFA.text: Se for possível, quanto estiver em vós, tende paz com todos os homens.

RVA.text: Si se puede hacer, cuanto está en vosotros, tened paz con todos los hombres.

KJV.text: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

WEBM.text: If it is possible, as much as it is up to you, be at peace with all men.

JFA.text: Cada um contribua segundo propôs no seu coração; não com tristeza, ou por necessidade; porque Deus ama ao que dá com alegria.

RVA.text: Cada uno dé como propuso en su corazón: no con tristeza, ó por necesidad; porque Dios ama el dador alegre.

KJV.text: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.

WEBM.text: Let each man give according as he has determined in his heart; not grudgingly, or under compulsion; for God loves a cheerful giver.

JFA.text: A resposta branda desvia o furor, mas a palavra dura suscita a ira.

RVA.text: LA blanda respuesta quita la ira: Mas la palabra áspera hace subir el furor.

KJV.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

WEBM.text: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

JFA.text: Sujeitando-vos uns aos outros no temor de Deus.

RVA.text: Sujetados los unos á los otros en el temor de Dios.

KJV.text: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

WEBM.text: subjecting yourselves to one another in the fear of Christ.

JFA.text: Tenha, porém, a paciência a sua obra perfeita, para que sejais perfeitos e completos, sem faltar em coisa alguma.

RVA.text: Mas tenga la paciencia perfecta su obra, para que seáis perfectos y cabales, sin faltar en alguna cosa.

KJV.text: But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

WEBM.text: Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.

JFA.text: Regozijai-vos sempre.

RVA.text: Estad siempre gozosos.

KJV.text: Rejoice evermore.

WEBM.text: Rejoice always.

JFA.text: E a paz de Deus, para a qual também fôstes chamados em um corpo, domine em vossos corações; e sêde agradecidos.

RVA.text: Y la paz de Dios gobierne en vuestros corazones, á la cual asimismo sois llamados en un cuerpo; y sed agradecidos.

KJV.text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.

WEBM.text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which also you were called in one body; and be thankful.

JFA.text: No dia em que eu temer, hei de confiar em ti.

RVA.text: En el día que temo, Yo en ti confío.

KJV.text: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

WEBM.text: When I am afraid, I will put my trust in you.

JFA.text: Em paz também me deitarei e dormirei, porque só tu, SENHOR, me fazes habitar em segurança.

RVA.text: En paz me acostaré, y asimismo dormiré; Porque solo tú, Jehová, me harás estar confiado.

KJV.text: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, Lord, only makest me dwell in safety.

WEBM.text: In peace I will both lay myself down and sleep, for you, Lord alone, make me live in safety.

JFA.text: O SENHOR é o meu pastor; nada me faltará.

RVA.text: Salmo de David. JEHOVA es mi pastor; nada me faltará.

KJV.text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.

WEBM.text: The Lord is my shepherd: I shall lack nothing.

JFA.text: Deitar-me faz em verdes pastos, guia-me mansamente a águas tranquilas.

RVA.text: En lugares de delicados pastos me hará yacer: Junto á aguas de reposo me pastoreará.

KJV.text: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.

WEBM.text: He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters.

JFA.text: Refrigera a minha alma; guia-me pelas veredas da justiça por amor do seu nome.

RVA.text: Confortará mi alma; Guiárame por sendas de justicia por amor de su nombre.

KJV.text: He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake.

WEBM.text: He restores my soul. He guides me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.

JFA.text: Ainda que eu andasse pelo vale da sombra da morte, não temeria mal algum, porque tu estás comigo; a tua vara e o teu cajado me consolam.

RVA.text: Aunque ande en valle de sombra de muerte, No temeré mal alguno; porque tú estarás conmigo: Tu vara y tu cayado me infundirán aliento.

KJV.text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

WEBM.text: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me. Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

JFA.text: Preparas uma mesa perante mim na presença dos meus inimigos, unges a minha cabeça com óleo, o meu cálice transborda.

RVA.text: Aderezarás mesa delante de mí, en presencia de mis angustiadores: Ungiste mi cabeza con aceite: mi copa está rebosando.

KJV.text: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

WEBM.text: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil. My cup runs over.

JFA.text: Certamente que a bondade e a misericórdia me seguirão todos os dias da minha vida; e habitarei na Casa do SENHOR por longos dias.

RVA.text: Ciertamente el bien y la misericordia me seguirán todos los días de mi vida: Y en la casa de Jehová moraré por largos días.

KJV.text: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.

WEBM.text: Surely goodness and loving kindness shall follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the Lord’s house forever.

JFA.text: Viu Deus que a luz era boa; e separou a luz das trevas.

RVA.text: Y vió Dios que la luz era buena: y apartó Dios la luz de las tinieblas.

KJV.text: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.

WEBM.text: God saw the light, and saw that it was good. God divided the light from the darkness.

JFA.text: Chamou Deus à luz “Dia”, e às trevas chamou “Noite”. Houve então, a tarde e a manhã: o primeiro dia.

RVA.text: Y llamó Dios á la luz Día, y á las tinieblas llamó Noche: y fué la tarde y la mañana un día.

KJV.text: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

WEBM.text: God called the light “day”, and the darkness he called “night”. There was evening and there was morning, the first day.

JFA.text: E disse Deus: haja um firmamento no meio das águas, e haja separação entre águas e águas.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Haya expansión en medio de las aguas, y separe las aguas de las aguas.

KJV.text: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let there be an expanse in the middle of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.”

JFA.text: Fez, pois, Deus o firmamento, e separou as águas que estavam debaixo do firmamento das que estavam por cima do firmamento. E assim foi.

RVA.text: E hizo Dios la expansión, y apartó las aguas que estaban debajo de la expansión, de las aguas que estaban sobre la expansión: y fué así.

KJV.text: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.

WEBM.text: God made the expanse, and divided the waters which were under the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse; and it was so.

JFA.text: Então disse Deus: “Que as águas que estão sob o céu se reúnam num só lugar, a fim de que apareça a parte seca!” E assim aconteceu.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Júntense las aguas que están debajo de los cielos en un lugar, y descúbrase la seca: y fué así.

KJV.text: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear;” and it was so.

JFA.text: Chamou Deus ao elemento seco terra, e ao ajuntamento das águas mares. E viu Deus que isso era bom.

RVA.text: Y llamó Dios á la seca Tierra, y á la reunión de las aguas llamó Mares: y vió Dios que era bueno.

KJV.text: And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.

WEBM.text: God called the dry land “earth”, and the gathering together of the waters he called “seas”. God saw that it was good.

JFA.text: A terra, pois, produziu relva, ervas que davam semente segundo as suas espécies, e árvores que davam fruto que tinha em si a sua semente, segundo as suas espécies. E viu Deus que isso era bom.

RVA.text: Y produjo la tierra hierba verde, hierba que da simiente según su naturaleza, y árbol que da fruto, cuya simiente está en él, según su género: y vió Dios que era bueno.

KJV.text: And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

WEBM.text: The earth yielded grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit, with their seeds in it, after their kind; and God saw that it was good.

JFA.text: E disse Deus: haja luminares no firmamento do céu, para fazerem separação entre o dia e a noite; sejam eles para sinais e para estações, e para dias e anos.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Sean lumbreras en la expansión de los cielos para apartar el día y la noche: y sean por señales, y para las estaciones, y para días y años.

KJV.text: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs to mark seasons, days, and years;

JFA.text: E sirvam de luminares no firmamento do céu, para alumiar a terra. E assim foi.

RVA.text: Y sean por lumbreras en la expansión de los cielos para alumbrar sobre la tierra: y fue.

KJV.text: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.

WEBM.text: And let them be for lights in the expanse of the sky to give light on the earth;” and it was so.

JFA.text: Deus, pois, fez os dois grandes luminares: o luminar maior para governar o dia, e o luminar menor para governar a noite; fez também as estrelas.

RVA.text: E hizo Dios las dos grandes lumbreras; la lumbrera mayor para que señorease en el día, y la lumbrera menor para que señorease en la noche: hizo también las estrellas.

KJV.text: And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.

WEBM.text: God made the two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night. He also made the stars.

JFA.text: E Deus os pôs no firmamento do céu para alumiar a terra.

RVA.text: Y púsolas Dios en la expansión de los cielos, para alumbrar sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth.

WEBM.text: God set them in the expanse of the sky to give light to the earth,

JFA.text: Para governar o dia e a noite, e para fazer separação entre a luz e as trevas. E viu Deus que isso era bom.

RVA.text: Y para señorear en el día y en la noche, y para apartar la luz y las tinieblas: y vió Dios que era bueno.

KJV.text: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.

WEBM.text: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God saw that it was good.

JFA.text: E foi a tarde e a manhã, o dia quarto.

RVA.text: Y fué la tarde y la mañana el día cuarto.

KJV.text: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.

WEBM.text: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.

JFA.text: E disse Deus: Produzam as águas cardumes de seres viventes; e voem as aves acima da terra no firmamento do céu.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Produzcan las aguas reptil de ánima viviente, y aves que vuelen sobre la tierra, en la abierta expansión de los cielos.

KJV.text: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let the waters abound with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of the sky.”

JFA.text: Criou, pois, Deus os monstros marinhos, e todos os seres viventes que se arrastavam, os quais as águas produziram abundantemente segundo as suas espécies; e toda ave que voa, segundo a sua espécie. E viu Deus que isso era bom.

RVA.text: Y crió Dios las grandes ballenas, y toda cosa viva que anda arrastrando, que las aguas produjeron según su género, y toda ave alada según su especie: y vió Dios que era bueno.

KJV.text: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

WEBM.text: God created the large sea creatures and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.

JFA.text: Então Deus os abençoou, dizendo: Frutificai e multiplicai-vos, e enchei as águas dos mares; e multipliquem-se as aves sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y Dios los bendijo diciendo: Fructificad y multiplicad, y henchid las aguas en los mares, y las aves se multipliquen en la tierra.

KJV.text: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.

WEBM.text: God blessed them, saying, “Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth.”

JFA.text: E foi a tarde e a manhã, o dia quinto.

RVA.text: Y fué la tarde y la mañana el día quinto.

KJV.text: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.

WEBM.text: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.

JFA.text: E disse Deus: Produza a terra seres viventes segundo as suas espécies: animais domésticos, répteis, e animais selvagens segundo as suas espécies. E assim foi.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Produzca la tierra seres vivientes según su género, bestias y serpientes y animales de la tierra según su especie: y fué así.

KJV.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let the earth produce living creatures after their kind, livestock, creeping things, and animals of the earth after their kind;” and it was so.

JFA.text: Deus, pois, fez os animais selvagens segundo as suas espécies, e os animais domésticos segundo as suas espécies, e todos os répteis da terra segundo as suas espécies. E viu Deus que isso era bom.

RVA.text: E hizo Dios animales de la tierra según su género, y ganado según su género, y todo animal que anda arrastrando sobre la tierra según su especie: y vió Dios que era bueno.

KJV.text: And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

WEBM.text: God made the animals of the earth after their kind, and the livestock after their kind, and everything that creeps on the ground after its kind. God saw that it was good.

JFA.text: E a todos os animais da terra, a todas as aves do céu e a todo ser vivente que se arrasta sobre a terra, tenho dado todas as ervas verdes como mantimento. E assim foi.

RVA.text: Y á toda bestia de la tierra, y á todas las aves de los cielos, y á todo lo que se mueve sobre la tierra, en que hay vida, toda hierba verde les será para comer: y fué así.

KJV.text: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.

WEBM.text: To every animal of the earth, and to every bird of the sky, and to everything that creeps on the earth, in which there is life, I have given every green herb for food;” and it was so.

JFA.text: Eis as origens dos céus e da terra, quando foram criados. No dia em que o Senhor Deus fez a terra e os céus

RVA.text: Estos son los orígenes de los cielos y de la tierra cuando fueron criados, el día que Jehová Dios hizo la tierra y los cielos.

KJV.text: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the Lord God made the earth and the heavens.

WEBM.text: This is the history of the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that God made the earth and the heavens.

JFA.text: Não havia ainda nenhuma planta do campo na terra, pois nenhuma erva do campo tinha ainda brotado; porque o Senhor Deus não tinha feito chover sobre a terra, nem havia homem para lavrar a terra.

RVA.text: Y toda planta del campo antes que fuese en la tierra, y toda hierba del campo antes que naciese: porque aun no había Jehová Dios hecho llover sobre la tierra, ni había hombre para que labrase la tierra.

KJV.text: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the Lord God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.

WEBM.text: No plant of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for God had not caused it to rain on the earth. There was not a man to till the ground.

JFA.text: Um vapor, porém, subia da terra, e regava toda a face da terra.

RVA.text: Mas subía de la tierra un vapor, que regaba toda la faz de la tierra.

KJV.text: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

WEBM.text: But a mist went up from the earth, and watered the whole surface of the ground.

JFA.text: Viram os filhos de Deus que as filhas dos homens eram formosas; e tomaram para si mulheres de todas as que escolheram.

RVA.text: Viendo los hijos de Dios que las hijas de los hombres eran hermosas, tomáronse mujeres, escogiendo entre todas.

KJV.text: That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.

WEBM.text: God’s sons saw that men’s daughters were beautiful, and they took any that they wanted for themselves as wives.

JFA.text: Então disse o Senhor: O meu Espírito não permanecerá para sempre no homem, porquanto ele é carne, mas os seus dias serão cento e vinte anos.

RVA.text: Y dijo Jehová: No contenderá mi espíritu con el hombre para siempre, porque ciertamente él es carne: mas serán sus días ciento y veinte años.

KJV.text: And the Lord said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.

WEBM.text: And the Lord said, “My Spirit will not strive with man forever, because he also is flesh; so his days will be one hundred twenty years.”

JFA.text: Naqueles dias estavam os nefilins na terra, e também depois, quando os filhos de Deus conheceram as filhas dos homens, as quais lhes deram filhos. Esses nefilins eram os valentes, os homens de renome, que houve na antiguidade.

RVA.text: Había gigantes en la tierra en aquellos días, y también después que entraron los hijos de Dios á las hijas de los hombres, y les engendraron hijos: éstos fueron los valientes que desde la antigüedad fueron varones de nombre.

KJV.text: There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown.

WEBM.text: The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when God’s sons came in to men’s daughters and had children with them. Those were the mighty men who were of old, men of renown.

JFA.text: Então arrependeu-se o Senhor de haver feito o homem na terra, e isso lhe pesou no coração.

RVA.text: Y arrepintióse Jehová de haber hecho hombre en la tierra, y pesóle en su corazón.

KJV.text: And it repented the Lord that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.

WEBM.text: And the Lord was sorry that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him in his heart

JFA.text: E disse o Senhor: Destruirei da face da terra o homem que criei, tanto o homem como o animal, os répteis e as aves do céu; porque me arrependo de os haver feito.

RVA.text: Y dijo Jehová: Raeré los hombres que he criado de sobre la faz de la tierra, desde el hombre hasta la bestia, y hasta el reptil y las aves del cielo: porque me arrepiento de haberlos hecho.

KJV.text: And the Lord said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the air; for it repenteth me that I have made them.

WEBM.text: And the Lord said, “I will destroy man whom I have created from the surface of the ground—man, along with animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky—for I am sorry that I have made them.”

JFA.text: Noé, porém, achou graça aos olhos do Senhor.

RVA.text: Empero Noé halló gracia en los ojos de Jehová.

KJV.text: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the Lord.

WEBM.text: But Noah found favor in the Lord’s eyes.

JFA.text: Gerou Noé três filhos: Sem, Cão e Jafé.

RVA.text: Y engendró Noé tres hijos: á Sem, á Châm, y á Japhet.

KJV.text: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

WEBM.text: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

JFA.text: A terra, porém, estava corrompida diante de Deus, e cheia de violência.

RVA.text: Y corrompióse la tierra delante de Dios, y estaba la tierra llena de violencia.

KJV.text: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

WEBM.text: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

JFA.text: Viu Deus a terra, e eis que estava corrompida; porque toda a carne havia corrompido o seu caminho sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y miró Dios la tierra, y he aquí que estaba corrompida; porque toda carne había corrompido su camino sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And God looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.

WEBM.text: God saw the earth, and saw that it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way on the earth.

JFA.text: Então disse Deus a Noé: O fim de toda carne é chegado perante mim; porque a terra está cheia da violência dos homens; eis que os destruirei juntamente com a terra.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios á Noé: El fin de toda carne ha venido delante de mí; porque la tierra está llena de violencia á causa de ellos; y he aquí que yo los destruiré con la tierra.

KJV.text: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.

WEBM.text: God said to Noah, “I will bring an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Behold, I will destroy them and the earth.

JFA.text: Faze para ti uma arca de madeira de gôfer: farás compartimentos na arca, e a revestirás de betume por dentro e por fora.

RVA.text: Hazte un arca de madera de Gopher: harás aposentos en el arca y la embetunarás con brea por dentro y por fuera.

KJV.text: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

WEBM.text: Make a ship of gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ship, and shall seal it inside and outside with pitch.

JFA.text: Desta maneira a farás: o comprimento da arca será de trezentos côvados, a sua largura de cinqüenta e a sua altura de trinta.

RVA.text: Y de esta manera la harás: de trescientos codos la longitud del arca, de cincuenta codos su anchura, y de treinta codos su altura.

KJV.text: And this is the fashion which thou shalt make it of: The length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.

WEBM.text: This is how you shall make it. The length of the ship shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.

JFA.text: Farás na arca uma janela e lhe darás um côvado de altura; e a porta da arca porás no seu lado; fá-la-ás com andares, baixo, segundo e terceiro.

RVA.text: Una ventana harás al arca, y la acabarás á un codo de elevación por la parte de arriba: y pondrás la puerta del arca á su lado; y le harás piso bajo, segundo y tercero.

KJV.text: A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.

WEBM.text: You shall make a roof in the ship, and you shall finish it to a cubit upward. You shall set the door of the ship in its side. You shall make it with lower, second, and third levels.

JFA.text: Porque eis que eu trago o dilúvio sobre a terra, para destruir, de debaixo do céu, toda a carne em que há espírito de vida; tudo o que há na terra expirará.

RVA.text: Y yo, he aquí que yo traigo un diluvio de aguas sobre la tierra, para destruir toda carne en que haya espíritu de vida debajo del cielo; todo lo que hay en la tierra morirá.

KJV.text: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

WEBM.text: I, even I, will bring the flood of waters on this earth, to destroy all flesh having the breath of life from under the sky. Everything that is in the earth will die.

JFA.text: Mas contigo estabelecerei o meu pacto; entrarás na arca, tu e contigo teus filhos, tua mulher e as mulheres de teus filhos.

RVA.text: Mas estableceré mi pacto contigo, y entrarás en el arca tú, y tus hijos y tu mujer, y las mujeres de tus hijos contigo.

KJV.text: But with thee will I establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons' wives with thee.

WEBM.text: But I will establish my covenant with you. You shall come into the ship, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives with you.

JFA.text: De tudo o que vive, de toda a carne, dois de cada espécie, farás entrar na arca, para os conservares vivos contigo; macho e fêmea serão.

RVA.text: Y de todo lo que vive, de toda carne, dos de cada especie meterás en el arca, para que tengan vida contigo; macho y hembra serán.

KJV.text: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.

WEBM.text: Of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ship, to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female.

JFA.text: Das aves segundo as suas espécies, do gado segundo as suas espécies, de todo réptil da terra segundo as suas espécies, dois de cada espécie virão a ti, para os conservares em vida.

RVA.text: De las aves según su especie, y de las bestias según su especie, de todo reptil de la tierra según su especie, dos de cada especie entrarán contigo para que hayan vida.

KJV.text: Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.

WEBM.text: Of the birds after their kind, of the livestock after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort will come to you, to keep them alive.

JFA.text: Leva contigo de tudo o que se come, e ajunta-o para ti; e te será para alimento, a ti e a eles.

RVA.text: Y toma contigo de toda vianda que se come, y allégala á ti; servirá de alimento para ti y para ellos.

KJV.text: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.

WEBM.text: Take with you some of all food that is eaten, and gather it to yourself; and it will be for food for you, and for them.”

JFA.text: Assim fez Noé; segundo tudo o que Deus lhe mandou, assim o fez.

RVA.text: E hízolo así Noé; hizo conforme á todo lo que Dios le mandó.

KJV.text: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.

WEBM.text: Thus Noah did. He did all that God commanded him.

JFA.text: Ora, a serpente era o mais astuto de todos os animais do campo, que o Senhor Deus tinha feito. E esta disse à mulher: É assim que Deus disse: Não comereis de toda árvore do jardim?

RVA.text: Empero la serpiente era astuta, más que todos los animales del campo que Jehová Dios había hecho; la cual dijo á la mujer: ¿Conque Dios os ha dicho: No comáis de todo árbol del huerto?

KJV.text: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

WEBM.text: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which the Lord God had made. He said to the woman, “Has God really said, ‘You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?’”

JFA.text: Então, vendo a mulher que aquela árvore era boa para se comer, e agradável aos olhos, e árvore desejável para dar entendimento, tomou do seu fruto, comeu, e deu a seu marido, e ele também comeu.

RVA.text: Y vió la mujer que el árbol era bueno para comer, y que era agradable á los ojos, y árbol codiciable para alcanzar la sabiduría; y tomó de su fruto, y comió; y dió también á su marido, el cual comió así como ella.

KJV.text: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.

WEBM.text: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took some of its fruit, and ate; and she gave some to her husband with her, and he ate it, too.

JFA.text: Porei inimizade entre ti e a mulher, e entre a tua descendência e a sua descendência; esta te ferirá a cabeça, e tu lhe ferirás o calcanhar.

RVA.text: Y enemistad pondré entre ti y la mujer, y entre tu simiente y la simiente suya; ésta te herirá en la cabeza, y tú le herirás en el calcañar.

KJV.text: And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.

WEBM.text: I will put hostility between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel.

JFA.text: E à mulher disse: Multiplicarei grandemente a dor da tua conceição; em dor darás à luz filhos; e o teu desejo será para o teu marido, e ele te dominará.

RVA.text: A la mujer dijo: Multiplicaré en gran manera tus dolores y tus preñeces; con dolor parirás los hijos; y á tu marido será tu deseo, y él se enseñoreará de ti.

KJV.text: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.

WEBM.text: To the woman he said, “I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. In pain you will bear children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.”

JFA.text: Conheceu Adão a Eva, sua mulher; ela concebeu e, tendo dado à luz a Caim, disse: Alcancei do Senhor um varão.

RVA.text: Y conocio Adam á su mujer Eva, la cual concibió y parió á Caín, y dijo: Adquirido he varón por Jehová.

KJV.text: And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the Lord.

WEBM.text: The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, “I have gotten a man with the Lord’s help.”

JFA.text: Sucedeu que, quando os homens começaram a multiplicar-se sobre a terra, e lhes nasceram filhas.

RVA.text: Y acaecio que, cuando comenzaron los hombres á multiplicarse sobre la faz de la tierra, y les nacieron hijas,

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,

WEBM.text: When men began to multiply on the surface of the ground, and daughters were born to them

JFA.text: Viu o Senhor que era grande a maldade do homem na terra, e que toda a imaginação dos pensamentos de seu coração era má continuamente.

RVA.text: Y vió Jehová que la malicia de los hombres era mucha en la tierra, y que todo designio de los pensamientos del corazón de ellos era de continuo solamente el mal.

KJV.text: And God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.

WEBM.text: The Lord saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of man’s heart was continually only evil.

JFA.text: Estas são as gerações de Noé. Era homem justo e perfeito em suas gerações, e andava com Deus.

RVA.text: Estas son las generaciones de Noé: Noé, varón justo, perfecto fué en sus generaciones; con Dios caminó Noé.

KJV.text: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.

WEBM.text: This is the history of the generations of Noah: Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.

JFA.text: Ora, toda a terra tinha uma só língua e um só idioma.

RVA.text: Era entonces toda la tierra de una lengua y unas mismas palabras.

KJV.text: And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.

WEBM.text: The whole earth was of one language and of one speech.

JFA.text: Ora, o Senhor disse a Abrão: Sai-te da tua terra, da tua parentela, e da casa de teu pai, para a terra que eu te mostrarei.

RVA.text: Empero Jehová había dicho á Abram: Vete de tu tierra y de tu parentela, y de la casa de tu padre, á la tierra que te mostraré.

KJV.text: Now the Lord had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's house, unto a land that I will shew thee:

WEBM.text: Now the Lord said to Abram, “Leave your country, and your relatives, and your father’s house, and go to the land that I will show you.”

JFA.text: Abençoarei aos que te abençoarem, e amaldiçoarei àquele que te amaldiçoar; e em ti serão benditas todas as famílias da terra.

RVA.text: Y bendeciré á los que te bendijeren, y á los que te maldijeren maldeciré: y serán benditas en ti todas las familias de la tierra.

KJV.text: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.

WEBM.text: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who curses you. All the families of the earth will be blessed through you.

JFA.text: Depois destas coisas veio a palavra do Senhor a Abrão numa visão, dizendo: Não temas, Abrão; eu sou o teu escudo, o teu galardão será grandíssimo.

RVA.text: Después de estas cosas fué la palabra de Jehová á Abram en visión, diciendo: No temas, Abram; yo soy tu escudo, y tu galardón sobremanera grande.

KJV.text: After these things the word of the Lord came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.

WEBM.text: After these things the Lord’s word came to Abram in a vision, saying, “Don’t be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward.”

JFA.text: Quando Abrão tinha noventa e nove anos, apareceu-lhe o Senhor e lhe disse: Eu sou o Deus Todo-Poderoso; anda em minha presença, e sê perfeito.

RVA.text: Y siendo Abram de edad de noventa y nueve años, aparecióle Jehová, y le dijo: Yo soy el Dios Todopoderoso; anda delante de mí, y sé perfecto.

KJV.text: And when Abram was ninety years old and nine, the Lord appeared to Abram, and said unto him, I am the Almighty God; walk before me, and be thou perfect.

WEBM.text: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to Abram, and said to him, “I am God Almighty. Walk before me, and be blameless.”

JFA.text: Sucedeu, depois destas coisas, que Deus provou a Abraão, dizendo-lhe: Abraão! E este respondeu: Eis-me aqui.

RVA.text: Y acontecio después de estas cosas, que tentó Dios á Abraham, y le dijo: Abraham. Y él respondió: Heme aquí.

KJV.text: And it came to pass after these things, that God did tempt Abraham, and said unto him, Abraham: and he said, Behold, here I am.

WEBM.text: After these things, God tested Abraham, and said to him, “Abraham!” He said, “Here I am.”

JFA.text: Depois disse o Senhor a Noé: Entra na arca, tu e toda a tua casa, porque tenho visto que és justo diante de mim nesta geração.

RVA.text: Y JEHOVA dijo á Noé: Entra tú y toda tu casa en el arca porque á ti he visto justo delante de mí en esta generación.

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.

WEBM.text: And the Lord said to Noah, “Come with all of your household into the ship, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation.

JFA.text: De todos os animais limpos levarás contigo sete e sete, o macho e sua fêmea; mas dos animais que não são limpos, dois, o macho e sua fêmea.

RVA.text: De todo animal limpio te tomarás de siete en siete, macho y su hembra; mas de los animales que no son limpios, dos, macho y su hembra.

KJV.text: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.

WEBM.text: You shall take seven pairs of every clean animal with you, the male and his female. Of the animals that are not clean, take two, the male and his female.

JFA.text: Também das aves do céu sete e sete, macho e fêmea, para se conservar em vida sua espécie sobre a face de toda a terra.

RVA.text: También de las aves de los cielos de siete en siete, macho y hembra; para guardar en vida la casta sobre la faz de toda la tierra.

KJV.text: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.

WEBM.text: Also of the birds of the sky, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive on the surface of all the earth.

JFA.text: Porque, passados ainda sete dias, farei chover sobre a terra quarenta dias e quarenta noites, e exterminarei da face da terra todas as criaturas que fiz.

RVA.text: Porque pasados aún siete días, yo haré llover sobre la tierra cuarenta días y cuarenta noches; y raeré toda sustancia que hice de sobre la faz de la tierra.

KJV.text: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.

WEBM.text: In seven days, I will cause it to rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights. I will destroy every living thing that I have made from the surface of the ground.”

JFA.text: E Noé fez segundo tudo o que o Senhor lhe ordenara.

RVA.text: E hizo Noé conforme á todo lo que le mandó Jehová.

KJV.text: And Noah did according unto all that the Lord commanded him.

WEBM.text: And Noah did everything that the Lord commanded him.

JFA.text: Tinha Noé seiscentos anos de idade, quando o dilúvio veio sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y siendo Noé de seiscientos años, el diluvio de las aguas fué sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.

WEBM.text: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth.

JFA.text: Noé entrou na arca com seus filhos, sua mulher e as mulheres de seus filhos, por causa das águas do dilúvio.

RVA.text: Y vino Noé, y sus hijos, y su mujer, y las mujeres de sus hijos con él al arca, por las aguas del diluvio.

KJV.text: And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.

WEBM.text: Noah went into the ship with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, because of the floodwaters.

JFA.text: Dos animais limpos e dos que não são limpos, das aves, e de todo réptil sobre a terra.

RVA.text: De los animales limpios, y de los animales que no eran limpios, y de las aves, y de todo lo que anda arrastrando sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth.

WEBM.text: Clean animals, unclean animals, birds, and everything that creeps on the ground.

JFA.text: Entraram dois a dois para junto de Noé na arca, macho e fêmea, como Deus ordenara a Noé.

RVA.text: De dos en dos entraron á Noé en el arca: macho y hembra, como mandó Dios á Noé.

KJV.text: There went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.

WEBM.text: Went by pairs to Noah into the ship, male and female, as God commanded Noah.

JFA.text: Passados os sete dias, vieram sobre a terra as águas do dilúvio.

RVA.text: Y sucedió que al séptimo día las aguas del diluvio fueron sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.

WEBM.text: After the seven days, the floodwaters came on the earth.

JFA.text: No ano seiscentos da vida de Noé, no mês segundo, aos dezessete dias do mês, romperam-se todas as fontes do grande abismo, e as janelas do céu se abriram.

RVA.text: El año seiscientos de la vida de Noé, en el mes segundo á diecisiete días del mes, aquel día fueron rotas todas las fuentes del grande abismo, y las cataratas de los cielos fueron abiertas.

KJV.text: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.

WEBM.text: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day all the fountains of the great deep burst open, and the sky’s windows opened.

JFA.text: Nesse mesmo dia entrou Noé na arca, e juntamente com ele seus filhos Sem, Cão e Jafé, como também sua mulher e as três mulheres de seus filhos.

RVA.text: En este mismo día entró Noé, y Sem, y Châm y Japhet, hijos de Noé, la mujer de Noé, y las tres mujeres de sus hijos con él en el arca.

KJV.text: In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark.

WEBM.text: In the same day Noah, and Shem, Ham, and Japheth—the sons of Noah—and Noah’s wife and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ship.

JFA.text: E com eles todo animal segundo a sua espécie, todo o gado segundo a sua espécie, todo réptil que se arrasta sobre a terra segundo a sua espécie e toda ave segundo a sua espécie, pássaros de toda qualidade.

RVA.text: Ellos y todos los animales silvestres según sus especies, y todos los animales mansos según sus especies, y todo reptil que anda arrastrando sobre la tierra según su especie, y toda ave según su especie, todo pájaro, toda especie de volátil.

KJV.text: They, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.

WEBM.text: They, and every animal after its kind, all the livestock after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.

JFA.text: Entraram para junto de Noé na arca, dois a dois de toda a carne em que havia espírito de vida.

RVA.text: Y vinieron á Noé al arca, de dos en dos de toda carne en que había espíritu de vida.

KJV.text: And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein is the breath of life.

WEBM.text: Pairs from all flesh with the breath of life in them went into the ship to Noah.

JFA.text: E os que entraram eram macho e fêmea de toda a carne, como Deus lhe tinha ordenado; e o Senhor o fechou dentro.

RVA.text: Y los que vinieron, macho y hembra de toda carne vinieron, como le había mandado Dios: y Jehová le cerró la puerta.

KJV.text: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the Lord shut him in.

WEBM.text: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; then the Lord shut him in.

JFA.text: Veio o dilúvio sobre a terra durante quarenta dias; e as águas cresceram e levantaram a arca, e ela se elevou por cima da terra.

RVA.text: Y fué el diluvio cuarenta días sobre la tierra; y las aguas crecieron, y alzaron el arca, y se elevó sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth.

WEBM.text: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ship, and it was lifted up above the earth.

JFA.text: Prevaleceram as águas e cresceram grandemente sobre a terra; e a arca vagava sobre as águas.

RVA.text: Y prevalecieron las aguas, y crecieron en gran manera sobre la tierra; y andaba el arca sobre la faz de las aguas.

KJV.text: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.

WEBM.text: The waters rose, and increased greatly on the earth; and the ship floated on the surface of the waters.

JFA.text: As águas prevaleceram excessivamente sobre a terra; e todos os altos montes que havia debaixo do céu foram cobertos.

RVA.text: Y las aguas prevalecieron mucho en extremo sobre la tierra; y todos los montes altos que había debajo de todos los cielos, fueron cubiertos.

KJV.text: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that were under the whole heaven, were covered.

WEBM.text: The waters rose very high on the earth. All the high mountains that were under the whole sky were covered.

JFA.text: Quinze côvados acima deles prevaleceram as águas; e assim foram cobertos.

RVA.text: Quince codos en alto prevalecieron las aguas; y fueron cubiertos los montes.

KJV.text: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.

WEBM.text: The waters rose fifteen cubits higher, and the mountains were covered.

JFA.text: Pereceu toda a carne que se movia sobre a terra, tanto ave como gado, animais selvagens, todo réptil que se arrasta sobre a terra, e todo homem.

RVA.text: Y murió toda carne que se mueve sobre la tierra, así de aves como de ganados, y de bestias, y de todo reptil que anda arrastrando sobre la tierra, y todo hombre.

KJV.text: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man.

WEBM.text: All flesh died that moved on the earth, including birds, livestock, animals, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, and every man.

JFA.text: Tudo o que tinha fôlego do espírito de vida em suas narinas, tudo o que havia na terra seca, morreu.

RVA.text: Todo lo que tenía aliento de espíritu de vida en sus narices, de todo lo que había en la tierra, murió.

KJV.text: All in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was in the dry land, died.

WEBM.text: All on the dry land, in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, died.

JFA.text: Assim foram exterminadas todas as criaturas que havia sobre a face da terra, tanto o homem como o gado, o réptil, e as aves do céu; todos foram exterminados da terra; ficou somente Noé, e os que com ele estavam na arca.

RVA.text: Así fué destruída toda sustancia que vivía sobre la faz de la tierra, desde el hombre hasta la bestia, y los reptiles, y las aves del cielo; y fueron raídos de la tierra; y quedó solamente Noé, y lo que con él estaba en el arca.

KJV.text: And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and Noah only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark.

WEBM.text: Every living thing was destroyed that was on the surface of the ground, including man, livestock, creeping things, and birds of the sky. They were destroyed from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ship.

JFA.text: A terra era sem forma e vazia; e havia trevas sobre a face do abismo, mas o Espírito de Deus pairava sobre a face das águas.

RVA.text: Y la tierra estaba desordenada y vacía, y las tinieblas estaban sobre la haz del abismo, y el Espíritu de Dios se movía sobre la haz de las aguas.

KJV.text: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

WEBM.text: The earth was formless and empty. Darkness was on the surface of the deep and God’s Spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.

JFA.text: Chamou Deus ao firmamento céu. E foi a tarde e a manhã, o dia segundo.

RVA.text: Y llamó Dios á la expansión Cielos: y fué la tarde y la mañana el día segundo.

KJV.text: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.

WEBM.text: God called the expanse “sky”. There was evening and there was morning, a second day.

JFA.text: E disse Deus: Produza a terra relva, ervas que dêem semente, e árvores frutíferas que, segundo as suas espécies, dêem fruto que tenha em si a sua semente, sobre a terra. E assim foi.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Produzca la tierra hierba verde, hierba que dé simiente; árbol de fruto que dé fruto según su género, que su simiente esté en él, sobre la tierra: y fué así.

KJV.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

WEBM.text: God said, “Let the earth yield grass, herbs yielding seeds, and fruit trees bearing fruit after their kind, with their seeds in it, on the earth”; and it was so.

JFA.text: E foi a tarde e a manhã, o dia terceiro.

RVA.text: Y fué la tarde y la mañana el día tercero.

KJV.text: And the evening and the morning were the third day.

WEBM.text: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.

JFA.text: Então Deus os abençoou e lhes disse: Frutificai e multiplicai-vos; enchei a terra e sujeitai-a; dominai sobre os peixes do mar, sobre as aves do céu e sobre todos os animais que se arrastam sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y los bendijo Dios; y díjoles Dios: Fructificad y multiplicad, y henchid la tierra, y sojuzgadla, y señoread en los peces de la mar, y en las aves de los cielos, y en todas las bestias que se mueven sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.

WEBM.text: God blessed them. God said to them, “Be fruitful, multiply, fill the earth, and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living thing that moves on the earth.”

JFA.text: Disse-lhes mais: Eis que vos tenho dado todas as ervas que produzem semente, as quais se acham sobre a face de toda a terra, bem como todas as árvores em que há fruto que dê semente; ser-vos-ão para mantimento.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: He aquí que os he dado toda hierba que da simiente, que está sobre la haz de toda la tierra; y todo árbol en que hay fruto de árbol que da simiente, seros ha para comer.

KJV.text: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.

WEBM.text: God said, “Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is on the surface of all the earth, and every tree, which bears fruit yielding seed. It will be your food.”

JFA.text: Assim foram acabados os céus e a terra, com todo o seu exército.

RVA.text: Y fueron acabados los cielos y la tierra, y todo su ornamento.

KJV.text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

WEBM.text: The heavens, the earth, and all their vast array were finished.

JFA.text: Abençoou Deus o sétimo dia, e o santificou; porque nele descansou de toda a sua obra que criara e fizera.

RVA.text: Y bendijo Dios al día séptimo, y santificólo, porque en él reposó de toda su obra que había Dios criado y hecho.

KJV.text: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.

WEBM.text: God blessed the seventh day, and made it holy, because he rested in it from all his work of creation which he had done.

JFA.text: E formou o Senhor Deus o homem do pó da terra, e soprou-lhe nas narinas o fôlego da vida; e o homem tornou-se alma vivente.

RVA.text: Formó, pues, Jehová Dios al hombre del polvo de la tierra, y alentó en su nariz soplo de vida; y fué el hombre en alma viviente.

KJV.text: And the Lord God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

WEBM.text: The Lord God formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

JFA.text: Tomou, pois, o Senhor Deus o homem, e o pôs no jardim do Édem para o lavrar e guardar.

RVA.text: Tomó, pues, Jehová Dios al hombre, y le puso en el huerto de Edén, para que lo labrara y lo guardase.

KJV.text: And the Lord God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

WEBM.text: The Lord God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to cultivate and keep it.

JFA.text: Ordenou o Senhor Deus ao homem, dizendo: De toda árvore do jardim podes comer livremente; mas da árvore do conhecimento do bem e do mal, dessa não comerás; porque no dia em que dela comeres, certamente morrerás.

RVA.text: Y mandó Jehová Dios al hombre, diciendo: De todo árbol del huerto comerás; Mas del árbol de ciencia del bien y del mal no comerás de él; porque el día que de él comieres, morirás.

KJV.text: And the Lord God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.

WEBM.text: The Lord God commanded the man, saying, “You may freely eat of every tree of the garden; but you shall not eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil; for in the day that you eat of it, you will surely die.”

JFA.text: Disse mais o Senhor Deus: Não é bom que o homem esteja só; far-lhe-ei uma ajudadora que lhe seja idônea.

RVA.text: Y dijo Jehová Dios: No es bueno que el hombre esté solo; haréle ayuda idónea para él.

KJV.text: And the Lord God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.

WEBM.text: The Lord God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make him a helper comparable to him.”

JFA.text: Portanto deixará o homem a seu pai e a sua mãe, e unir-se-á à sua mulher, e serão uma só carne.

RVA.text: Por tanto, dejará el hombre á su padre y á su madre, y allegarse ha á su mujer, y serán una sola carne.

KJV.text: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.

WEBM.text: Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, and will join with his wife, and they will be one flesh.

JFA.text: Eis que o povo é um e todos têm uma só língua; e isto é o que começam a fazer; agora não haverá restrição para tudo o que eles intentarem fazer.

RVA.text: Y dijo Jehová: He aquí el pueblo es uno, y todos éstos tienen un lenguaje: y han comenzado á obrar, y nada les retraerá ahora de lo que han pensando hacer.

KJV.text: And the Lord said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

WEBM.text: The Lord said, Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language, and this is what they begin to do. Now nothing will be withheld from them, which they intend to do.

JFA.text: Enquanto a terra durar, não deixará de haver sementeira e ceifa, frio e calor, verão e inverno, dia e noite.

RVA.text: Todavía serán todos los tiempos de la tierra; la sementera y la siega, y el frío y calor, verano é invierno, y día y noche, no cesarán.

KJV.text: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

WEBM.text: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night will not cease.

JFA.text: Sentiu o Senhor o suave cheiro e disse em seu coração: Não tornarei mais a amaldiçoar a terra por causa do homem; porque a imaginação do coração do homem é má desde a sua meninice; nem tornarei mais a ferir todo vivente, como acabo de fazer.

RVA.text: Y percibió Jehová olor de suavidad; y dijo Jehová en su corazón: No tornaré más á maldecir la tierra por causa del hombre; porque el intento del corazón del hombre es malo desde su juventud: ni volveré más á destruir todo viviente, como he hecho.

KJV.text: And the Lord smelled a sweet savour; and the Lord said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

WEBM.text: The Lord smelled the pleasant aroma. The Lord said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake because the imagination of man’s heart is evil from his youth. I will never again strike every living thing, as I have done.

JFA.text: Tudo quanto se move e vive vos servirá de mantimento, bem como a erva verde; tudo vos tenho dado.

RVA.text: Todo lo que se mueve y vive, os será para mantenimiento: así como las legumbres y hierbas, os lo he dado todo.

KJV.text: Every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the green herb have I given you all things.

WEBM.text: Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. As I gave you the green herb, I have given everything to you.

JFA.text: A carne, porém, com sua vida, isto é, com seu sangue, não comereis.

RVA.text: Empero carne con su vida, que es su sangre, no comeréis.

KJV.text: But flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.

WEBM.text: But flesh with its life, that is, its blood, you shall not eat.

JFA.text: Quem derramar sangue de homem, pelo homem terá o seu sangue derramado; porque Deus fez o homem à sua imagem.

RVA.text: El que derramare sangre del hombre, por el hombre su sangre será derramada; porque á imagen de Dios es hecho el hombre.

KJV.text: Whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.

WEBM.text: Whoever sheds man’s blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image.

JFA.text: Sim, estabeleço o meu pacto convosco; não será mais destruída toda a carne pelas águas do dilúvio; e não haverá mais dilúvio, para destruir a terra.

RVA.text: Estableceré mi pacto con vosotros, y no fenecerá ya más toda carne con aguas de diluvio; ni habrá más diluvio para destruir la tierra.

KJV.text: And I will establish my covenant with you, neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.

WEBM.text: I will establish my covenant with you: All flesh will not be cut off any more by the waters of the flood. There will never again be a flood to destroy the earth.

JFA.text: O meu arco tenho posto nas nuvens, e ele será por sinal de haver um pacto entre mim e a terra.

RVA.text: Mi arco pondré en las nubes, el cual será por señal de convenio entre mí y la tierra.

KJV.text: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.

WEBM.text: I set my rainbow in the cloud, and it will be a sign of a covenant between me and the earth.

JFA.text: E acontecerá que, quando eu trouxer nuvens sobre a terra, e aparecer o arco nas nuvens, então me lembrarei do meu pacto, que está entre mim e vós e todo ser vivente de toda a carne; e as águas não se tornarão mais em dilúvio para destruir toda a carne.

RVA.text: Y será que cuando haré venir nubes sobre la tierra, se dejará ver entonces mi arco en las nubes. Y acordarme he del pacto mío, que hay entre mí y vosotros y toda alma viviente de toda carne; y no serán más las aguas por diluvio para destruir toda carne.

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud: And I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

WEBM.text: When I bring a cloud over the earth, that the rainbow will be seen in the cloud, and I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh, and the waters will no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

JFA.text: Então tomaram Sem e Jafé uma capa, e puseram-na sobre os seus ombros, e andando virados para trás, cobriram a nudez de seu pai, tendo os rostos virados, de maneira que não viram a nudez de seu pai.

RVA.text: Entonces Sem y Japhet tomaron la ropa, y la pusieron sobre sus propios hombros, y andando hacia atrás, cubrieron la desnudez de su padre teniendo vueltos sus rostros, y así no vieron la desnudez de su padre.

KJV.text: And Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father's nakedness.

WEBM.text: Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it on both their shoulders, went in backwards, and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were backwards, and they didn’t see their father’s nakedness.

JFA.text: Deus lembrou-se de Noé, de todos os animais e de todo o gado, que estavam com ele na arca; e Deus fez passar um vento sobre a terra, e as águas começaram a diminuir.

RVA.text: Y ACORDOSE Dios de Noé, y de todos los animales, y de todas las bestias que estaban con él en el arca; é hizo pasar Dios un viento sobre la tierra, y disminuyeron las aguas.

KJV.text: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters assuaged.

WEBM.text: God remembered Noah, all the animals, and all the livestock that were with him in the ship; and God made a wind to pass over the earth. The waters subsided.

JFA.text: Cerraram-se as fontes do abismo e as janelas do céu, e a chuva do céu se deteve.

RVA.text: Y se cerraron las fuentes del abismo, y las cataratas de los cielos; y la lluvia de los cielos fué detenida.

KJV.text: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained.

WEBM.text: The deep’s fountains and the sky’s windows were also stopped, and the rain from the sky was restrained.

JFA.text: As águas se foram retirando de sobre a terra; no fim de cento e cinquenta dias começaram a minguar.

RVA.text: Y tornáronse las aguas de sobre la tierra, yendo y volviendo: y decrecieron las aguas al cabo de ciento y cincuenta días.

KJV.text: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.

WEBM.text: The waters continually receded from the earth. After the end of one hundred fifty days the waters receded.

JFA.text: No sétimo mês, no dia dezessete do mês, repousou a arca sobre os montes de Arará.

RVA.text: Y reposó el arca en el mes séptimo, á dicisiete días del mes, sobre los montes de Armenia.

KJV.text: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.

WEBM.text: The ship rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat’s mountains.

JFA.text: E as águas foram minguando até o décimo mês; no décimo mês, no primeiro dia do mês, apareceram os cumes dos montes.

RVA.text: Y las aguas fueron decreciendo hasta el mes décimo: en el décimo, al primero del mes, se descubrieron las cimas de los montes.

KJV.text: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.

WEBM.text: The waters receded continually until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were visible.

JFA.text: Ao cabo de quarenta dias, abriu Noé a janela que havia feito na arca.

RVA.text: Y sucedió que, al cabo de cuarenta días, abrió Noé la ventana del arca que había hecho.
