KJV.text: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made.

WEBM.text: At the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ship which he had made.

JFA.text: Soltou um corvo que, saindo, ia e voltava até que as águas se secaram de sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y esperó aún otros siete días, y volvió á enviar la paloma fuera del arca.

KJV.text: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.

WEBM.text: And he sent out a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth.

JFA.text: Depois soltou uma pomba, para ver se as águas tinham minguado de sobre a face da terra.

RVA.text: Envió también de sí á la paloma, para ver si las aguas se habían retirado de sobre la faz de la tierra.

KJV.text: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground.

WEBM.text: He himself sent out a dove to see if the waters were abated from the surface of the ground.

JFA.text: Mas a pomba não achou onde pousar a planta do pé, e voltou a ele para a arca; porque as águas ainda estavam sobre a face de toda a terra; e Noé, estendendo a mão, tomou-a e a recolheu consigo na arca.

RVA.text: Y no halló la paloma donde sentar la planta de su pie, y volvióse á él al arca, porque las aguas estaban aún sobre la faz de toda la tierra: entonces él extendió su mano y cogiéndola, hízola entrar consigo en el arca.

KJV.text: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.

WEBM.text: But the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned into the ship to him, for the waters were on the surface of the whole earth. He put out his hand, and took her, and brought her to him into the ship.

JFA.text: Esperou ainda outros sete dias, e tornou a soltar a pomba fora da arca.

RVA.text: Y esperó aún otros siete días, y volvió á enviar la paloma fuera del arca.

KJV.text: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark.

WEBM.text: He waited yet another seven days; and again he sent the dove out of the ship.

JFA.text: Á tardinha a pomba voltou para ele, e eis no seu bico uma folha verde de oliveira; assim soube Noé que as águas tinham minguado de sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y la paloma volvió á él á la hora de la tarde: y he aquí que traía una hoja de oliva tomada en su pico: y entendió Noé que las aguas se habían retirado de sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf pluckt off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.

WEBM.text: The dove came back to him at evening and, behold, in her mouth was a freshly plucked olive leaf. So Noah knew that the waters were abated from the earth.

JFA.text: Então esperou ainda outros sete dias, e soltou a pomba; e esta não tornou mais a ele.

RVA.text: Y esperó aún otros siete días, y envió la paloma, la cual no volvió ya más á él.

KJV.text: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.

WEBM.text: He waited yet another seven days, and sent out the dove; and she didn’t return to him any more.

JFA.text: No ano seiscentos e um, no mês primeiro, no primeiro dia do mês, secaram-se as águas de sobre a terra. Então Noé tirou a cobertura da arca: e olhou, e eis que a face a terra estava enxuta.

RVA.text: Y sucedió que en el año seiscientos y uno de Noé, en el mes primero, al primero del mes, las aguas se enjugaron de sobre la tierra y quitó Noé la cubierta del arca, y miró, y he aquí que la faz de la tierra estaba enjuta.

KJV.text: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.

WEBM.text: In the six hundred first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ship, and looked. He saw that the surface of the ground was dry.

JFA.text: No segundo mês, aos vinte e sete dias do mês, a terra estava seca.

RVA.text: Y en el mes segundo, á los veintisiete días del mes, se secó la tierra.

KJV.text: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.

WEBM.text: In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.

JFA.text: Então falou Deus a Noé, dizendo:

RVA.text: Y habló Dios á Noé diciendo:

KJV.text: And God spake unto Noah, saying:

WEBM.text: God spoke to Noah, saying,

JFA.text: Sai da arca, tu, e juntamente contigo tua mulher, teus filhos e as mulheres de teus filhos.

RVA.text: Sal del arca tú, y tu mujer, y tus hijos, y las mujeres de tus hijos contigo.

KJV.text: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons' wives with thee.

WEBM.text: “Go out of the ship, you, your wife, your sons, and your sons’ wives with you.

JFA.text: Todos os animais que estão contigo, de toda a carne, tanto aves como gado e todo réptil que se arrasta sobre a terra, traze-os para fora contigo; para que se reproduzam abundantemente na terra, frutifiquem e se multipliquem sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Todos los animales que están contigo de toda carne, de aves y de bestias y de todo reptil que anda arrastrando sobre la tierra, sacarás contigo; y vayan por la tierra, y fructifiquen, y multiplíquense sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.

WEBM.text: Bring out with you every living thing that is with you of all flesh, including birds, livestock, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply on the earth.”

JFA.text: Então saiu Noé, e com ele seus filhos, sua mulher e as mulheres de seus filhos.

RVA.text: Entonces salió Noé, y sus hijos, y su mujer, y las mujeres de sus hijos con él.

KJV.text: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him:

WEBM.text: Noah went out, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives with him.

JFA.text: Todo animal, todo réptil e toda ave, tudo o que se move sobre a terra, segundo as suas famílias, saiu da arca.

RVA.text: Todos los animales, y todo reptil y toda ave, todo lo que se mueve sobre la tierra según sus especies, salieron del arca.

KJV.text: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.

WEBM.text: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatever moves on the earth, after their families, went out of the ship.

JFA.text: Edificou Noé um altar ao Senhor; e tomou de todo animal limpo e de toda ave limpa, e ofereceu holocaustos sobre o altar.

RVA.text: Y edificó Noé un altar á Jehová y tomó de todo animal limpio y de toda ave limpia, y ofreció holocausto en el altar.

KJV.text: And Noah builded an altar unto the Lord; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

WEBM.text: Noah built an altar to the Lord, and took of every clean animal, and of every clean bird, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

JFA.text: Abençoou Deus a Noé e a seus filhos, e disse-lhes: Frutificai e multiplicai-vos, e enchei a terra.

RVA.text: Y BENDIJO Dios á Noé y á sus hijos, y díjoles: Fructificad, y multiplicad, y henchid la tierra.

KJV.text: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

WEBM.text: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fruitful, multiply, and replenish the earth.

JFA.text: Terão medo e pavor de vós todo animal da terra, toda ave do céu, tudo o que se move sobre a terra e todos os peixes do mar; nas vossas mãos são entregues.

RVA.text: Y vuestro temor y vuestro pavor será sobre todo animal de la tierra, y sobre toda ave de los cielos, en todo lo que se moverá en la tierra, y en todos los peces del mar: en vuestra mano son entregados.

KJV.text: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth upon the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.

WEBM.text: The fear of you and the dread of you will be on every animal of the earth, and on every bird of the sky. Everything that moves along the ground, and all the fish of the sea, are delivered into your hand.

JFA.text: Certamente requererei o vosso sangue, o sangue das vossas vidas; de todo animal o requererei; como também do homem, sim, da mão do irmão de cada um requererei a vida do homem.

RVA.text: Porque ciertamente demandaré la sangre de vuestras vidas; de mano de todo animal la demandaré, y de mano del hombre; de mano del varón su hermano demandaré la vida del hombre.

KJV.text: And surely your blood of your lives will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man's brother will I require the life of man.

WEBM.text: I will surely require accounting for your life’s blood. At the hand of every animal I will require it. At the hand of man, even at the hand of every man’s brother, I will require the life of man.

JFA.text: Mas vós frutificai, e multiplicai-vos; povoai abundantemente a terra, e multiplicai-vos nela.

RVA.text: Mas vosotros fructificad, y multiplicaos; procread abundantemente en la tierra, y multiplicaos en ella.

KJV.text: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.

WEBM.text: Be fruitful and multiply. Increase abundantly in the earth, and multiply in it.”

JFA.text: Disse também Deus a Noé, e a seus filhos com ele.

RVA.text: Y habló Dios á Noé y á sus hijos con él, diciendo:

KJV.text: And God spake unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,

WEBM.text: God spoke to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,

JFA.text: Eis que eu estabeleço o meu pacto convosco e com a vossa descendência depois de vós.

RVA.text: Yo, he aquí que yo establezco mi pacto con vosotros, y con vuestra simiente después de vosotros.

KJV.text: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;

WEBM.text: “As for me, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your offspring after you.

JFA.text: E com todo ser vivente que convosco está: com as aves, com o gado e com todo animal da terra; com todos os que saíram da arca, sim, com todo animal da terra.

RVA.text: Y con toda alma viviente que está con vosotros, de aves, de animales, y de toda bestia de la tierra que está con vosotros; desde todos los que salieron del arca hasta todo animal de la tierra.

KJV.text: And with every living creature that is with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.

WEBM.text: And with every living creature that is with you: the birds, the livestock, and every animal of the earth with you, of all that go out of the ship, even every animal of the earth.

JFA.text: E disse Deus: Este é o sinal do pacto que firmo entre mim e vós e todo ser vivente que está convosco, por gerações perpétuas.

RVA.text: Y dijo Dios: Esta será la señal del pacto que yo establezco entre mí y vosotros y toda alma viviente que está con vosotros, por siglos perpetuos.

KJV.text: And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:

WEBM.text: God said, “This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations.

JFA.text: E acontecerá que, quando eu trouxer nuvens sobre a terra, e aparecer o arco nas nuvens.

RVA.text: Y será que cuando haré venir nubes sobre la tierra, se dejará ver entonces mi arco en las nubes.

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:

WEBM.text: When I bring a cloud over the earth, that the rainbow will be seen in the cloud.

JFA.text: Então me lembrarei do meu pacto, que está entre mim e vós e todo ser vivente de toda a carne; e as águas não se tornarão mais em dilúvio para destruir toda a carne.

RVA.text: Y acordarme he del pacto mío, que hay entre mí y vosotros y toda alma viviente de toda carne; y no serán más las aguas por diluvio para destruir toda carne.

KJV.text: And I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

WEBM.text: I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh, and the waters will no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

JFA.text: O arco estará nas nuvens, e olharei para ele a fim de me lembrar do pacto perpétuo entre Deus e todo ser vivente de toda a carne que está sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Y estará el arco en las nubes, y verlo he para acordarme del pacto perpetuo entre Dios y toda alma viviente, con toda carne que hay sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.

WEBM.text: The rainbow will be in the cloud. I will look at it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth.”

JFA.text: Disse Deus a Noé ainda: Esse é o sinal do pacto que tenho estabelecido entre mim e toda a carne que está sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Dijo, pues, Dios á Noé: Esta será la señal del pacto que he establecido entre mí y toda carne que está sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: And God said unto Noah, This is the token of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.

WEBM.text: God said to Noah, “This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth.”

JFA.text: Então falou Deus todas estas palavras, dizendo:

RVA.text: Y HABLO Dios todas estas palabras, diciendo:

KJV.text: And God spake all these words, saying,

WEBM.text: God spoke all these words, saying,

JFA.text: Eu sou o Senhor teu Deus, que te tirei da terra do Egito, da casa da servidão.

RVA.text: Yo soy JEHOVA tu Dios, que te saqué de la tierra de Egipto, de casa de siervos.

KJV.text: I am the Lord thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

WEBM.text: “I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

JFA.text: Não te encurvarás diante delas, nem as servirás; porque eu, o Senhor teu Deus, sou Deus zeloso, que visito a iniqüidade dos pais nos filhos até a terceira e quarta geração daqueles que me odeiam.

RVA.text: No te inclinarás á ellas, ni las honrarás; porque yo soy Jehová tu Dios, fuerte, celoso, que visito la maldad de los padres sobre los hijos, sobre los terceros y sobre los cuartos, á los que me aborrecen.

KJV.text: Thou shalt not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them: for I the Lord thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me;

WEBM.text: You shall not bow yourself down to them, nor serve them, for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, on the third and on the fourth generation of those who hate me.

JFA.text: E uso de misericórdia com milhares dos que me amam e guardam os meus mandamentos.

RVA.text: Y que hago misericordia en millares á los que me aman, y guardan mis mandamientos.

KJV.text: And shewing mercy unto thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments.

WEBM.text: And showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.

JFA.text: Não tomarás o nome do Senhor teu Deus em vão; porque o Senhor não terá por inocente aquele que tomar o seu nome em vão.

RVA.text: No tomarás el nombre de Jehová tu Dios en vano; porque no dará por inocente Jehová al que tomare su nombre en vano.

KJV.text: Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain; for the Lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.

WEBM.text: “You shall not misuse the name of the Lord your God, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who misuses his name.

JFA.text: Seis dias trabalharás, e farás todo o teu trabalho.

RVA.text: Seis días trabajarás, y harás toda tu obra.

KJV.text: Six days shalt thou labour, and do all thy work:

WEBM.text: You shall labor six days, and do all your work.

JFA.text: Mas o sétimo dia é o sábado do Senhor teu Deus. Nesse dia não farás trabalho algum, nem tu, nem teu filho, nem tua filha, nem o teu servo, nem a tua serva, nem o teu animal, nem o estrangeiro que está dentro das tuas portas.

RVA.text: Mas el séptimo día será reposo para Jehová tu Dios: no hagas en él obra alguna, tú, ni tu hijo, ni tu hija, ni tu siervo, ni tu criada, ni tu bestia, ni tu extranjero que está dentro de tus puertas.

KJV.text: But the seventh day is the sabbath of the Lord thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates:

WEBM.text: But the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. You shall not do any work in it, you, nor your son, nor your daughter, your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your livestock, nor your stranger who is within your gates.

JFA.text: Porque em seis dias fez o Senhor o céu e a terra, o mar e tudo o que neles há, e ao sétimo dia descansou; por isso o Senhor abençoou o dia do sábado, e o santificou.

RVA.text: Mas el séptimo día será reposo para Jehová tu Dios: no hagas en él obra alguna, tú, ni tu hijo, ni tu hija, ni tu siervo, ni tu criada, ni tu bestia, ni tu extranjero que está dentro de tus puertas:

KJV.text: For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the Lord blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.

WEBM.text: For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day; therefore God blessed the Sabbath day, and made it holy.

JFA.text: Não adulterarás.

RVA.text: No cometerás adulterio.

KJV.text: Thou shalt not commit adultery.

WEBM.text: You shall not commit adultery.

JFA.text: Não dirás falso testemunho contra o teu proximo.

RVA.text: No hablarás contra tu prójimo falso testimonio.

KJV.text: Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbour.

WEBM.text: You shall not give false testimony against your neighbor.

JFA.text: Não cobiçarás a casa do teu próximo, não cobiçarás a mulher do teu próximo, nem o seu servo, nem a sua serva, nem o seu boi, nem o seu jumento, nem coisa alguma do teu próximo.

RVA.text: No codiciarás la casa de tu prójimo, no codiciarás la mujer de tu prójimo, ni su siervo, ni su criada, ni su buey, ni su asno, ni cosa alguna de tu prójimo.

KJV.text: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbour's.

WEBM.text: You shall not covet your neighbor’s house. You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor’s.

JFA.text: E Jesus, descendo com eles, parou num lugar plano, onde havia não só grande número de seus discípulos, mas também grande multidão do povo, de toda a Judéia e Jerusalém, e do litoral de Tiro e de Sidom, que tinham vindo para ouví-lo e serem curados das suas doenças.

RVA.text: Y descendió con ellos, y se paró en un lugar llano, y la compañía de sus discípulos, y una grande multitud de pueblo de toda Judea y de Jerusalem, y de la costa de Tiro y de Sidón, que habían venido á oirle, y para ser sanados de sus enfermedades.

KJV.text: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

WEBM.text: He came down with them, and stood on a level place, with a crowd of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.

JFA.text: E os que eram atormentados por espíritos imundos ficavam curados.

RVA.text: Y los que habían sido atormentados de espíritus inmundos: y estaban curados.

KJV.text: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.

WEBM.text: As well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and they were being healed.

JFA.text: E toda a multidão procurava tocar-lhe; porque saía dele poder que curava a todos.

RVA.text: Y toda la gente procuraba tocarle; porque salía de él virtud, y sanaba á todos.

KJV.text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all.

WEBM.text: All the multitude sought to touch him, for power came out of him and healed them all.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados vós, que agora tendes fome, porque sereis fartos. Bem-aventurados vós, que agora chorais, porque haveis de rir.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados los que ahora tenéis hambre; porque seréis saciados. Bienaventurados los que ahora lloráis, porque reiréis.

KJV.text: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.

WEBM.text: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.

JFA.text: Bem-aventurados sereis quando os homens vos odiarem, e quando vos expulsarem da sua companhia, e vos injuriarem, e rejeitarem o vosso nome como indigno, por causa do Filho do homem.

RVA.text: Bienaventurados seréis, cuando los hombres os aborrecieren, y cuando os apartaren de sí, y os denostaren, y desecharen vuestro nombre como malo, por el Hijo del hombre.

KJV.text: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man's sake.

WEBM.text: Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.

JFA.text: Regozijai-vos nesse dia e exultai, porque eis que é grande o vosso galardão no céu; pois assim faziam os seus pais aos profetas.

RVA.text: Gozaos en aquel día, y alegraos; porque he aquí vuestro galardón es grande en los cielos; porque así hacían sus padres á los profetas.

KJV.text: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

WEBM.text: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven, for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.

JFA.text: Mas ai de vós que sois ricos! porque já recebestes a vossa consolação.

RVA.text: Mas ­ay de vosotros, ricos! porque tenéis vuestro consuelo.

KJV.text: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.

WEBM.text: But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.

JFA.text: Ai de vós, os que agora estais fartos! porque tereis fome. Ai de vós, os que agora rides! porque vos lamentareis e chorareis.

RVA.text: Ay de vosotros, los que estáis hartos! porque tendréis hambre. ­Ay de vosotros, los que ahora reís! porque lamentaréis y lloraréis.

KJV.text: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

WEBM.text: Woe to you, you who are full now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.

JFA.text: Ai de vós, quando todos os homens vos louvarem! porque assim faziam os seus pais aos falsos profetas.

RVA.text: Ay de vosotros, cuando todos los hombres dijeren bien de vosotros! porque así hacían sus padres á los falsos profetas.

KJV.text: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

WEBM.text: Woe, when men speak well of you, for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.

JFA.text: Ao que te ferir numa face, oferece-lhe também a outra; e ao que te houver tirado a capa, não lhe negues também a túnica.

RVA.text: Y al que te hiriere en la mejilla, dale también la otra; y al que te quitare la capa, ni aun el sayo le defiendas.

KJV.text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloak forbid not to take thy coat also.

WEBM.text: To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don’t withhold your coat also.

JFA.text: Dá a todo o que te pedir; e ao que tomar o que é teu, não lho reclames.

RVA.text: Y á cualquiera que te pidiere, da; y al que tomare lo que es tuyo, no vuelvas á pedir.

KJV.text: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again.

WEBM.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and don’t ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.

JFA.text: Se amardes aos que vos amam, que mérito há nisso? Pois também os pecadores amam aos que os amam.

RVA.text: Porque si amáis á los que os aman, ¿qué gracias tendréis? porque también los pecadores aman á los que los aman.

KJV.text: For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.

WEBM.text: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.

JFA.text: E se fizerdes bem aos que vos fazem bem, que mérito há nisso? Também os pecadores fazem o mesmo.

RVA.text: Y si hiciereis bien á los que os hacen bien, ¿qué gracias tendréis? porque también los pecadores hacen lo mismo.

KJV.text: And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.

WEBM.text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.

JFA.text: E se emprestardes àqueles de quem esperais receber, que mérito há nisso? Também os pecadores emprestam aos pecadores, para receberem outro tanto.

RVA.text: Y si prestareis á aquellos de quienes esperáis recibir, ¿qué gracias tendréis? porque también los pecadores prestan á los pecadores, para recibir otro tanto.

KJV.text: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.

WEBM.text: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.

JFA.text: Amai, porém a vossos inimigos, fazei bem e emprestai, nunca desanimado; e grande será a vossa recompensa, e sereis filhos do Altíssimo; porque ele é benigno até para com os integrantes e maus.

RVA.text: Amad, pués, á vuestros enemigos, y haced bien, y prestad, no esperando de ello nada; y será vuestro galardón grande, y seréis hijos del Altísimo: porque él es benigno para con los ingratos y malos.

KJV.text: But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil.

WEBM.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.

JFA.text: Sede misericordiosos, como também vosso Pai é misericordioso.

RVA.text: Sed pues misericordiosos, como también vuestro Padre es misericordioso.

KJV.text: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.

WEBM.text: Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.

JFA.text: E ele se pôs a ensiná-los, dizendo:

RVA.text: Y abriendo su boca, les enseñaba, diciendo:

KJV.text: And he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,

WEBM.text: He opened his mouth and taught them, saying,

JFA.text: Alegrai-vos e exultai, porque é grande o vosso galardão nos céus; porque assim perseguiram aos profetas que foram antes de vós.

RVA.text: Gozaos y alegraos; porque vuestra merced es grande en los cielos: que así persiguieron á los profetas que fueron antes de vosotros.

KJV.text: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.

WEBM.text: Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven. For that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

JFA.text: Qualquer, pois, que violar um destes mandamentos, por menor que seja, e assim ensinar aos homens, será chamado o menor no reino dos céus; aquele, porém, que os cumprir e ensinar será chamado grande no reino dos céus.

RVA.text: De manera que cualquiera que infringiere uno de estos mandamientos muy pequeños, y así enseñare á los hombres, muy pequeño será llamado en el reino de los cielos: mas cualquiera que hiciere y enseñare, éste será llamado grande en el reino de los cielos.

KJV.text: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

WEBM.text: Therefore, whoever shall break one of these least commandments and teach others to do so, shall be called least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whoever shall do and teach them shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.

JFA.text: Pois eu vos digo que, se a vossa justiça não exceder a dos escribas e fariseus, de modo nenhum entrareis no reino dos céus.

RVA.text: Porque os digo, que si vuestra justicia no fuere mayor que la de los escribas y de los Fariseos, no entraréis en el reino de los cielos.

KJV.text: For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.

WEBM.text: For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, there is no way you will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

JFA.text: Eu, porém, vos digo que todo aquele que se encolerizar contra seu irmão, será réu de juízo; e quem disser a seu irmão: Raca, será réu diante do sinédrio; e quem lhe disser: Tolo, será réu do fogo do inferno.

RVA.text: Mas yo os digo, que cualquiera que se enojare locamente con su hermano, será culpado del juicio; y cualquiera que dijere á su hermano, Raca, será culpado del concejo; y cualquiera que dijere, Fatuo, será culpado del infierno del fuego.

KJV.text: But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.

WEBM.text: But I tell you that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause will be in danger of the judgment. Whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca!’ will be in danger of the council. Whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be in danger of the fire of Gehenna.

JFA.text: Portanto, se estiveres apresentando a tua oferta no altar, e aí te lembrares de que teu irmão tem alguma coisa contra ti.

RVA.text: Por tanto, si trajeres tu presente al altar, y allí te acordares de que tu hermano tiene algo contra ti.

KJV.text: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee;

WEBM.text: “If therefore you are offering your gift at the altar, and there remember that your brother has anything against you.

JFA.text: Deixa ali diante do altar a tua oferta, e vai conciliar-te primeiro com teu irmão, e depois vem apresentar a tua oferta.

RVA.text: Deja allí tu presente delante del altar, y vete, vuelve primero en amistad con tu hermano, y entonces ven y ofrece tu presente.

KJV.text: Leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

WEBM.text: Leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.

JFA.text: Concilia-te depressa com o teu adversário, enquanto estás no caminho com ele; para que não aconteça que o adversário te entregue ao guarda, e sejas lançado na prisão.

RVA.text: Concíliate con tu adversario presto, entre tanto que estás con él en el camino; porque no acontezca que el adversario te entregue al juez, y el juez te entregue al alguacil, y seas echado en prisión.

KJV.text: Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

WEBM.text: Agree with your adversary quickly while you are with him on the way; lest perhaps the prosecutor deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be cast into prison.

JFA.text: Em verdade te digo que de maneira nenhuma sairás dali enquanto não pagares o último ceitil.

RVA.text: De cierto te digo, que no saldrás de allí, hasta que pagues el último cuadrante.

KJV.text: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

WEBM.text: Most certainly I tell you, you shall by no means get out of there until you have paid the last penny.

JFA.text: Ouvistes que foi dito: Não adulterarás.

RVA.text: Oísteis que fué dicho: No adulterarás.

KJV.text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

WEBM.text: You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’

JFA.text: Eu, porém, vos digo que todo aquele que olhar para uma mulher para a cobiçar, já em seu coração cometeu adultério com ela.

RVA.text: Mas yo os digo, que cualquiera que mira á una mujer para codiciarla, ya adulteró con ella en su corazón.

KJV.text: But I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.

WEBM.text: But I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.

JFA.text: Se o teu olho direito te faz tropeçar, arranca-o e lança-o de ti; pois te é melhor que se perca um dos teus membros do que seja todo o teu corpo lançado no inferno.

RVA.text: Por tanto, si tu ojo derecho te fuere ocasión de caer, sácalo, y échalo de ti: que mejor te es que se pierda uno de tus miembros, que no que todo tu cuerpo sea echado al infierno.

KJV.text: And if thy right eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.

WEBM.text: If your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

JFA.text: E, se a tua mão direita te faz tropeçar, corta-a e lança-a de ti; pois te é melhor que se perca um dos teus membros do que vá todo o teu corpo para o inferno.

RVA.text: Y si tu mano derecha te fuere ocasión de caer, córtala, y échala de ti: que mejor te es que se pierda uno de tus miembros, que no que todo tu cuerpo sea echado al infierno.

KJV.text: And if thy right hand offend thee, cut it off, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.

WEBM.text: If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off, and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

JFA.text: Também foi dito: Quem repudiar sua mulher, dê-lhe carta de divórcio.

RVA.text: También fué dicho: Cualquiera que repudiare á su mujer, déle carta de divorcio.

KJV.text: It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:

WEBM.text: “It was also said, ‘Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorce."

JFA.text: Eu, porém, vos digo que todo aquele que repudia sua mulher, a não ser por causa de infidelidade, a faz adúltera; e quem casar com a repudiada, comete adultério.

RVA.text: Mas yo os digo, que el que repudiare á su mujer, fuera de causa de fornicación, hace que ella adultere; y el que se casare con la repudiada, comete adulterio.

KJV.text: But I say unto you, That whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery.

WEBM.text: But I tell you that whoever puts away his wife, except for the cause of sexual immorality, makes her an adulteress; and whoever marries her when she is put away commits adultery.

JFA.text: Outrossim, ouvistes que foi dito aos antigos: Não jurarás falso, mas cumprirás para com o Senhor os teus juramentos.

RVA.text: Además habéis oído que fué dicho á los antiguos: No te perjurarás; mas pagarás al Señor tus juramentos.

KJV.text: Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:

WEBM.text: “Again you have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, ‘You shall not make false vows, but shall perform to the Lord your vows.

JFA.text: Eu, porém, vos digo que de maneira nenhuma jureis; nem pelo céu, porque é o trono de Deus.

RVA.text: Mas yo os digo: No juréis en ninguna manera: ni por el cielo, porque es el trono de Dios;

KJV.text: But I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven; for it is God's throne:

WEBM.text: But I tell you, don’t swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God.

JFA.text: Nem pela terra, porque é o escabelo de seus pés; nem por Jerusalém, porque é a cidade do grande Rei.

RVA.text: Ni por la tierra, porque es el estrado de sus pies; ni por Jerusalem, porque es la ciudad del gran Rey.

KJV.text: Nor by the earth; for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem; for it is the city of the great King.

WEBM.text: Nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

JFA.text: Nem jures pela tua cabeça, porque não podes tornar um só cabelo branco ou preto.

RVA.text: Ni por tu cabeza jurarás, porque no puedes hacer un cabello blanco ó negro.

KJV.text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

WEBM.text: Neither shall you swear by your head, for you can’t make one hair white or black.

JFA.text: E ao que quiser pleitear contigo, e tirar-te a túnica, larga-lhe também a capa.

RVA.text: Y al que quisiere ponerte á pleito y tomarte tu ropa, déjale también la capa.

KJV.text: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloak also.

WEBM.text: If anyone sues you to take away your coat, let him have your cloak also.

JFA.text: E, se qualquer te obrigar a caminhar mil passos, vai com ele dois mil.

RVA.text: Y á cualquiera que te cargare por una milla, ve con él dos.

KJV.text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

WEBM.text: Whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.

JFA.text: Dá a quem te pedir, e não voltes as costas ao que quiser que lhe emprestes.

RVA.text: Al que te pidiere, dale; y al que quisiere tomar de ti prestado, no se lo rehuses.

KJV.text: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.

WEBM.text: Give to him who asks you, and don’t turn away him who desires to borrow from you.

JFA.text: Para que vos torneis filhos do vosso Pai que está nos céus; porque ele faz nascer o seu sol sobre maus e bons, e faz chover sobre justos e injustos.

RVA.text: Para que seáis hijos de vuestro Padre que está en los cielos: que hace que su sol salga sobre malos y buenos, y llueve sobre justos é injustos.

KJV.text: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

WEBM.text: That you may be children of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the just and the unjust.

JFA.text: Pois, se amardes aos que vos amam, que recompensa tereis? não fazem os publicanos também o mesmo?

RVA.text: Porque si amareis á los que os aman, ¿qué recompensa tendréis? ¿no hacen también lo mismo los publicanos?

KJV.text: For if ye love them which love you, what reward have ye? do not even the publicans the same?

WEBM.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?

JFA.text: Quando, pois, deres esmola, não faças tocar trombeta diante de ti, como fazem os hipócritas nas sinagogas e nas ruas, para serem glorificados pelos homens. Em verdade vos digo que já receberam a sua recompensa.

RVA.text: Cuando pues haces limosna, no hagas tocar trompeta delante de ti, como hacen los hipócritas en las sinagogas y en las plazas, para ser estimados de los hombres: de cierto os digo, que ya tienen su recompensa.

KJV.text: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

WEBM.text: Therefore, when you do merciful deeds, don’t sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

JFA.text: Mas, quando tu deres esmola, não saiba a tua mão esquerda o que faz a direita.

RVA.text: Mas cuando tú haces limosna, no sepa tu izquierda lo que hace tu derecha.

KJV.text: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

WEBM.text: But when you do merciful deeds, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand does.

JFA.text: Para que a tua esmola fique em secreto; e teu Pai, que vê em secreto, te recompensará.

RVA.text: Para que sea tu limosna en secreto: y tu Padre que ve en secreto, él te recompensará en público.

KJV.text: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

WEBM.text: So that your merciful deeds may be in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

JFA.text: E, orando, não useis de vãs repetições, como os gentios; porque pensam que pelo seu muito falar serão ouvidos.

RVA.text: Y orando, no seáis prolijos, como los Gentiles; que piensan que por su parlería serán oídos.

KJV.text: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

WEBM.text: In praying, don’t use vain repetitions as the Gentiles do; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.

JFA.text: Não vos assemelheis, pois, a eles; porque vosso Pai sabe o que vos é necessário, antes de vós lho pedirdes.

RVA.text: No os hagáis, pues, semejantes á ellos; porque vuestro Padre sabe de qué cosas tenéis necesidad, antes que vosotros le pidáis.

KJV.text: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

WEBM.text: Therefore don’t be like them, for your Father knows what things you need before you ask him.

JFA.text: Venha o teu reino, seja feita a tua vontade, assim na terra como no céu.

RVA.text: Venga tu reino. Sea hecha tu voluntad, como en el cielo, así también en la tierra.

KJV.text: Thy kingdom come, Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.

WEBM.text: Let your Kingdom come. Let your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.

JFA.text: O pão nosso de cada dia nos dá hoje.

RVA.text: Danos hoy nuestro pan cotidiano.

KJV.text: Give us this day our daily bread.

WEBM.text: Give us today our daily bread.

JFA.text: E perdoa-nos as nossas dívidas, assim como nós também temos perdoado aos nossos devedores.

RVA.text: Y perdónanos nuestras deudas, como también nosotros perdonamos á nuestros deudores.

KJV.text: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

WEBM.text: Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.

JFA.text: E não nos deixes entrar em tentação; mas livra-nos do mal. Porque teu é o reino e o poder, e a glória, para sempre, Amém.

RVA.text: Y no nos metas en tentación, mas líbranos del mal: porque tuyo es el reino, y el poder, y la gloria, por todos los siglos. Amén.

KJV.text: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.

WEBM.text: Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one. For yours is the Kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen.

JFA.text: Se, porém, não perdoardes aos homens, tampouco vosso Pai perdoará vossas ofensas.

RVA.text: Mas si no perdonareis á los hombres sus ofensas, tampoco vuestro Padre os perdonará vuestras ofensas.

KJV.text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

WEBM.text: But if you don’t forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

JFA.text: Quando jejuardes, não vos mostreis contristrados como os hipócritas; porque eles desfiguram os seus rostos, para que os homens vejam que estão jejuando. Em verdade vos digo que já receberam a sua recompensa.

RVA.text: Y cuando ayunáis, no seáis como los hipócritas, austeros; porque ellos demudan sus rostros para parecer á los hombres que ayunan: de cierto os digo, que ya tienen su pago.

KJV.text: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

WEBM.text: Moreover when you fast, don’t be like the hypocrites, with sad faces. For they disfigure their faces that they may be seen by men to be fasting. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

JFA.text: Tu, porém, quando jejuares, unge a tua cabeça, e lava o teu rosto.

RVA.text: Mas tú, cuando ayunas, unge tu cabeza y lava tu rostro.

KJV.text: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;

WEBM.text: But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face.

JFA.text: Para não mostrar aos homens que estás jejuando, mas a teu Pai, que está em secreto; e teu Pai, que vê em secreto, te recompensará.

RVA.text: Para no parecer á los hombres que ayunas, sino á tu Padre que está en secreto: y tu Padre que ve en secreto, te recompensará en público.

KJV.text: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.

WEBM.text: So that you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

JFA.text: Porque onde estiver o teu tesouro, aí estará também o teu coração.

RVA.text: Porque donde estuviere vuestro tesoro, allí estará vuestro corazón.

KJV.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

WEBM.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

JFA.text: A candeia do corpo são os olhos; de sorte que, se os teus olhos forem bons, todo teu corpo terá luz.

RVA.text: La lámpara del cuerpo es el ojo: así que, si tu ojo fuere sincero, todo tu cuerpo será luminoso.

KJV.text: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

WEBM.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light.

JFA.text: Se, porém, os teus olhos forem maus, o teu corpo será tenebroso. Se, portanto, a luz que em ti há são trevas, quão grandes são tais trevas!

RVA.text: Mas si tu ojo fuere malo, todo tu cuerpo será tenebroso. Así que, si la lumbre que en ti hay son tinieblas, ¿cuántas serán las mismas tinieblas?

KJV.text: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!

WEBM.text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

JFA.text: Olhai para as aves do céu, que não semeiam, nem ceifam, nem ajuntam em celeiros; e vosso Pai celestial as alimenta. Não valeis vós muito mais do que elas?

RVA.text: Mirad las aves del cielo, que no siembran, ni siegan, ni allegan en alfolíes; y vuestro Padre celestial las alimenta. ¿No sois vosotros mucho mejores que ellas?.

KJV.text: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?

WEBM.text: See the birds of the sky, that they don’t sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you of much more value than they?

JFA.text: Ora, qual de vós, por mais ansioso que esteja, pode acrescentar um côvado à sua estatura?

RVA.text: Mas ¿quién de vosotros podrá, congojándose, añadir á su estatura un codo?

KJV.text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

WEBM.text: Which of you by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?

JFA.text: E pelo que haveis de vestir, por que andais ansiosos? Olhai para os lírios do campo, como crescem; não trabalham nem fiam.

RVA.text: Y por el vestido ¿por qué os congojáis? Reparad los lirios del campo, cómo crecen; no trabajan ni hilan;

KJV.text: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

WEBM.text: Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin.

JFA.text: Contudo vos digo que nem mesmo Salomão em toda a sua glória se vestiu como um deles.

RVA.text: Mas os digo, que ni aun Salomón con toda su gloria fué vestido así como uno de ellos.

KJV.text: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

WEBM.text: Yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.

JFA.text: Pois, se Deus assim veste a erva do campo, que hoje existe e amanhã é lançada no forno, quanto mais a vós, homens de pouca fé?

RVA.text: Y si la hierba del campo que hoy es, y mañana es echada en el horno, Dios la viste así, ¿no hará mucho más á vosotros, hombres de poca fe?

KJV.text: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?

WEBM.text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won’t he much more clothe you, you of little faith?

JFA.text: Portanto, não vos inquieteis, dizendo: Que havemos de comer? ou: Que havemos de beber? ou: Com que nos havemos de vestir?

RVA.text: No os congojéis pues, diciendo: ¿Qué comeremos, ó qué beberemos, ó con qué nos cubriremos?

KJV.text: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

WEBM.text: Therefore don’t be anxious, saying, ‘What will we eat?’, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘With what will we be clothed?’

JFA.text: Pois a todas estas coisas os gentios procuram. Porque vosso Pai celestial sabe que precisais de tudo isso.

RVA.text: Porque los Gentiles buscan todas estas cosas: que vuestro Padre celestial sabe que de todas estas cosas habéis menester.

KJV.text: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

WEBM.text: For the Gentiles seek after all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.

JFA.text: Não vos inquieteis, pois, pelo dia de amanhã; porque o dia de amanhã cuidará de si mesmo. Basta a cada dia o seu mal.

RVA.text: Así que, no os congojéis por el día de mañana; que el día de mañana traerá su fatiga: basta al día su afán.

KJV.text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.

WEBM.text: Therefore don’t be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day’s own evil is sufficient.

JFA.text: Porque com o juízo com que julgais, sereis julgados; e com a medida com que medis vos medirão a vós.

RVA.text: Porque con el juicio con que juzgáis, seréis juzgados; y con la medida con que medís, os volverán á medir.

KJV.text: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.

WEBM.text: For with whatever judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you.

JFA.text: E por que vês o argueiro no olho do teu irmão, e não reparas na trave que está no teu olho?

RVA.text: Y ¿por qué miras la mota que está en el ojo de tu hermano, y no echas de ver la viga que está en tu ojo?

KJV.text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

WEBM.text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?

JFA.text: Ou como dirás a teu irmão: Deixa-me tirar o argueiro do teu olho, quando tens a trave no teu?

RVA.text: O ¿cómo dirás á tu hermano: Espera, echaré de tu ojo la mota, y he aquí la viga en tu ojo?

KJV.text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beam is in thine own eye?

WEBM.text: Or how will you tell your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye,’ and behold, the beam is in your own eye?

JFA.text: Hipócrita! tira primeiro a trave do teu olho; e então verás bem para tirar o argueiro do olho do teu irmão.

RVA.text: Hipócrita! echa primero la viga de tu ojo, y entonces mirarás en echar la mota del ojo de tu hermano.

KJV.text: Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother's eye.

WEBM.text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother’s eye.

JFA.text: Ou qual dentre vós é o homem que, se seu filho lhe pedir pão, lhe dará uma pedra?

RVA.text: ¿Qué hombre hay de vosotros, á quien si su hijo pidiere pan, le dará una piedra?

KJV.text: Or what man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?

WEBM.text: Or who is there among you who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

JFA.text: Ou, se lhe pedir peixe, lhe dará uma serpente?

RVA.text: ¿Y si le pidiere un pez, le dará una serpiente?

KJV.text: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?

WEBM.text: Or if he asks for a fish, who will give him a serpent?

JFA.text: Se vós, pois, sendo maus, sabeis dar boas dádivas a vossos filhos, quanto mais vosso Pai, que está nos céus, dará boas coisas aos que lhas pedirem?

RVA.text: Pues si vosotros, siendo malos, sabéis dar buenas dádivas á vuestros hijos, ¿cuánto más vuestro Padre que está en los cielos, dará buenas cosas á los que le piden?

KJV.text: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?

WEBM.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

JFA.text: E porque estreita é a porta, e apertado o caminho que conduz à vida, e poucos são os que a encontram.

RVA.text: Porque estrecha es la puerta, y angosto el camino que lleva á la vida, y pocos son los que la hallan.

KJV.text: Because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

WEBM.text: How the gate is narrow and the way is restricted that leads to life! There are who find it.

JFA.text: Pelos seus frutos os conhecereis. Colhem-se, porventura, uvas dos espinheiros, ou figos dos abrolhos?

RVA.text: Por sus frutos los conoceréis. ¿Cógense uvas de los espinos, ó higos de los abrojos?

KJV.text: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?

WEBM.text: By their fruits you will know them. Do you gather grapes from thorns or figs from thistles?

JFA.text: Assim, toda árvore boa produz bons frutos; porém a árvore má produz frutos maus.

RVA.text: Así, todo buen árbol lleva buenos frutos; mas el árbol maleado lleva malos frutos.

KJV.text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

WEBM.text: Even so, every good tree produces good fruit, but the corrupt tree produces evil fruit.

JFA.text: Uma árvore boa não pode dar maus frutos; nem uma árvore má dar frutos bons.

RVA.text: No puede el buen árbol llevar malos frutos, ni el árbol maleado llevar frutos buenos.

KJV.text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

WEBM.text: A good tree can’t produce evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree produce good fruit.

JFA.text: Toda árvore que não produz bom fruto é cortada e lançada no fogo.

RVA.text: odo árbol que no lleva buen fruto, córtase y échase en el fuego.

KJV.text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

WEBM.text: Every tree that doesn’t grow good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

JFA.text: Portanto, pelos seus frutos os conhecereis.

RVA.text: Así que, por sus frutos los conoceréis.

KJV.text: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them.

WEBM.text: Therefore by their fruits you will know them.

JFA.text: Muitos me dirão naquele dia: Senhor, Senhor, não profetizamos nós em teu nome? e em teu nome não expulsamos demônios? e em teu nome não fizemos muitos milagres?

RVA.text: Muchos me dirán en aquel día: Señor, Señor, ¿no profetizamos en tu nombre, y en tu nombre lanzamos demonios, y en tu nombre hicimos mucho milagros?

KJV.text: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works?

WEBM.text: Many will tell me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name, in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many mighty works?’

JFA.text: Então lhes direi claramemnte: Nunca vos conheci; apartai-vos de mim, vós que praticais a iniquidade.

RVA.text: Y entonces les protestaré: Nunca os conocí; apartaos de mí, obradores de maldad.

KJV.text: And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

WEBM.text: Then I will tell them, ‘I never knew you. Depart from me, you who work iniquity.’

JFA.text: E desceu a chuva, correram as torrentes, sopraram os ventos, e bateram com ímpeto contra aquela casa; contudo não caiu, porque estava fundada sobre a rocha.

RVA.text: Y descendió lluvia, y vinieron ríos, y soplaron vientos, y combatieron aquella casa; y no cayó: porque estaba fundada sobre la peña.

KJV.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it was founded upon a rock.

WEBM.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it didn’t fall, for it was founded on the rock.

JFA.text: E desceu a chuva, correram as torrentes, sopraram os ventos, e bateram com ímpeto contra aquela casa, e ela caiu; e grande foi a sua queda.

RVA.text: Y descendió lluvia, y vinieron ríos, y soplaron vientos, é hicieron ímpetu en aquella casa; y cayó, y fué grande su ruina.

KJV.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.

WEBM.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it fell—and its fall was great.”

JFA.text: Ao concluir Jesus este discurso, as multidões se maravilhavam da sua doutrina;

RVA.text: Y fué que, como Jesús acabó estas palabras, las gentes se admiraban de su doctrina.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his doctrine:

WEBM.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, the multitudes were astonished at his teaching.

JFA.text: Porque as ensinava como tendo autoridade, e não como os escribas.

RVA.text: Porque les enseñaba como quien tiene autoridad, y no como los escribas.

KJV.text: For he taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.

WEBM.text: For he taught them with authority, and not like the scribes.

JFA.text: Disse-lhe mais: Certo homem tinha dois filhos.

RVA.text: Y dijo: Un hombre tenía dos hijos.

KJV.text: And he said, A certain man had two sons:

WEBM.text: He said, “A certain man had two sons.

JFA.text: O mais moço deles disse ao pai: Pai, dá-me a parte dos bens que me toca. Repartiu-lhes, pois, os seus haveres.

RVA.text: Y el menor de ellos dijo á su padre: Padre, dame la parte de la hacienda que me pertenece: y les repartió la hacienda.

KJV.text: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.

WEBM.text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of your property.’ So he divided his livelihood between them.

JFA.text: Poucos dias depois, o filho mais moço ajuntando tudo, partiu para um país distante, e ali desperdiçou os seus bens, vivendo dissolutamente.

RVA.text: Y no muchos días después, juntándolo todo el hijo menor, partió lejos á una provincia apartada; y allí desperdició su hacienda viviendo perdidamente.

KJV.text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.

WEBM.text: Not many days after, the younger son gathered all of this together and traveled into a far country. There he wasted his property with riotous living.

JFA.text: E, havendo ele dissipado tudo, houve naquela terra uma grande fome, e começou a passar necessidades.

RVA.text: Y cuando todo lo hubo malgastado, vino una grande hambre en aquella provincia, y comenzóle á faltar.

KJV.text: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.

WEBM.text: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.

JFA.text: Então foi encontrar-se a um dos cidadãos daquele país, o qual o mandou para os seus campos a apascentar porcos.

RVA.text: Y fué y se llegó á uno de los ciudadanos de aquella tierra, el cual le envió á su hacienda para que apacentase los puercos.

KJV.text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.

WEBM.text: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

JFA.text: E desejava encher o estômago com as alfarrobas que os porcos comiam; e ninguém lhe dava nada.

RVA.text: Y deseaba henchir su vientre de las algarrobas que comían los puercos; mas nadie se las daba.

KJV.text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

WEBM.text: He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.

JFA.text: Caindo, porém, em si, disse: Quantos empregados de meu pai têm abundância de pão, e eu aqui pereço de fome!

RVA.text: Y volviendo en sí, dijo: ­Cuántos jornaleros en casa de mi padre tienen abundancia de pan, y yo aquí perezco de hambre!

KJV.text: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!

WEBM.text: But when he came to himself he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough to spare, and I’m dying with hunger!

JFA.text: Levantar-me-ei, irei ter com meu pai e dir-lhe-ei: Pai, pequei contra o céu e diante de ti;

RVA.text: Me levantaré, é iré á mi padre, y le diré: Padre, he pecado contra el cielo y contra ti.

KJV.text: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,

WEBM.text: I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight.

JFA.text: Já não sou digno de ser chamado teu filho; trata-me como um dos teus empregados.

RVA.text: Ya no soy digno de ser llamado tu hijo; hazme como á uno de tus jornaleros.

KJV.text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

WEBM.text: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.”

JFA.text: Levantou-se, pois, e foi para seu pai. Estando ele ainda longe, seu pai o viu, encheu-se de compaixão e, correndo, lançou-se-lhe ao pescoço e o beijou.

RVA.text: Y levantándose, vino á su padre. Y como aun estuviese lejos, viólo su padre, y fué movido á misericordia, y corrió, y echóse sobre su cuello, y besóle.

KJV.text: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

WEBM.text: “He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

JFA.text: Disse-lhe o filho: Pai, pequei conta o céu e diante de ti; já não sou digno de ser chamado teu filho.

RVA.text: Y el hijo le dijo: Padre, he pecado contra el cielo, y contra ti, y ya no soy digno de ser llamado tu hijo.

KJV.text: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.

WEBM.text: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’

JFA.text: Mas o pai disse aos seus servos: Trazei depressa a melhor roupa, e vesti-lha, e ponde-lhe um anel no dedo e alparcas nos pés;

RVA.text: Mas el padre dijo á sus siervos: Sacad el principal vestido, y vestidle; y poned un anillo en su mano, y zapatos en sus pies.

KJV.text: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:

WEBM.text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand, and sandals on his feet.

JFA.text: Trazei também o bezerro, cevado e matai-o; comamos, e regozijemo-nos.

RVA.text: Y traed el becerro grueso, y matadlo, y comamos, y hagamos fiesta.

KJV.text: And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill it; and let us eat, and be merry:

WEBM.text: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let’s eat, and celebrate;

JFA.text: Porque este meu filho estava morto, e reviveu; tinha-se perdido, e foi achado. E começaram a regozijar-se.

RVA.text: Porque este mi hijo muerto era, y ha revivido; habíase perdido, y es hallado. Y comenzaron á regocijarse.

KJV.text: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.

WEBM.text: for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ Then they began to celebrate.

JFA.text: Ora, o seu filho mais velho estava no campo; e quando voltava, ao aproximar-se de casa, ouviu a música e as danças.

RVA.text: Y su hijo el mayor estaba en el campo; el cual como vino, y llegó cerca de casa, oyó la sinfonía y las danzas.

KJV.text: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.

WEBM.text: “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.

JFA.text: E chegando um dos servos, perguntou-lhe que era aquilo.

RVA.text: Y llamando á uno de los criados, preguntóle qué era aquello.

KJV.text: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.

WEBM.text: He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe este: Chegou teu irmão; e teu pai matou o bezerro cevado, porque o recebeu são e salvo.

RVA.text: Y él le dijo: Tu hermano ha venido; y tu padre ha muerto el becerro grueso, por haberle recibido salvo.

KJV.text: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.

WEBM.text: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’

JFA.text: Mas ele se indignou e não queria entrar. Saiu então o pai e instava com ele.

RVA.text: Entonces se enojó, y no quería entrar. Salió por tanto su padre, y le rogaba que entrase.

KJV.text: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.

WEBM.text: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.

JFA.text: Ele, porém, respondeu ao pai: Eis que há tantos anos te sirvo, e nunca transgredi um mandamento teu; contudo nunca me deste um cabrito para eu me regozijar com os meus amigos;

RVA.text: Mas él respondiendo, dijo al padre: He aquí tantos años te sirvo, no habiendo traspasado jamás tu mandamiento, y nunca me has dado un cabrito para gozarme con mis amigos.

KJV.text: And he answering said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:

WEBM.text: But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.

JFA.text: vindo, porém, este teu filho, que desperdiçou os teus bens com as meretrizes, mataste-lhe o bezerro cevado.

RVA.text: Mas cuando vino éste tu hijo, que ha consumido tu hacienda con rameras, has matado para él el becerro grueso.

KJV.text: But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.

WEBM.text: But when this your son came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’

JFA.text: Replicou-lhe o pai: Filho, tu sempre estás comigo, e tudo o que é meu é teu.

RVA.text: El entonces le dijo: Hijo, tú siempre estás conmigo, y todas mis cosas son tuyas.

KJV.text: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.

WEBM.text: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.

JFA.text: Era justo, porém, regozijarmo-nos e alegramo-nos, porque este teu irmão estava morto, e reviveu; tinha-se perdido, e foi achado.

RVA.text: Mas era menester hacer fiesta y holgar nos, porque este tu hermano muerto era, y ha revivido; habíase perdido, y es hallado.

KJV.text: It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.

WEBM.text: But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’”

JFA.text: Ele, porém, querendo justificar-se, perguntou a Jesus: E quem é o meu próximo?

RVA.text: Mas él, queriéndose justificar á sí mismo, dijo á Jesús: ¿Y quién es mi prójimo?

KJV.text: But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

WEBM.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, asked Jesus, “Who is my neighbor?”

JFA.text: Jesus, prosseguindo, disse: Um homem descia de Jerusalém a Jericó, e caiu nas mãos de salteadores, os quais o despojaram e espancando-o, se retiraram, deixando-o meio morto.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo Jesús, dijo: Un hombre descendía de Jerusalem á Jericó, y cayó en manos de ladrones, los cuales le despojaron; é hiriéndole, se fueron, dejándole medio muerto.

KJV.text: And Jesus answering said, A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

WEBM.text: Jesus answered, “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

JFA.text: Casualmente, descia pelo mesmo caminho certo sacerdote; e vendo-o, passou de largo.

RVA.text: Y aconteció, que descendió un sacerdote por aquel camino, y viéndole, se pasó de un lado.

KJV.text: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

WEBM.text: By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

JFA.text: De igual modo também um levita chegou àquele lugar, viu-o, e passou de largo.

RVA.text: Y asimismo un Levita, llegando cerca de aquel lugar, y viéndole, se pasó de un lado.

KJV.text: And likewise a Levite, when he was at the place, came and looked on him, and passed by on the other side.

WEBM.text: In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.

JFA.text: Mas um samaritano, que ia de viagem, chegou perto dele e, vendo-o, encheu-se de compaixão;

RVA.text: Mas un Samaritano que transitaba, viniendo cerca de él, y viéndole, fué movido á misericordia.

KJV.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion on him,

WEBM.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he traveled, came where he was. When he saw him, he was moved with compassion,

JFA.text: E aproximando-se, atou-lhe as feridas, deitando nelas azeite e vinho; e pondo-o sobre a sua cavalgadura, levou-o para uma estalagem e cuidou dele.

RVA.text: Y llegándose, vendó sus heridas, echándo les aceite y vino; y poniéndole sobre su cabalgadura, llevóle al mesón, y cuidó de él.

KJV.text: And went to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine, and set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

WEBM.text: came to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. He set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

JFA.text: No dia seguinte tirou dois denários, deu-os ao hospedeiro e disse-lhe: Cuida dele; e tudo o que gastares a mais, eu to pagarei quando voltar.

RVA.text: Y otro día al partir, sacó dos denarios, y diólos al huésped, y le dijo: Cuídamele; y todo lo que de más gastares, yo cuando vuelva te lo pagaré.

KJV.text: And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gave them to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.

WEBM.text: On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. Whatever you spend beyond that, I will repay you when I return.’

JFA.text: Qual, pois, destes três te parece ter sido o próximo daquele que caiu nas mãos dos salteadores?

RVA.text: ¿Quién, pues, de estos tres te parece que fué el prójimo de aquél que cayó en manos de los ladrónes?

KJV.text: Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves?

WEBM.text: Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?”

JFA.text: Respondeu o doutor da lei: Aquele que usou de misericórdia para com ele. Disse-lhe, pois, Jesus: Vai, e faze tu o mesmo.

RVA.text: Y él dijo: El que usó con él de misericordia. Entonces Jesús le dijo: Ve, y haz tú lo mismo.

KJV.text: And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.

WEBM.text: He said, “He who showed mercy on him.”

JFA.text: E ainda que tivesse o dom de profecia, e conhecesse todos os mistérios e toda a ciência, e ainda que tivesse toda fé, de maneira tal que transportasse os montes, e não tivesse amor, nada seria.

RVA.text: Y si tuviese profecía, y entendiese todos los misterios y toda ciencia; y si tuviese toda la fe, de tal manera que traspasase los montes, y no tengo caridad, nada soy.

KJV.text: And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.

WEBM.text: If I have the gift of prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge; and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but don’t have love, I am nothing.

JFA.text: E ainda que distribuísse todos os meus bens para sustento dos pobres, e ainda que entregasse o meu corpo para ser queimado, e não tivesse amor, nada disso me aproveitaria.

RVA.text: Y si repartiese toda mi hacienda para dar de comer a pobres, y si entregase mi cuerpo para ser quemado, y no tengo caridad, de nada me sirve.

KJV.text: And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.

WEBM.text: If I give away all my goods to feed the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, but don’t have love, it profits me nothing.

JFA.text: O amor é sofredor, é benigno; o amor não é invejoso; o amor não se vangloria, não se ensoberbece,

RVA.text: La caridad es sufrida, es benigna; la caridad no tiene envidia, la caridad no hace sinrazón, no se ensancha.

KJV.text: Charity suffereth long, and is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

WEBM.text: Love is patient and is kind. Love doesn’t envy. Love doesn’t brag, is not proud.

JFA.text: Não se porta inconvenientemente, não busca os seus próprios interesses, não se irrita, não suspeita mal.

RVA.text: No es injuriosa, no busca lo suyo, no se irrita, no piensa el mal.

KJV.text: Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;

WEBM.text: Doesn’t behave itself inappropriately, doesn’t seek its own way, is not provoked, takes no account of evil.

JFA.text: Não se regozija com a injustiça, mas se regozija com a verdade.

RVA.text: No se huelga de la injusticia, mas se huelga de la verdad.

KJV.text: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;

WEBM.text: Doesn’t rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth.

JFA.text: Tudo sofre, tudo crê, tudo espera, tudo suporta.

RVA.text: Todo lo sufre, todo lo cree, todo lo espera, todo lo soporta.

KJV.text: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

WEBM.text: Bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, and endures all things.

JFA.text: O amor jamais acaba; mas havendo profecias, serão aniquiladas; havendo línguas, cessarão; havendo ciência, desaparecerá.

RVA.text: La caridad nunca deja de ser: mas las profecías se han de acabar, y cesarán las lenguas, y la ciencia ha de ser quitada.
