KJV.text: Charity never faileth: but whether there be prophecies, they shall fail; whether there be tongues, they shall cease; whether there be knowledge, it shall vanish away.

WEBM.text: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will be done away with. Where there are various languages, they will cease. Where there is knowledge, it will be done away with.

JFA.text: Porque, em parte conhecemos, e em parte profetizamos.

RVA.text: Porque en parte conocemos, y en parte profetizamos.

KJV.text: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.

WEBM.text: For we know in part and we prophesy in part.

JFA.text: Mas, quando vier o que é perfeito, então o que é em parte será aniquilado.

RVA.text: Mas cuando venga lo que es perfecto, entonces lo que es en parte será quitado.

KJV.text: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.

WEBM.text: But when that which is complete has come, then that which is partial will be done away with.

JFA.text: Porque por ela os antigos alcançaram bom testemunho.

RVA.text: Porque por ella alcanzaron testimonio los antiguos.

KJV.text: For by it the elders obtained a good report.

WEBM.text: For by this, the elders obtained testimony.

JFA.text: Pela fé Abel ofereceu a Deus mais excelente sacrifício que Caim, pelo qual alcançou testemunho de que era justo, dando Deus testemunho das suas oferendas, e por meio dela depois de morto, ainda fala.

RVA.text: Por la fe Abel ofreció á Dios mayor sacrificio que Caín, por la cual alcanzó testimonio de que era justo, dando Dios testimonio á sus presentes; y difunto, aun habla por ella.

KJV.text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.

WEBM.text: By faith, Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he had testimony given to him that he was righteous, God testifying with respect to his gifts; and through it he, being dead, still speaks.

JFA.text: Pela fé Enoque foi trasladado para não ver a morte; e não foi achado, porque Deus o trasladara; pois antes da sua trasladação alcançou testemunho de que agradara a Deus.

RVA.text: Por la fe Enoc fué traspuesto para no ver muerte, y no fué hallado, porque lo traspuso Dios. Y antes que fuese traspuesto, tuvo testimonio de haber agradado á Dios.

KJV.text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.

WEBM.text: By faith, Enoch was taken away, so that he wouldn’t see death, and he was not found, because God translated him. For he has had testimony given to him that before his translation he had been well pleasing to God.

JFA.text: Pela fé Noé, divinamente avisado das coisas que ainda não se viam, sendo temente a Deus, preparou uma arca para o salvamento da sua família; e por esta fé condenou o mundo, e tornou-se herdeiro da justiça que é segundo a fé.

RVA.text: Por la fe Noé, habiendo recibido respuesta de cosas que aun no se veían, con temor aparejó el arca en que su casa se salvase: por la cual fe condenó al mundo, y fué hecho heredero de la justicia que es por la fe.

KJV.text: By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.

WEBM.text: By faith, Noah, being warned about things not yet seen, moved with godly fear, prepared a ship for the saving of his house, through which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith.

JFA.text: Pela fé Abraão, sendo chamado, obedeceu, saindo para um lugar que havia de receber por herança; e saiu, sem saber para onde ia.

RVA.text: Por la fe Abraham, siendo llamado, obedeció para salir al lugar que había de recibir por heredad; y salió sin saber dónde iba.

KJV.text: By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.

WEBM.text: By faith, Abraham, when he was called, obeyed to go out to the place which he was to receive for an inheritance. He went out, not knowing where he went.

JFA.text: Pela fé peregrinou na terra da promessa, como em terra alheia, habitando em tendas com Isaque e Jacó, herdeiros com ele da mesma promessa;

RVA.text: Por fe habitó en la tierra prometida como en tierra ajena, morando en cabañas con Isaac y Jacob, herederos juntamente de la misma promesa.

KJV.text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as in a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:

WEBM.text: By faith, he lived as an alien in the land of promise, as in a land not his own, dwelling in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise.

JFA.text: Porque esperava a cidade que tem os fundamentos, da qual o arquiteto e edificador é Deus.

RVA.text: Porque esperaba ciudad con fundamentos, el artífice y hacedor de la cual es Dios.

KJV.text: For he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

WEBM.text: For he looked for the city which has the foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

JFA.text: Pela fé, até a própria Sara recebeu a virtude de conceber um filho, mesmo fora da idade, porquanto teve por fiel aquele que lho havia prometido.

RVA.text: Por la fe también la misma Sara, siendo estéril, recibió fuerza para concebir simiente; y parió aun fuera del tiempo de la edad, porque creyó ser fiel el que lo había prometido.

KJV.text: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.

WEBM.text: By faith, even Sarah herself received power to conceive, and she bore a child when she was past age, since she counted him faithful who had promised.

JFA.text: Todos estes morreram na fé, sem terem alcançado as promessas; mas tendo-as visto e saudado, de longe, confessaram que eram estrangeiros e peregrinos na terra.

RVA.text: Conforme á la fe murieron todos éstos sin haber recibido las promesas, sino mirándolas de lejos, y creyéndolas, y saludándolas, y confesando que eran peregrinos y advenedizos sobre la tierra.

KJV.text: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of them, and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

WEBM.text: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them and embraced them from afar, and having confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

JFA.text: Ora, os que tais coisas dizem, mostram que estão buscando uma pátria.

RVA.text: Porque los que esto dicen, claramente dan á entender que buscan una patria.

KJV.text: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.

WEBM.text: For those who say such things make it clear that they are seeking a country of their own.

JFA.text: E se, na verdade, se lembrassem daquela donde haviam saído, teriam oportunidade de voltar.

RVA.text: Que si se acordaran de aquella de donde salieron, cierto tenían tiempo para volverse.

KJV.text: And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

WEBM.text: If indeed they had been thinking of that country from which they went out, they would have had enough time to return.

JFA.text: Mas agora desejam uma pátria melhor, isto é, a celestial. Pelo que também Deus não se envergonha deles, de ser chamado seu Deus, porque já lhes preparou uma cidade.

RVA.text: Empero deseaban la mejor, es á saber, la celestial; por lo cual Dios no se averguenza de llamarse Dios de ellos: porque les había aparejado ciudad.

KJV.text: But now they desire a better country, that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.

WEBM.text: But now they desire a better country, that is, a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed of them, to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.

JFA.text: Compadece-te de mim, ó Deus, segundo a tua benignidade; apaga as minhas tansgressões, segundo a multidão das tuas misericórdias.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: Salmo de David, cuando después que entró á Bath-sebah, vino á él Nathán el profeta. TEN piedad de mí, oh Dios, conforme á tu misericordia: Conforme á la multitud de tus piedades borra mis rebeliones.

KJV.text: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

WEBM.text: Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.

JFA.text: Lava-me completamente da minha iniquidade, e purifica-me do meu pecado.

RVA.text: Lávame más y más de mi maldad, Y límpiame de mi pecado.

KJV.text: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

WEBM.text: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity. Cleanse me from my sin.

JFA.text: Pois eu conheço as minhas transgressões, e o meu pecado está sempre diante de mim.

RVA.text: Porque yo reconozco mis rebeliones; Y mi pecado está siempre delante de mí.

KJV.text: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.

WEBM.text: For I know my transgressions. My sin is constantly before me.

JFA.text: Contra ti, contra ti somente, pequei, e fiz o que é mau diante dos teus olhos; de sorte que és justificado em falares, e inculpável em julgares.

RVA.text: A ti, á ti solo he pecado, Y he hecho lo malo delante de tus ojos: Porque seas reconocido justo en tu palabra, Y tenido por puro en tu juicio.

KJV.text: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.

WEBM.text: Against you, and you only, I have sinned, and done that which is evil in your sight, so you may be proved right when you speak, and justified when you judge.

JFA.text: Eis que eu nasci em iniquidade, e em pecado me concedeu minha mãe.

RVA.text: He aquí, en maldad he sido formado, Y en pecado me concibió mi madre.

KJV.text: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.

WEBM.text: Behold, I was born in iniquity. My mother conceived me in sin.

JFA.text: Eis que desejas que a verdade esteja no íntimo; faze-me, pois, conhecer a sabedoria no secreto da minha alma.

RVA.text: He aquí, tú amas la verdad en lo íntimo: Y en lo secreto me has hecho comprender sabiduría.

KJV.text: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

WEBM.text: Behold, you desire truth in the inward parts. You teach me wisdom in the inmost place.

JFA.text: Purifica-me com hissopo, e ficarei limpo; lava-me, e ficarei mais alvo do que a neve.

RVA.text: Purifícame con hisopo, y será limpio: Lávame, y seré emblanquecido más que la nieve.

KJV.text: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

WEBM.text: Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

JFA.text: Faze-me ouvir júbilo e alegria, para que se regozijem os ossos que esmagaste.

RVA.text: Hazme oir gozo y alegría; Y se recrearán los huesos que has abatido.

KJV.text: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

WEBM.text: Let me hear joy and gladness, that the bones which you have broken may rejoice.

JFA.text: Esconde o teu rosto dos meus pecados, e apaga todas as minhas iniquidades.

RVA.text: Esconde tu rostro de mis pecados, Y borra todas mis maldades.

KJV.text: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

WEBM.text: Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all of my iniquities.

JFA.text: Não me lances fora da tua presença, e não retire de mim o teu santo Espírito.

RVA.text: No me eches de delante de ti; Y no quites de mí tu santo espíritu.

KJV.text: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

WEBM.text: Don’t throw me from your presence, and don’t take your Holy Spirit from me.

JFA.text: Restitui-me a alegria da tua salvação, e sustém-me com um espírito voluntário.

RVA.text: Vuélveme el gozo de tu salud; Y el espíritu libre me sustente.

KJV.text: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.

WEBM.text: Restore to me the joy of your salvation. Uphold me with a willing spirit.

JFA.text: Então ensinarei aos transgressores os teus caminhos, e pecadores se converterão a ti.

RVA.text: Enseñaré á los prevaricadores tus caminos; Y los pecadores se convertirán á ti.

KJV.text: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

WEBM.text: Then I will teach transgressors your ways. Sinners will be converted to you.

JFA.text: Livra-me dos crimes de sangue, ó Deus, Deus da minha salvação, e a minha língua cantará alegremente a tua justiça.

RVA.text: Líbrame de homicidios, oh Dios, Dios de mi salud: Cantará mi lengua tu justicia

KJV.text: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

WEBM.text: Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God, the God of my salvation. My tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.

JFA.text: Abre, Senhor, os meus lábios, e a minha boca proclamará o teu louvor.

RVA.text: Señor, abre mis labios; Y publicará mi boca tu alabanza.

KJV.text: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

WEBM.text: Lord, open my lips. My mouth will declare your praise.

JFA.text: Pois tu não te comprazes em sacrifícios; se eu te oferecesse holocaustos, tu não te deleitarias.

RVA.text: Porque no quieres tú sacrificio, que yo daría; No quieres holocausto.

KJV.text: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.

WEBM.text: For you don’t delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it. You have no pleasure in burnt offering.

JFA.text: O sacrifício aceitável a Deus é o espírito quebrantado; ao coração quebrantado e contrito não desprezarás, ó Deus.

RVA.text: Los sacrificios de Dios son el espíritu quebrantado: Al corazón contrito y humillado no despreciarás tú, oh Dios.

KJV.text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

WEBM.text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit. O God, you will not despise a broken and contrite heart.

JFA.text: Faze o bem a Sião, segundo a tua boa vontade; edifica os muros de Jerusalém.

RVA.text: Haz bien con tu benevolencia á Sión: Edifica los muros de Jerusalem.

KJV.text: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

WEBM.text: Do well in your good pleasure to Zion. Build the walls of Jerusalem.

JFA.text: Então te agradarás de sacrifícios de justiça dos holocaustos e das ofertas queimadas; então serão oferecidos novilhos sobre o teu altar.

RVA.text: Entonces te agradarán los sacrificios de justicia, el holocausto ú ofrenda del todo quemada: Entonces ofrecerán sobre tu altar becerros.

KJV.text: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.

WEBM.text: Then you will delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, in burnt offerings and in whole burnt offerings. Then they will offer bulls on your altar.

JFA.text: Senhor, tu me sondas, e me conheces.

RVA.text: Al Músico principal: Salmo de David. OH Jehová, tú me has examinado y conocido.

KJV.text: O lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.

WEBM.text: O Lord, you have searched me, and you know me.

JFA.text: Tu conheces o meu sentar e o meu levantar; de longe entendes o meu pensamento.

RVA.text: Tú has conocido mi sentarme y mi levantarme, Has entendido desde lejos mis pensamientos.

KJV.text: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

WEBM.text: You know my sitting down and my rising up. You perceive my thoughts from afar.

JFA.text: Esquadrinhas o meu andar, e o meu deitar, e conheces todos os meus caminhos.

RVA.text: Mi senda y mi acostarme has rodeado, Y estás impuesto en todos mis caminos.

KJV.text: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

WEBM.text: You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.

JFA.text: Sem que haja uma palavra na minha língua, eis que, ó Senhor, tudo conheces.

RVA.text: Pues aun no está la palabra en mi lengua, Y he aquí, oh Jehová, tú la sabes toda.

KJV.text: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O Lord, thou knowest it altogether.

WEBM.text: For there is not a word on my tongue, but, behold, O Lord, you know it altogether.

JFA.text: Tal conhecimento é maravilhoso demais para mim; elevado é, não o posso atingir.

RVA.text: Más maravillosa es la ciencia que mi capacidad; Alta es, no puedo comprenderla.

KJV.text: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

WEBM.text: This knowledge is beyond me. It’s lofty. I can’t attain it.

JFA.text: Para onde me irei do teu Espírito, ou para onde fugirei da tua presença?

RVA.text: ¿Adónde me iré de tu espíritu? ¿Y adónde huiré de tu presencia?

KJV.text: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

WEBM.text: Where could I go from your Spirit? Or where could I flee from your presence?

JFA.text: Se subir ao céu, tu aí estás; se fizer no Seol a minha cama, eis que tu ali estás também.

RVA.text: Si subiere á los cielos, allí estás tú: Y si en abismo hiciere mi estrado, he aquí allí tú estás.

KJV.text: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

WEBM.text: If I ascend up into heaven, you are there. If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there!

JFA.text: Se tomar as asas da alva, se habitar nas extremidades do mar.

RVA.text: Si tomare las alas del alba, Y habitare en el extremo de la mar.

KJV.text: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

WEBM.text: If I take the wings of the dawn, and settle in the uttermost parts of the sea,

JFA.text: Ainda ali a tua mão me guiará e a tua destra me susterá.

RVA.text: Aun allí me guiará tu mano, Y me asirá tu diestra.

KJV.text: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

WEBM.text: Even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.

JFA.text: Se eu disser: Ocultem-me as trevas; torne-se em noite a luz que me circunda.

RVA.text: Si dijere: Ciertamente las tinieblas me encubrirán; Aun la noche resplandecerá tocante á mí.

KJV.text: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

WEBM.text: If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me. The light around me will be night,”

JFA.text: Nem ainda as trevas são escuras para ti, mas a noite resplandece como o dia; as trevas e a luz são para ti a mesma coisa.

RVA.text: Aun las tinieblas no encubren de ti, Y la noche resplandece como el día: Lo mismo te son las tinieblas que la luz.

KJV.text: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

WEBM.text: Even the darkness doesn’t hide from you, but the night shines as the day. The darkness is like light to you.

JFA.text: Pois tu formaste os meus rins; entreteceste-me no ventre de minha mãe.

RVA.text: Porque tú poseiste mis riñones; Cubrísteme en el vientre de mi madre.

KJV.text: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

WEBM.text: For you formed my inmost being. You knit me together in my mother’s womb.

JFA.text: Eu te louvarei, porque de um modo tão admirável e maravilhoso fui formado; maravilhosas são as tuas obras, e a minha alma o sabe muito bem.

RVA.text: Te alabaré; porque formidables, maravillosas son tus obras: Estoy maravillado, Y mi alma lo conoce mucho.

KJV.text: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

WEBM.text: I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Your works are wonderful. My soul knows that very well.

JFA.text: Os meus ossos não te foram encobertos, quando no oculto fui formado, e esmeradamente tecido nas profundezas da terra.

RVA.text: No fué encubierto de ti mi cuerpo, Bien que en oculto fuí formado, Y compaginado en lo más bajo de la tierra.

KJV.text: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

WEBM.text: My frame wasn’t hidden from you, when I was made in secret, woven together in the depths of the earth.

JFA.text: Os teus olhos viram a minha substância ainda informe, e no teu livro foram escritos os dias, sim, todos os dias que foram ordenados para mim, quando ainda não havia nem um deles.

RVA.text: Mi embrión vieron tus ojos, Y en tu libro estaban escritas todas aquellas cosas Que fueron luego formadas, Sin faltar una de ellas.

KJV.text: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

WEBM.text: Your eyes saw my body. In your book they were all written, the days that were ordained for me, when as yet there were none of them.

JFA.text: E quão preciosos me são, ó Deus, os teus pensamentos! Quão grande é a soma deles!

RVA.text: Así que ­cuán preciosos me son, oh Dios, tus pensamientos! ­Cuán multiplicadas son sus cuentas!

KJV.text: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

WEBM.text: How precious to me are your thoughts, God! How vast is their sum!

JFA.text: Se eu os contasse, seriam mais numerosos do que a areia; quando acordo ainda estou contigo.

RVA.text: Si los cuento, multiplícanse más que la arena: Despierto, y aun estoy contigo.

KJV.text: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

WEBM.text: If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand. When I wake up, I am still with you.

JFA.text: Oxalá que matasses o perverso, ó Deus, e que os homens sanguinários se apartassem de mim,

RVA.text: De cierto, oh Dios, matarás al impío; Apartaos pues de mí, hombres sanguinarios.

KJV.text: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

WEBM.text: If only you, God, would kill the wicked. Get away from me, you bloodthirsty men!

JFA.text: Homens que se rebelam contra ti, e contra ti se levantam para o mal.

RVA.text: Porque blasfemias dicen ellos contra ti: Tus enemigos toman en vano tu nombre

KJV.text: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

WEBM.text: For they speak against you wickedly. Your enemies take your name in vain.

JFA.text: Não odeio eu, ó Senhor, aqueles que te odeiam? e não me aflijo por causa dos que se levantam contra ti?

RVA.text: ¿No tengo en odio, oh Jehová, á los que te aborrecen, Y me conmuevo contra tus enemigos?

KJV.text: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

WEBM.text: O Lord, don’t I hate those who hate you? Am I not grieved with those who rise up against you?

JFA.text: Odeio-os com ódio completo; tenho-os por inimigos.

RVA.text: Aborrézcolos con perfecto odio; Téngolos por enemigos.

KJV.text: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

WEBM.text: I hate them with perfect hatred. They have become my enemies.

JFA.text: Sonda-me, ó Deus, e conhece o meu coração; prova-me, e conhece os meus pensamentos.

RVA.text: Examíname, oh Dios, y conoce mi corazón: Pruébame y reconoce mis pensamientos.

KJV.text: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

WEBM.text: Search me, God, and know my heart. Try me, and know my thoughts.

JFA.text: Vê se há em mim algum caminho perverso, e guia-me pelo caminho eterno.

RVA.text: Y ve si hay en mí camino de perversidad, Y guíame en el camino eterno.

KJV.text: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

WEBM.text: See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the everlasting way.

JFA.text: Bete. O coração do seu marido confia nela, e não lhe haverá falta de lucro.

RVA.text: El corazón de su marido está en ella confiado, Y no tendrá necesidad de despojo.

KJV.text: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

WEBM.text: The heart of her husband trusts in her. He shall have no lack of gain.

JFA.text: Guímel. Ela lhe faz bem, e não mal, todos os dias da sua vida.

RVA.text: Darále ella bien y no mal, Todos los días de su vida.

KJV.text: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

WEBM.text: She does him good, and not harm, all the days of her life.

JFA.text: Dálete. Ela busca lã e linho, e trabalha de boa vontade com as mãos.

RVA.text: Buscó lana y lino, Y con voluntad labró de sus manos.

KJV.text: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

WEBM.text: She seeks wool and flax, and works eagerly with her hands.

JFA.text: Hê. É como os navios do negociante; de longe traz o seu pão.

RVA.text: Fué como navío de mercader: Trae su pan de lejos.

KJV.text: She is like the merchants' ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

WEBM.text: She is like the merchant ships. She brings her bread from afar.

JFA.text: Vave. E quando ainda está escuro, ela se levanta, e dá mantimento à sua casa, e a tarefa às suas servas.

RVA.text: Levantóse aun de noche, Y dió comida á su familia, Y ración á sus criadas.

KJV.text: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

WEBM.text: She rises also while it is yet night, gives food to her household, and portions for her servant girls.

JFA.text: Zaine. Considera um campo, e compra-o; planta uma vinha com o fruto de suas maos.

RVA.text: Consideró la heredad, y compróla; Y plantó viña del fruto de sus manos.

KJV.text: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

WEBM.text: She considers a field, and buys it. With the fruit of her hands, she plants a vineyard.

JFA.text: Hete. Cinge os seus lombos de força, e fortalece os seus braços.

RVA.text: Ciñó sus lomos de fortaleza, Y esforzó sus brazos.

KJV.text: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

WEBM.text: She arms her waist with strength, and makes her arms strong.

JFA.text: Vave. E quando ainda está escuro, ela se levanta, e dá mantimento à sua casa, e a tarefa às suas servas. Zaine. Considera um campo, e compra-o; planta uma vinha com o fruto de suas maos. Hete. Cinge os seus lombos de força, e fortalece os seus braços.

RVA.text: Levantóse aun de noche, Y dió comida á su familia, Y ración á sus criadas. Consideró la heredad, y compróla; Y plantó viña del fruto de sus manos. Ciñó sus lomos de fortaleza, Y esforzó sus brazos.

KJV.text: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens. She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard. She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

WEBM.text: She rises also while it is yet night, gives food to her household, and portions for her servant girls. She considers a field, and buys it. With the fruit of her hands, she plants a vineyard. She arms her waist with strength, and makes her arms strong.

JFA.text: Tete. Prova e vê que é boa a sua mercadoria; e a sua lâmpada não se apaga de noite.

RVA.text: Gustó que era buena su granjería: Su candela no se apagó de noche.

KJV.text: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.

WEBM.text: She perceives that her merchandise is profitable. Her lamp doesn’t go out by night.

JFA.text: Iode. Estende as mãos ao fuso, e as suas mãos pegam na roca.

RVA.text: Aplicó sus manos al huso, Y sus manos tomaron la rueca.

KJV.text: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

WEBM.text: She lays her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.

JFA.text: Cafe. Abre a mão para o pobre; sim, ao necessitado estende as suas mãos.

RVA.text: Alargó su mano al pobre, Y extendió sus manos al menesteroso.

KJV.text: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

WEBM.text: She opens her arms to the poor; yes, she extends her hands to the needy.

JFA.text: Lâmede. Não tem medo da neve pela sua família; pois todos os da sua casa estão vestidos de escarlate.

RVA.text: No tendrá temor de la nieve por su familia, Porque toda su familia está vestida de ropas dobles.

KJV.text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

WEBM.text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household; for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

JFA.text: Meme. Faz para si cobertas; de linho fino e de púrpura é o seu vestido.

RVA.text: Ella se hizo tapices; De lino fino y púrpura es su vestido.

KJV.text: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.

WEBM.text: She makes for herself carpets of tapestry. Her clothing is fine linen and purple.

JFA.text: Nune. Conhece-se o seu marido nas portas, quando se assenta entre os anciãos da terra.

RVA.text: Conocido es su marido en las puertas, Cuando se sienta con los ancianos de la tierra.

KJV.text: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

WEBM.text: Her husband is respected in the gates, when he sits among the elders of the land.

JFA.text: Sâmerue. Faz vestidos de linho, e vende-os, e entrega cintas aos mercadores.

RVA.text: Hizo telas, y vendió; Y dió cintas al mercader.

KJV.text: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

WEBM.text: She makes linen garments and sells them, and delivers sashes to the merchant.

JFA.text: Aine. A força e a dignidade são os seus vestidos; e ri-se do tempo vindouro.

RVA.text: Fortaleza y honor son su vestidura; Y en el día postrero reirá.

KJV.text: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

WEBM.text: Strength and dignity are her clothing. She laughs at the time to come.

JFA.text: Pê. Abre a sua boca com sabedoria, e o ensino da benevolência está na sua língua.

RVA.text: Abrió su boca con sabiduría: Y la ley de clemencia está en su lengua.

KJV.text: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.

WEBM.text: She opens her mouth with wisdom. Kind instruction is on her tongue.

JFA.text: Tsadê. Olha pelo governo de sua casa, e não come o pão da preguiça.

RVA.text: Considera los caminos de su casa, Y no come el pan de balde.

KJV.text: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

WEBM.text: She looks well to the ways of her household, and doesn’t eat the bread of idleness.

JFA.text: Côfe. Levantam-se seus filhos, e lhe chamam bem-aventurada, como também seu marido, que a louva, dizendo:

RVA.text: Levantáronse sus hijos, y llamáronla bienaventurada; Y su marido también la alabó.

KJV.text: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.

WEBM.text: Her children rise up and call her blessed. Her husband also praises her:

JFA.text: Reche. Muitas mulheres têm procedido virtuosamente, mas tu a todas sobrepujas.

RVA.text: Muchas mujeres hicieron el bien; Mas tú las sobrepujaste á todas.

KJV.text: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

WEBM.text: “Many women do noble things, but you excel them all.”

JFA.text: Tau. Dai-lhe do fruto das suas mãos, e louvem-na nas portas as suas obras.

RVA.text: Dadle el fruto de sus manos, Y alábenla en las puertas sus hechos.

KJV.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.

WEBM.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands! Let her works praise her in the gates!"

JFA.text: E para onde eu vou vós conheceis o caminho.

RVA.text: Y sabéis á dónde yo voy; y sabéis el camino.

KJV.text: And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.

WEBM.text: You know where I go, and you know the way.”

JFA.text: Disse-lhe Tomé: Senhor, não sabemos para onde vais; e como podemos saber o caminho?

RVA.text: Dícele Tomás: Señor, no sabemos á dónde vas: ¿cómo, pues, podemos saber el camino?

KJV.text: Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?

WEBM.text: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?”

JFA.text: Se vós me conhecêsseis a mim, também conheceríeis a meu Pai; e já desde agora o conheceis, e o tendes visto.

RVA.text: Si me conocieseis, también á mi Padre conocierais: y desde ahora le conocéis, y le habéis visto.

KJV.text: If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also: and from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.

WEBM.text: If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on, you know him, and have seen him.”

JFA.text: Disse-lhe Felipe: Senhor, mostra-nos o Pai, e isso nos basta.

RVA.text: Dícele Felipe: Señor, muéstranos el Padre, y nos basta.

KJV.text: Philip saith unto him, Lord, show us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

WEBM.text: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Jesus: Há tanto tempo que estou convosco, e ainda não me conheces, Felipe? Quem me viu a mim, viu o Pai; como dizes tu: Mostra-nos o Pai?

RVA.text: Jesús le dice: ¿Tanto tiempo ha que estoy con vosotros, y no me has conocido, Felipe? El que me ha visto, ha visto al Padre; ¿cómo, pues, dices tú: Muéstranos el Padre?

KJV.text: Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou then, Show us the Father?

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you such a long time, and do you not know me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father. How do you say, ‘Show us the Father?’

JFA.text: Não crês tu que eu estou no Pai, e que o Pai está em mim? As palavras que eu vos digo, não as digo por mim mesmo; mas o Pai, que permanece em mim, é quem faz as suas obras.

RVA.text: ¿No crees que yo soy en el Padre, y el Padre en mí? Las palabras que yo os hablo, no las hablo de mí mismo: mas el Padre que está en mí, él hace las obras.

KJV.text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.

WEBM.text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? The words that I tell you, I speak not from myself; but the Father who lives in me does his works.

JFA.text: Crede-me que eu estou no Pai, e que o Pai está em mim; crede ao menos por causa das mesmas obras.

RVA.text: Creedme que yo soy en el Padre, y el Padre en mí: de otra manera, creedme por las mismas obras.

KJV.text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works' sake.

WEBM.text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me; or else believe me for the very works’ sake.

JFA.text: E tudo quanto pedirdes em meu nome, eu o farei, para que o Pai seja glorificado no Filho.

RVA.text: Y todo lo que pidiereis al Padre en mi nombre, esto haré, para que el Padre sea glorificado en el Hijo.

KJV.text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

WEBM.text: Whatever you will ask in my name, I will do it, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

JFA.text: Se me pedirdes alguma coisa em meu nome, eu a farei.

RVA.text: Si algo pidiereis en mi nombre, yo lo haré.

KJV.text: If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.

WEBM.text: If you will ask anything in my name, I will do it.

JFA.text: A saber, o Espírito da verdade, o qual o mundo não pode receber; porque não o vê nem o conhece; mas vós o conheceis, porque ele habita convosco, e estará em vós.

RVA.text: Al Espíritu de verdad, al cual el mundo no puede recibir, porque no le ve, ni le conoce: mas vosotros le conocéis; porque está con vosotros, y será en vosotros.

KJV.text: Even the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, neither knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.

WEBM.text: The Spirit of truth, whom the world can’t receive; for it doesn’t see him and doesn’t know him. You know him, for he lives with you, and will be in you.

JFA.text: Não vos deixarei órfãos; voltarei a vós.

RVA.text: No os dejaré huérfanos: vendré á vosotros.

KJV.text: I will not leave you comfortless: I will come to you.

WEBM.text: I will not leave you orphans. I will come to you.

JFA.text: Ainda um pouco, e o mundo não me verá mais; mas vós me vereis, porque eu vivo, e vós vivereis.

RVA.text: Aun un poquito, y el mundo no me verá más; empero vosotros me veréis; porque yo vivo, y vosotros también viviréis.

KJV.text: Yet a little while, and the world seeth me no more; but ye see me: because I live, ye shall live also.

WEBM.text: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.

JFA.text: Aquele que tem os meus mandamentos e os guarda, esse é o que me ama; e aquele que me ama será amado de meu Pai, e eu o amarei, e me manifestarei a ele.

RVA.text: El que tiene mis mandamientos, y los guarda, aquél es el que me ama; y el que me ama, será amado de mi Padre, y yo le amaré, y me manifestaré á él.

KJV.text: He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself to him.

WEBM.text: One who has my commandments and keeps them, that person is one who loves me. One who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him, and will reveal myself to him.

JFA.text: Perguntou-lhe Judas (não o Iscariotes): O que houve, Senhor, que te hás de manifestar a nós, e não ao mundo?

RVA.text: Dícele Judas, no el Iscariote: Señor, ¿qué hay porque te hayas de manifestar á nosotros, y no al mundo?

KJV.text: Judas saith unto him, not Iscariot, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?

WEBM.text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, what has happened that you are about to reveal yourself to us, and not to the world?”

JFA.text: Quem não me ama, não guarda as minhas palavras; ora, a palavra que estais ouvindo não é minha, mas do Pai que me enviou.

RVA.text: El que no me ama, no guarda mis palabras: y la palabra que habéis oído, no es mía, sino del Padre que me envió.

KJV.text: He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father's which sent me.

WEBM.text: He who doesn’t love me doesn’t keep my words. The word which you hear isn’t mine, but the Father’s who sent me.

JFA.text: Estas coisas vos tenho falado, estando ainda convosco.

RVA.text: Estas cosas os he hablado estando con vosotros.

KJV.text: These things have I spoken unto you, being yet present with you.

WEBM.text: I have said these things to you while still living with you.

JFA.text: Mas o Ajudador, o Espírito Santo a quem o Pai enviará em meu nome, esse vos ensinará todas as coisas, e vos fará lembrar de tudo quanto eu vos tenho dito.

RVA.text: Mas el Consolador, el Espíritu Santo, al cual el Padre enviará en mi nombre, él os enseñará todas las cosas, y os recordará todas las cosas que os he dicho.

KJV.text: But the Comforter, which is the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.

WEBM.text: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things, and will remind you of all that I said to you.

JFA.text: Eu vo-lo disse agora, antes que aconteça, para que, quando acontecer, vós creiais.

RVA.text: Y ahora os lo he dicho antes que se haga; para que cuando se hiciere, creáis.

KJV.text: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye might believe.

WEBM.text: Now I have told you before it happens so that when it happens, you may believe.

JFA.text: Já não falarei muito convosco, porque vem o príncipe deste mundo, e ele nada tem em mim.

RVA.text: Ya no hablaré mucho con vosotros: porque viene el príncipe de este mundo; mas no tiene nada en mí.

KJV.text: Hereafter I will not talk much with you: for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nothing in me.

WEBM.text: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world comes, and he has nothing in me.

JFA.text: Mas, assim como o Pai me ordenou, assim mesmo faço, para que o mundo saiba que eu amo o Pai. Levantai-vos, vamo-nos daqui.

RVA.text: Empero para que conozca el mundo que amo al Padre, y como el Padre me dió el mandamiento, así hago. Levantaos, vamos de aquí.

KJV.text: But that the world may know that I love the Father; and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.

WEBM.text: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let’s go from here.

JFA.text: Toda vara em mim que não dá fruto, ele a corta; e toda vara que dá fruto, ele a limpa, para que dê mais fruto.

RVA.text: Todo pámpano que en mí no lleva fruto, le quitará: y todo aquel que lleva fruto, le limpiará, para que lleve más fruto.

KJV.text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

WEBM.text: Every branch in me that doesn’t bear fruit, he takes away. Every branch that bears fruit, he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.

JFA.text: Vós já estais limpos pela palavra que vos tenho falado.

RVA.text: Ya vosotros sois limpios por la palabra que os he hablado.

KJV.text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.

WEBM.text: You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.

JFA.text: Quem não permanece em mim é lançado fora, como a vara, e seca; tais varas são recolhidas, lançadas no fogo e queimadas.

RVA.text: El que en mí no estuviere, será echado fuera como mal pámpano, y se secará; y los cogen, y los echan en el fuego, y arden.

KJV.text: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.

WEBM.text: If a man doesn’t remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch and is withered; and they gather them, throw them into the fire, and they are burned.

JFA.text: Nisto é glorificado meu Pai, que deis muito fruto; e assim sereis meus discípulos.

RVA.text: En esto es glorificado mi Padre, en que llevéis mucho fruto, y seáis así mis discípulos.

KJV.text: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.

WEBM.text: “In this my Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit; and so you will be my disciples."

JFA.text: Se guardardes os meus mandamentos, permanecereis no meu amor; do mesmo modo que eu tenho guardado os mandamentos de meu Pai, e permaneço no seu amor.

RVA.text: Si guardareis mis mandamientos, estaréis en mi amor; como yo también he guardado los mandamientos de mi Padre, y estoy en su amor.

KJV.text: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and abide in his love.

WEBM.text: If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and remain in his love.

JFA.text: Estas coisas vos tenho dito, para que o meu gozo permaneça em vós, e o vosso gozo seja completo.

RVA.text: Estas cosas os he hablado, para que mi gozo esté en vosotros, y vuestro gozo sea cumplido.

KJV.text: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

WEBM.text: I have spoken these things to you, that my joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be made full.

JFA.text: Vós sois meus amigos, se fizerdes o que eu vos mando.

RVA.text: Vosotros sois mis amigos, si hiciereis las cosas que yo os mando.

KJV.text: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.

WEBM.text: You are my friends, if you do whatever I command you.

JFA.text: Já não vos chamo servos, porque o servo não sabe o que faz o seu senhor; mas chamei-vos amigos, porque tudo quanto ouvi de meu Pai vos dei a conhecer.

RVA.text: Ya no os llamaré siervos, porque el siervo no sabe lo que hace su señor: mas os he llamado amigos, porque todas las cosas que oí de mi Padre, os he hecho notorias.

KJV.text: Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.

WEBM.text: No longer do I call you servants, for the servant doesn’t know what his lord does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I heard from my Father, I have made known to you.

JFA.text: Isto vos mando: que vos ameis uns aos outros.

RVA.text: Esto os mando: Que os améis los unos á los otros.

KJV.text: These things I command you, that ye love one another.

WEBM.text: I command these things to you, that you may love one another.

JFA.text: Se fôsseis do mundo, o mundo amaria o que era seu; mas, porque não sois do mundo, antes eu vos escolhi do mundo, por isso é que o mundo vos odeia.

RVA.text: Si fuerais del mundo, el mundo amaría lo suyo; mas porque no sois del mundo, antes yo os elegí del mundo, por eso os aborrece el mundo.

KJV.text: If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

WEBM.text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

JFA.text: Mas tudo isto vos farão por causa do meu nome, porque não conhecem aquele que me enviou.

RVA.text: Mas todo esto os harán por causa de mi nombre, porque no conocen al que me ha enviado.

KJV.text: But all these things will they do unto you for my name's sake, because they know not him that sent me.

WEBM.text: But they will do all these things to you for my name’s sake, because they don’t know him who sent me.

JFA.text: Se eu não viera e não lhes falara, não teriam pecado; agora, porém, não têm desculpa do seu pecado.

RVA.text: Si no hubiera venido, ni les hubiera hablado, no tendrían pecado, mas ahora no tienen excusa de su pecado.

KJV.text: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no cloak for their sin.

WEBM.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

JFA.text: Aquele que me odeia a mim, odeia também a meu Pai.

RVA.text: El que me aborrece, también á mi Padre aborrece.

KJV.text: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.

WEBM.text: He who hates me, hates my Father also.

JFA.text: Se eu entre eles não tivesse feito tais obras, quais nenhum outro fez, não teriam pecado; mas agora, não somente viram, mas também odiaram tanto a mim como a meu Pai.

RVA.text: Si no hubiese hecho entre ellos obras cuales ningún otro ha hecho, no tendrían pecado; mas ahora, y las han visto, y me aborrecen á mí y á mi Padre.

KJV.text: If I had not done among them the works which none other man did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.

WEBM.text: If I hadn’t done among them the works which no one else did, they wouldn’t have had sin. But now they have seen and also hated both me and my Father.

JFA.text: Mas isto é para que se cumpra a palavra que está escrita na sua lei: Odiaram-me sem causa.

RVA.text: Mas para que se cumpla la palabra que está escrita en su ley: Que sin causa me aborrecieron.

KJV.text: But this cometh to pass, that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.

WEBM.text: But this happened so that the word may be fulfilled which was written in their law, ‘They hated me without a cause.’

JFA.text: Quando vier o Ajudador, que eu vos enviarei da parte do Pai, o Espírito da verdade, que do Pai procede, esse dará testemunho de mim;

RVA.text: Empero cuando viniere el Consolador, el cual yo os enviaré del Padre, el Espíritu de verdad, el cual procede del Padre, él dará testimonio de mí.

KJV.text: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me:

WEBM.text: When the Counselor has come, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will testify about me.

JFA.text: E também vós dareis testemunho, porque estais comigo desde o princípio.

RVA.text: Y vosotros daréis testimonio, porque estáis conmigo desde el principio.

KJV.text: And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

WEBM.text: You will also testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.

JFA.text: Tenho-vos dito estas coisas para que não vos escandalizeis.

RVA.text: ESTAS cosas os he hablado, para que no os escandalicéis.

KJV.text: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.

WEBM.text: I have said these things to you so that you wouldn’t be caused to stumble.

JFA.text: Expulsar-vos-ão das sinagogas; ainda mais, vem a hora em que qualquer que vos matar julgará prestar um serviço a Deus.

RVA.text: Os echarán de los sinagogas; y aun viene la hora, cuando cualquiera que os matare, pensará que hace servició á Dios.

KJV.text: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.

WEBM.text: They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time comes that whoever kills you will think that he offers service to God.

JFA.text: E isto vos farão, porque não conheceram ao Pai nem a mim.

RVA.text: Y estas cosas os harán, porque no conocen al Padre ni á mí.

KJV.text: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

WEBM.text: They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor me.

JFA.text: Mas tenho-vos dito estas coisas, a fim de que, quando chegar aquela hora, vos lembreis de que eu vo-las tinha dito. Não vo-las disse desde o princípio, porque estava convosco.

RVA.text: Mas os he dicho esto, para que cuando aquella hora viniere, os acordeis que yo os lo había dicho. Esto empero no os lo dije al principio, porque yo estaba con vosotros.

KJV.text: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.

WEBM.text: But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn’t tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.

JFA.text: Agora, porém, vou para aquele que me enviou; e nenhum de vós me pergunta: Para onde vais?

RVA.text: Mas ahora voy al que me envió; y ninguno de vosotros me pregunta: ¿Adónde vas?

KJV.text: But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

WEBM.text: But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’

JFA.text: Antes, porque vos disse isto, o vosso coração se encheu de tristeza.

RVA.text: Antes, porque os he hablado estas cosas, tristeza ha henchido vuestro corazón.

KJV.text: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

WEBM.text: But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.

JFA.text: E quando ele vier, convencerá o mundo do pecado, da justiça e do juízo:

RVA.text: Y cuando él viniere redarguirá al mundo de pecado, y de justicia, y de juicio.

KJV.text: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

WEBM.text: When he has come, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment;

JFA.text: Do pecado, porque não crêem em mim.

RVA.text: De pecado ciertamente, por cuanto no creen en mí.

KJV.text: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

WEBM.text: about sin, because they don’t believe in me;

JFA.text: Da justiça, porque vou para meu Pai, e não me vereis mais.

RVA.text: Y de justicia, por cuanto voy al Padre, y no me veréis más.

KJV.text: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;

WEBM.text: about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won’t see me any more;

JFA.text: E do juízo, porque o príncipe deste mundo já está julgado.

RVA.text: Y de juicio, por cuanto el príncipe de este mundo es juzgado.

KJV.text: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

WEBM.text: about judgment, because the prince of this world has been judged.

JFA.text: Quando vier, porém, aquele, o Espírito da verdade, ele vos guiará a toda a verdade; porque não falará por si mesmo, mas dirá o que tiver ouvido, e vos anunciará as coisas vindouras.

RVA.text: ero cuando viniere aquel Espíritu de verdad, él os guiará á toda verdad; porque no hablará de sí mismo, sino que hablará todo lo que oyere, y os hará saber las cosas que han de venir.

KJV.text: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.

WEBM.text: However when he, the Spirit of truth, has come, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he hears, he will speak. He will declare to you things that are coming.

JFA.text: Ele me glorificará, porque receberá do que é meu, e vo-lo anunciará.

RVA.text: El me glorificará: porque tomará de lo mío, y os lo hará saber.

KJV.text: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew it unto you.

WEBM.text: He will glorify me, for he will take from what is mine, and will declare it to you.

JFA.text: Tudo quanto o Pai tem é meu; por isso eu vos disse que ele, recebendo do que é meu, vo-lo anunciará.

RVA.text: Todo lo que tiene el Padre, mío es: por eso dije que tomará de lo mío, y os lo hará saber.

KJV.text: All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall shew it unto you.

WEBM.text: All things that the Father has are mine; therefore I said that he takes of mine and will declare it to you.

JFA.text: Um pouco, e já não me vereis; e outra vez um pouco, e ver-me-eis.

RVA.text: Un poquito, y no me veréis; y otra vez un poquito, y me veréis: porque yo voy al Padre.

KJV.text: A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.

WEBM.text: A little while, and you will not see me. Again a little while, and you will see me.”

JFA.text: Então alguns dos seus discípulos perguntaram uns para os outros: Que é isto que nos diz? Um pouco, e não me vereis; e outra vez um pouco, e ver-me-eis; e: Porquanto vou para o Pai?

RVA.text: Entonces dijeron algunos de sus discípulos unos á otros: ¿Qué es esto que nos dice: Un poquito, y no me veréis; y otra vez un poquito, y me veréis: y, por que yo voy al Padre?

KJV.text: Then said some of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?

WEBM.text: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, “What is this that he says to us, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;’ and, ‘Because I go to the Father’?”

JFA.text: Diziam pois: Que quer dizer isto: Um pouco? Não compreendemos o que ele está dizendo.

RVA.text: Decían pues: ¿Qué es esto que dice: Un poquito? No entendemos lo que habla.

KJV.text: They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? we cannot tell what he saith.

WEBM.text: They said therefore, “What is this that he says, ‘A little while’? We don’t know what he is saying.”

JFA.text: Percebeu Jesus que o queriam interrogar, e disse-lhes: Indagais entre vós acerca disto que disse: Um pouco, e não me vereis; e outra vez um pouco, e ver-me-eis?

RVA.text: Y conoció Jesús que le querían preguntar, y díjoles: ¿Preguntáis entre vosotros de esto que dije: Un poquito, y no me veréis, y otra vez un poquito, y me veréis?

KJV.text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said unto them, Do ye enquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?

WEBM.text: Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, “Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?’

JFA.text: Em verdade, em verdade, vos digo que vós chorareis e vos lamentareis, mas o mundo se alegrará; vós estareis tristes, porém a vossa tristeza se converterá em alegria.

RVA.text: De cierto, de cierto os digo, que vosotros lloraréis y lamentaréis, y el mundo se alegrará: empero aunque vosotros estaréis tristes, vuestra tristeza se tornará en gozo.

KJV.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

WEBM.text: Most certainly I tell you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.

JFA.text: A mulher, quando está para dar à luz, sente tristeza porque é chegada a sua hora; mas, depois de ter dado à luz a criança, já não se lembra da aflição, pelo gozo de haver um homem nascido ao mundo.

RVA.text: La mujer cuando pare, tiene dolor, porque es venida su hora; mas después que ha parido un niño, ya no se acuerda de la angustia, por el gozo de que haya nacido un hombre en el mundo.

KJV.text: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

WEBM.text: A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn’t remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.

JFA.text: Assim também vós agora, na verdade, tendes tristeza; mas eu vos tornarei a ver, e alegrar-se-á o vosso coração, e a vossa alegria ninguém vo-la tirará.

RVA.text: También, pues, vosotros ahora ciertamente tenéis tristeza; mas otra vez os veré, y se gozará vuestro corazón, y nadie quitará de vosotros vuestro gozo.

KJV.text: And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.

WEBM.text: Therefore you now have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.

JFA.text: Naquele dia nada me perguntareis. Em verdade, em verdade vos digo que tudo quanto pedirdes ao Pai, ele vo-lo concederá em meu nome.

RVA.text: Y aquel día no me preguntaréis nada. De cierto, de cierto os digo, que todo cuanto pidiereis al Padre en mi nombre, os lo dará.

KJV.text: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give it you.

WEBM.text: “In that day you will ask me no questions. Most certainly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.

JFA.text: Até agora nada pedistes em meu nome; pedi, e recebereis, para que o vosso gozo seja completo.

RVA.text: Hasta ahora nada habéis pedido en mi nombre: pedid, y recibiréis, para que vuestro gozo sea cumplido.

KJV.text: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.

WEBM.text: Until now, you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be made full.

JFA.text: Disse-vos estas coisas por figuras; chega, porém, a hora em que vos não falarei mais por figuras, mas abertamente vos falarei acerca do Pai.

RVA.text: Estas cosas os he hablado en proverbios: la hora viene cuando ya no os hablaré por proverbios, pero claramente os anunciaré del Padre.

KJV.text: These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs: but the time cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall shew you plainly of the Father.

WEBM.text: I have spoken these things to you in figures of speech. But the time is coming when I will no more speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly about the Father.

JFA.text: Naquele dia pedireis em meu nome, e não vos digo que eu rogarei por vós ao Pai.

RVA.text: Aquel día pediréis en mi nombre: y no os digo, que yo rogaré al Padre por vosotros.

KJV.text: At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you:

WEBM.text: In that day you will ask in my name; and I don’t say to you that I will pray to the Father for you,

JFA.text: Pois o Pai mesmo vos ama; visto que vós me amastes e crestes que eu saí de Deus.

RVA.text: Pues el mismo Padre os ama, porque vosotros me amasteis, y habéis creído que yo salí de Dios.

KJV.text: For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

WEBM.text: for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came from God.

JFA.text: Saí do Pai, e vim ao mundo; outra vez deixo o mundo, e vou para o Pai.

RVA.text: Salí del Padre, y he venido al mundo: otra vez dejo el mundo, y voy al Padre.

KJV.text: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

WEBM.text: I came from the Father, and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.”

JFA.text: Disseram os seus discípulos: Eis que agora falas abertamente, e não por figura alguma.

RVA.text: Dícenle sus discípulos: He aquí, ahora hablas claramente, y ningún proverbio dices.

KJV.text: His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.

WEBM.text: His disciples said to him, “Behold, now you are speaking plainly, and using no figures of speech.

JFA.text: Agora conhecemos que sabes todas as coisas, e não necessitas de que alguém te interrogue. Por isso cremos que saíste de Deus.

RVA.text: Ahora entendemos que sabes todas las cosas, y no necesitas que nadie te pregunte: en esto creemos que has salido de Dios.

KJV.text: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.

WEBM.text: Now we know that you know all things, and don’t need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came from God.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhes Jesus: Credes agora?

RVA.text: Respondióles Jesús: ¿Ahora creéis?

KJV.text: Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?

WEBM.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?

JFA.text: Eis que vem a hora, e já é chegada, em que vós sereis dispersos cada um para o seu lado, e me deixareis só; mas não estou só, porque o Pai está comigo.

RVA.text: He aquí, la hora viene, y ha venido, que seréis esparcidos cada uno por su parte, y me dejaréis solo: mas no estoy solo, porque el Padre está conmigo.

KJV.text: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

WEBM.text: Behold, the time is coming, yes, and has now come, that you will be scattered, everyone to his own place, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

JFA.text: Tiago, servo de Deus e do Senhor Jesus Cristo, às doze tribos da Dispersão, saúde.

RVA.text: JACOBO, siervo de Dios y del Señor Jesucristo, á las doce tribus que están esparcidas, salud.

KJV.text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.

WEBM.text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.

JFA.text: Meus irmãos, tende por motivo de grande gozo o passardes por várias provações.

RVA.text: Hermanos míos, tened por sumo gozo cuando cayereis en diversas tentaciones.

KJV.text: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

WEBM.text: Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations.

JFA.text: Sabendo que a aprovação da vossa fé produz a perseverança.

RVA.text: Sabiendo que la prueba de vuestra fe obra paciencia.

KJV.text: Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

WEBM.text: Knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

JFA.text: Meus irmãos, tende por motivo de grande gozo o passardes por várias provações. Sabendo que a aprovação da vossa fé produz a perseverança.

RVA.text: Hermanos míos, tened por sumo gozo cuando cayereis en diversas tentaciones. Sabiendo que la prueba de vuestra fe obra paciencia.

KJV.text: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations; Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

WEBM.text: Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations. Knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

JFA.text: Homem vacilante que é, e inconstante em todos os seus caminhos.

RVA.text: El hombre de doblado ánimo es inconstante en todos sus caminos.

KJV.text: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.

WEBM.text: He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways.

JFA.text: Mas o irmão de condição humilde glorie-se na sua exaltação.

RVA.text: El hermano que es de baja suerte, gloríese en su alteza.

KJV.text: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:

WEBM.text: But let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position;

JFA.text: E o rico no seu abatimento; porque ele passará como a flor da erva.

RVA.text: Mas el que es rico, en su bajeza; porque él se pasará como la flor de la hierba.

KJV.text: But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.

WEBM.text: and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away.

JFA.text: Cada um, porém, é tentado, quando atraído e engodado pela sua própria concupiscência.

RVA.text: Sino que cada uno es tentado, cuando de su propia concupiscencia es atraído, y cebado.

KJV.text: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.

WEBM.text: But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust and enticed.

JFA.text: Então a concupiscência, havendo concebido, dá à luz o pecado; e o pecado, sendo consumado, gera a morte.

RVA.text: Y la concupiscencia, después que ha concebido, pare el pecado: y el pecado, siendo cumplido, engendra muerte.

KJV.text: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

WEBM.text: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin. The sin, when it is full grown, produces death.

JFA.text: Não vos enganeis, meus amados irmãos.

RVA.text: Amados hermanos míos, no erréis.

KJV.text: Do not err, my beloved brethren.

WEBM.text: Don’t be deceived, my beloved brothers.

JFA.text: Segundo a sua própria vontade, ele nos gerou pela palavra da verdade, para que fôssemos como que primícias das suas criaturas.

RVA.text: El, de su voluntad nos ha engendrado por la palabra de verdad, para que seamos primicias de sus criaturas.

KJV.text: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

WEBM.text: Of his own will he gave birth to us by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures.

JFA.text: Porque a ira do homem não opera a justiça de Deus.

RVA.text: Porque la ira del hombre no obra la justicia de Dios.

KJV.text: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

WEBM.text: For the anger of man doesn’t produce the righteousness of God.

JFA.text: Pelo que, despojando-vos de toda sorte de imundícia e de todo vestígio do mal, recebei com mansidão a palavra em vós implantada, a qual é poderosa para salvar as vossas almas.

RVA.text: Por lo cual, dejando toda inmundicia y superfluidad de malicia, recibid con mansedumbre la palabra ingerida, la cual puede hacer salvas vuestras almas.

KJV.text: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.

WEBM.text: Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls

JFA.text: Pois se alguém é ouvinte da palavra e não cumpridor, é semelhante a um homem que contempla no espelho o seu rosto natural;

RVA.text: Porque si alguno oye la palabra, y no la pone por obra, este tal es semejante al hombre que considera en un espejo su rostro natural.

KJV.text: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

WEBM.text: For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror;

JFA.text: Porque se contempla a si mesmo e vai-se, e logo se esquece de como era.

RVA.text: Porque él se consideró á sí mismo, y se fué, y luego se olvidó qué tal era.

KJV.text: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

WEBM.text: for he sees himself, and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was.

JFA.text: Entretanto aquele que atenta bem para a lei perfeita, a da liberdade, e nela persevera, não sendo ouvinte esquecido, mas executor da obra, este será bem-aventurado no que fizer.

RVA.text: Mas el que hubiere mirado atentamente en la perfecta ley, que es la de la libertad, y perseverado en ella, no siendo oidor olvidadizo, sino hacedor de la obra, este tal será bienaventurado en su hecho.

KJV.text: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

WEBM.text: But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom and continues, not being a hearer who forgets, but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does.

JFA.text: Se alguém cuida ser religioso e não refreia a sua língua, mas engana o seu coração, a sua religião é vã.

RVA.text: Si alguno piensa ser religioso entre vosotros, y no refrena su lengua, sino engañando su corazón, la religión del tal es vana.

KJV.text: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man's religion is vain.

WEBM.text: If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn’t bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man’s religion is worthless.

JFA.text: Tendo, pois, nascido Jesus em Belém da Judéia, no tempo do rei Herodes, eis que vieram do oriente a Jerusalém uns magos que perguntavam.

RVA.text: Y como fué nacido Jesús en Bethlehem de Judea en días del rey Herodes, he aquí unos magos vinieron del oriente á Jerusalem,

KJV.text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,

WEBM.text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying.

JFA.text: Onde está aquele que é nascido rei dos judeus? pois do oriente vimos a sua estrela e viemos adorá-lo.

RVA.text: Diciendo: ¿Dónde está el Rey de los Judíos, que ha nacido? porque su estrella hemos visto en el oriente, y venimos á adorarle.

KJV.text: Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.

WEBM.text: “Where is he who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.”

JFA.text: O rei Herodes, ouvindo isso, perturbou-se, e com ele toda a Jerusalém.

RVA.text: Y oyendo esto el rey Herodes, se turbó, y toda Jerusalem con él.

KJV.text: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

WEBM.text: When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

JFA.text: E, reunindo todos os principais sacerdotes e os escribas do povo, perguntava-lhes onde havia de nascer o Cristo.

RVA.text: Y convocados todos los príncipes de los sacerdotes, y los escribas del pueblo, les preguntó dónde había de nacer el Cristo.

KJV.text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.

WEBM.text: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them where the Christ would be born.

JFA.text: Responderam-lhe eles: Em Belém da Judéia; pois assim está escrito pelo profeta.

RVA.text: Y ellos le dijeron: En Bethlehem de Judea; porque así está escrito por el profeta:

KJV.text: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,

WEBM.text: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet.

JFA.text: E tu, Belém, terra de Judá, de modo nenhum és a menor entre as principais cidades de Judá; porque de ti sairá o Guia que há de apascentar o meu povo de Israel.

RVA.text: Y tú, Bethlehem, de tierra de Judá, No eres muy pequeña entre los príncipes de Judá; Porque de ti saldrá un guiador, Que apacentará á mi pueblo Israel.

KJV.text: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.

WEBM.text: ‘You Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the princes of Judah; for out of you shall come a governor who shall shepherd my people, Israel.’”Micah 5:2

JFA.text: Então Herodes chamou secretamente os magos, e deles inquiriu com precisão acerca do tempo em que a estrela aparecera.

RVA.text: Entonces Herodes, llamando en secreto á los magos, entendió de ellos diligentemente el tiempo del aparecimiento de la estrella;

KJV.text: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.

WEBM.text: Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and learned from them exactly what time the star appeared.

JFA.text: E enviando-os a Belém, disse-lhes: Ide, e perguntai diligentemente pelo menino; e, quando o achardes, participai-mo, para que também eu vá e o adore.

RVA.text: Y enviándolos á Bethlehem, dijo: Andad allá, y preguntad con diligencia por el niño; y después que le hallareis, hacédmelo saber, para que yo también vaya y le adore.

KJV.text: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.

WEBM.text: He sent them to Bethlehem, and said, “Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him.”

JFA.text: Tendo eles, pois, ouvido o rei, partiram; e eis que a estrela que tinham visto quando no oriente ia adiante deles, até que, chegando, se deteve sobre o lugar onde estava o menino.

RVA.text: Y ellos, habiendo oído al rey, se fueron: y he aquí la estrella que habían visto en el oriente, iba delante de ellos, hasta que llegando, se puso sobre donde estaba el niño.

KJV.text: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

WEBM.text: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them until it came and stood over where the young child was.

JFA.text: Ao verem eles a estrela, regozijaram-se com grande alegria.

RVA.text: Y vista la estrella, se regocijaron con muy grande gozo.

KJV.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

WEBM.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.

JFA.text: E entrando na casa, viram o menino com Maria sua mãe e, prostrando-se, o adoraram; e abrindo os seus tesouros, ofertaram-lhe dádivas: ouro incenso e mirra.

RVA.text: Y entrando en la casa, vieron al niño con su madre María, y postrándose, le adoraron; y abriendo sus tesoros, le ofrecieron dones, oro, é incienso y mirra.

KJV.text: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense and myrrh.

WEBM.text: They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

JFA.text: Ora, sendo por divina revelação avisados em sonhos para não voltarem a Herodes, regressaram à sua terra por outro caminho.

RVA.text: Y siendo avisados por revelación en sueños que no volviesen á Herodes, se volvieron á su tierra por otro camino.

KJV.text: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.

WEBM.text: Being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way.

JFA.text: E, havendo eles se retirado, eis que um anjo do Senhor apareceu a José em sonho, dizendo: Levanta-te, toma o menino e sua mãe, foge para o Egito, e ali fica até que eu te fale; porque Herodes há de procurar o menino para o matar.

RVA.text: Y partidos ellos, he aquí el ángel del Señor aparece en sueños á José, diciendo: Levántate, y toma al niño y á su madre, y huye á Egipto, y estáte allá hasta que yo te lo diga; porque ha de acontecer, que Herodes buscará al niño para matarlo.

KJV.text: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.

WEBM.text: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.”

JFA.text: Levantou-se, pois, tomou de noite o menino e sua mãe, e partiu para o Egito.

RVA.text: Y él despertando, tomó al niño y á su madre de noche, y se fué á Egipto;

KJV.text: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:

WEBM.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother by night and departed into Egypt.
