JFA.text: E lá ficou até a morte de Herodes, para que se cumprisse o que fora dito da parte do Senhor pelo profeta: Do Egito chamei o meu Filho.

RVA.text: Y estuvo allá hasta la muerte de Herodes: para que se cumpliese lo que fué dicho por el Señor, por el profeta que dijo: De Egipto llamé á mi Hijo.

KJV.text: And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.

WEBM.text: And was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called my son.”Hosea 11:1

JFA.text: Então Herodes, vendo que fora iludido pelos magos, irou-se grandemente e mandou matar todos os meninos de dois anos para baixo que havia em Belém, e em todos os seus arredores, segundo o tempo que com precisão inquirira dos magos.

RVA.text: Herodes entonces, como se vió burlado de los magos, se enojó mucho, y envió, y mató á todos los niños que había en Bethlehem y en todos sus términos, de edad de dos años abajo, conforme al tiempo que había entendido de los magos.

KJV.text: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men.

WEBM.text: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked by the wise men, was exceedingly angry, and sent out and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men.

JFA.text: Cumpriu-se então o que fora dito pelo profeta Jeremias.

RVA.text: Entonces fué cumplido lo que se había dicho por el profeta Jeremías, que dijo:

KJV.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying,

WEBM.text: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying.

JFA.text: Em Ramá se ouviu uma voz, lamentação e grande pranto: Raquel chorando os seus filhos, e não querendo ser consolada, porque eles já não existem.

RVA.text: Voz fué oída en Ramá, Grande lamentación, lloro y gemido: Rachêl que llora sus hijos, Y no quiso ser consolada, porque perecieron.

KJV.text: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.

WEBM.text: “A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she wouldn’t be comforted, because they are no more.”Jeremiah 31:15

JFA.text: Mas tendo morrido Herodes, eis que um anjo do Senhor apareceu em sonho a José no Egito.

RVA.text: Mas muerto Herodes, he aquí el ángel del Señor aparece en sueños á José en Egipto,

KJV.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

WEBM.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying.

JFA.text: Dizendo: Levanta-te, toma o menino e sua mãe e vai para a terra de Israel; porque já morreram os que procuravam a morte do menino.

RVA.text: Diciendo: Levántate, y toma al niño y á su madre, y vete á tierra de Israel; que muertos son los que procuraban la muerte del niño.

KJV.text: Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child's life.

WEBM.text: “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child’s life are dead.”

JFA.text: Então ele se levantou, tomou o menino e sua mãe e foi para a terra de Israel.

RVA.text: Entonces él se levantó, y tomó al niño y á su madre, y se vino á tierra de Israel.

KJV.text: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

WEBM.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

JFA.text: Ouvindo, porém, que Arquelau reinava na Judéia em lugar de seu pai Herodes, temeu ir para lá; mas avisado em sonho por divina revelação, retirou-se para as regiões da Galiléia.

RVA.text: Y oyendo que Archelao reinaba en Judea en lugar de Herodes su padre, temió ir allá: mas amonestado por revelación en sueños, se fué á las partes de Galilea.

KJV.text: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:

WEBM.text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there. Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee.

JFA.text: E foi habitar numa cidade chamada Nazaré; para que se cumprisse o que fora dito pelos profetas: Ele será chamado nazareno.

RVA.text: Y vino, y habitó en la ciudad que se llama Nazaret: para que se cumpliese lo que fué dicho por los profetas, que había de ser llamado Nazareno.

KJV.text: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.

WEBM.text: And came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets that he will be called a Nazarene.

JFA.text: Chegando, então, o tentador, disse-lhe: Se tu és Filho de Deus manda que estas pedras se tornem em pães.

RVA.text: Y llegándose á él el tentador, dijo: Si eres Hijo de Dios, di que estas piedras se hagan pan.

KJV.text: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.

WEBM.text: The tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”

JFA.text: Então o Diabo o levou à cidade santa, colocou-o sobre o pináculo do templo.

RVA.text: Entonces el diablo le pasa á la santa ciudad, y le pone sobre las almenas del templo,

KJV.text: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,

WEBM.text: Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple.

JFA.text: E disse-lhe: Se tu és Filho de Deus, lança-te daqui abaixo; porque está escrito: Aos seus anjos dará ordens a teu respeito; e: eles te susterão nas mãos, para que nunca tropeces em alguma pedra.

RVA.text: Y le dice: Si eres Hijo de Dios, échate abajo; que escrito está: A sus ángeles mandará por ti, Y te alzarán en las manos, Para que nunca tropieces con tu pie en piedra.

KJV.text: And saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.

WEBM.text: And said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you,’ and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, so that you don’t dash your foot against a stone.’”Psalm 91:11-12

JFA.text: Replicou-lhe Jesus: Também está escrito: Não tentarás o Senhor teu Deus.

RVA.text: Jesús le dijo: Escrito está además: No tentarás al Señor tu Dios.

KJV.text: Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “Again, it is written, ‘You shall not test the Lord, your God.’”Deuteronomy 6:16

JFA.text: Novamente o Diabo o levou a um monte muito alto; e mostrou-lhe todos os reinos do mundo, e a glória deles.

RVA.text: Otra vez le pasa el diablo á un monte muy alto, y le muestra todos los reinos del mundo, y su gloria,

KJV.text: Again, the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;

WEBM.text: Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.

JFA.text: E disse-lhe: Tudo isto te darei, se, prostrado, me adorares.

RVA.text: Y dícele: Todo esto te daré, si postrado me adorares.

KJV.text: And saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

WEBM.text: He said to him, “I will give you all of these things, if you will fall down and worship me.”

JFA.text: Então o Diabo o deixou; e eis que vieram os anjos e o serviram.

RVA.text: El diablo entonces le dejó: y he aquí los ángeles llegaron y le servían.

KJV.text: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.

WEBM.text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and served him.

JFA.text: Ora, ouvindo Jesus que João fora entregue, retirou-se para a Galiléia.

RVA.text: Mas oyendo Jesús que Juan era preso, se volvió á Galilea;

KJV.text: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;

WEBM.text: Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee.

JFA.text: E, deixando Nazaré, foi habitar em Cafarnaum, cidade marítima, nos confins de Zabulom e Naftali.

RVA.text: Y dejando á Nazaret, vino y habitó en Capernaum, ciudad marítima, en los confines de Zabulón y de Nephtalim:

KJV.text: And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:

WEBM.text: Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.

JFA.text: Ppara que se cumprisse o que fora dito pelo profeta Isaías.

RVA.text: Para que se cumpliese lo que fué dicho por el profeta Isaías, que dijo:

KJV.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,

WEBM.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying.

JFA.text: A terra de Zabulom e a terra de Naftali, o caminho do mar, além do Jordão, a Galiléia dos gentios.

RVA.text: La tierra de Zabulón, y la tierra de Nephtalim, Camino de la mar, de la otra parte del Jordán, Galilea de los Gentiles;

KJV.text: The land of Zabulon, and the land of Nephthalim, by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;

WEBM.text: “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles."

JFA.text: Desde então começou Jesus a pregar, e a dizer: Arrependei- vos, porque é chegado o reino dos céus.

RVA.text: Desde entonces comenzó Jesús á predicar, y á decir: Arrepentíos, que el reino de los cielos se ha acercado.

KJV.text: From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

WEBM.text: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say, “Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.”

JFA.text: E Jesus, andando ao longo do mar da Galiléia, viu dois irmãos - Simão, chamado Pedro, e seu irmão André, os quais lançavam a rede ao mar, porque eram pescadores.

RVA.text: Y andando Jesús junto á la mar de Galilea, vió á dos hermanos, Simón, que es llamado Pedro, y Andrés su hermano, que echaban la red en la mar; porque eran pescadores.

KJV.text: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.

WEBM.text: Walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers: Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.

JFA.text: Eles, pois, deixando imediatamente as redes, o seguiram.

RVA.text: Ellos entonces, dejando luego las redes, le siguieron.

KJV.text: And they straightway left their nets, and followed him.

WEBM.text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.

JFA.text: E, passando mais adiante, viu outros dois irmãos - Tiago, filho de Zebedeu, e seu irmão João, no barco com seu pai Zebedeu, consertando as redes; e os chamou.

RVA.text: Y pasando de allí vió otros dos hermanos, Jacobo, hijo de Zebedeo, y Juan su hermano, en el barco con Zebedeo, su padre, que remendaban sus redes; y los llamó.

KJV.text: And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.

WEBM.text: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them.

JFA.text: Estes, deixando imediatamente o barco e seu pai, seguiram- no.

RVA.text: Y ellos, dejando luego el barco y á su padre, le siguieron.

KJV.text: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.

WEBM.text: They immediately left the boat and their father, and followed him.

JFA.text: E percorria Jesus toda a Galiléia, ensinando nas sinagogas, pregando o evangelho do reino, e curando todas as doenças e enfermidades entre o povo.

RVA.text: Y rodeó Jesús toda Galilea, enseñando en las sinagogas de ellos, y predicando el evangelio del reino, y sanando toda enfermedad y toda dolencia en el pueblo.

KJV.text: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.

WEBM.text: Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

JFA.text: Assim a sua fama correu por toda a Síria; e trouxeram-lhe todos os que padeciam, acometidos de várias doenças e tormentos, os endemoninhados, os lunáticos, e os paralíticos; e ele os curou.

RVA.text: Y corría su fama por toda la Siria; y le trajeron todos los que tenían mal: los tomados de diversas enfermedades y tormentos, y los endemoniados, y lunáticos, y paralíticos, y los sanó.

KJV.text: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.

WEBM.text: The report about him went out into all Syria. They brought to him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them.

JFA.text: De sorte que o seguiam grandes multidões da Galiléia, de Decápolis, de Jerusalém, da Judéia, e dalém do Jordão.

RVA.text: Y le siguieron muchas gentes de Galilea y de Decápolis y de Jerusalem y de Judea y de la otra parte del Jordán.

KJV.text: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, and from Decapolis, and from Jerusalem, and from Judaea, and from beyond Jordan.

WEBM.text: Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from beyond the Jordan followed him.

JFA.text: Quando Jesus desceu do monte, grandes multidões o seguiam.

RVA.text: Y como descendió del monte, le seguían muchas gentes.

KJV.text: When he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

WEBM.text: When he came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

JFA.text: E eis que veio um leproso e o adorava, dizendo: Senhor, se quiseres, podes tornar-me limpo.

RVA.text: Y he aquí un leproso vino, y le adoraba, diciendo: Señor, si quisieres, puedes limpiarme.

KJV.text: And, behold, there came a leper and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

WEBM.text: Behold, a leper came to him and worshiped him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”

JFA.text: Jesus, pois, estendendo a mão, tocou-o, dizendo: Quero; sê limpo. No mesmo instante ficou purificado da sua lepra.

RVA.text: Y extendiendo Jesús su mano, le tocó, diciendo: Quiero; sé limpio. Y luego su lepra fué limpiada.

KJV.text: And Jesus put forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou clean. And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

WEBM.text: Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I want to. Be made clean.” Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

JFA.text: Disse-lhe então Jesus: Olha, não contes isto a ninguém; mas vai, mostra-te ao sacerdote, e apresenta a oferta que Moisés determinou, para lhes servir de testemunho.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús le dijo: Mira, no lo digas á nadie; mas ve, muéstrate al sacerdote, y ofrece el presente que mandó Moisés, para testimonio á ellos.

KJV.text: And Jesus saith unto him, See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “See that you tell nobody; but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”

JFA.text: Tendo Jesus entrado em Cafarnaum, chegou-se a ele um centurião que lhe rogava, dizendo.

RVA.text: Y entrando Jesús en Capernaum, vino á él un centurión, rogándole,

KJV.text: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,

WEBM.text: When he came into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking him for help, 6 saying, “Lord, my servant lies in the house paralyzed, grievously tormented.”

JFA.text: Senhor, o meu criado jaz em casa paralítico, e horrivelmente atormentado.

RVA.text: Y diciendo: Señor, mi mozo yace en casa paralítico, gravemente atormentado.

KJV.text: And saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Jesus: Eu irei, e o curarei.

RVA.text: Y Jesús le dijo: Yo iré y le sanaré.

KJV.text: And Jesus saith unto him, I will come and heal him.

WEBM.text: The centurion answered, “Lord, I’m not worthy for you to come under my roof. Just say the word, and my servant will be healed.

JFA.text: O centurião, porém, replicou-lhe: Senhor, não sou digno de que entres debaixo do meu telhado; mas somente dize uma palavra, e o meu criado há de sarar.

RVA.text: Y respondió el centurión, y dijo: Señor, no soy digno de que entres debajo de mi techado; mas solamente mi la palabra, y mi mozo sanará.

KJV.text: The centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.

WEBM.text: For I am also a man under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and tell another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and tell my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

JFA.text: Pois também eu sou homem sujeito à autoridade, e tenho soldados às minhas ordens; e digo a este: Vai, e ele vai; e a outro: Vem, e ele vem; e ao meu servo: Faze isto, e ele o faz.

RVA.text: Porque también yo soy hombre bajo de potestad, y tengo bajo de mí soldados: y digo á éste: Ve, y va; y al otro: Ven, y viene; y á mi siervo: Haz esto, y lo hace.

KJV.text: For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to this man, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

WEBM.text: When Jesus heard it, he marveled and said to those who followed, “Most certainly I tell you, I haven’t found so great a faith, not even in Israel.

JFA.text: Jesus, ouvindo isso, admirou-se, e disse aos que o seguiam: Em verdade vos digo que a ninguém encontrei em Israel com tamanha fé.

RVA.text: Y oyendo Jesús, se maravilló, y dijo á los que le seguían: De cierto os digo, que ni aun en Israel he hallado fe tanta.

KJV.text: When Jesus heard it, he marvelled, and said to them that followed, Verily I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

WEBM.text: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven.

JFA.text: Também vos digo que muitos virão do oriente e do ocidente, e reclinar-se-ão à mesa de Abraão, Isaque e Jacó, no reino dos céus.

RVA.text: Y os digo que vendrán muchos del oriente y del occidente, y se sentarán con Abraham, é Isaac, y Jacob, en el reino de los cielos:

KJV.text: And I say unto you, That many shall come from the east and west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven.

WEBM.text: But the children of the Kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

JFA.text: Mas os filhos do reino serão lançados nas trevas exteriores; ali haverá choro e ranger de dentes.

RVA.text: Mas los hijos del reino serán echados á las tinieblas de afuera: allí será el lloro y el crujir de dientes.

KJV.text: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to the centurion, “Go your way. Let it be done for you as you have believed.” His servant was healed in that hour.

JFA.text: Então disse Jesus ao centurião: Vai-te, e te seja feito assim como creste. E naquela mesma hora o seu criado sarou.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús dijo al centurión: Ve, y como creiste te sea hecho. Y su mozo fué sano en el mismo momento.

KJV.text: And Jesus said unto the centurion, Go thy way; and as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee. And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour.

WEBM.text: When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.

JFA.text: Ora, tendo Jesus entrado na casa de Pedro, viu a sogra deste de cama; e com febre.

RVA.text: Y vino Jesús á casa de Pedro, y vió á su suegra echada en cama, y con fiebre.

KJV.text: And when Jesus was come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother laid, and sick of a fever.

WEBM.text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. So she got up and served him.

JFA.text: E tocou-lhe a mão, e a febre a deixou; então ela se levantou, e o servia.

RVA.text: Y tocó su mano, y la fiebre la dejó: y ella se levantó, y les servía.

KJV.text: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose, and ministered unto them.

WEBM.text: When evening came, they brought to him many possessed with demons. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick.

JFA.text: Caída a tarde, trouxeram-lhe muitos endemoninhados; e ele com a sua palavra expulsou os espíritos, e curou todos os enfermos.

RVA.text: Y como fué ya tarde, trajeron á él muchos endemoniados: y echó los demonios con la palabra, y sanó á todos los enfermos;

KJV.text: When the even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with his word, and healed all that were sick:

WEBM.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying, “He took our infirmities and bore our diseases.”Isaiah 53:4

JFA.text: Para que se cumprisse o que fora dito pelo profeta Isaías: Ele tomou sobre si as nossas enfermidades, e levou as nossas doenças.

RVA.text: Para que se cumpliese lo que fué dicho por el profeta Isaías, que dijo: El mismo tomó nuestras enfermedades, y llevó nuestras dolencias.

KJV.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities, and bare our sicknesses.

WEBM.text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes around him, he gave the order to depart to the other side.

JFA.text: Vendo Jesus uma multidão ao redor de si, deu ordem de partir para o outro lado do mar.

RVA.text: Y viendo Jesús muchas gentes alrededor de sí, mandó pasar á la otra parte del lago.

KJV.text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.

WEBM.text: A scribe came and said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”

JFA.text: E, aproximando-se um escriba, disse-lhe: Mestre, seguir-te- ei para onde quer que fores.

RVA.text: Y llegándose un escriba, le dijo: Maestro, te seguiré á donde quiera que fueres.

KJV.text: And a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Jesus: As raposas têm covis, e as aves do céu têm ninhos; mas o Filho do homem não tem onde reclinar a cabeça.

RVA.text: Y Jesús le dijo: Las zorras tienen cavernas, y las aves del cielo nidos; mas el Hijo del hombre no tiene donde recueste su cabeza.

KJV.text: And Jesus saith unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.

WEBM.text: Another of his disciples said to him, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”

JFA.text: E outro de seus discípulos lhe disse: Senhor, permite-me ir primeiro sepultar meu pai.

RVA.text: Y otro de sus discípulos le dijo: Señor, dame licencia para que vaya primero, y entierre á mi padre.

KJV.text: And another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

WEBM.text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead.”

JFA.text: Jesus, porém, respondeu-lhe: Segue-me, e deixa os mortos sepultar os seus próprios mortos.

RVA.text: Y Jesús le dijo: Sígueme; deja que los muertos entierren á sus muertos.

KJV.text: But Jesus said unto him, Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead.

WEBM.text: When he got into a boat, his disciples followed him.

JFA.text: E, entrando ele no barco, seus discípulos o seguiram.

RVA.text: Y entrando él en el barco, sus discípulos le siguieron.

KJV.text: And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.

WEBM.text: Behold, a violent storm came up on the sea, so much that the boat was covered with the waves; but he was asleep.

JFA.text: E eis que se levantou no mar tão grande tempestade que o barco era coberto pelas ondas; ele, porém, estava dormindo.

RVA.text: Y he aquí, fué hecho en la mar un gran movimiento, que el barco se cubría de las ondas; mas él dormía.

KJV.text: And, behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.

WEBM.text: The disciples came to him and woke him up, saying, “Save us, Lord! We are dying!”

JFA.text: Os discípulos, pois, aproximando-se, o despertaram, dizendo: Salva-nos, Senhor, que estamos perecendo.

RVA.text: Y llegándose sus discípulos, le despertaron, diciendo: Señor, sálvanos, que perecemos.

KJV.text: And his disciples came to him, and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us: we perish.

WEBM.text: He said to them, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then he got up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.

JFA.text: Ele lhes respondeu: Por que temeis, homens de pouca fé? Então, levantando-se repreendeu os ventos e o mar, e seguiu-se grande bonança.

RVA.text: Y él les dice: ¿Por qué teméis, hombres de poca fe? Entonces, levantándose, reprendió á los vientos y á la mar; y fué grande bonanza.

KJV.text: And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.

WEBM.text: The men marveled, saying, “What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

JFA.text: E aqueles homens se maravilharam, dizendo: Que homem é este, que até os ventos e o mar lhe obedecem?

RVA.text: Y los hombres se maravillaron, diciendo: ¿Qué hombre es éste, que aun los vientos y la mar le obedecen?

KJV.text: But the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him!

WEBM.text: When he came to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two people possessed by demons met him there, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that nobody could pass that way.

JFA.text: Tendo ele chegado ao outro lado, à terra dos gadarenos, saíram-lhe ao encontro dois endemoninhados, vindos dos sepulcros; tão ferozes eram que ninguém podia passar por aquele caminho.

RVA.text: Y como él hubo llegado en la otra ribera al país de los Gergesenos, le vinieron al encuentro dos endemoniados que salían de los sepulcros, fieros en gran manera, que nadie podía pasar por aquel camino.

KJV.text: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with devils, coming out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.

WEBM.text: Behold, they cried out, saying, “What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”

JFA.text: E eis que gritaram, dizendo: Que temos nós contigo, Filho de Deus? Vieste aqui atormentar-nos antes do tempo?

RVA.text: Y he aquí clamaron, diciendo: ¿Qué tenemos contigo, Jesús, Hijo de Dios? ¿has venido acá á molestarnos antes de tiempo?

KJV.text: And, behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God? art thou come hither to torment us before the time?

WEBM.text: Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding far away from them.

JFA.text: Ora, a alguma distância deles, andava pastando uma grande manada de porcos.

RVA.text: Y estaba lejos de ellos un hato de muchos puercos paciendo.

KJV.text: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding.

WEBM.text: The demons begged him, saying, “If you cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of pigs.”

JFA.text: E os demônios rogavam-lhe, dizendo: Se nos expulsas, manda- nos entrar naquela manada de porcos.

RVA.text: Y los demonios le rogaron, diciendo: Si nos echas, permítenos ir á aquel hato de puercos.

KJV.text: So the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.

WEBM.text: He said to them, “Go!”

JFA.text: Disse-lhes Jesus: Ide. Então saíram, e entraram nos porcos; e eis que toda a manada se precipitou pelo despenhadeiro no mar, perecendo nas águas.

RVA.text: Y les dijo: Id. Y ellos salieron, y se fueron á aquel hato de puercos: y he aquí, todo el hato de los puercos se precipitó de un despeñadero en la mar, y murieron en las aguas.

KJV.text: And he said unto them, Go. And when they were come out, they went into the herd of swine: and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters.

WEBM.text: They came out, and went into the herd of pigs; and behold, the whole herd of pigs rushed down the cliff into the sea and died in the water.

JFA.text: Os pastores fugiram e, chegando à cidade, divulgaram todas estas coisas, e o que acontecera aos endemoninhados.

RVA.text: Y los porqueros huyeron, y viniendo á la ciudad, contaron todas las cosas, y lo que había pasado con los endemoniados.

KJV.text: And they that kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told every thing, and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils.

WEBM.text: Those who fed them fled and went away into the city and told everything, including what happened to those who were possessed with demons.

JFA.text: E eis que toda a cidade saiu ao encontro de Jesus; e vendo- o, rogaram-lhe que se retirasse dos seus termos.

RVA.text: Y he aquí, toda la ciudad salió á encontrar á Jesús: Y cuando le vieron, le rogaban que saliese de sus términos.

KJV.text: And, behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besought him that he would depart out of their coasts.

WEBM.text: Behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged that he would depart from their borders.

JFA.text: Naquele tempo Herodes, o tetrarca, ouviu a fama de Jesus.

RVA.text: En aquel tiempo Herodes el tetrarca oyó la fama de Jesús,

KJV.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,

WEBM.text: At that time, Herod the tetrarch heard the report concerning Jesus.

JFA.text: E disse aos seus cortesãos: Este é João, o Batista; ele ressuscitou dentre os mortos, e por isso estes poderes milagrosos operam nele.

RVA.text: Y dijo á sus criados: Este es Juan el Bautista: él ha resucitado de los muertos, y por eso virtudes obran en él.

KJV.text: And said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

WEBM.text: And said to his servants, “This is John the Baptizer. He is risen from the dead. That is why these powers work in him.”

JFA.text: Pois Herodes havia prendido a João, e, maniatando-o, o guardara no cárcere, por causa de Herodias, mulher de seu irmão Felipe.

RVA.text: Porque Herodes había prendido á Juan, y le había aprisionado y puesto en la cárcel, por causa de Herodías, mujer de Felipe su hermano;

KJV.text: For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife.

WEBM.text: For Herod had arrested John, and bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.

JFA.text: Porque João lhe dizia: Não te é lícito possuí-la.

RVA.text: Porque Juan le decía: No te es lícito tenerla.

KJV.text: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.

WEBM.text: For John said to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

JFA.text: E queria matá-lo, mas temia o povo; porque o tinham como profeta.

RVA.text: Y quería matarle, mas temía al pueblo; porque le tenían como á profeta.

KJV.text: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.

WEBM.text: When he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.

JFA.text: Festejando-se, porém, o dia natalício de Herodes, a filha de Herodias dançou no meio dos convivas, e agradou a Herodes.

RVA.text: Mas celebrándose el día del nacimiento de Herodes, la hija de Herodías danzó en medio, y agradó á Herodes.

KJV.text: But when Herod's birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod.

WEBM.text: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced among them and pleased Herod.

JFA.text: Pelo que este prometeu com juramento dar-lhe tudo o que pedisse.

RVA.text: Y prometió él con juramento de darle todo lo que pidiese.

KJV.text: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.

WEBM.text: Therefore he promised with an oath to give her whatever she should ask.

JFA.text: E instigada por sua mãe, disse ela: Dá-me aqui num prato a cabeça de João, o Batista.

RVA.text: Y ella, instruída primero de su madre, dijo: Dame aquí en un plato la cabeza de Juan el Bautista.

KJV.text: And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist's head in a charger.

WEBM.text: She, being prompted by her mother, said, “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptizer.”

JFA.text: Entristeceu-se, então, o rei; mas, por causa do juramento, e dos que estavam à mesa com ele, ordenou que se lhe desse.

RVA.text: Entonces el rey se entristeció; mas por el juramento, y por los que estaban juntamente á la mesa, mandó que se le diese.

KJV.text: And the king was sorry: nevertheless for the oath's sake, and them which sat with him at meat, he commanded it to be given her.

WEBM.text: The king was grieved, but for the sake of his oaths and of those who sat at the table with him, he commanded it to be given.

JFA.text: E mandou degolar a João no cárcere.

RVA.text: Y enviando, degolló á Juan en la cárcel.

KJV.text: And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.

WEBM.text: And he sent and beheaded John in the prison.

JFA.text: E a cabeça foi trazida num prato, e dada à jovem, e ela a levou para a sua mãe.

RVA.text: Y fué traída su cabeza en un plato y dada á la muchacha; y ella la presentó á su madre.

KJV.text: And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she brought it to her mother.

WEBM.text: His head was brought on a platter and given to the young lady; and she brought it to her mother.

JFA.text: Então vieram os seus discípulos, levaram o corpo e o sepultaram; e foram anunciá-lo a Jesus.

RVA.text: Entonces llegaron sus discípulos, y tomaron el cuerpo, y lo enterraron; y fueron, y dieron las nuevas á Jesús.

KJV.text: And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.

WEBM.text: His disciples came, took the body, and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.

JFA.text: Jesus, ouvindo isto, retirou-se dali num barco, para um, lugar deserto, à parte; e quando as multidões o souberam, seguiram-no a pé desde as cidades.

RVA.text: Y oyéndo lo Jesús, se apartó de allí en un barco á un lugar descierto, apartado: y cuando las gentes lo oyeron, le siguieron á pie de las ciudades.

KJV.text: When Jesus heard of it, he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart: and when the people had heard thereof, they followed him on foot out of the cities.

WEBM.text: Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat to a deserted place apart. When the multitudes heard it, they followed him on foot from the cities.

JFA.text: E ele, ao desembarcar, viu uma grande multidão; e, compadecendo-se dela, curou os seus enfermos.

RVA.text: Y saliendo Jesús, vió un gran gentío, y tuvo compasión de ellos, y sanó á los que de ellos había enfermos.

KJV.text: And Jesus went forth, and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.

WEBM.text: Jesus went out, and he saw a great multitude. He had compassion on them and healed their sick.

JFA.text: Chegada a tarde, aproximaram-se dele os discípulos, dizendo: O lugar é deserto, e a hora é já passada; despede as multidões, para que vão às aldeias, e comprem o que comer.

RVA.text: Y cuando fué la tarde del día, se llegaron á él sus discípulos, diciendo: El lugar es desierto, y el tiempo es ya pasado: despide las gentes, para que se vayan por las aldeas, y compren para sí de comer.

KJV.text: And when it was evening, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves victuals.

WEBM.text: When evening had come, his disciples came to him, saying, “This place is deserted, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves food.”

JFA.text: Jesus, porém, lhes disse: Não precisam ir embora; dai-lhes vós de comer.

RVA.text: Y Jesús les dijo: No tienen necesidad de irse: dadles vosotros de comer.

KJV.text: But Jesus said unto them, They need not depart; give ye them to eat.

WEBM.text: But Jesus said to them, “They don’t need to go away. You give them something to eat.”

JFA.text: Então eles lhe disseram: Não temos aqui senão cinco pães e dois peixes.

RVA.text: Y ellos dijeron: No tenemos aquí sino cinco panes y dos peces.

KJV.text: And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.

WEBM.text: They told him, “We only have here five loaves and two fish.”

JFA.text: E ele disse: trazei-mos aqui.

RVA.text: Y él les dijo: Traédmelos acá.

KJV.text: He said, Bring them hither to me.

WEBM.text: He said, “Bring them here to me.”

JFA.text: Tendo mandado às multidões que se reclinassem sobre a relva, tomou os cinco pães e os dois peixes e, erguendo os olhos ao céu, os abençoou; e partindo os pães, deu-os aos discípulos, e os discípulos às multidões.

RVA.text: Y mandando á las gentes recostarse sobre la hierba, tomando los cinco panes y los dos peces, alzando los ojos al cielo, bendijo, y partió y dió los panes á los discípulos, y los discípulos á las gentes.

KJV.text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake, and gave the loaves to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

WEBM.text: He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass; and he took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, broke and gave the loaves to the disciples; and the disciples gave to the multitudes.

JFA.text: Todos comeram e se fartaram; e dos pedaços que sobejaram levantaram doze cestos cheios.

RVA.text: Y comieron todos, y se hartaron; y alzaron lo que sobró de los pedazos, doce cestas llenas.

KJV.text: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full.

WEBM.text: They all ate and were filled. They took up twelve baskets full of that which remained left over from the broken pieces.

JFA.text: Ora, os que comeram foram cerca de cinco mil homens, além de mulheres e crianças.

RVA.text: Y los que comieron fueron como cinco mil hombres, sin las mujeres y los niños.

KJV.text: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside women and children.

WEBM.text: Those who ate were about five thousand men, in addition to women and children.

JFA.text: Logo em seguida obrigou os seus discípulos a entrar no barco, e passar adiante dele para o outro lado, enquanto ele despedia as multidões.

RVA.text: Y luego Jesús hizo á sus discípulos entrar en el barco, é ir delante de él á la otra parte del lago, entre tanto que él despedía á las gentes.

KJV.text: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship, and to go before him unto the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

WEBM.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

JFA.text: Tendo-as despedido, subiu ao monte para orar à parte. Ao anoitecer, estava ali sozinho.

RVA.text: Y despedidas las gentes, subió al monte, apartado, á orar: y como fué la tarde del día, estaba allí solo.

KJV.text: And when he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray: and when the evening was come, he was there alone.

WEBM.text: After he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain by himself to pray. When evening had come, he was there alone.

JFA.text: Entrementes, o barco já estava a muitos estádios da terra, açoitado pelas ondas; porque o vento era contrário.

RVA.text: Y ya el barco estaba en medio de la mar, atormentado de las ondas; porque el viento era contrario.

KJV.text: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.

WEBM.text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, distressed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.

JFA.text: Â quarta vigília da noite, foi Jesus ter com eles, andando sobre o mar.

RVA.text: Mas á la cuarta vela de la noche, Jesús fué á ellos andando sobre la mar.

KJV.text: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.

WEBM.text: In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus came to them, walking on the sea.See Job 9:8

JFA.text: Os discípulos, porém, ao vê-lo andando sobre o mar, assustaram-se e disseram: É um fantasma. E gritaram de medo.

RVA.text: Y los discípulos, viéndole andar sobre la mar, se turbaron, diciendo: Fantasma es. Y dieron voces de miedo.

KJV.text: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they cried out for fear.

WEBM.text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, “It’s a ghost!” and they cried out for fear.

JFA.text: Jesus, porém, imediatamente lhes falou, dizendo: Tende ânimo; sou eu; não temais.

RVA.text: Mas luego Jesús les habló, diciendo: Confiad, yo soy; no tengáis miedo.

KJV.text: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.

WEBM.text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Pedro: Senhor! se és tu, manda-me ir ter contigo sobre as águas.

RVA.text: Entonces le respondió Pedro, y dijo: Señor, si tú eres, manda que yo vaya á ti sobre las aguas.

KJV.text: And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.

WEBM.text: Peter answered him and said, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the waters.”

JFA.text: Quando se aproximaram de Jerusalém, e chegaram a Betfagé, ao Monte das Oliveiras, enviou Jesus dois discípulos, dizendo-lhes.

RVA.text: Y como se acercaron á Jerusalem, y vinieron á Bethfagé, al monte de las Olivas, entonces Jesús envió dos discípulos,

KJV.text: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,

WEBM.text: When they came near to Jerusalem and came to Bethsphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples.

JFA.text: Ide à aldeia que está defronte de vós, e logo encontrareis uma jumenta presa, e um jumentinho com ela; desprendei-a, e trazei- mos.

RVA.text: Diciéndoles: Id á la aldea que está delante de vosotros, y luego hallaréis una asna atada, y un pollino con ella: desatad la, y traédme los.

KJV.text: Saying unto them, Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.

WEBM.text: Saying to them, “Go into the village that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to me.

JFA.text: E, se alguém vos disser alguma coisa, respondei: O Senhor precisa deles; e logo os enviará.

RVA.text: Y si alguno os dijere algo, decid: El Señor los ha menester. Y luego los dejará.

KJV.text: And if any man say ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.

WEBM.text: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and immediately he will send them.”

JFA.text: Ora, isso aconteceu para que se cumprisse o que foi dito pelo profeta.

RVA.text: Y todo esto fué hecho, para que se cumpliese lo que fué dicho por el profeta, que dijo:

KJV.text: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,

WEBM.text: All this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying,

JFA.text: Dizei à filha de Sião: Eis que aí te vem o teu Rei, manso e montado em um jumento, em um jumentinho, cria de animal de carga.

RVA.text: Decid á la hija de Sión: He aquí, tu Rey viene á ti, Manso, y sentado sobre una asna, Y sobre un pollino, hijo de animal de yugo.

KJV.text: Tell ye the daughter of Sion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, and a colt the foal of an ass.

WEBM.text: “Tell the daughter of Zion, behold, your King comes to you, humble, and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.”Zechariah 9:9

JFA.text: Indo, pois, os discípulos e fazendo como Jesus lhes ordenara.

RVA.text: Y los discípulos fueron, é hicieron como Jesús les mandó;

KJV.text: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,

WEBM.text: The disciples went and did just as Jesus commanded them.

JFA.text: Trouxeram a jumenta e o jumentinho, e sobre eles puseram os seus mantos, e Jesus montou.

RVA.text: Y trajeron el asna y el pollino, y pusieron sobre ellos sus mantos; y se sentó sobre ellos.

KJV.text: And brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they set him thereon.

WEBM.text: And brought the donkey and the colt and laid their clothes on them; and he sat on them.

JFA.text: E a maior parte da multidão estendeu os seus mantos pelo caminho; e outros cortavam ramos de árvores, e os espalhavam pelo caminho.

RVA.text: Y la compañía, que era muy numerosa, tendía sus mantos en el camino: y otros cortaban ramos de los árboles, y los tendían por el camino.

KJV.text: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; others cut down branches from the trees, and strawed them in the way.

WEBM.text: A very great multitude spread their clothes on the road. Others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.

JFA.text: E as multidões, tanto as que o precediam como as que o seguiam, clamavam, dizendo: Hosana ao Filho de Davi! bendito o que vem em nome do Senhor! Hosana nas alturas!

RVA.text: Y las gentes que iban delante, y las que iban detrás, aclamaban diciendo: ­Hosanna al Hijo de David! ­Bendito el que viene en el nombre del Señor! ­Hosanna en las alturas!

KJV.text: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.

WEBM.text: The multitudes who went in front of him, and those who followed, kept shouting, “Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!” Psalm 118:26

JFA.text: Ao entrar ele em Jerusalém, agitou-se a cidade toda e perguntava: Quem é este?

RVA.text: Y entrando él en Jerusalem, toda la ciudad se alborotó, diciendo. ¿Quién es éste?

KJV.text: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?

WEBM.text: When he had come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”

JFA.text: E as multidões respondiam: Este é o profeta Jesus, de Nazaré da Galiléia.

RVA.text: Y las gentes decían: Este es Jesús, el profeta, de Nazaret de Galilea.

KJV.text: And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.

WEBM.text: The multitudes said, “This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.”

JFA.text: Então Jesus entrou no templo, expulsou todos os que ali vendiam e compravam, e derribou as mesas dos cambistas e as cadeiras dos que vendiam pombas.

RVA.text: Y entró Jesús en el templo de Dios, y echó fuera todos los que vendían y compraban en el templo, y trastornó las mesas de los cambiadores, y las sillas de los que vendían palomas;

KJV.text: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,

WEBM.text: Jesus entered into the temple of God and drove out all of those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables and the seats of those who sold the doves.

JFA.text: E disse-lhes: Está escrito: A minha casa será chamada casa de oração; vós, porém, a fazeis covil de salteadores.

RVA.text: Y les dice: Escrito está: Mi casa, casa de oración será llamada; mas vosotros cueva de ladrones la habéis hecho.

KJV.text: And said unto them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

WEBM.text: He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’Isaiah 56:7 but you have made it a den of robbers!”Jeremiah 7:11

JFA.text: E chegaram-se a ele no templo cegos e coxos, e ele os curou.

RVA.text: Entonces vinieron á él ciegos y cojos en el templo, y los sanó.

KJV.text: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.

WEBM.text: The lame and the blind came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

JFA.text: Vendo, porém, os principais sacerdotes e os escribas as maravilhas que ele fizera, e os meninos que clamavam no templo: Hosana ao Filho de Davi, indignaram-se.

RVA.text: Mas los príncipes de los sacerdotes y los escribas, viendo las maravillas que hacía, y á los muchachos aclamando en el templo y diciendo: ­Hosanna al Hijo de David! se indignaron,

KJV.text: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the son of David; they were sore displeased,

WEBM.text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children who were crying in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the son of David!” they were indignant.

JFA.text: E perguntaram-lhe: Ouves o que estes estão dizendo? Respondeu-lhes Jesus: Sim; nunca lestes: Da boca de pequeninos e de criancinhas de peito tiraste perfeito louvor?

RVA.text: Y le dijeron: ¿Oyes lo que éstos dicen? Y Jesús les dice: Sí: ¿nunca leísteis: De la boca de los niños y de los que maman perfeccionaste la alabanza?

KJV.text: And said unto him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus saith unto them, Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?

WEBM.text: And said to him, “Do you hear what these are saying?” Jesus said to them, “Yes. Did you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of children and nursing babies, you have perfected praise?’”Psalm 8:2

JFA.text: E deixando-os, saiu da cidade para Betânia, e ali passou a noite.

RVA.text: Y dejándolos, se salió fuera de la ciudad, á Bethania; y posó allí.

KJV.text: And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.

WEBM.text: He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and camped there.

JFA.text: Ora, de manhã, ao voltar à cidade, teve fome.

RVA.text: Y por la mañana volviendo á la ciudad, tuvo hambre.

KJV.text: Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.

WEBM.text: Now in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry.

JFA.text: E, avistando uma figueira à beira do caminho, dela se aproximou, e não achou nela senão folhas somente; e disse-lhe: Nunca mais nasça fruto de ti. E a figueira secou imediatamente.

RVA.text: Y viendo una higuera cerca del camino, vino á ella, y no halló nada en ella, sino hojas solamente, y le dijo: Nunca más para siempre nazca de ti fruto. Y luego se secó la higuera.

KJV.text: And when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it, Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever. And presently the fig tree withered away.

WEBM.text: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it, “Let there be no fruit from you forever!” Immediately the fig tree withered away.

JFA.text: Quando os discípulos viram isso, perguntaram admirados: Como é que imediatamente secou a figueira?

RVA.text: Y viendo esto los discípulos, maravillados decían: ¿Cómo se secó luego la higuera?

KJV.text: And when the disciples saw it, they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!

WEBM.text: When the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, “How did the fig tree immediately wither away?”

JFA.text: Jesus, porém, respondeu-lhes: Em verdade vos digo que, se tiverdes fé e não duvidardes, não só fareis o que foi feito à figueira, mas até, se a este monte disserdes: Ergue-te e lança-te no mar, isso será feito.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo Jesús les dijo: De cierto os digo, que si tuviereis fe, y no dudareis, no sólo haréis esto de la higuera: mas si á este monte dijereis: Quítate y échate en la mar, será hecho.

KJV.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.

WEBM.text: Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, if you have faith and don’t doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it would be done.

JFA.text: Tendo Jesus entrado no templo, e estando a ensinar, aproximaram-se dele os principais sacerdotes e os anciãos do povo, e perguntaram: Com que autoridade fazes tu estas coisas? e quem te deu tal autoridade?

RVA.text: Y como vino al templo, llegáronse á él cuando estaba enseñando, los príncipes de los sacerdotes y los ancianos del pueblo, diciendo. ¿Con qué autoridad haces esto? ¿y quién te dió esta autoridad?

KJV.text: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?

WEBM.text: When he had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching, and said, “By what authority do you do these things? Who gave you this authority?”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhes Jesus: Eu também vos perguntarei uma coisa; se ma disserdes, eu de igual modo vos direi com que autoridade faço estas coisas.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo Jesús, les dijo: Yo también os preguntaré una palabra, la cual si me dijereis, también yo os diré con qué autoridad hago esto.

KJV.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

WEBM.text: Jesus answered them, “I also will ask you one question, which if you tell me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

JFA.text: O batismo de João, donde era? do céu ou dos homens? Ao que eles arrazoavam entre si: Se dissermos: Do céu, ele nos dirá: Então por que não o crestes?

RVA.text: El bautismo de Juan, ¿de dónde era? ¿del cielo, ó de los hombres? Ellos entonces pensaron entre sí, diciendo: Si dijéremos, del cielo, nos dirá: ¿Por qué pues no le creísteis?

KJV.text: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?

WEBM.text: The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven or from men?” They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

JFA.text: Mas, se dissermos: Dos homens, tememos o povo; porque todos consideram João como profeta.

RVA.text: Y si dijéremos, de los hombres, tememos al pueblo; porque todos tienen á Juan por profeta.

KJV.text: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.

WEBM.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a prophet.”

JFA.text: Responderam, pois, a Jesus: Não sabemos. Disse-lhe ele: Nem eu vos digo com que autoridade faço estas coisas.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo á Jesús, dijeron: No sabemos. Y él también les dijo: Ni yo os digo con qué autoridad hago esto.

KJV.text: And they answered Jesus, and said, We cannot tell. And he said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

WEBM.text: They answered Jesus, and said, “We don’t know.” He also said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.

JFA.text: Mas que vos parece? Um homem tinha dois filhos, e, chegando- se ao primeiro, disse: Filho, vai trabalhar hoje na vinha.

RVA.text: Mas, ¿qué os parece? Un hombre tenía dos hijos, y llegando al primero, le dijo: Hijo, ve hoy á trabajar en mi viña.

KJV.text: But what think ye? A certain man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to day in my vineyard.

WEBM.text: But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first, and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’

JFA.text: Ele respondeu: Sim, senhor; mas não foi.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo él, dijo: No quiero; mas después, arrepentido, fué.

KJV.text: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.

WEBM.text: He answered, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he changed his mind, and went.

JFA.text: Chegando-se, então, ao segundo, falou-lhe de igual modo; respondeu-lhe este: Não quero; mas depois, arrependendo-se, foi.

RVA.text: Y llegando al otro, le dijo de la misma manera; y respondiendo él, dijo: Yo, señor, voy. Y no fué.

KJV.text: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, I go, sir: and went not.

WEBM.text: He came to the second, and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I’m going, sir,’ but he didn’t go.

JFA.text: Qual dos dois fez a vontade do pai? Disseram eles: O segundo. Disse-lhes Jesus: Em verdade vos digo que os publicanos e as meretrizes entram adiante de vós no reino de Deus.

RVA.text: ¿Cuál de los dos hizo la voluntad de su padre? Dicen ellos: El primero. Díceles Jesús: De cierto os digo, que los publicanos y las rameras os van delante al reino de Dios.

KJV.text: Whether of them twain did the will of his father? They say unto him, The first. Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.

WEBM.text: Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said to him, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Most certainly I tell you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering into God’s Kingdom before you.

JFA.text: Pois João veio a vós no caminho da justiça, e não lhe deste crédito, mas os publicanos e as meretrizes lho deram; vós, porém, vendo isto, nem depois vos arrependestes para crerdes nele.

RVA.text: Porque vino á vosotros Juan en camino de justicia, y no le creísteis; y los publicanos y las rameras le creyeron; y vosotros, viendo esto, no os arrepentisteis después para creerle.

KJV.text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye had seen it, repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.

WEBM.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you didn’t believe him; but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. When you saw it, you didn’t even repent afterward, that you might believe him.

JFA.text: Ouvi ainda outra parábola: Havia um homem, proprietário, que plantou uma vinha, cercou-a com uma sebe, cavou nela um lagar, e edificou uma torre; depois arrendou-a a uns lavradores e ausentou-se do país.

RVA.text: Oíd otra parábola: Fué un hombre, padre de familia, el cual plantó una viña; y la cercó de vallado, y cavó en ella un lagar, y edificó una torre, y la dió á renta á labradores, y se partió lejos.

KJV.text: Hear another parable: There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country:

WEBM.text: “Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a wine press in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.

JFA.text: E quando chegou o tempo dos frutos, enviou os seus servos aos lavradores, para receber os seus frutos.

RVA.text: Y cuando se acercó el tiempo de los frutos, envió sus siervos á los labradores, para que recibiesen sus frutos.

KJV.text: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.

WEBM.text: When the season for the fruit came near, he sent his servants to the farmers to receive his fruit.

JFA.text: E os lavradores, apoderando-se dos servos, espancaram um, mataram outro, e a outro apedrejaram.

RVA.text: Mas los labradores, tomando á los siervos, al uno hirieron, y al otro mataron, y al otro apedrearon.

KJV.text: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.

WEBM.text: The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

JFA.text: Depois enviou ainda outros servos, em maior número do que os primeiros; e fizeram-lhes o mesmo.

RVA.text: Envió de nuevo otros siervos, más que los primeros; é hicieron con ellos de la misma manera.

KJV.text: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them likewise.

WEBM.text: Again, he sent other servants more than the first; and they treated them the same way.

JFA.text: Por último enviou-lhes seu filho, dizendo: A meu filho terão respeito.

RVA.text: Y á la postre les envió su hijo, diciendo: Tendrán respeto á mi hijo.

KJV.text: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.

WEBM.text: But afterward he sent to them his son, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

JFA.text: Mas os lavradores, vendo o filho, disseram entre si: Este é o herdeiro; vinde, matemo-lo, e apoderemo-nos da sua herança.

RVA.text: Mas los labradores, viendo al hijo, dijeron entre sí: Este es el heredero; venid, matémosle, y tomemos su heredad.

KJV.text: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.

WEBM.text: But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and seize his inheritance.’

JFA.text: E, agarrando-o, lançaram-no fora da vinha e o mataram.

RVA.text: Y tomado, le echaron fuera de la viña, y le mataron.

KJV.text: And they caught him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew him.

WEBM.text: So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard, then killed him.

JFA.text: Quando, pois, vier o senhor da vinha, que fará àqueles lavradores?

RVA.text: Pues cuando viniere el señor de la viña, ¿qué hará á aquellos labradores?

KJV.text: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?

WEBM.text: When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”

JFA.text: Responderam-lhe eles: Fará perecer miseravelmente a esses maus, e arrendará a vinha a outros lavradores, que a seu tempo lhe entreguem os frutos.

RVA.text: Dícenle: á los malos destruirá miserablemente, y su viña dará á renta á otros labradores, que le paguen el fruto á sus tiempos.

KJV.text: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.

WEBM.text: They told him, “He will miserably destroy those miserable men, and will lease out the vineyard to other farmers who will give him the fruit in its season.”

JFA.text: Disse-lhes Jesus: Nunca lestes nas Escrituras: A pedra que os edificadores rejeitaram, essa foi posta como pedra angular; pelo Senhor foi feito isso, e é maravilhoso aos nossos olhos?

RVA.text: Díceles Jesús: ¿Nunca leísteis en las Escrituras: La piedra que desecharon los que edificaban, Esta fué hecha por cabeza de esquina: Por el Señor es hecho esto, Y es cosa maravillosa en nuestros ojos?

KJV.text: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

WEBM.text: Jesus said to them, “Did you never read in the Scriptures, ‘The stone which the builders rejected was made the head of the corner. This was from the Lord. It is marvelous in our eyes’?Psalm 118:22-23

JFA.text: Portanto eu vos digo que vos será tirado o reino de Deus, e será dado a um povo que dê os seus frutos.

RVA.text: Por tanto os digo, que el reino de Dios será quitado de vosotros, y será dado á gente que haga los frutos de él.

KJV.text: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.

WEBM.text: “Therefore I tell you, God’s Kingdom will be taken away from you and will be given to a nation producing its fruit.

JFA.text: E quem cair sobre esta pedra será despedaçado; mas aquele sobre quem ela cair será reduzido a pó.

RVA.text: Y el que cayere sobre esta piedra, será quebrantado; y sobre quien ella cayere, le desmenuzará.

KJV.text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

WEBM.text: He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it will fall, it will scatter him as dust.”

JFA.text: Os principais sacerdotes e os fariseus, ouvindo essas parábolas, entenderam que era deles que Jesus falava.

RVA.text: Y oyendo los príncipes de los sacerdotes y los Fariseos sus parábolas, entendieron que hablaba de ellos.

KJV.text: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.

WEBM.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he spoke about them.

JFA.text: E procuravam prendê-lo, mas temeram o povo, porquanto este o tinha por profeta.

RVA.text: Y buscando cómo echarle mano, temieron al pueblo; porque le tenían por profeta.

KJV.text: But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.

WEBM.text: When they sought to seize him, they feared the multitudes, because they considered him to be a prophet.

JFA.text: E havendo Jesus concluído todas estas palavras, disse aos seus discípulos.

RVA.text: Y acontecio que, como hubo acabado Jesús todas estas palabras, dijo á sus discípulos:

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,

WEBM.text: When Jesus had finished all these words, he said to his disciples.

JFA.text: Sabeis que daqui a dois dias é a páscoa; e o Filho do homem será entregue para ser crucificado.

RVA.text: Sabéis que dentro de dos días se hace la pascua, y el Hijo del hombre es entregado para ser crucificado.

KJV.text: Ye know that after two days is the feast of the passover, and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.

WEBM.text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified.”

JFA.text: Então os principais sacerdotes e os anciãos do povo se reuniram no pátio da casa do sumo sacerdote, o qual se chamava Caifás.

RVA.text: Entonces los príncipes de los sacerdotes, y los escribas, y los ancianos del pueblo se juntaron al patio del pontífice, el cual se llamaba Caifás;

KJV.text: Then assembled together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people, unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,

WEBM.text: Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas.

JFA.text: E deliberaram como prender Jesus a traição, e o matar.

RVA.text: Y tuvieron consejo para prender por engaño á Jesús, y matarle.

KJV.text: And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and kill him.

WEBM.text: They took counsel together that they might take Jesus by deceit and kill him.

JFA.text: Mas diziam: Não durante a festa, para que não haja tumulto entre o povo.

RVA.text: Y decían: No en el día de la fiesta, porque no se haga alboroto en el pueblo.

KJV.text: But they said, Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people.

WEBM.text: But they said, “Not during the feast, lest a riot occur among the people.”

JFA.text: Estando Jesus em Betânia, em casa de Simão, o leproso.

RVA.text: Y estando Jesús en Bethania, en casa de Simón el leproso,

KJV.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

WEBM.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper.

JFA.text: Aproximou-se dele uma mulher que trazia um vaso de alabastro cheio de bálsamo precioso, e lho derramou sobre a cabeça, estando ele reclinado à mesa.

RVA.text: Vino á él una mujer, teniendo un vaso de alabastro de unguento de gran precio, y lo derramó sobre la cabeza de él, estando sentado á la mesa.

KJV.text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat at meat.

WEBM.text: A woman came to him having an alabaster jar of very expensive ointment, and she poured it on his head as he sat at the table.

JFA.text: Quando os discípulos viram isso, indignaram-se, e disseram: Para que este disperdício?

RVA.text: Lo cual viendo sus discípulos, se enojaron, diciendo: ¿Por qué se pierde esto?

KJV.text: But when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?

WEBM.text: But when his disciples saw this, they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?"

JFA.text: Pois este bálsamo podia ser vendido por muito dinheiro, que se daria aos pobres.

RVA.text: Porque esto se podía vender por gran precio, y darse á los pobres.

KJV.text: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.

WEBM.text: "For this ointment might have been sold for much and given to the poor.”

JFA.text: Jesus, porém, percebendo isso, disse-lhes: Por que molestais esta mulher? pois praticou uma boa ação para comigo.

RVA.text: Y entendiéndolo Jesús, les dijo: ¿Por qué dais pena á esta mujer? Pues ha hecho conmigo buena obra.

KJV.text: When Jesus understood it, he said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.

WEBM.text: However, knowing this, Jesus said to them, “Why do you trouble the woman? She has done a good work for me.

JFA.text: Porquanto os pobres sempre os tendes convosco; a mim, porém, nem sempre me tendes.

RVA.text: Porque siempre tendréis pobres con vosotros, mas á mí no siempre me tendréis.

KJV.text: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.

WEBM.text: For you always have the poor with you, but you don’t always have me.

JFA.text: Ora, derramando ela este bálsamo sobre o meu corpo, fê-lo a fim de preparar-me para a minha sepultura.

RVA.text: Porque echando este unguento sobre mi cuerpo, para sepultarme lo ha hecho.

KJV.text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body, she did it for my burial.

WEBM.text: For in pouring this ointment on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

JFA.text: Em verdade vos digo que onde quer que for pregado em todo o mundo este evangelho, também o que ela fez será contado para memória sua.

RVA.text: De cierto os digo, que donde quiera que este evangelio fuere predicado en todo el mundo, también será dicho para memoria de ella, lo que ésta ha hecho.

KJV.text: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, there shall also this, that this woman hath done, be told for a memorial of her.

WEBM.text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be spoken of as a memorial of her.”

JFA.text: Então um dos doze, chamado Judas Iscariotes, foi ter com os principais sacerdotes.

RVA.text: Entonces uno de los doce, que se llamaba Judas Iscariote, fué á los príncipes de los sacerdotes,

KJV.text: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,

WEBM.text: Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests.

JFA.text: E disse: Que me quereis dar, e eu vo-lo entregarei? E eles lhe pesaram trinta moedas de prata.

RVA.text: Y les dijo: ¿Qué me queréis dar, y yo os lo entregaré? Y ellos le señalaron treinta piezas de plata.

KJV.text: And said unto them, What will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.

WEBM.text: And said, “What are you willing to give me if I deliver him to you?” So they weighed out for him thirty pieces of silver.

JFA.text: E desde então buscava ele oportunidade para o entregar.

RVA.text: Y desde entonces buscaba oportunidad para entregarle.

KJV.text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

WEBM.text: From that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

JFA.text: Ora, no primeiro dia dos pães ázimos, vieram os discípulos a Jesus, e perguntaram: Onde queres que façamos os preparativos para comeres a páscoa?

RVA.text: Y el primer día de la fiesta de los panes sin levadura, vinieron los discípulos á Jesús, diciéndole: ¿Dónde quieres que aderecemos para ti para comer la pascua?

KJV.text: Now the first day of the feast of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover?

WEBM.text: Now on the first day of unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying to him, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: Ide à cidade a um certo homem, e dizei-lhe: O Mestre diz: O meu tempo está próximo; em tua casa celebrarei a páscoa com os meus discípulos.

RVA.text: Y él dijo: Id á la ciudad á cierto hombre, y decidle: El Maestro dice: Mi tiempo está cerca; en tu casa haré la pascua con mis discípulos.

KJV.text: And he said, Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Master saith, My time is at hand; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.

WEBM.text: He said, “Go into the city to a certain person, and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is at hand. I will keep the Passover at your house with my disciples.”’”

JFA.text: E os discípulos fizeram como Jesus lhes ordenara, e prepararam a páscoa.

RVA.text: Y los discípulos hicieron como Jesús les mandó, y aderezaron la pascua.

KJV.text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them; and they made ready the passover.

WEBM.text: The disciples did as Jesus commanded them, and they prepared the Passover.

JFA.text: Ao anoitecer reclinou-se à mesa com os doze discípulos.

RVA.text: Y como fué la tarde del día, se sentó á la mesa con los doce.

KJV.text: Now when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.

WEBM.text: Now when evening had come, he was reclining at the table with the twelve disciples.

JFA.text: E, enquanto comiam, disse: Em verdade vos digo que um de vós me trairá.

RVA.text: Y comiendo ellos, dijo: De cierto os digo, que uno de vosotros me ha de entregar.

KJV.text: And as they did eat, he said, Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

WEBM.text: As they were eating, he said, “Most certainly I tell you that one of you will betray me.”

JFA.text: E eles, profundamente contristados, começaram cada um a perguntar-lhe: Porventura sou eu, Senhor?

RVA.text: Y entristecidos ellos en gran manera, comenzó cada uno de ellos á decirle: ¿Soy yo, Señor?

KJV.text: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Lord, is it I?

WEBM.text: They were exceedingly sorrowful, and each began to ask him, “It isn’t me, is it, Lord?”

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: O que mete comigo a mão no prato, esse me trairá.

RVA.text: Entonces él respondiendo, dijo: El que mete la mano conmigo en el plato, ése me ha de entregar.

KJV.text: And he answered and said, He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.

WEBM.text: He answered, “He who dipped his hand with me in the dish will betray me.

JFA.text: Em verdade o Filho do homem vai, conforme está escrito a seu respeito; mas ai daquele por quem o Filho do homem é traido! bom seria para esse homem se não houvera nascido.

RVA.text: A la verdad el Hijo del hombre va, como está escrito de él, mas ­ay de aquel hombre por quien el Hijo del hombre es entregado! bueno le fuera al tal hombre no haber nacido.

KJV.text: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man if he had not been born.

WEBM.text: The Son of Man goes even as it is written of him, but woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”

JFA.text: Também Judas, que o traía, perguntou: Porventura sou eu, Rabí? Respondeu-lhe Jesus: Tu o disseste.

RVA.text: Entonces respondiendo Judas, que le entregaba, dijo. ¿Soy yo, Maestro? Dícele: Tú lo has dicho.

KJV.text: Then Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Master, is it I? He said unto him, Thou hast said.

WEBM.text: Judas, who betrayed him, answered, “It isn’t me, is it, Rabbi?”

JFA.text: E tomando um cálice, rendeu graças e deu-lho, dizendo: Bebei dele todos.

RVA.text: Y tomando el vaso, y hechas gracias, les dió, diciendo: Bebed de él todos;

KJV.text: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, Drink ye all of it;

WEBM.text: He took the cup, gave thanks, and gave to them, saying, “All of you drink it".

JFA.text: Pois isto é o meu sangue, o sangue do pacto, o qual é derramado por muitos para remissão dos pecados.

RVA.text: Porque esto es mi sangre del nuevo pacto, la cual es derramada por muchos para remisión de los pecados.

KJV.text: For this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.

WEBM.text: For this is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many for the remission of sins.
