JFA.text: Mas digo-vos que desde agora não mais beberei deste fruto da videira até aquele dia em que convosco o beba novo, no reino de meu Pai.

RVA.text: Y os digo, que desde ahora no beberé más de este fruto de la vid, hasta aquel día, cuando lo tengo de beber nuevo con vosotros en el reino de mi Padre.

KJV.text: But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom.

WEBM.text: But I tell you that I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on, until that day when I drink it anew with you in my Father’s Kingdom.”

JFA.text: E tendo cantado um hino, saíram para o Monte das Oliveiras.

RVA.text: Y habiendo cantado el himno, salieron al monte de las Olivas.

KJV.text: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

WEBM.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

JFA.text: Então Jesus lhes disse: Todos vós esta noite vos escandalizareis de mim; pois está escrito: Ferirei o pastor, e as ovelhas do rebanho se dispersarão.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús les dice: Todos vosotros seréis escandalizados en mí esta noche; porque escrito está: Heriré al Pastor, y las ovejas de la manada serán dispersas.

KJV.text: Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.

WEBM.text: Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’Zechariah 13:7

JFA.text: Todavia, depois que eu ressurgir, irei adiante de vós para a Galiléia.

RVA.text: Mas después que haya resucitado, iré delante de vosotros á Galilea.

KJV.text: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.

WEBM.text: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”

JFA.text: Mas Pedro, respondendo, disse-lhe: Ainda que todos se escandalizem de ti, eu nunca me escandalizarei.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo Pedro, le dijo: Aunque todos sean escandalizados en ti, yo nunca seré escandalizado.

KJV.text: Peter answered and said unto him, Though all men shall be offended because of thee, yet will I never be offended.

WEBM.text: But Peter answered him, “Even if all will be made to stumble because of you, I will never be made to stumble.”

JFA.text: Disse-lhe Jesus: Em verdade te digo que esta noite, antes que o galo cante três vezes me negarás.

RVA.text: Jesús le dice: De cierto te digo que esta noche, antes que el gallo cante, me negarás tres veces.

KJV.text: Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “Most certainly I tell you that tonight, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Pedro: Ainda que me seja necessário morrer contigo, de modo algum te negarei. E o mesmo disseram todos os discípulos.

RVA.text: Dícele Pedro. Aunque me sea menester morir contigo, no te negaré. Y todos los discípulos dijeron lo mismo.

KJV.text: Peter said unto him, Though I should die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.

WEBM.text: Peter said to him, “Even if I must die with you, I will not deny you.” All of the disciples also said likewise.

JFA.text: Então foi Jesus com eles a um lugar chamado Getsêmane, e disse aos discípulos: Sentai-vos aqui, enquanto eu vou ali orar.

RVA.text: Entonces llegó Jesús con ellos á la aldea que se llama Gethsemaní, y dice á sus discípulos: Sentaos aquí, hasta que vaya allí y ore.

KJV.text: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto the disciples, Sit ye here, while I go and pray yonder.

WEBM.text: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to his disciples, “Sit here, while I go there and pray.”

JFA.text: E levando consigo Pedro e os dois filhos de Zebedeu, começou a entristecer-se e a angustiar-se.

RVA.text: Y tomando á Pedro, y á los dos hijos de Zebedeo, comenzó á entristecerse y á angustiarse en gran manera.

KJV.text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.

WEBM.text: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and severely troubled.

JFA.text: Então lhes disse: A minha alma está triste até a morte; ficai aqui e vigiai comigo.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús les dice: Mi alma está muy triste hasta la muerte; quedaos aquí, y velad conmigo.

KJV.text: Then saith he unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: tarry ye here, and watch with me.

WEBM.text: Then he said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch with me.”

JFA.text: E adiantando-se um pouco, prostrou-se com o rosto em terra e orou, dizendo: Meu Pai, se é possível, passa de mim este cálice; todavia, não seja como eu quero, mas como tu queres.

RVA.text: Y yéndose un poco más adelante, se postró sobre su rostro, orando, y diciendo: Padre mío, si es posible, pase de mí este vaso; empero no como yo quiero, sino como tú.

KJV.text: And he went a little farther, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless not as I will, but as thou wilt.

WEBM.text: He went forward a little, fell on his face, and prayed, saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass away from me; nevertheless, not what I desire, but what you desire.”

JFA.text: Voltando para os discípulos, achou-os dormindo; e disse a Pedro: Assim nem uma hora pudestes vigiar comigo?

RVA.text: Y vino á sus discípulos, y los halló durmiendo, y dijo á Pedro: ¿Así no habéis podido velar conmigo una hora?

KJV.text: And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and saith unto Peter, What, could ye not watch with me one hour?

WEBM.text: He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “What, couldn’t you watch with me for one hour?

JFA.text: Retirando-se mais uma vez, orou, dizendo: Pai meu, se este cálice não pode passar sem que eu o beba, faça-se a tua vontade.

RVA.text: Otra vez fué, segunda vez, y oró diciendo. Padre mío, si no puede este vaso pasar de mí sin que yo lo beba, hágase tu voluntad.

KJV.text: He went away again the second time, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if this cup may not pass away from me, except I drink it, thy will be done.

WEBM.text: Again, a second time he went away and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this cup can’t pass away from me unless I drink it, your desire be done.”

JFA.text: E, voltando outra vez, achou-os dormindo, porque seus olhos estavam carregados.

RVA.text: Y vino, y los halló otra vez durmiendo; porque los ojos de ellos estaban agravados.

KJV.text: And he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.

WEBM.text: He came again and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

JFA.text: Deixando-os novamente, foi orar terceira vez, repetindo as mesmas palavras.

RVA.text: Y dejándolos fuése de nuevo, y oró tercera vez, diciendo las mismas palabras.

KJV.text: And he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.

WEBM.text: He left them again, went away, and prayed a third time, saying the same words.

JFA.text: Então voltou para os discípulos e disse-lhes: Dormi agora e descansai. Eis que é chegada a hora, e o Filho do homem está sendo entregue nas mãos dos pecadores.

RVA.text: Entonces vino á sus discípulos y díceles: Dormid ya, y descansad: he aquí ha llegado la hora, y el Hijo del hombre es entregado en manos de pecadores.

KJV.text: Then cometh he to his disciples, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

WEBM.text: Then he came to his disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

JFA.text: Levantai-vos, vamo-nos; eis que é chegado aquele que me trai.

RVA.text: Levantaos, vamos: he aquí ha llegado el que me ha entregado.

KJV.text: Rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray me.

WEBM.text: Arise, let’s be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”

JFA.text: E estando ele ainda a falar, eis que veio Judas, um dos doze, e com ele grande multidão com espadas e varapaus, vinda da parte dos principais sacerdotes e dos anciãos do povo.

RVA.text: Y hablando aún él, he aquí Judas, uno de los doce, vino, y con él mucha gente con espadas y con palos, de parte de los príncipes de los sacerdotes, y de los ancianos del pueblo.

KJV.text: And while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

WEBM.text: While he was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

JFA.text: Ora, o que o traía lhes havia dado um sinal, dizendo: Aquele que eu beijar, esse é: prendei-o.

RVA.text: Y el que le entregaba les había dado señal, diciendo: Al que yo besare, aquél es: prendedle.

KJV.text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he: hold him fast.

WEBM.text: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, “Whoever I kiss, he is the one. Seize him.”

JFA.text: E logo, aproximando-se de Jesus disse: Salve, Rabi. E o beijou.

RVA.text: Y luego que llegó á Jesús, dijo: Salve, Maestro. Y le besó.

KJV.text: And forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and kissed him.

WEBM.text: Immediately he came to Jesus, and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.

JFA.text: Jesus, porém, lhe disse: Amigo, a que vieste? Nisto, aproximando-se eles, lançaram mão de Jesus, e o prenderam.

RVA.text: Y Jesús le dijo: Amigo, ¿á qué vienes? Entonces llegaron, y echaron mano á Jesús, y le prendieron.

KJV.text: And Jesus said unto him, Friend, wherefore art thou come? Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus and took him.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “Friend, why are you here?” Then they came and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

JFA.text: E eis que um dos que estavam com Jesus, estendendo a mão, puxou da espada e, ferindo o servo do sumo sacerdote, cortou-lhe uma orelha.

RVA.text: Y he aquí, uno de los que estaban con Jesús, extendiendo la mano, sacó su espada, é hiriendo á un siervo del pontífice, le quitó la oreja.

KJV.text: And, behold, one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest's, and smote off his ear.

WEBM.text: Behold, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.

JFA.text: Então Jesus lhe disse: Mete a tua espada no seu lugar; porque todos os que lançarem mão da espada, à espada morrerão.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús le dice: Vuelve tu espada á su lugar; porque todos los que tomaren espada, á espada perecerán.

KJV.text: Then said Jesus unto him, Put up again thy sword into his place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.

WEBM.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back into its place, for all those who take the sword will die by the sword.

JFA.text: Ou pensas tu que eu não poderia rogar a meu Pai, e que ele não me mandaria agora mesmo mais de doze legiões de anjos?

RVA.text: ¿Acaso piensas que no puedo ahora orar á mi Padre, y él me daría más de doce legiones de ángeles?

KJV.text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father, and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels?

WEBM.text: Or do you think that I couldn’t ask my Father, and he would even now send me more than twelve legions of angels?

JFA.text: Como, pois, se cumpririam as Escrituras, que dizem que assim convém que aconteça?

RVA.text: ¿Cómo, pues, se cumplirían las Escrituras, que así conviene que sea hecho?

KJV.text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?

WEBM.text: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that it must be so?”

JFA.text: Disse Jesus à multidão naquela hora: Saístes com espadas e varapaus para me prender, como a um salteador? Todos os dias estava eu sentado no templo ensinando, e não me prendestes.

RVA.text: En aquella hora dijo Jesús á las gentes: ¿Como á ladrón habéis salido con espadas y con palos á prenderme? Cada día me sentaba con vosotros enseñando en el templo, y no me prendisteis.

KJV.text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes, Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on me.

WEBM.text: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, “Have you come out as against a robber with swords and clubs to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me.

JFA.text: Mas tudo isso aconteceu para que se cumprissem as Escrituras dos profetas. Então todos os discípulos, deixando-o fugiram.

RVA.text: Mas todo esto se hace, para que se cumplan las Escrituras de los profetas. Entonces todos los discípulos huyeron, dejándole.

KJV.text: But all this was done, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.

WEBM.text: But all this has happened that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples left him and fled.

JFA.text: Aqueles que prenderam a Jesus levaram-no à presença do sumo sacerdote Caifás, onde os escribas e os anciãos estavam reunidos.

RVA.text: Y ellos, prendido Jesús, le llevaron á Caifás pontífice, donde los escribas y los ancianos estaban juntos.

KJV.text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.

WEBM.text: Those who had taken Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.

JFA.text: E Pedro o seguia de longe até o pátio do sumo sacerdote; e entrando, sentou-se entre os guardas, para ver o fim.

RVA.text: Mas Pedro le seguía de lejos hasta el patio del pontífice; y entrando dentro, estábase sentado con los criados, para ver el fin.

KJV.text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest's palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.

WEBM.text: But Peter followed him from a distance to the court of the high priest, and entered in and sat with the officers, to see the end.

JFA.text: Ora, os principais sacerdotes e todo o sinédrio buscavam falso testemunho contra Jesus, para poderem entregá-lo à morte.

RVA.text: Y los príncipes de los sacerdotes, y los ancianos, y todo el consejo, buscaban falso testimonio contra Jesús, para entregale á la muerte;

KJV.text: Now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;

WEBM.text: Now the chief priests, the elders, and the whole council sought false testimony against Jesus, that they might put him to death.

JFA.text: E não achavam, apesar de se apresentarem muitas testemunhas falsas. Mas por fim compareceram duas.

RVA.text: Y no lo hallaron, aunque muchos testigos falsos se llegaban; mas á la postre vinieron dos testigos falsos,

KJV.text: But found none: yea, though many false witnesses came, yet found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,

WEBM.text: And they found none. Even though many false witnesses came forward, they found none. But at last two false witnesses came forward.

JFA.text: E disseram: Este disse: Posso destruir o santuário de Deus, e reedificá-lo em três dias.

RVA.text: Que dijeron: Este dijo: Puedo derribar el templo de Dios, y en tres días reedificarlo.

KJV.text: And said, This fellow said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.

WEBM.text: And said, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.’”

JFA.text: Levantou-se então o sumo sacerdote e perguntou-lhe: Nada respondes? Que é que estes depõem contra ti?

RVA.text: Y levantándose el pontífice, le dijo: ¿No respondes nada? ¿qué testifican éstos contra ti?

KJV.text: And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?

WEBM.text: The high priest stood up and said to him, “Have you no answer? What is this that these testify against you?”

JFA.text: Jesus, porém, guardava silêncio. E o sumo sacerdote disse- lhe: Conjuro-te pelo Deus vivo que nos digas se tu és o Cristo, o Filho do Deus.

RVA.text: Mas Jesús callaba. Respondiendo el pontífice, le dijo: Te conjuro por el Dios viviente, que nos digas si eres tú el Cristo, Hijo de Dios.

KJV.text: But Jesus held his peace, And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.

WEBM.text: But Jesus stayed silent. The high priest answered him, “I adjure you by the living God that you tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God.”

JFA.text: Repondeu-lhe Jesus: É como disseste; contudo vos digo que vereis em breve o Filho do homem assentado à direita do Poder, e vindo sobre as nuvens do céu.

RVA.text: Jesús le dijo: Tú lo has dicho: y aun os digo, que desde ahora habéis de ver al Hijo de los hombres sentado á la diestra de la potencia de Dios, y que viene en las nubes del cielo.

KJV.text: Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.

WEBM.text: Jesus said to him, “You have said so. Nevertheless, I tell you, after this you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of the sky.”

JFA.text: Então o sumo sacerdote rasgou as suas vestes, dizendo: Blasfemou; para que precisamos ainda de testemunhas? Eis que agora acabais de ouvir a sua blasfêmia.

RVA.text: Entonces el pontífice rasgó sus vestidos, diciendo: Blasfemado ha: ¿qué más necesidad tenemos de testigos? He aquí, ahora habéis oído su blasfemia.

KJV.text: Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.

WEBM.text: Then the high priest tore his clothing, saying, “He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Behold, now you have heard his blasphemy."

JFA.text: Que vos parece? Responderam eles: É réu de morte.

RVA.text: ¿Qué os parece? Y respondiendo ellos, dijeron: Culpado es de muerte.

KJV.text: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

WEBM.text: What do you think?” They answered, “He is worthy of death!”

JFA.text: Então uns lhe cuspiram no rosto e lhe deram socos.

RVA.text: Entonces le escupieron en el rostro, y le dieron de bofetadas; y otros le herían con mojicones,

KJV.text: Then did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smote him with the palms of their hands,

WEBM.text: Then they spat in his face and beat him with their fists, and some slapped him.

JFA.text: E outros o esbofetearam, dizendo: Profetiza-nos, ó Cristo, quem foi que te bateu?

RVA.text: Diciendo: Profetízanos tú, Cristo, quién es el que te ha herido.

KJV.text: Saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?

WEBM.text: Saying, “Prophesy to us, you Christ! Who hit you?”

JFA.text: Ora, Pedro estava sentado fora, no pátio; e aproximou-se dele uma criada, que disse: Tu também estavas com Jesus, o galileu.

RVA.text: Y Pedro estaba sentado fuera en el patio: y se llegó á él una criada, diciendo: Y tú con Jesús el Galileo estabas.

KJV.text: Now Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.

WEBM.text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the court, and a maid came to him, saying, “You were also with Jesus, the Galilean!”

JFA.text: Mas ele negou diante de todos, dizendo: Não sei o que dizes.

RVA.text: Mas él negó delante de todos, diciendo: No sé lo que dices.

KJV.text: But he denied before them all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.

WEBM.text: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I don’t know what you are talking about.”

JFA.text: E saindo ele para o vestíbulo, outra criada o viu, e disse aos que ali estavam: Este também estava com Jesus, o nazareno.

RVA.text: Y saliendo él á la puerta, le vió otra, y dijo á los que estaban allí: También éste estaba con Jesús Nazareno.

KJV.text: And when he was gone out into the porch, another maid saw him, and said unto them that were there, This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth.

WEBM.text: When he had gone out onto the porch, someone else saw him and said to those who were there, “This man also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”

JFA.text: E ele negou outra vez, e com juramento: Não conheço tal homem.

RVA.text: Y nego otra vez con juramento: No conozco al hombre.

KJV.text: And again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.

WEBM.text: Again he denied it with an oath, “I don’t know the man.”

JFA.text: E daí a pouco, aproximando-se os que ali estavam, disseram a Pedro: Certamente tu também és um deles pois a tua fala te denuncia.

RVA.text: Y un poco después llegaron los que estaban por allí, y dijeron á Pedro: Verdaderamente también tú eres de ellos, porque aun tu habla te hace manifiesto.

KJV.text: And after a while came unto him they that stood by, and said to Peter, Surely thou also art one of them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.

WEBM.text: After a little while those who stood by came and said to Peter, “Surely you are also one of them, for your speech makes you known.”

JFA.text: Então começou ele a praguejar e a jurar, dizendo: Não conheço esse homem. E imediatamente o galo cantou.

RVA.text: Entonces comienzó á hacer imprecaciones, y á jurar, diciendo: No conozco al hombre. Y el gallo cantó luego.

KJV.text: Then began he to curse and to swear, saying, I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.

WEBM.text: Then he began to curse and to swear, “I don’t know the man!” Immediately the rooster crowed.

JFA.text: E Pedro lembrou-se do que dissera Jesus: Antes que o galo cante, três vezes me negarás. E, saindo dali, chorou amargamente.

RVA.text: Pedro se acordó de la palabra de Jesús que le había dicho: “Antes que cante el gallo, tú me negarás tres veces”. Y saliendo fuera, lloró amargamente.

KJV.text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.

WEBM.text: Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said to him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” Then he went out and wept bitterly.

JFA.text: Ora, chegada a manhã, todos os principais sacerdotes e os anciãos do povo entraram em conselho contra Jesus, para o matarem.

RVA.text: Y venida la mañana, entraron en consejo todos los príncipes de los sacerdotes, y los ancianos del pueblo, contra Jesús, para entregarle á muerte.

KJV.text: When the morning was come, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:

WEBM.text: Now when morning had come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death.

JFA.text: E, maniatando-o, levaram-no e o entregaram a Pilatos, o governador.

RVA.text: Y le llevaron atado, y le entregaron á Poncio Pilato presidente.

KJV.text: And when they had bound him, they led him away, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.

WEBM.text: They bound him, led him away, and delivered him up to Pontius Pilate, the governor.

JFA.text: Então Judas, aquele que o traíra, vendo que Jesus fora condenado, devolveu, compungido, as trinta moedas de prata aos anciãos, dizendo.

RVA.text: Entonces Judas, el que le había entregado, viendo que era condenado, volvió arrepentido las treinta piezas de plata á los príncipes de los sacerdotes y á los ancianos,

KJV.text: Then Judas, which had betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

WEBM.text: Then Judas, who betrayed him, when he saw that Jesus was condemned, felt remorse, and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders.

JFA.text: Pequei, traindo o sangue inocente. Responderam eles: Que nos importa? Seja isto lá contigo.

RVA.text: Diciendo: Yo he pecado entregando la sangre inocente. Mas ellos dijeron: ¿Qué se nos da á nosotros? Viéras lo tú.

KJV.text: Saying, I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood. And they said, What is that to us? see thou to that.

WEBM.text: Saying, “I have sinned in that I betrayed innocent blood.” But they said, “What is that to us? You see to it.”

JFA.text: E tendo ele atirado para dentro do santuário as moedas de prata, retirou-se, e foi enforcar-se.

RVA.text: Y arrojando las piezas de plata en el templo, partióse; y fué, y se ahorcó.

KJV.text: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.

WEBM.text: He threw down the pieces of silver in the sanctuary and departed. Then he went away and hanged himself.

JFA.text: Os principais sacerdotes, pois, tomaram as moedas de prata, e disseram: Não é lícito metê-las no cofre das ofertas, porque é preço de sangue.

RVA.text: Y los príncipes de los sacerdotes, tomando las piezas de plata, dijeron: No es lícito echarlas en el tesoro de los dones, porque es precio de sangre.

KJV.text: And the chief priests took the silver pieces, and said, It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.

WEBM.text: The chief priests took the pieces of silver and said, “It’s not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood.”

JFA.text: E, tendo deliberado em conselho, compraram com elas o campo do oleiro, para servir de cemitério para os estrangeiros.

RVA.text: Mas habido consejo, compraron con ellas el campo del alfarero, por sepultura para los extranjeros.

KJV.text: And they took counsel, and bought with them the potter's field, to bury strangers in.

WEBM.text: They took counsel, and bought the potter’s field with them to bury strangers in.

JFA.text: Por isso tem sido chamado aquele campo, até o dia de hoje, Campo de Sangue.

RVA.text: Por lo cual fué llamado aquel campo, Campo de sangre, hasta el día de hoy.

KJV.text: Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.

WEBM.text: Therefore that field has been called “The Field of Blood” to this day.

JFA.text: Cumpriu-se, então, o que foi dito pelo profeta Jeremias: Tomaram as trinta moedas de prata, preço do que foi avaliado, a quem certos filhos de Israel avaliaram.

RVA.text: Entonces se cumplió lo que fué dicho por el profeta Jeremías, que dijo: Y tomaron las treinta piezas de plata, precio del apreciado, que fué apreciado por los hijos de Israel;

KJV.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was valued, whom they of the children of Israel did value;

WEBM.text: Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying: “They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him upon whom a price had been set, whom some of the children of Israel priced.

JFA.text: E deram-nas pelo campo do oleiro, assim como me ordenou o Senhor.

RVA.text: Y las dieron para el campo del alfarero, como me ordenó el Señor.

KJV.text: And gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord appointed me.

WEBM.text: And they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”Zechariah 11:12-13; Jeremiah 19:1-13; 32:6-9

JFA.text: Jesus, pois, ficou em pé diante do governador; e este lhe perguntou: És tu o rei dos judeus? Respondeu-lhe Jesus: É como dizes.

RVA.text: Y Jesús estuvo delante del presidente; y el presidente le preguntó, diciendo: ¿Eres tú el Rey de los judíos? Y Jesús le dijo: Tú lo dices.

KJV.text: And Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And Jesus said unto him, Thou sayest.

WEBM.text: Now Jesus stood before the governor; and the governor asked him, saying, “Are you the King of the Jews?” Jesus said to him, “So you say.”

JFA.text: Mas ao ser acusado pelos principais sacerdotes e pelos anciãos, nada respondeu.

RVA.text: Y siendo acusado por los príncipes de los sacerdotes, y por los ancianos, nada respondió.

KJV.text: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.

WEBM.text: When he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.

JFA.text: Perguntou-lhe então Pilatos: Não ouves quantas coisas testificam contra ti?

RVA.text: Pilato entonces le dice: ¿No oyes cuántas cosas testifican contra tí?

KJV.text: Then said Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?

WEBM.text: Then Pilate said to him, “Don’t you hear how many things they testify against you?”

JFA.text: E Jesus não lhe respondeu a uma pergunta sequer; de modo que o governador muito se admirava.

RVA.text: Y no le respondió ni una palabra; de tal manera que el presidente se maravillaba mucho,

KJV.text: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.

WEBM.text: He gave him no answer, not even one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.

JFA.text: Ora, por ocasião da festa costumava o governador soltar um preso, escolhendo o povo aquele que quisesse.

RVA.text: Y en el día de la fiesta acostumbraba el presidente soltar al pueblo un preso, cual quisiesen.

KJV.text: Now at that feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.

WEBM.text: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to release to the multitude one prisoner whom they desired.

JFA.text: Nesse tempo tinham um preso notório, chamado Barrabás.

RVA.text: Y tenían entonces un preso famoso que se llamaba Barrabás.

KJV.text: And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.

WEBM.text: They had then a notable prisoner called Barabbas.

JFA.text: Portanto, estando o povo reunido, perguntou-lhe Pilatos: Qual quereis que vos solte? Barrabás, ou Jesus, chamado o Cristo?

RVA.text: Y juntos ellos, les dijo Pilato; ¿Cuál queréis que os suelte? ¿á Barrabás ó á Jesús que se dice el Cristo?

KJV.text: Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye that I release unto you? Barabbas, or Jesus which is called Christ?

WEBM.text: When therefore they were gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”

JFA.text: Pois sabia que por inveja o haviam entregado.

RVA.text: Porque sabía que por envidia le habían entregado.

KJV.text: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.

WEBM.text: For he knew that because of envy they had delivered him up.

JFA.text: E estando ele assentado no tribunal, sua mulher mandou dizer-lhe: Não te envolvas na questão desse justo, porque muito sofri hoje em sonho por causa dele.

RVA.text: Y estando él sentado en el tribunal, su mujer envió á él, diciendo: No tengas que ver con aquel justo; porque hoy he padecido muchas cosas en sueños por causa de él.

KJV.text: When he was set down on the judgment seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that just man: for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.

WEBM.text: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, “Have nothing to do with that righteous man, for I have suffered many things today in a dream because of him.”

JFA.text: Mas os principais sacerdotes e os anciãos persuadiram as multidões a que pedissem Barrabás e fizessem morrer Jesus.

RVA.text: Mas los príncipes de los sacerdotes y los ancianos, persuadieron al pueblo que pidiese á Barrabás, y á Jesús matase.

KJV.text: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.

WEBM.text: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes to ask for Barabbas and destroy Jesus.

JFA.text: O governador, pois, perguntou-lhes: Qual dos dois quereis que eu vos solte? E disseram: Barrabás.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo el presidente les dijo: ¿Cuál de los dos queréis que os suelte? Y ellos dijeron: á Barrabás.

KJV.text: The governor answered and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you? They said, Barabbas.

WEBM.text: But the governor answered them, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” They said, “Barabbas!”

JFA.text: Tornou-lhes Pilatos: Que farei então de Jesus, que se chama Cristo? Disseram todos: Seja crucificado.

RVA.text: Pilato les dijo: ¿Qué pues haré de Jesús que se dice el Cristo? Dícenle todos: Sea crucificado.

KJV.text: Pilate saith unto them, What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ? They all say unto him, Let him be crucified.

WEBM.text: Pilate said to them, “What then shall I do to Jesus who is called Christ?” They all said to him, “Let him be crucified!”

JFA.text: Pilatos, porém, disse: Pois que mal fez ele? Mas eles clamavam ainda mais: Seja crucificado.

RVA.text: Y el presidente les dijo: Pues ¿qué mal ha hecho? Mas ellos gritaban más, diciendo: Sea crucificado.

KJV.text: And the governor said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more, saying, Let him be crucified.

WEBM.text: But the governor said, “Why? What evil has he done?” But they cried out exceedingly, saying, “Let him be crucified!”

JFA.text: Ao ver Pilatos que nada conseguia, mas pelo contrário que o tumulto aumentava, mandando trazer água, lavou as mãos diante da multidão, dizendo: Sou inocente do sangue deste homem; seja isso lá convosco.

RVA.text: Y viendo Pilato que nada adelantaba, antes se hacía más alboroto, tomando agua se lavó las manos delante del pueblo, diciendo: Inocente soy yo de la sangre de este justo veréis lo vosotros.

KJV.text: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing, but that rather a tumult was made, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just person: see ye to it.

WEBM.text: So when Pilate saw that nothing was being gained, but rather that a disturbance was starting, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this righteous person. You see to it.”

JFA.text: E todo o povo respondeu: O seu sangue caia sobre nós e sobre nossos filhos.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo todo el pueblo, dijo: Su sangre sea sobre nosotros, y sobre nuestros hijos.

KJV.text: Then answered all the people, and said, His blood be on us, and on our children.

WEBM.text: All the people answered, “May his blood be on us and on our children!”

JFA.text: Então lhes soltou Barrabás; mas a Jesus mandou açoitar, e o entregou para ser crucificado.

RVA.text: Entonces les soltó á Barrabás: y habiendo azotado á Jesús, le entregó para ser crucificado.

KJV.text: Then released he Barabbas unto them: and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered him to be crucified.

WEBM.text: Then he released Barabbas to them, but Jesus he flogged and delivered to be crucified.

JFA.text: Nisso os soldados do governador levaram Jesus ao pretório, e reuniram em torno dele toda a corte.

RVA.text: Entonces los soldados del presidente llevaron á Jesús al pretorio, y juntaron á él toda la cuadrilla;

KJV.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto him the whole band of soldiers.

WEBM.text: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole garrison together against him.

JFA.text: E, despindo-o, vestiram-lhe um manto escarlate.

RVA.text: Y desnudándole, le echaron encima un manto de grana;

KJV.text: And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.

WEBM.text: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him.

JFA.text: E tecendo uma coroa de espinhos, puseram-lha na cabeça, e na mão direita uma cana, e ajoelhando-se diante dele, o escarneciam, dizendo: Salve, rei dos judeus!

RVA.text: Y pusieron sobre su cabeza una corona tejida de espinas, y una caña en su mano derecha; é hincando la rodilla delante de él, le burlaban, diciendo: ­Salve, Rey de los Judíos!

KJV.text: And when they had platted a crown of thorns, they put it upon his head, and a reed in his right hand: and they bowed the knee before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!

WEBM.text: They braided a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled down before him and mocked him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”

JFA.text: E, cuspindo nele, tiraram-lhe a cana, e davam-lhe com ela na cabeça.

RVA.text: Y escupiendo en él, tomaron la caña, y le herían en la cabeza.

KJV.text: And they spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.

WEBM.text: They spat on him, and took the reed and struck him on the head.

JFA.text: Depois de o terem escarnecido, despiram-lhe o manto, puseram-lhe as suas vestes, e levaram-no para ser crucificado.

RVA.text: Y después que le hubieron escarnecido, le desnudaron el manto, y le vistieron de sus vestidos, y le llevaron para crucificarle.

KJV.text: And after that they had mocked him, they took the robe off from him, and put his own raiment on him, and led him away to crucify him.

WEBM.text: When they had mocked him, they took the robe off him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.

JFA.text: Ao saírem, encontraram um homem cireneu, chamado Simão, a quem obrigaram a levar a cruz de Jesus.

RVA.text: Y saliendo, hallaron á un Cireneo, que se llamaba Simón: á éste cargaron para que llevase su cruz.

KJV.text: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name: him they compelled to bear his cross.

WEBM.text: As they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name, and they compelled him to go with them, that he might carry his cross.

JFA.text: Quando chegaram ao lugar chamado Gólgota, que quer dizer, lugar da Caveira.

RVA.text: Y como llegaron al lugar que se llamaba Gólgotha, que es dicho, El lugar de la calavera,

KJV.text: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,

WEBM.text: When they came to a place called “Golgotha”, that is to say, “The place of a skull,”

JFA.text: Deram-lhe a beber vinho misturado com fel; mas ele, provando-o, não quis beber.

RVA.text: Le dieron á beber vinagre mezclado con hiel: y gustando, no quiso beber lo

KJV.text: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted thereof, he would not drink.

WEBM.text: They gave him sour wine to drink mixed with gall. When he had tasted it, he would not drink.

JFA.text: Então, depois de o crucificarem, repartiram as vestes dele, lançando sortes, para que se cumprisse o que foi dito pelo profeta: Repartiram entre si as minhas vestes, e sobre a minha túnica deitaram sortes.

RVA.text: Y después que le hubieron crucificado, repartieron sus vestidos, echando suertes: para que se cumpliese lo que fué dicho por el profeta: Se repartieron mis vestidos, y sobre mi ropa echaron suertes.

KJV.text: And they crucified him, and parted his garments, casting lots: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.

WEBM.text: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots.

JFA.text: E, sentados, ali o guardavam.

RVA.text: Y sentados le guardaban allí.

KJV.text: And sitting down they watched him there;

WEBM.text: And they sat and watched him there.

JFA.text: Puseram-lhe por cima da cabeça a sua acusação escrita: ESTE É JESUS, O REI DOS JUDEUS.

RVA.text: Y pusieron sobre su cabeza su causa escrita: ESTE ES JESUS EL REY DE LOS JUDIOS.

KJV.text: And set up over his head his accusation written, This Is Jesus The King Of The Jews.

WEBM.text: They set up over his head the accusation against him written, “THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

JFA.text: Então foram crucificados com ele dois salteadores, um à direita, e outro à esquerda.

RVA.text: Entonces crucificaron con él dos ladrones, uno á la derecha, y otro á la izquierda.

KJV.text: Then were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.

WEBM.text: Then there were two robbers crucified with him, one on his right hand and one on the left.

JFA.text: E os que iam passando blasfemavam dele, meneando a cabeça.

RVA.text: Y los que pasaban, le decían injurias, meneando sus cabezas,

KJV.text: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,

WEBM.text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads.

JFA.text: E dizendo: Tu, que destróis o santuário e em três dias o reedificas, salva-te a ti mesmo; se és Filho de Deus, desce da cruz.

RVA.text: Y diciendo: Tú, el que derribas el templo, y en tres días lo reedificas, sálvate á ti mismo: si eres Hijo de Dios, desciende de la cruz.

KJV.text: And saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days, save thyself. If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.

WEBM.text: And saying, “You who destroy the temple and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”

JFA.text: De igual modo também os principais sacerdotes, com os escribas e anciãos, escarnecendo, diziam.

RVA.text: De esta manera también los príncipes de los sacerdotes, escarneciendo con los escribas y los Fariseos y los ancianos, decían:

KJV.text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him, with the scribes and elders, said,

WEBM.text: Likewise the chief priests also mocking with the scribes, the Pharisees, and the elders, said.

JFA.text: A outros salvou; a si mesmo não pode salvar. Rei de Israel é ele; desça agora da cruz, e creremos nele.

RVA.text: á otros salvó, á sí mismo no puede salvar: si es el Rey de Israel, descienda ahora de la cruz, y creeremos en él.

KJV.text: He saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.

WEBM.text: “He saved others, but he can’t save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him."

JFA.text: Confiou em Deus, livre-o ele agora, se lhe quer bem; porque disse: Sou Filho de Deus.

RVA.text: Confió en Dios: líbrele ahora si le quiere: porque ha dicho: Soy Hijo de Dios.

KJV.text: He trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.

WEBM.text: He trusts in God. Let God deliver him now, if he wants him; for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”

JFA.text: O mesmo lhe lançaram em rosto também os salteadores que com ele foram crucificados.

RVA.text: Lo mismo también le zaherían los ladrones que estaban crucificados con él.

KJV.text: The thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.

WEBM.text: The robbers also who were crucified with him cast on him the same reproach.

JFA.text: E, desde a hora sexta, houve trevas sobre toda a terra, até a hora nona.

RVA.text: Y desde la hora de sexta fueron tinieblas sobre toda la tierra hasta la hora de nona.

KJV.text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.

WEBM.text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

JFA.text: Alguns dos que ali estavam, ouvindo isso, diziam: Ele chama por Elias.

RVA.text: Y algunos de los que estaban allí, oyéndolo, decían: A Elías llama éste.

KJV.text: Some of them that stood there, when they heard that, said, This man calleth for Elias.

WEBM.text: Some of them who stood there, when they heard it, said, “This man is calling Elijah.”

JFA.text: E logo correu um deles, tomou uma esponja, ensopou-a em vinagre e, pondo-a numa cana, dava-lhe de beber.

RVA.text: Y luego, corriendo uno de ellos, tomó una esponja, y la hinchió de vinagre, y poniéndola en una caña, dábale de beber.

KJV.text: And straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.

WEBM.text: Immediately one of them ran and took a sponge, filled it with vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave him a drink.

JFA.text: Os outros, porém, disseram: Deixa, vejamos se Elias vem salvá-lo.

RVA.text: Y los otros decían: Deja, veamos si viene Elías á librarle.

KJV.text: The rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.

WEBM.text: The rest said, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to save him.”

JFA.text: De novo bradou Jesus com grande voz, e entregou o espírito.

RVA.text: Mas Jesús, habiendo otra vez exclamado con grande voz, dió el espíritu.

KJV.text: Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.

WEBM.text: Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up his spirit.

JFA.text: E eis que o véu do santuário se rasgou em dois, de alto a baixo; a terra tremeu, as pedras se fenderam.

RVA.text: Y he aquí, el velo del templo se rompió en dos, de alto á bajo: y la tierra tembló, y las piedras se hendieron;

KJV.text: And, behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;

WEBM.text: Behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom. The earth quaked and the rocks were split.

JFA.text: Os sepulcros se abriram, e muitos corpos de santos que tinham dormido foram ressuscitados.

RVA.text: Y abriéronse los sepulcros, y muchos cuerpos de santos que habían dormido, se levantaron;

KJV.text: And the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,

WEBM.text: The tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised.

JFA.text: E, saindo dos sepulcros, depois da ressurreição dele, entraram na cidade santa, e apareceram a muitos.

RVA.text: Y salidos de los sepulcros, después de su resurrección, vinieron á la santa ciudad, y aparecieron á muchos.

KJV.text: And came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.

WEBM.text: And coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, they entered into the holy city and appeared to many.

JFA.text: Ora, o centurião e os que com ele guardavam Jesus, vendo o terremoto e as coisas que aconteciam, tiveram grande temor, e disseram: Verdadeiramente este era filho de Deus.

RVA.text: Y el centurión, y los que estaban con él guardando á Jesús, visto el terremoto, y las cosas que habían sido hechas, temieron en gran manera, diciendo: Verdaderamente Hijo de Dios era éste.

KJV.text: Now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.

WEBM.text: Now the centurion and those who were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things that were done, were terrified, saying, “Truly this was the Son of God!”

JFA.text: Também estavam ali, olhando de longe, muitas mulheres que tinham seguido Jesus desde a Galiléia para o ouvir.

RVA.text: Y estaban allí muchas mujeres mirando de lejos, las cuales habían seguido de Galilea á Jesús, sirviéndole:

KJV.text: And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:

WEBM.text: Many women were there watching from afar, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, serving him.

JFA.text: Entre as quais se achavam Maria Madalena, Maria, mãe de Tiago e de José, e a mãe dos filhos de Zebedeu.

RVA.text: Entre las cuales estaban María Magdalena, y María la madre de Jacobo y de José, y la madre de los hijos de Zebedeo.

KJV.text: Among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedees children.

WEBM.text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

JFA.text: Ao cair da tarde, veio um homem rico de Arimatéia, chamado José, que também era discípulo de Jesus.

RVA.text: Y como fué la tarde del día, vino un hombre rico de Arimatea, llamado José, el cual también había sido discípulo de Jesús.

KJV.text: When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathaea, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus' disciple:

WEBM.text: When evening had come, a rich man from Arimathaea named Joseph, who himself was also Jesus’ disciple, came.

JFA.text: Esse foi a Pilatos e pediu o corpo de Jesus. Então Pilatos mandou que lhe fosse entregue.

RVA.text: Este llegó á Pilato, y pidió el cuerpo de Jesús: entonces Pilato mandó que se le diese el cuerpo.

KJV.text: He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

WEBM.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given up.

JFA.text: E José, tomando o corpo, envolveu-o num pano limpo, de linho.

RVA.text: Y tomando José el cuerpo, lo envolvió en una sábana limpia,

KJV.text: And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

WEBM.text: Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth.

JFA.text: E depositou-o no seu sepulcro novo, que havia aberto em rocha; e, rodando uma grande pedra para a porta do sepulcro, retirou- se.

RVA.text: Y lo puso en su sepulcro nuevo, que había labrado en la peña: y revuelta una grande piedra á la puerta del sepulcro, se fué.

KJV.text: And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.

WEBM.text: And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut out in the rock. Then he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb, and departed.

JFA.text: Mas achavam-se ali Maria Madalena e a outra Maria, sentadas defronte do sepulcro.

RVA.text: Y estaban allí María Magdalena, y la otra María, sentadas delante del sepulcro.

KJV.text: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.

WEBM.text: Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.

JFA.text: No dia seguinte, isto é, o dia depois da preparação, reuniram-se os principais sacerdotes e os fariseus perante Pilatos.

RVA.text: Y el siguiente día, que es después de la preparación, se juntaron los príncipes de los sacerdotes y los Fariseos á Pilato,

KJV.text: Now the next day, that followed the day of the preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate,

WEBM.text: Now on the next day, which was the day after the Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together to Pilate.

JFA.text: E disseram: Senhor, lembramo-nos de que aquele embusteiro, quando ainda vivo, afirmou: Depois de três dias ressurgirei.

RVA.text: Diciendo: Señor, nos acordamos que aquel engañador dijo, viviendo aún: Después de tres días resucitaré.

KJV.text: Saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I will rise again.

WEBM.text: Saying, “Sir, we remember what that deceiver said while he was still alive: ‘After three days I will rise again.’

JFA.text: Manda, pois, que o sepulcro seja guardado com segurança até o terceiro dia; para não suceder que, vindo os discípulos, o furtem e digam ao povo: Ressurgiu dos mortos; e assim o último embuste será pior do que o primeiro.

RVA.text: Manda, pues, que se asegure el sepulcro hasta el día tercero; porque no vengan sus discípulos de noche, y le hurten, y digan al pueblo: Resucitó de los muertos. Y será el postrer error peor que el primero.

KJV.text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so the last error shall be worse than the first.

WEBM.text: Command therefore that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples come at night and steal him away, and tell the people, ‘He is risen from the dead;’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”

JFA.text: Disse-lhes Pilatos: Tendes uma guarda; ide, tornai-o seguro, como entendeis.

RVA.text: Y Pilato les dijo: Tenéis una guardia: id, aseguradlo como sabéis.

KJV.text: Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, make it as sure as ye can.

WEBM.text: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard. Go, make it as secure as you can.”

JFA.text: Foram, pois, e tornaram seguro o sepulcro, selando a pedra, e deixando ali a guarda.

RVA.text: Y yendo ellos, aseguraron el sepulcro, sellando la piedra, con la guardia.

KJV.text: So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting a watch.

WEBM.text: So they went with the guard and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone.

JFA.text: E eis que houvera um grande terremoto; pois um anjo do Senhor descera do céu e, chegando-se, removera a pedra e estava sentado sobre ela.

RVA.text: Y he aquí, fué hecho un gran terremoto: porque el ángel del Señor, descendiendo del cielo y llegando, había revuelto la piedra, y estaba sentado sobre ella.

KJV.text: And, behold, there was a great earthquake: for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.

WEBM.text: Behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from the sky and came and rolled away the stone from the door and sat on it.

JFA.text: O seu aspecto era como um relâmpago, e as suas vestes brancas como a neve.

RVA.text: Y su aspecto era como un relámpago, y su vestido blanco como la nieve.

KJV.text: His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:

WEBM.text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing white as snow.

JFA.text: E de medo dele tremeram os guardas, e ficaram como mortos.

RVA.text: Y de miedo de él los guardas se asombraron, y fueron vueltos como muertos.

KJV.text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake, and became as dead men.

WEBM.text: For fear of him, the guards shook, and became like dead men.

JFA.text: Mas o anjo disse às mulheres: Não temais vós; pois eu sei que buscais a Jesus, que foi crucificado.

RVA.text: Y respondiendo el ángel, dijo á las mujeres: No temáis vosotras; porque yo sé que buscáis á Jesús, que fué crucificado.

KJV.text: And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye: for I know that ye seek Jesus, which was crucified.

WEBM.text: The angel answered the women, “Don’t be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus, who has been crucified.

JFA.text: Não está aqui, porque ressurgiu, como ele disse. Vinde, vede o lugar onde jazia.

RVA.text: No está aquí; porque ha resucitado, como dijo. Venid, ved el lugar donde fué puesto el Señor.

KJV.text: He is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.

WEBM.text: He is not here, for he has risen, just like he said. Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.

JFA.text: E ide depressa, e dizei aos seus discípulos que ressurgiu dos mortos; e eis que vai adiante de vós para a Galiléia; ali o vereis. Eis que vo-lo tenho dito.

RVA.text: E id presto, decid á sus discípulos que ha resucitado de los muertos: y he aquí va delante de vosotros á Galilea; allí le veréis; he aquí, os lo he dicho.

KJV.text: And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.

WEBM.text: Go quickly and tell his disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.’ Behold, I have told you.”

JFA.text: E, partindo elas pressurosamente do sepulcro, com temor e grande alegria, correram a anunciá-lo aos discípulos.

RVA.text: Entonces ellas, saliendo del sepulcro con temor y gran gozo, fueron corriendo á dar las nuevas á sus discípulos. Y mientras iban á dar las nuevas á sus discípulos,

KJV.text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.

WEBM.text: They departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring his disciples word.

JFA.text: E eis que Jesus lhes veio ao encontro, dizendo: Salve. E elas, aproximando-se, abraçaram-lhe os pés, e o adoraram.

RVA.text: He aquí, Jesús les sale al encuentro, diciendo: Salve. Y ellas se llegaron y abrazaron sus pies, y le adoraron.

KJV.text: And as they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, All hail. And they came and held him by the feet, and worshipped him.

WEBM.text: As they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” They came and took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.

JFA.text: Então lhes disse Jesus: Não temais; ide dizer a meus irmãos que vão para a Galiléia; ali me verão.

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús les dice: No temáis: id, dad las nuevas á mis hermanos, para que vayan á Galilea, y allí me verán.

KJV.text: Then said Jesus unto them, Be not afraid: go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me.

WEBM.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t be afraid. Go tell my brothers that they should go into Galilee, and there they will see me.”

JFA.text: Ora, enquanto elas iam, eis que alguns da guarda foram à cidade, e contaram aos principais sacerdotes tudo quanto havia acontecido.

RVA.text: Y yendo ellas, he aquí unos de la guardia vinieron á la ciudad, y dieron aviso á los príncipes de los sacerdotes de todas las cosas que habían acontecido.

KJV.text: Now when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done.

WEBM.text: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city and told the chief priests all the things that had happened.

JFA.text: E congregados eles com os anciãos e tendo consultado entre si, deram muito dinheiro aos soldados.

RVA.text: Y juntados con los ancianos, y habido consejo, dieron mucho dinero á los soldados,

KJV.text: And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,

WEBM.text: When they were assembled with the elders and had taken counsel, they gave a large amount of silver to the soldiers.

JFA.text: E ordenaram-lhes que dissessem: Vieram de noite os seus discípulos e, estando nós dormindo, furtaram-no.

RVA.text: Diciendo: Decid: Sus discípulos vinieron de noche, y le hurtaron, durmiendo nosotros.

KJV.text: Saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.

WEBM.text: Saying, “Say that his disciples came by night and stole him away while we slept.

JFA.text: E, se isto chegar aos ouvidos do governador, nós o persuadiremos, e vos livraremos de cuidado.

RVA.text: Y si esto fuere oído del presidente, nosotros le persuadiremos, y os haremos seguros.

KJV.text: And if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.

WEBM.text: If this comes to the governor’s ears, we will persuade him and make you free of worry.”

JFA.text: Então eles, tendo recebido o dinheiro, fizeram como foram instruídos. E essa história tem-se divulgado entre os judeus até o dia de hoje.

RVA.text: Y ellos, tomando el dinero, hicieron como estaban instruídos: y este dicho fué divulgado entre los Judíos hasta el día de hoy.

KJV.text: So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.

WEBM.text: So they took the money and did as they were told. This saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continues until today.

JFA.text: Partiram, pois, os onze discípulos para a Galiléia, para o monte onde Jesus lhes designara.

RVA.text: Mas los once discípulos se fueron á Galilea, al monte donde Jesús les había ordenado.

KJV.text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them.

WEBM.text: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had sent them.

JFA.text: Quando o viram, o adoraram; mas alguns duvidaram.

RVA.text: Y como le vieron, le adoraron: mas algunos dudaban.

KJV.text: And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.

WEBM.text: When they saw him, they bowed down to him; but some doubted.

JFA.text: Ora, Acabe fez saber a Jezabel tudo quanto Elias havia feito, e como matara à espada todos os profetas.

RVA.text: Y Achâb dió la nueva á Jezabel de todo lo que Elías había hecho, de como había muerto á cuchillo á todos los profetas.

KJV.text: And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and withal how he had slain all the prophets with the sword.

WEBM.text: Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.

JFA.text: Então Jezabel mandou um mensageiro a Elias, a dizer-lhe: Assim me façam os deuses, e outro tanto, se até amanhã a estas horas eu não fizer a tua vida como a de um deles.

RVA.text: Entonces envió Jezabel á Elías un mensajero, diciendo: Así me hagan los dioses, y así me añadan, si mañana á estas horas yo no haya puesto tu persona como la de uno de ellos.

KJV.text: Then Jezebel sent a messenger unto Elijah, saying, So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I make not thy life as the life of one of them by to morrow about this time.

WEBM.text: Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, “So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I don’t make your life as the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time!”

JFA.text: Quando ele viu isto, levantou-se e, para escapar com vida, se foi. E chegando a Berseba, que pertence a Judá, deixou ali o seu moço.

RVA.text: Viendo pues el peligro, levantóse y fuése por salvar su vida, y vino á Beer-seba, que es en Judá, y dejó allí su criado.

KJV.text: And when he saw that, he arose, and went for his life, and came to Beersheba, which belongeth to Judah, and left his servant there.

WEBM.text: When he saw that, he arose, and ran for his life, and came to Beersheba, which belongs to Judah, and left his servant there.

JFA.text: Ele, porém, entrou pelo deserto caminho de um dia, e foi sentar-se debaixo de um zimbro; e pediu para si a morte, dizendo: Já basta, ó Senhor; toma agora a minha vida, pois não sou melhor do que meus pais.

RVA.text: Y él se fué por el desierto un día de camino, y vino y sentóse debajo de un enebro; y deseando morirse, dijo: Baste ya, oh Jehová, quita mi alma; que no soy yo mejor que mis padres.

KJV.text: But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree: and he requested for himself that he might die; and said, It is enough; now, O Lord, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.

WEBM.text: But he himself went a day’s journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree. Then he requested for himself that he might die, and said, “It is enough. Now, O Lord, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.”

JFA.text: E deitando-se debaixo do zimbro, dormiu; e eis que um anjo o tocou, e lhe disse: Levanta-te e come.

RVA.text: Y echándose debajo del enebro, quedóse dormido: y he aquí luego un ángel que le tocó, y le dijo: Levántate, come.

KJV.text: And as he lay and slept under a juniper tree, behold, then an angel touched him, and said unto him, Arise and eat.

WEBM.text: He lay down and slept under a juniper tree; and behold, an angel touched him, and said to him, “Arise and eat!”

JFA.text: Ele olhou, e eis que à sua cabeceira estava um pão cozido sobre as brasas, e uma botija de água. Tendo comido e bebido, tornou a deitar-se.

RVA.text: Entonces él miró, y he aquí á su cabecera una torta cocida sobre las ascuas, y un vaso de agua: y comió y bebió y volvióse á dormir.

KJV.text: And he looked, and, behold, there was a cake baken on the coals, and a cruse of water at his head. And he did eat and drink, and laid him down again.

WEBM.text: He looked, and behold, there was at his head a cake baked on the coals, and a jar of water. He ate and drank, and lay down again.

JFA.text: O anjo do Senhor veio segunda vez, tocou-o, e lhe disse: Levanta-te e come, porque demasiado longa te será a viagem.

RVA.text: Y volviendo el ángel de Jehová la segunda vez, tocóle, diciendo: Levántate, come: porque gran camino te resta.

KJV.text: And the angel of the Lord came again the second time, and touched him, and said, Arise and eat; because the journey is too great for thee.

WEBM.text: And the angel of the Lord came again the second time, and touched him, and said, “Arise and eat, because the journey is too great for you.”

JFA.text: Levantou-se, pois, e comeu e bebeu; e com a força desse alimento caminhou quarenta dias e quarenta noites até Horebe, o monte de Deus.

RVA.text: Levantóse pues, y comió y bebió; y caminó con la fortaleza de aquella comida cuarenta días y cuarenta noches, hasta el monte de Dios, Horeb.

KJV.text: And he arose, and did eat and drink, and went in the strength of that meat forty days and forty nights unto Horeb the mount of God.

WEBM.text: He arose, and ate and drank, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb, God’s Mountain.

JFA.text: Ali entrou numa caverna, onde passou a noite. E eis que lhe veio a palavra do Senhor, dizendo: Que fazes aqui, Elias?

RVA.text: Y allí se metió en una cueva, donde tuvo la noche. Y fué á él palabra de Jehová, el cual le dijo: ¿Qué haces aquí, Elías?

KJV.text: And he came thither unto a cave, and lodged there; and, behold, the word of the Lord came to him, and he said unto him, What doest thou here, Elijah?

WEBM.text: He came to a cave there, and camped there; and behold, the word of the Lord came to him, and he said to him, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: Tenho sido muito zeloso pelo Senhor Deus dos exércitos; porque os filhos de Israel deixaram o teu pacto, derrubaram os teus altares, e mataram os teus profetas à espada; e eu, somente eu, fiquei, e buscam a minha vida para ma tirarem.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: Sentido he un vivo celo por Jehová Dios de los ejércitos; porque los hijos de Israel han dejado tu alianza, han derribado tus altares, y han muerto á cuchillo tus profetas: y yo solo he quedado, y me buscan para quitarme la vida.

KJV.text: And he said, I have been very jealous for the Lord God of hosts: for the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thine altars, and slain thy prophets with the sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.

WEBM.text: He said, “I have been very jealous for the Lord, the God of Armies; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and killed your prophets with the sword. I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.”

JFA.text: Ao que Deus lhe disse: Vem cá fora, e põe-te no monte perante o Senhor: E eis que o Senhor passou; e um grande e forte vento fendia os montes e despedaçava as penhas diante do Senhor, porém o Senhor não estava no vento; e depois do vento um terremoto, porém o Senhor não estava no terremoto;

RVA.text: Y él le dijo: Sal fuera, y ponte en el monte delante de Jehová. Y he aquí Jehová que pasaba, y un grande y poderoso viento que rompía los montes, y quebraba las peñas delante de Jehová: mas Jehová no estaba en el viento. Y tras el viento un terremoto: mas Jehová no estaba en el terremoto.

KJV.text: And he said, Go forth, and stand upon the mount before the Lord. And, behold, the Lord passed by, and a great and strong wind rent the mountains, and brake in pieces the rocks before the Lord; but the Lord was not in the wind: and after the wind an earthquake; but the Lord was not in the earthquake:

WEBM.text: He said, “Go out, and stand on the mountain before the Lord.” Behold, the Lord passed by, and a great and strong wind tore the mountains, and broke in pieces the rocks before the Lord; but the Lord was not in the wind. After the wind there was an earthquake; but the Lord was not in the earthquake.

JFA.text: e depois do terremoto um fogo, porém o Senhor não estava no fogo; e ainda depois do fogo uma voz mansa e delicada.

RVA.text: Y tras el terremoto un fuego: mas Jehová no estaba en el fuego. Y tras el fuego un silvo apacible y delicado.

KJV.text: And after the earthquake a fire; but the Lord was not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voice.

WEBM.text: After the earthquake a fire passed; but the Lord was not in the fire. After the fire, there was a still small voice.

JFA.text: E ao ouvi-la, Elias cobriu o rosto com a capa e, saindo, pôs-se à entrada da caverna. E eis que lhe veio uma voz, que dizia: Que fazes aqui, Elias?

RVA.text: Y cuando lo oyó Elías, cubrió su rostro con su manto, y salió, y paróse á la puerta de la cueva. Y he aquí llegó una voz á él, diciendo: ¿Qué haces aquí, Elías?

KJV.text: And it was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entering in of the cave. And, behold, there came a voice unto him, and said, What doest thou here, Elijah?

WEBM.text: When Elijah heard it, he wrapped his face in his mantle, went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. Behold, a voice came to him, and said, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: Tenho sido muito zeloso pelo Senhor Deus dos exércitos; porque os filhos de Israel deixaram o teu pacto, derrubaram os teus altares, e mataram os teus profetas à espada; e eu, somente eu, fiquei, e buscam a minha vida para ma tirarem.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: Sentido he un vivo celo por Jehová Dios de los ejércitos; porque los hijos de Israel han dejado tu alianza, han derribado tus altares, y han muerto á cuchillo tus profetas: y yo solo he quedado, y me buscan para quitarme la vida.

KJV.text: And he said, I have been very jealous for the Lord God of hosts: because the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thine altars, and slain thy prophets with the sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.

WEBM.text: He said, “I have been very jealous for the Lord, the God of Armies; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and killed your prophets with the sword. I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.”

JFA.text: Então o Senhor lhe disse: Vai, volta pelo teu caminho para o deserto de Damasco; quando lá chegares, ungirás a Hazael para ser rei sobre a Síria.

RVA.text: Y díjole Jehová: Ve, vuélvete por tu camino, por el desierto de Damasco: y llegarás, y ungirás á Hazael por rey de Siria;

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto him, Go, return on thy way to the wilderness of Damascus: and when thou comest, anoint Hazael to be king over Syria:

WEBM.text: And the Lord said to him, “Go, return on your way to the wilderness of Damascus. When you arrive, anoint Hazael to be king over Syria.

JFA.text: E a Jeú, filho de Ninsi, ungirás para ser rei sobre Israel; bem como a Eliseu, filho de Safate de Abel-Meolá, ungirás para ser profeta em teu lugar.

RVA.text: Y á Jehú hijo de Nimsi, ungirás por rey sobre Israel; y á Eliseo hijo de Saphat, de Abel-mehula, ungirás para que sea profeta en lugar de ti.

KJV.text: And Jehu the son of Nimshi shalt thou anoint to be king over Israel: and Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abelmeholah shalt thou anoint to be prophet in thy room.

WEBM.text: Anoint Jehu the son of Nimshi to be king over Israel; and anoint Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel Meholah to be prophet in your place.

JFA.text: E há de ser que o que escapar da espada de Hazael, matá-lo-á Jeú; e o que escapar da espada de Jeú, matá-lo-á Eliseu.

RVA.text: Y será, que el que escapare del cuchillo, de Hazael, Jehú lo matará; y el que escapare del cuchillo de Jehú, Eliseo lo matará.

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, that him that escapeth the sword of Hazael shall Jehu slay: and him that escapeth from the sword of Jehu shall Elisha slay.

WEBM.text: He who escapes from the sword of Hazael, Jehu will kill; and he who escapes from the sword of Jehu, Elisha will kill.

JFA.text: Todavia deixarei em Israel sete mil: todos os joelhos que não se dobraram a Baal, e toda boca que não o beijou.

RVA.text: Y yo haré que queden en Israel siete mil; todas rodillas que no se encorvaron á Baal, y bocas todas que no lo besaron.

KJV.text: Yet I have left me seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed unto Baal, and every mouth which hath not kissed him.

WEBM.text: Yet I reserved seven thousand in Israel, all the knees of which have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth which has not kissed him.”

JFA.text: Partiu, pois, Elias dali e achou Eliseu, filho de Safate, que andava lavrando com doze juntas de bois adiante dele, estando ele com a duodécima; chegando-se Elias a Eliseu, lançou a sua capa sobre ele.

RVA.text: Y partiéndose él de allí, halló á Eliseo hijo de Saphat, que araba con doce yuntas delante de sí; y él era uno de los doce gañanes. Y pasando Elías por delante de él, echó sobre él su manto.

KJV.text: So he departed thence, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed by him, and cast his mantle upon him.

WEBM.text: So he departed from there, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth. Elijah went over to him, and put his mantle on him.

JFA.text: Então, deixando este os bois, correu após Elias, e disse: Deixa-me beijar a meu pai e a minha mãe, e então te seguirei. Respondeu-lhe Elias: Vai, volta; pois, que te fiz eu?

RVA.text: Entonces dejando él los bueyes, vino corriendo en pos de Elías, y dijo: Ruégote que me dejes besar mi padre y mi madre, y luego te seguiré. Y él le dijo: Ve, vuelve: ¿qué te he hecho yo?

KJV.text: And he left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, Let me, I pray thee, kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow thee. And he said unto him, Go back again: for what have I done to thee?

WEBM.text: Elisha left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, “Let me please kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow you.”He said to him, “Go back again; for what have I done to you?”

JFA.text: Voltou, pois, de o seguir, tomou a junta de bois, e os matou, e com os aparelhos dos bois cozeu a carne, e a deu ao povo, e comeram. Então se levantou e seguiu a Elias, e o servia.

RVA.text: Y volvióse de en pos de él, y tomó un par de bueyes, y matólos, y con el arado de los bueyes coció la carne de ellos, y dióla al pueblo que comiesen. Después se levantó, y fué tras Elías, y servíale.

KJV.text: And he returned back from him, and took a yoke of oxen, and slew them, and boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen, and gave unto the people, and they did eat. Then he arose, and went after Elijah, and ministered unto him.

WEBM.text: He returned from following him, and took the yoke of oxen, and killed them, and boiled their meat with the instruments of the oxen, and gave to the people, and they ate. Then he arose, and went after Elijah, and served him.

JFA.text: Quando o Senhor estava para tomar Elias ao céu num redemoinho, Elias partiu de Gilgal com Eliseu.

RVA.text: Y ACONTECIO que, cuando quiso Jehová alzar á Elías en un torbellino al cielo, Elías venía con Eliseo de Gilgal.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when the Lord would take up Elijah into heaven by a whirlwind, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.

WEBM.text: When the Lord was about to take Elijah up by a whirlwind into heaven, Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.

JFA.text: Disse Elias a Eliseu: Fica-te aqui, porque o Senhor me envia a Betel. Eliseu, porém disse: Vive o Senhor, e vive a tua alma, que não te deixarei. E assim desceram a Betel.

RVA.text: Y dijo Elías á Eliseo: Quédate ahora aquí, porque Jehová me ha enviado á Beth-el. Y Eliseo dijo: Vive Jehová, y vive tu alma, que no te dejaré. Descendieron pues á Beth-el.

KJV.text: And Elijah said unto Elisha, Tarry here, I pray thee; for the Lord hath sent me to Bethel. And Elisha said unto him, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel.

WEBM.text: Elijah said to Elisha, “Please wait here, for the Lord has sent me as far as Bethel.” Elisha said, “As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.” So they went down to Bethel.

JFA.text: Então os filhos dos profetas que estavam em Betel saíram ao encontro de Eliseu, e lhe disseram: Sabes que o Senhor hoje tomará o teu senhor por sobre a tua cabeça? E ele disse: Sim, eu o sei; calai-vos.

RVA.text: Y saliendo á Eliseo los hijos de los profetas que estaban en Beth-el, dijéronle: ¿Sabes cómo Jehová quitará hoy á tu señor de tu cabeza? Y él dijo: Sí, yo lo sé; callad.

KJV.text: And the sons of the prophets that were at Bethel came forth to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Lord will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he said, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.

WEBM.text: The sons of the prophets who were at Bethel came out to Elisha, and said to him, “Do you know that the Lord will take away your master from your head today?” He said, “Yes, I know it. Hold your peace.”

JFA.text: E Elias lhe disse: Eliseu, fica-te aqui, porque o Senhor me envia a Jericó. Ele, porém, disse: Vive o Senhor, e vive a tua alma, que não te deixarei. E assim vieram a Jericó.

RVA.text: Y Elías le volvió á decir: Eliseo, quédate aquí ahora, porque Jehová me ha enviado á Jericó. Y él dijo: Vive Jehová, y vive tu alma, que no te dejaré. Vinieron pues á Jericó.

KJV.text: And Elijah said unto him, Elisha, tarry here, I pray thee; for the Lord hath sent me to Jericho. And he said, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.

WEBM.text: Elijah said to him, “Elisha, please wait here, for the Lord has sent me to Jericho.” He said, “As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.” So they came to Jericho.

JFA.text: Então os filhos dos profetas que estavam em Jericó se chegaram a Eliseu, e lhe disseram: Sabes que o Senhor hoje tomará o teu senhor por sobre a tua cabeça? E ele disse: Sim, eu o sei; calai-vos.

RVA.text: Y llegáronse á Eliseo los hijos de los profetas que estaban en Jericó, y dijéronle: ¿Sabes cómo Jehová quitará hoy á tu señor de tu cabeza? Y él respondió: Sí, yo lo sé; callad.

KJV.text: And the sons of the prophets that were at Jericho came to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Lord will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he answered, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.

WEBM.text: He answered, “Yes, I know it. Hold your peace.”

JFA.text: E Elias lhe disse: Fica-te aqui, porque o senhor me envia ao Jordão. Mas ele disse: Vive o Senhor, e vive a tua alma, que não te deixarei. E assim ambos foram juntos.

RVA.text: Y Elías le dijo: Ruégote que te quedes aquí, porque Jehová me ha enviado al Jordán. Y él dijo: Vive Jehová, y vive tu alma, que no te dejaré. Fueron pues ambos á dos.

KJV.text: And Elijah said unto him, Tarry, I pray thee, here; for the Lord hath sent me to Jordan. And he said, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And they two went on.

WEBM.text: Elijah said to him, “Please wait here, for the Lord has sent me to the Jordan.” He said, “As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.” Then they both went on.
