JFA.text: E foram cinquenta homens dentre os filhos dos profetas, e pararam defronte deles, de longe; e eles dois pararam junto ao Jordão.

RVA.text: Y vinieron cincuenta varones de los hijos de los profetas, y paráronse enfrente á lo lejos: y ellos dos se pararon junto al Jordán.

KJV.text: And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Jordan.

WEBM.text: Fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood opposite them at a distance; and they both stood by the Jordan.

JFA.text: Então Elias tomou a sua capa e, dobrando-a, feriu as águas, as quais se dividiram de uma à outra banda; e passaram ambos a pé enxuto.

RVA.text: Tomando entonces Elías su manto, doblólo, é hirió las aguas, las cuales se apartaron á uno y á otro lado, y pasaron ambos en seco.

KJV.text: And Elijah took his mantle, and wrapped it together, and smote the waters, and they were divided hither and thither, so that they two went over on dry ground.

WEBM.text: Elijah took his mantle, and rolled it up, and struck the waters, and they were divided here and there, so that they both went over on dry ground.

JFA.text: Havendo eles passado, Elias disse a Eliseu: Pede-me o que queres que eu te faça, antes que seja tomado de ti. E disse Eliseu: Peço-te que haja sobre mim dobrada porção de teu espírito.

RVA.text: Y como hubieron pasado, Elías dijo á Eliseo: Pide lo que quieres que haga por ti, antes que sea quitado de contigo. Y dijo Eliseo: Ruégote que las dos partes de tu espíritu sean sobre mí.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.

WEBM.text: When they had gone over, Elijah said to Elisha, “Ask what I shall do for you, before I am taken from you.” Elisha said, “Please let a double portion of your spirit be on me.”

JFA.text: Respondeu Elias: Coisa difícil pediste. Todavia, se me vires quando for tomado de ti, assim se te fará; porém, se não, não se fará.

RVA.text: Y él le dijo: Cosa difícil has pedido. Si me vieres cuando fuere quitado de ti, te será así hecho; mas si no, no.

KJV.text: And he said, Thou hast asked a hard thing: nevertheless, if thou see me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so.

WEBM.text: He said, “You have asked a hard thing. If you see me when I am taken from you, it will be so for you; but if not, it will not be so.”

JFA.text: E, indo eles caminhando e conversando, eis que um carro de fogo, com cavalos de fogo, os separou um do outro; e Elias subiu ao céu num redemoinho.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que, yendo ellos hablando, he aquí, un carro de fuego con caballos de fuego apartó á los dos: y Elías subió al cielo en un torbellino.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, and parted them both asunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

WEBM.text: As they continued on and talked, behold, a chariot of fire and horses of fire separated them, and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

JFA.text: O que vendo Eliseu, clamou: Meu pai, meu pai! o carro de Israel, e seus cavaleiros! E não o viu mais. Pegou então nas suas vestes e as rasgou em duas partes;

RVA.text: Y viéndolo Eliseo, clamaba: ­Padre mío, padre mío, carro de Israel y su gente de á caballo! Y nunca más le vió, y trabando de sus vestidos, rompiólos en dos partes.

KJV.text: And Elisha saw it, and he cried, My father, my father, the chariot of Israel, and the horsemen thereof. And he saw him no more: and he took hold of his own clothes, and rent them in two pieces.

WEBM.text: Elisha saw it, and he cried, “My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and its horsemen!” He saw him no more. Then he took hold of his own clothes, and tore them in two pieces.

JFA.text: Tomou a capa de Elias, que dele caíra, voltou e parou à beira do Jordão.

RVA.text: Alzó luego el manto de Elías que se le había caído, y volvió, y paróse á la orilla del Jordán.

KJV.text: He took up also the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of Jordan;

WEBM.text: He also took up Elijah’s mantle that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of the Jordan.

JFA.text: Então, pegando da capa de Elias, que dele caíra, feriu as águas e disse: Onde está o Senhor, o Deus de Elias? Quando feriu as águas, estas se dividiram de uma à outra banda, e Eliseu passou.

RVA.text: Y tomando el manto de Elías que se le había caído, hirió las aguas, y dijo: ¿Dónde está Jehová, el Dios de Elías? Y así que hubo del mismo modo herido las aguas, apartáronse á uno y á otro lado, y pasó Eliseo.

KJV.text: And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, Where is the Lord God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over.

WEBM.text: He took Elijah’s mantle that fell from him, and struck the waters, and said, “Where is the Lord, the God of Elijah?” When he also had struck the waters, they were divided apart, and Elisha went over.

JFA.text: Vendo-o, pois, os filhos dos profetas que estavam defronte dele em Jericó, disseram: O espírito de Elias repousa sobre Eliseu. E vindo ao seu encontro, inclinaram-se em terra diante dele.

RVA.text: Y viéndole los hijos de los profetas que estaban en Jericó de la otra parte, dijeron: El espíritu de Elías reposó sobre Eliseo. Y viniéronle á recibir, é inclináronse á él hasta la tierra.

KJV.text: And when the sons of the prophets which were to view at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

WEBM.text: When the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho facing him saw him, they said, “The spirit of Elijah rests on Elisha.” They came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

JFA.text: E disseram-lhe: Eis que entre os teus servos há cinquenta homens valentes. Deixa-os ir, pedimos-te, em busca do teu senhor; pode ser que o Espírito do Senhor o tenha arrebatado e lançado nalgum monte, ou nalgum vale. Ele, porém, disse: Não os envieis.

RVA.text: Y dijéronle: He aquí hay con tus siervos cincuenta varones fuertes: vayan ahora y busquen á tu señor; quizá lo ha levantado el espíritu de Jehová, y lo ha echado en algún monte ó en algún valle. Y él les dijo: No enviéis.

KJV.text: And they said unto him, Behold now, there be with thy servants fifty strong men; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master: lest peradventure the Spirit of the Lord hath taken him up, and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, Ye shall not send.

WEBM.text: They said to him, “See now, there are with your servants fifty strong men. Please let them go and seek your master. Perhaps the Spirit of the Lord has taken him up, and put him on some mountain, or into some valley.” He said, “Don’t send them.”

JFA.text: Mas insistiram com ele, até que se envergonhou; e disse-lhes: Enviai. E enviaram cinquenta homens, que o buscaram três dias, porém não o acharam.

RVA.text: Mas ellos le importunaron, hasta que avergonzándose, dijo: Enviad. Entonces ellos enviaron cincuenta hombres, los cuales lo buscaron tres días, mas no lo hallaron.

KJV.text: And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. They sent therefore fifty men; and they sought three days, but found him not.

WEBM.text: When they urged him until he was ashamed, he said, “Send them.” Therefore they sent fifty men; and they searched for three days, but didn’t find him.

JFA.text: Então voltaram para Eliseu, que ficara em Jericó; e ele lhes disse: Não vos disse eu que não fôsseis?

RVA.text: Y cuando volvieron á él, que se había quedado en Jericó, él les dijo: ¿No os dije yo que no fueseis?

KJV.text: And when they came again to him, (for he tarried at Jericho,) he said unto them, Did I not say unto you, Go not?

WEBM.text: They came back to him, while he stayed at Jericho; and he said to them, “Didn’t I tell you, ‘Don’t go?’”

JFA.text: Os homens da cidade disseram a Eliseu: Eis que a situação desta cidade é agradável, como vê o meu senhor; porém as águas são péssimas, e a terra é estéril.

RVA.text: Y los hombres de la ciudad dijeron á Eliseo: He aquí el asiento de esta ciudad es bueno, como mi señor ve; mas las aguas son malas, y la tierra enferma.

KJV.text: And the men of the city said unto Elisha, Behold, I pray thee, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord seeth: but the water is naught, and the ground barren.

WEBM.text: The men of the city said to Elisha, “Behold, please, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord sees; but the water is bad, and the land is barren.”

JFA.text: E ele disse: Trazei-me um jarro novo, e ponde nele sal. E lho trouxeram.

RVA.text: Entonces él dijo: Traedme una botija nueva, y poned en ella sal. Y trajéronsela.

KJV.text: And he said, Bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein. And they brought it to him.

WEBM.text: He said, “Bring me a new jar, and put salt in it.” Then they brought it to him.

JFA.text: Então saiu ele ao manancial das águas e, deitando sal nele, disse: Assim diz o Senhor: Sarei estas águas; não mais sairá delas morte nem esterilidade.

RVA.text: Y saliendo él á los manaderos de las aguas, echó dentro la sal, y dijo: Así ha dicho Jehová: Yo sané estas aguas, y no habrá más en ellas muerte ni enfermedad.

KJV.text: And he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast the salt in there, and said, Thus saith the Lord, I have healed these waters; there shall not be from thence any more death or barren land.

WEBM.text: He went out to the spring of the waters, and threw salt into it, and said, “The Lord says, ‘I have healed these waters. There shall not be from there any more death or barren wasteland.’”

JFA.text: E aquelas águas ficaram sãs, até o dia de hoje, conforme a palavra que Eliseu disse.

RVA.text: Y fueron sanas las aguas hasta hoy, conforme á la palabra que habló Eliseo.

KJV.text: So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the saying of Elisha which he spake.

WEBM.text: So the waters were healed to this day, according to Elisha’s word which he spoke.

JFA.text: Então subiu dali a Betel; e, subindo ele pelo caminho, uns meninos saíram da cidade, e zombavam dele, dizendo: Sobe, calvo; sobe, calvo!

RVA.text: Después subió de allí á Beth-el; y subiendo por el camino, salieron los muchachos de la ciudad, y se burlaban de él, diciendo: ­Calvo, sube! ­calvo, sube!

KJV.text: And he went up from thence unto Bethel: and as he was going up by the way, there came forth little children out of the city, and mocked him, and said unto him, Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head.

WEBM.text: He went up from there to Bethel. As he was going up by the way, some youths came out of the city and mocked him, and said to him, “Go up, you baldy! Go up, you baldy!”

JFA.text: E, virando-se ele para trás, os viu, e os amaldiçoou em nome do Senhor. Então duas ursas saíram do bosque, e despedaçaram quarenta e dois daqueles meninos.

RVA.text: Y mirando él atrás, viólos, y maldíjolos en el nombre de Jehová. Y salieron dos osos del monte, y despedazaron de ellos cuarenta y dos muchachos.

KJV.text: And he turned back, and looked on them, and cursed them in the name of the Lord. And there came forth two she bears out of the wood, and tare forty and two children of them.

WEBM.text: He looked behind him and saw them, and cursed them in the name of the Lord. Then two female bears came out of the woods, and mauled forty-two of those youths.

JFA.text: E dali foi para o monte Carmelo, de onde voltou para Samária.

RVA.text: De allí fué al monte de Carmelo, y de allí volvió á Samaria.

KJV.text: And he went from thence to mount Carmel, and from thence he returned to Samaria.

WEBM.text: He went from there to Mount Carmel, and from there he returned to Samaria.

JFA.text: Ora, estes são os nomes dos filhos de Israel, que entraram no Egito; entraram com Jacó, cada um com a sua família:

RVA.text: ESTOS son los nombres de los hijos de Israel, que entraron en Egipto con Jacob; cada uno entró con su familia.

KJV.text: Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob.

WEBM.text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt (every man and his household came with Jacob):

JFA.text: Rúben, Simeão, Levi, e Judá;

RVA.text: Rubén, Simeón, Leví y Judá;

KJV.text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,

WEBM.text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,

JFA.text: Issacar, Zebulom e Benjamim;

RVA.text: Issachâr, Zabulón y Benjamín;

KJV.text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,

WEBM.text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,

JFA.text: Dã e Naftali, Gade e Aser.

RVA.text: Dan y Nephtalí, Gad y Aser.

KJV.text: Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

WEBM.text: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.

JFA.text: Todas as almas, pois, que procederam da coxa de Jacó, foram setenta; José, porém, já estava no Egito.

RVA.text: Y todas las almas de los que salieron del muslo de Jacob, fueron setenta. Y José estaba en Egipto.

KJV.text: And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already.

WEBM.text: All the souls who came out of Jacob’s body were seventy souls, and Joseph was in Egypt already.

JFA.text: Morreu, pois, José, e todos os seus irmãos, e toda aquela geração.

RVA.text: Y murió José, y todos sus hermanos, y toda aquella generación.

KJV.text: And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.

WEBM.text: Joseph died, as did all his brothers, and all that generation.

JFA.text: Depois os filhos de Israel frutificaram e aumentaram muito, multiplicaram-se e tornaram-se sobremaneira fortes, de modo que a terra se encheu deles.

RVA.text: Y los hijos de Israel crecieron, y multiplicaron, y fueron aumentados y corroborados en extremo; y llenóse la tierra de ellos.

KJV.text: And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.

WEBM.text: The children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and grew exceedingly mighty; and the land was filled with them.

JFA.text: Entrementes se levantou sobre o Egito um novo rei, que não conhecera a José.

RVA.text: Levantóse entretanto un nuevo rey sobre Egipto, que no conocía á José; el cual dijo á su pueblo:

KJV.text: Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph.

WEBM.text: Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who didn’t know Joseph.

JFA.text: Disse ele ao seu povo: Eis que o povo de Israel é mais numeroso e mais forte do que nos.

RVA.text: He aquí, el pueblo de los hijos de Israel es mayor y más fuerte que nosotros:

KJV.text: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we:

WEBM.text: He said to his people, “Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we.

JFA.text: Eia, usemos de astúcia para com ele, para que não se multiplique, e aconteça que, vindo guerra, ele também se ajunte com os nossos inimigos, e peleje contra nós e se retire da terra.

RVA.text: Ahora, pues, seamos sabios para con él, porque no se multiplique, y acontezca que viniendo guerra, él también se junte con nuestros enemigos, y pelee contra nosotros, y se vaya de la tierra.

KJV.text: Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land.

WEBM.text: Come, let’s deal wisely with them, lest they multiply, and it happen that when any war breaks out, they also join themselves to our enemies and fight against us, and escape out of the land.”

JFA.text: Portanto puseram sobre eles feitores, para os afligirem com suas cargas. Assim os israelitas edificaram para Faraó cidades armazéns, Pitom e Ramessés.

RVA.text: Entonces pusieron sobre él comisarios de tributos que los molestasen con sus cargas; y edificaron á Faraón las ciudades de los bastimentos, Phithom y Raamses.

KJV.text: Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh treasure cities, Pithom and Raamses.

WEBM.text: Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their burdens. They built storage cities for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.

JFA.text: Mas quanto mais os egípcios afligiam o povo de Israel, tanto mais este se multiplicava e se espalhava; de maneira que os egípcios se enfadavam por causa dos filhos de Israel.

RVA.text: Empero cuanto más los oprimían, tanto más se multiplicaban y crecían: así que estaban ellos fastidiados de los hijos de Israel.

KJV.text: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.

WEBM.text: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and the more they spread out. They started to dread the children of Israel.

JFA.text: Por isso os egípcios faziam os filhos de Israel servir com dureza;

RVA.text: Y los Egipcios hicieron servir á los hijos de Israel con dureza:

KJV.text: And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigour:

WEBM.text: The Egyptians ruthlessly made the children of Israel serve.

JFA.text: assim lhes amarguravam a vida com pesados serviços em barro e em tijolos, e com toda sorte de trabalho no campo, enfim com todo o seu serviço, em que os faziam servir com dureza.

RVA.text: Y amargaron su vida con dura servidumbre, en hacer barro y ladrillo, y en toda labor del campo, y en todo su servicio, al cual los obligaban con rigorismo.

KJV.text: And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in morter, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service, wherein they made them serve, was with rigour.

WEBM.text: And they made their lives bitter with hard service in mortar and in brick, and in all kinds of service in the field, all their service, in which they ruthlessly made them serve.

JFA.text: Falou o rei do Egito às parteiras das hebréias, das quais uma se chamava Sifrá e a outra Puá.

RVA.text: Y habló el rey de Egipto á las parteras de las Hebreas, una de las cuales se llamaba Siphra, y otra Phúa, y díjoles:

KJV.text: And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives, of which the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:

WEBM.text: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah.

JFA.text: Dizendo: Quando ajudardes no parto as hebréias, e as virdes sobre os assentos, se for filho, matá-lo-eis; mas se for filha, viverá.

RVA.text: Cuando parteareis á las Hebreas, y mirareis los asientos, si fuere hijo, matadlo; y si fuere hija, entonces viva.

KJV.text: And he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.

WEBM.text: And he said, “When you perform the duty of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them on the birth stool, if it is a son, then you shall kill him; but if it is a daughter, then she shall live.”

JFA.text: As parteiras, porém, temeram a Deus e não fizeram como o rei do Egito lhes ordenara, antes conservavam os meninos com vida.

RVA.text: Mas las parteras temieron á Dios, y no hicieron como les mandó el rey de Egipto, sino que reservaban la vida á los niños.

KJV.text: But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men children alive.

WEBM.text: But the midwives feared God, and didn’t do what the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the baby boys alive.

JFA.text: Pelo que o rei do Egito mandou chamar as parteiras e as interrogou: Por que tendes feito isto e guardado os meninos com vida?

RVA.text: Y el rey de Egipto hizo llamar á las parteras y díjoles: ¿Por qué habéis hecho esto, que habéis reservado la vida á los niños?

KJV.text: And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men children alive?

WEBM.text: The king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said to them, “Why have you done this thing and saved the boys alive?”

JFA.text: Responderam as parteiras a Faraó: É que as mulheres hebréias não são como as egípcias; pois são vigorosas, e já têm dado à luz antes que a parteira chegue a elas.

RVA.text: Y las parteras respondieron á Faraón: Porque las mujeres Hebreas no son como las Egipcias: porque son robustas, y paren antes que la partera venga á ellas.

KJV.text: And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them.

WEBM.text: The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women aren’t like the Egyptian women; for they are vigorous and give birth before the midwife comes to them.”

JFA.text: Portanto Deus fez bem às parteiras. E o povo se aumentou, e se fortaleceu muito.

RVA.text: Y Dios hizo bien á las parteras: y el pueblo se multiplicó, y se corroboraron en gran manera.

KJV.text: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.

WEBM.text: God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied, and grew very mighty.

JFA.text: Também aconteceu que, como as parteiras temeram a Deus, ele lhes estabeleceu as casas.

RVA.text: Y por haber las parteras temido á Dios, él les hizo casas.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them houses.

WEBM.text: Because the midwives feared God, he gave them families.

JFA.text: Então ordenou Faraó a todo o seu povo, dizendo: A todos os filhos que nascerem lançareis no rio, mas a todas as filhas guardareis com vida.

RVA.text: Entonces Faraón mandó á todo su pueblo, diciendo: Echad en el río todo hijo que naciere, y á toda hija reservad la vida.

KJV.text: And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.

WEBM.text: Pharaoh commanded all his people, saying, “You shall cast every son who is born into the river, and every daughter you shall save alive.”

JFA.text: Foi-se um homem da casa de Levi e casou com uma filha de Levi.

RVA.text: UN varón de la familia de Leví fué, y tomó por mujer una hija de Leví:

KJV.text: And there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.

WEBM.text: A man of the house of Levi went and took a daughter of Levi as his wife.

JFA.text: A mulher concebeu e deu à luz um filho; e, vendo que ele era formoso, escondeu-o três meses.

RVA.text: La cual concibió, y parió un hijo: y viéndolo que era hermoso, túvole escondido tres meses.

KJV.text: And the woman conceived, and bare a son: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.

WEBM.text: The woman conceived and bore a son. When she saw that he was a fine child, she hid him three months.

JFA.text: Não podendo, porém, escondê-lo por mais tempo, tomou para ele uma arca de juncos, e a revestiu de betume e pez; e, pondo nela o menino, colocou-a entre os juncos a margem do rio.

RVA.text: Pero no pudiendo ocultarle más tiempo, tomó una arquilla de juncos, y calafateóla con pez y betún, y colocó en ella al niño, y púsolo en un carrizal á la orilla del río:

KJV.text: And when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put the child therein; and she laid it in the flags by the river's brink.

WEBM.text: When she could no longer hide him, she took a papyrus basket for him, and coated it with tar and with pitch. She put the child in it, and laid it in the reeds by the river’s bank.

JFA.text: E sua irmã postou-se de longe, para saber o que lhe aconteceria.

RVA.text: Y paróse una hermana suya á lo lejos, para ver lo que le acontecería.

KJV.text: And his sister stood afar off, to wit what would be done to him.

WEBM.text: His sister stood far off, to see what would be done to him.

JFA.text: A filha de Faraó desceu para banhar-se no rio, e as suas criadas passeavam à beira do rio. Vendo ela a arca no meio os juncos, mandou a sua criada buscá-la.

RVA.text: Y la hija de Faraón descendió á lavarse al río, y paseándose sus doncellas por la ribera del río, vió ella la arquilla en el carrizal, y envió una criada suya á que la tomase.

KJV.text: And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river's side; and when she saw the ark among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it.

WEBM.text: Pharaoh’s daughter came down to bathe at the river. Her maidens walked along by the riverside. She saw the basket among the reeds, and sent her servant to get it.

JFA.text: E abrindo-a, viu a criança, e eis que o menino chorava; então ela teve compaixão dele, e disse: Este é um dos filhos dos hebreus.

RVA.text: Y como la abrió, vió al niño; y he aquí que el niño lloraba. Y teniendo compasión de él, dijo: De los niños de los Hebreos es éste.

KJV.text: And when she had opened it, she saw the child: and, behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews' children.

WEBM.text: She opened it, and saw the child, and behold, the baby cried. She had compassion on him, and said, “This is one of the Hebrews’ children.”

JFA.text: Então a irmã do menino perguntou à filha de Faraó: Queres que eu te vá chamar uma ama dentre as hebréias, para que crie este menino para ti?

RVA.text: Entonces su hermana dijo á la hija de Faraón: ¿Iré á llamarte un ama de las Hebreas, para que te críe este niño?

KJV.text: Then said his sister to Pharaoh's daughter, Shall I go and call to thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?

WEBM.text: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Should I go and call a nurse for you from the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for you?”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe a filha de Faraó: Vai. Foi, pois, a moça e chamou a mãe do menino.

RVA.text: Y la hija de Faraón respondió: Ve. Entonces fué la doncella, y llamó á la madre del niño;

KJV.text: And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child's mother.

WEBM.text: Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Go.” The young woman went and called the child’s mother.

JFA.text: Disse-lhe a filha de Faraó: Leva este menino, e cria-mo; eu te darei o teu salário. E a mulher tomou o menino e o criou.

RVA.text: A la cual dijo la hija de Faraón: Lleva este niño, y críamelo, y yo te lo pagaré. Y la mujer tomó al niño, y criólo.

KJV.text: And Pharaoh's daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the women took the child, and nursed it.

WEBM.text: Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child away, and nurse him for me, and I will give you your wages.” The woman took the child, and nursed it.

JFA.text: Quando, pois, o menino era já grande, ela o trouxe à filha de Faraó, a qual o adotou; e lhe chamou Moisés, dizendo: Porque das águas o tirei.

RVA.text: Y como creció el niño, ella lo trajo á la hija de Faraón, la cual lo prohijó, y púsole por nombre Moisés, diciendo: Porque de las aguas lo saqué.

KJV.text: And the child grew, and she brought him unto Pharaoh's daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses: and she said, Because I drew him out of the water.

WEBM.text: The child grew, and she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. She named him Moses, and said, “Because I drew him out of the water.”

JFA.text: Ora, aconteceu naqueles dias que, sendo Moisés já homem, saiu a ter com seus irmãos e atentou para as suas cargas; e viu um egípcio que feria a um hebreu dentre, seus irmãos.

RVA.text: Y en aquellos días acaeció que, crecido ya Moisés, salió á sus hermanos, y vió sus cargas: y observó á un Egipcio que hería á uno de los Hebreos, sus hermanos.

KJV.text: And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he spied an Egyptian smiting an Hebrew, one of his brethren.

WEBM.text: In those days, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his brothers and saw their burdens. He saw an Egyptian striking a Hebrew, one of his brothers.

JFA.text: Olhou para um lado e para outro, e vendo que não havia ninguém ali, matou o egipcio e escondeu-o na areia.

RVA.text: Y miró á todas partes, y viendo que no parecía nadie, mató al Egipcio, y escondiólo en la arena.

KJV.text: And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he slew the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.

WEBM.text: He looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no one, he killed the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.

JFA.text: Tornou a sair no dia seguinte, e eis que dois hebreus contendiam; e perguntou ao que fazia a injustiça: Por que feres a teu próximo?

RVA.text: Y salió al día siguiente, y viendo á dos Hebreos que reñían, dijo al que hacía la injuria: ¿Por qué hieres á tu prójimo?

KJV.text: And when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the Hebrews strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?

WEBM.text: He went out the second day, and behold, two men of the Hebrews were fighting with each other. He said to him who did the wrong, “Why do you strike your fellow?”

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: Quem te constituiu a ti príncipe e juiz sobre nós? Pensas tu matar-me, como mataste o egípcio? Temeu, pois, Moisés e disse: Certamente o negócio já foi descoberto.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: ¿Quién te ha puesto á ti por príncipe y juez sobre nosotros? ¿piensas matarme como mataste al Egipcio? Entonces Moisés tuvo miedo, y dijo: Ciertamente esta cosa es descubierta.

KJV.text: And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? And Moses feared, and said, Surely this thing is known.

WEBM.text: He said, “Who made you a prince and a judge over us? Do you plan to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses was afraid, and said, “Surely this thing is known.”

JFA.text: E quando Faraó soube disso, procurou matar a Moisés. Este, porém, fugiu da presença de Faraó, e foi habitar na terra de Midiã; e sentou-se junto a um poço.

RVA.text: Y oyendo Faraón este negocio, procuró matar á Moisés: mas Moisés huyó de delante de Faraón, y habitó en la tierra de Madián; y sentóse junto á un pozo.

KJV.text: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.

WEBM.text: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to kill Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and lived in the land of Midian, and he sat down by a well.

JFA.text: O sacerdote de Midiã tinha sete filhas, as quais vieram tirar água, e encheram os tanques para dar de beber ao rebanho de seu pai.

RVA.text: Tenía el sacerdote de Madián siete hijas, las cuales vinieron á sacar agua, para llenar las pilas y dar de beber á las ovejas de su padre.

KJV.text: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters: and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father's flock.

WEBM.text: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. They came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.

JFA.text: Então vieram os pastores, e as expulsaram dali; Moisés, porém, levantou-se e as defendeu, e deu de beber ao rebanho delas.

RVA.text: Mas los pastores vinieron, y echáronlas: Entonces Moisés se levantó y defendiólas, y abrevó sus ovejas.

KJV.text: And the shepherds came and drove them away: but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.

WEBM.text: The shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.

JFA.text: Quando elas voltaram a Reuel, seu pai, este lhes perguntou: como é que hoje voltastes tão cedo?

RVA.text: Y volviendo ellas á Ragüel su padre, díjoles él: ¿Por qué habéis hoy venido tan presto?

KJV.text: And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that ye are come so soon to day?

WEBM.text: When they came to Reuel, their father, he said, “How is it that you have returned so early today?”

JFA.text: Responderam elas: um egípcio nos livrou da mão dos pastores; e ainda tirou água para nós e deu de beber ao rebanho.

RVA.text: Y ellas respondieron: Un varón Egipcio nos defendió de mano de los pastores, y también nos sacó el agua, y abrevó las ovejas.

KJV.text: And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and also drew water enough for us, and watered the flock.

WEBM.text: They said, “An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover he drew water for us, and watered the flock.”

JFA.text: E ele perguntou a suas filhas: Onde está ele; por que deixastes lá o homem? chamai-o para que coma pão.

RVA.text: Y dijo á sus hijas: ¿Y dónde está? ¿por qué habéis dejado ese hombre? llamadle para que coma pan.

KJV.text: And he said unto his daughters, And where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.

WEBM.text: He said to his daughters, “Where is he? Why is it that you have left the man? Call him, that he may eat bread.”

JFA.text: Então Moisés concordou em marar com aquele homem, o qual lhe deu sua filha Zípora.

RVA.text: Y Moisés acordó en morar con aquel varón; y él dió á Moisés á su hija Séphora:

KJV.text: And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.

WEBM.text: Moses was content to dwell with the man. He gave Moses Zipporah, his daughter.

JFA.text: E ela deu à luz um filho, a quem ele chamou Gérson, porque disse: Peregrino sou em terra estrangeira.

RVA.text: La cual le parió un hijo, y él le puso por nombre Gersom: porque dijo: Peregrino soy en tierra ajena.

KJV.text: And she bare him a son, and he called his name Gershom: for he said, I have been a stranger in a strange land.

WEBM.text: She bore a son, and he named him Gershom, for he said, “I have lived as a foreigner in a foreign land.”

JFA.text: No decorrer de muitos dias, morreu o rei do Egito; e os filhos de Israel gemiam debaixo da servidão; pelo que clamaram, e subiu a Deus o seu clamor por causa dessa servidão.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que después de muchos días murió el rey de Egipto, y los hijos de Israel suspiraron á causa de la servidumbre, y clamaron: y subió á Dios el clamor de ellos con motivo de su servidumbre.

KJV.text: And it came to pass in process of time, that the king of Egypt died: and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God by reason of the bondage.

WEBM.text: In the course of those many days, the king of Egypt died, and the children of Israel sighed because of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up to God because of the bondage.

JFA.text: Então Deus, ouvindo-lhes os gemidos, lembrou-se do seu pacto com Abraão, com Isaque e com Jacó.

RVA.text: Y oyó Dios el gemido de ellos, y acordóse de su pacto con Abraham, Isaac y Jacob.

KJV.text: And God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.

WEBM.text: God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.

JFA.text: E atentou Deus para os filhos de Israel; e Deus os conheceu.

RVA.text: Y miró Dios á los hijos de Israel, y reconociólos Dios.

KJV.text: And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God had respect unto them.

WEBM.text: God saw the children of Israel, and God was concerned about them.

JFA.text: Ora, Moisés estava apascentando o rebanho de Jetro, seu sogro, sacerdote de Midiã; e levou o rebanho para trás do deserto, e chegou a Horebe, o monte de Deus.

RVA.text: Y APACENTANDO Moisés las ovejas de Jethro su suegro, sacerdote de Madián, llevó las ovejas detrás del desierto, y vino á Horeb, monte de Dios.

KJV.text: Now Moses kept the flock of Jethro his father in law, the priest of Midian: and he led the flock to the backside of the desert, and came to the mountain of God, even to Horeb.

WEBM.text: Now Moses was keeping the flock of Jethro, his father-in-law, the priest of Midian, and he led the flock to the back of the wilderness, and came to God’s mountain, to Horeb.

JFA.text: E apareceu-lhe o anjo do Senhor em uma chama de fogo do meio duma sarça. Moisés olhou, e eis que a sarça ardia no fogo, e a sarça não se consumia;

RVA.text: Y apareciósele el Angel de Jehová en una llama de fuego en medio de una zarza: y él miró, y vió que la zarza ardía en fuego, y la zarza no se consumía.

KJV.text: And the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.

WEBM.text: The angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire out of the middle of a bush. He looked, and behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.

JFA.text: pelo que disse: Agora me virarei para lá e verei esta maravilha, e por que a sarça não se queima.

RVA.text: Entonces Moisés dijo: Iré yo ahora, y veré esta grande visión, por qué causa la zarza no se quema.

KJV.text: And Moses said, I will now turn aside, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.

WEBM.text: Moses said, “I will go now, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burned.”

JFA.text: E vendo o Senhor que ele se virara para ver, chamou-o do meio da sarça, e disse: Moisés, Moisés! Respondeu ele: Eis-me aqui.

RVA.text: Y viendo Jehová que iba á ver, llamólo Dios de en medio de la zarza, y dijo: ­Moisés, Moisés! Y él respondió: Heme aquí.

KJV.text: And when the Lord saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here am I.

WEBM.text: When the Lord saw that he came over to see, God called to him out of the middle of the bush, and said, “Moses! Moses!” He said, “Here I am.”

JFA.text: Prosseguiu Deus: Não te chegues para cá; tira os sapatos dos pés; porque o lugar em que tu estás é terra santa.

RVA.text: Y dijo: No te llegues acá: quita tus zapatos de tus pies, porque el lugar en que tú estás, tierra santa es.

KJV.text: And he said, Draw not nigh hither: put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.

WEBM.text: He said, “Don’t come close. Take off your sandals, for the place you are standing on is holy ground.”

JFA.text: Disse mais: Eu sou o Deus de teu pai, o Deus de Abraão, o Deus de Isaque, e o Deus de Jacó. E Moisés escondeu o rosto, porque temeu olhar para Deus.

RVA.text: Y dijo: Yo soy el Dios de tu padre, Dios de Abraham, Dios de Isaac, Dios de Jacob. Entonces Moisés cubrió su rostro, porque tuvo miedo de mirar á Dios.

KJV.text: Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face; for he was afraid to look upon God.

WEBM.text: Moreover he said, “I am the God of your father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” Moses hid his face because he was afraid to look at God.

JFA.text: Então disse o Senhor: Com efeito tenho visto a aflição do meu povo, que está no Egito, e tenho ouvido o seu clamor por causa dos seus exatores, porque conheço os seus sofrimentos;

RVA.text: Y dijo Jehová: Bien he visto la aflicción de mi pueblo que está en Egipto, y he oído su clamor á causa de sus exactores; pues tengo conocidas sus angustias:

KJV.text: And the Lord said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people which are in Egypt, and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for I know their sorrows;

WEBM.text: The Lord said, “I have surely seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt, and have heard their cry because of their taskmasters, for I know their sorrows.

JFA.text: E desci para o livrar da mão dos egípcios, e para o fazer subir daquela terra para uma terra boa e espaçosa, para uma terra que mana leite e mel; para o lugar do cananeu, do heteu, do amorreu, do perizeu, do heveu e do jebuseu.

RVA.text: Y he descendido para librarlos de mano de los Egipcios, y sacarlos de aquella tierra á una tierra buena y ancha, á tierra que fluye leche y miel, á los lugares del Cananeo, del Hetheo, del Amorrheo, del Pherezeo, del Heveo, y del Jebuseo.

KJV.text: And I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

WEBM.text: I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land to a good and large land, to a land flowing with milk and honey; to the place of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.

JFA.text: E agora, eis que o clamor dos filhos de Israel é vindo a mim; e também tenho visto a opressão com que os egípcios os oprimem.

RVA.text: El clamor, pues, de los hijos de Israel ha venido delante de mí, y también he visto la opresión con que los Egipcios los oprimen.

KJV.text: Now therefore, behold, the cry of the children of Israel is come unto me: and I have also seen the oppression wherewith the Egyptians oppress them.

WEBM.text: Now, behold, the cry of the children of Israel has come to me. Moreover I have seen the oppression with which the Egyptians oppress them.

JFA.text: Agora, pois, vem e eu te enviarei a Faraó, para que tireis do Egito o meu povo, os filhos de Israel.

RVA.text: Ven por tanto ahora, y enviarte he á Faraón, para que saques á mi pueblo, los hijos de Israel, de Egipto.

KJV.text: Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.

WEBM.text: Come now therefore, and I will send you to Pharaoh, that you may bring my people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt.”

JFA.text: Então Moisés disse a Deus: Quem sou eu, para que vá a Faraó e tire do Egito os filhos de Israel?

RVA.text: Entonces Moisés respondió á Dios: ¿Quién soy yo, para que vaya á Faraón, y saque de Egipto á los hijos de Israel?

KJV.text: And Moses said unto God, Who am I, that I should go unto Pharaoh, and that I should bring forth the children of Israel out of Egypt?

WEBM.text: Moses said to God, “Who am I, that I should go to Pharaoh, and that I should bring the children of Israel out of Egypt?”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Deus: Certamente eu serei contigo; e isto te será por sinal de que eu te enviei: Quando houveres tirado do Egito o meu povo, servireis a Deus neste monte.

RVA.text: Y él le respondió: Ve, porque yo seré contigo; y esto te será por señal de que yo te he enviado: luego que hubieres sacado este pueblo de Egipto, serviréis á Dios sobre este monte.

KJV.text: And he said, Certainly I will be with thee; and this shall be a token unto thee, that I have sent thee: When thou hast brought forth the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.

WEBM.text: He said, “Certainly I will be with you. This will be the token to you, that I have sent you: when you have brought the people out of Egypt, you shall serve God on this mountain.”

JFA.text: Então disse Moisés a Deus: Eis que quando eu for aos filhos de Israel, e lhes disser: O Deus de vossos pais me enviou a vós; e eles me perguntarem: Qual é o seu nome? Que lhes direi?

RVA.text: Y dijo Moisés á Dios: He aquí que llego yo á los hijos de Israel, y les digo, El Dios de vuestros padres me ha enviado á vosotros; si ellos me preguntaren: ¿Cuál es su nombre? ¿qué les responderé?

KJV.text: And Moses said unto God, Behold, when I come unto the children of Israel, and shall say unto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you; and they shall say to me, What is his name? what shall I say unto them?

WEBM.text: Moses said to God, “Behold, when I come to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you,’ and they ask me, ‘What is his name?’ what should I tell them?”

JFA.text: E Deus disse mais a Moisés: Assim dirás aos filhos de Israel: O Senhor, o Deus de vossos pais, o Deus de Abraão, o Deus de Isaque, e o Deus de Jacó, me enviou a vós; este é o meu nome eternamente, e este é o meu memorial de geração em geração.

RVA.text: Y dijo más Dios á Moisés: Así dirás á los hijos de Israel: Jehová, el Dios de vuestros padres, el Dios de Abraham, Dios de Isaac y Dios de Jacob, me ha enviado á vosotros. Este es mi nombre para siempre, este es mi memorial por todos los siglos.

KJV.text: And God said moreover unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, the Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath sent me unto you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations.

WEBM.text: God said moreover to Moses, “You shall tell the children of Israel this, ‘The Lord, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you.’ This is my name forever, and this is my memorial to all generations.

JFA.text: Vai, ajunta os anciãos de Israel e dize-lhes: O Senhor, o Deus de vossos pais, o Deus de Abraão, de Isaque e de Jacó, apareceu-me, dizendo: certamente vos tenho visitado e visto o que vos tem sido feito no Egito;

RVA.text: Ve, y junta los ancianos de Israel, y diles: Jehová, el Dios de vuestros padres, el Dios de Abraham, de Isaac, y de Jacob, me apareció, diciendo: De cierto os he visitado, y visto lo que se os hace en Egipto;

KJV.text: Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and say unto them, The Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared unto me, saying, I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt:

WEBM.text: Go and gather the elders of Israel together, and tell them, ‘the Lord, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, has appeared to me, saying, “I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt.

JFA.text: E tenho dito: Far-vos-ei subir da aflição do Egito para a terra do cananeu, do heteu, do amorreu, do perizeu, do heveu e do jebuseu, para uma terra que mana leite e mel.

RVA.text: Y he dicho: Yo os sacaré de la aflicción de Egipto á la tierra del Cananeo, y del Hetheo, y del Amorrheo, y del Pherezeo, y del Heveo, y del Jebuseo, á una tierra que fluye leche y miel.

KJV.text: And I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt unto the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, unto a land flowing with milk and honey.

WEBM.text: I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt to the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, to a land flowing with milk and honey.”’

JFA.text: E ouvirão a tua voz; e ireis, tu e os anciãos de Israel, ao rei do Egito, e dir-lhe-eis: O Senhor, o Deus dos hebreus, encontrou-nos. Agora, pois, deixa-nos ir caminho de três dias para o deserto para que ofereçamos sacrifícios ao Senhor nosso Deus.

RVA.text: Y oirán tu voz; é irás tú, y los ancianos de Israel, al rey de Egipto, y le diréis: Jehová, el Dios de los Hebreos, nos ha encontrado; por tanto nosotros iremos ahora camino de tres días por el desierto, para que sacrifiquemos á Jehová nuestro Dios.

KJV.text: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The Lord God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the Lord our God.

WEBM.text: They will listen to your voice. You shall come, you and the elders of Israel, to the king of Egypt, and you shall tell him, ‘the Lord, the God of the Hebrews, has met with us. Now please let us go three days’ journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the Lord, our God.’

JFA.text: Eu sei, porém, que o rei do Egito não vos deixará ir, a não ser por uma forte mão.

RVA.text: Mas yo sé que el rey de Egipto no os dejará ir sino por mano fuerte.

KJV.text: And I am sure that the king of Egypt will not let you go, no, not by a mighty hand.

WEBM.text: I know that the king of Egypt won’t give you permission to go, no, not by a mighty hand.

JFA.text: Portanto estenderei a minha mão, e ferirei o Egito com todas as minhas maravilhas que farei no meio dele. Depois vos deixará ir.

RVA.text: Empero yo extenderé mi mano, y heriré á Egipto con todas mis maravillas que haré en él, y entonces os dejará ir.

KJV.text: And I will stretch out my hand, and smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go.

WEBM.text: I will reach out my hand and strike Egypt with all my wonders which I will do among them, and after that he will let you go.

JFA.text: E eu darei graça a este povo aos olhos dos egípcios; e acontecerá que, quando sairdes, não saireis vazios.

RVA.text: Y yo daré á este pueblo gracia en los ojos de los Egipcios, para que cuando os partiereis, no salgáis vacíos:

KJV.text: And I will give this people favour in the sight of the Egyptians: and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty.

WEBM.text: I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, and it will happen that when you go, you shall not go empty-handed.

JFA.text: Porque cada mulher pedirá à sua vizinha e à sua hóspeda jóias de prata e jóias de ouro, bem como vestidos, os quais poreis sobre vossos filhos e sobre vossas filhas; assim despojareis os egípcios.

RVA.text: Sino que demandará cada mujer á su vecina y á su huéspeda vasos de plata, vasos de oro, y vestidos: los cuales pondréis sobre vuestros hijos y vuestras hijas, y despojaréis á Egipto.

KJV.text: But every woman shall borrow of her neighbour, and of her that sojourneth in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your daughters; and ye shall spoil the Egyptians.

WEBM.text: But every woman shall ask of her neighbor, and of her who visits her house, jewels of silver, jewels of gold, and clothing. You shall put them on your sons, and on your daughters. You shall plunder the Egyptians.”

JFA.text: Então Faraó chamou Moisés e Arão de noite, e disse: Levantai-vos, saí do meio do meu povo, tanto vós como os filhos de Israel; e ide servir ao Senhor, como tendes dito.

RVA.text: E hizo llamar á Moisés y á Aarón de noche, y díjoles: Salid de en medio de mi pueblo vosotros, y los hijos de Israel; é id, servid á Jehová, como habéis dicho.

KJV.text: And he called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, Rise up, and get you forth from among my people, both ye and the children of Israel; and go, serve the Lord, as ye have said.

WEBM.text: He called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, “Rise up, get out from among my people, both you and the children of Israel; and go, serve the Lord, as you have said!

JFA.text: Levai também convosco os vossos rebanhos e o vosso gado, como tendes dito; e ide, e abençoai-me também a mim.

RVA.text: Tomad también vuestras ovejas y vuestras vacas, como habéis dicho, é idos; y bendecidme también á mí.

KJV.text: Also take your flocks and your herds, as ye have said, and be gone; and bless me also.

WEBM.text: Take both your flocks and your herds, as you have said, and be gone; and bless me also!”

JFA.text: E os egípcios apertavam ao povo, e apressando-se por lançá-los da terra; porque diziam: Estamos todos mortos.

RVA.text: Y los Egipcios apremiaban al pueblo, dándose priesa á echarlos de la tierra; porque decían: Todos somos muertos.

KJV.text: And the Egyptians were urgent upon the people, that they might send them out of the land in haste; for they said, We be all dead men.

WEBM.text: The Egyptians were urgent with the people, to send them out of the land in haste, for they said, “We are all dead men.”

JFA.text: Ao que o povo tomou a massa, antes que ela levedasse, e as amassadeiras atadas e em seus vestidos, sobre os ombros.

RVA.text: Y llevó el pueblo su masa antes que se leudase, sus masas envueltas en sus sábanas sobre sus hombros.

KJV.text: And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneadingtroughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.

WEBM.text: The people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading troughs being bound up in their clothes on their shoulders.

JFA.text: Fizeram, pois, os filhos de Israel conforme a palavra de Moisés, e pediram aos egípcios jóias de prata, e jóias de ouro, e vestidos.

RVA.text: E hicieron los hijos de Israel conforme al mandamiento de Moisés, demandando á los Egipcios vasos de plata, y vasos de oro, y vestidos.

KJV.text: And the children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they borrowed of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment:

WEBM.text: The children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing.

JFA.text: E o Senhor deu ao povo graça aos olhos dos egípcios, de modo que estes lhe davam o que pedia; e despojaram aos egipcios.

RVA.text: Y Jehová dió gracia al pueblo delante de los Egipcios, y prestáronles; y ellos despojaron á los Egipcios.

KJV.text: And the Lord gave the people favour in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they lent unto them such things as they required. And they spoiled the Egyptians.

WEBM.text: The Lord gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have what they asked. They plundered the Egyptians.

JFA.text: Assim viajaram os filhos de Israel de a Ramessés a Sucote, cerca de seiscentos mil homens de pé, sem contar as crianças.

RVA.text: Y partieron los hijos de Israel de Rameses á Succoth, como seiscientos mil hombres de á pie, sin contar los niños.

KJV.text: And the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand on foot that were men, beside children.

WEBM.text: The children of Israel traveled from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand on foot who were men, in addition to children.

JFA.text: Também subiu com eles uma grande mistura de gente; e, em rebanhos e manadas, uma grande quantidade de gado.

RVA.text: Y también subió con ellos grande multitud de diversa suerte de gentes; y ovejas, y ganados muy muchos.

KJV.text: And a mixed multitude went up also with them; and flocks, and herds, even very much cattle.

WEBM.text: A mixed multitude went up also with them, with flocks, herds, and even very much livestock.

JFA.text: E cozeram bolos ázimos da massa que levaram do Egito, porque ela não se tinha levedado, porquanto foram lançados do Egito; e não puderam deter-se, nem haviam preparado comida.

RVA.text: Y cocieron tortas sin levadura de la masa que habían sacado de Egipto; porque no había leudado, por cuanto echándolos los Egipcios, no habían podido detenerse, ni aun prepararse comida.

KJV.text: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt, for it was not leavened; because they were thrust out of Egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any victual.

WEBM.text: They baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought out of Egypt; for it wasn’t leavened, because they were thrust out of Egypt, and couldn’t wait, and they had not prepared any food for themselves.

JFA.text: Ora, o tempo que os filhos de Israel moraram no Egito foi de quatrocentos e trinta anos.

RVA.text: El tiempo que los hijos de Israel habitaron en Egipto, fué cuatrocientos treinta años.

KJV.text: Now the sojourning of the children of Israel, who dwelt in Egypt, was four hundred and thirty years.

WEBM.text: Now the time that the children of Israel lived in Egypt was four hundred thirty years.

JFA.text: E aconteceu que, ao fim de quatrocentos e trinta anos, naquele mesmo dia, todos os exércitos do Senhor saíram da terra do Egito.

RVA.text: Y pasados cuatrocientos treinta años, en el mismo día salieron todos los ejércitos de Jehová de la tierra de Egipto.

KJV.text: And it came to pass at the end of the four hundred and thirty years, even the selfsame day it came to pass, that all the hosts of the Lord went out from the land of Egypt.

WEBM.text: At the end of four hundred thirty years, to the day, all of the Lord's armies went out from the land of Egypt.

JFA.text: Esta é uma noite que se deve guardar ao Senhor, porque os tirou da terra do Egito; esta é a noite do Senhor, que deve ser guardada por todos os filhos de Israel através das suas gerações.

RVA.text: Es noche de guardar á Jehová, por haberlos sacado en ella de la tierra de Egipto. Esta noche deben guardar á Jehová todos los hijos de Israel en sus generaciones.

KJV.text: It is a night to be much observed unto the Lord for bringing them out from the land of Egypt: this is that night of the Lord to be observed of all the children of Israel in their generations.

WEBM.text: It is a night to be much observed to the Lord for bringing them out from the land of Egypt. This is that night of the Lord, to be much observed by all the children of Israel throughout their generations.

JFA.text: Disse mais o Senhor a Moisés e a Arão: Esta é a ordenança da páscoa; nenhum, estrangeiro comerá dela;

RVA.text: Y Jehová dijo á Moisés y á Aarón: Esta es la ordenanza de la Pascua: Ningún extraño comerá de ella:

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Moses and Aaron, This is the ordinance of the passover: There shall no stranger eat thereof:

WEBM.text: The Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “This is the ordinance of the Passover. No foreigner shall eat of it.

JFA.text: Mas todo escravo comprado por dinheiro, depois que o houveres circuncidado, comerá dela.

RVA.text: Mas todo siervo humano comprado por dinero, comerá de ella después que lo hubieres circuncidado.

KJV.text: But every man's servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat thereof.

WEBM.text: But every man’s servant who is bought for money, when you have circumcised him, then shall he eat of it.

JFA.text: O forasteiro e o assalariado não comerão dela.

RVA.text: El extranjero y el asalariado no comerán de ella.

KJV.text: A foreigner and an hired servant shall not eat thereof.

WEBM.text: A foreigner and a hired servant shall not eat of it.

JFA.text: Numa só casa se comerá o cordeiro; não levareis daquela carne fora da casa nem lhe quebrareis osso algum.

RVA.text: En una casa se comerá, y no llevarás de aquella carne fuera de casa, ni quebraréis hueso suyo.

KJV.text: In one house shall it be eaten; thou shalt not carry forth ought of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall ye break a bone thereof.

WEBM.text: It must be eaten in one house. You shall not carry any of the meat outside of the house. Do not break any of its bones.

JFA.text: Toda a congregação de Israel a observará.

RVA.text: Toda la congregación de Israel le sacrificará.

KJV.text: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.

WEBM.text: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.

JFA.text: Quando, porém, algum estrangeiro peregrinar entre vós e quiser celebrar a páscoa ao Senhor, circuncidem-se todos os seus varões; então se chegará e a celebrará, e será como o natural da terra; mas nenhum incircunciso comerá dela.

RVA.text: Mas si algún extranjero peregrinare contigo, y quisiere hacer la pascua á Jehová, séale circuncidado todo varón, y entonces se llegará á hacerla, y será como el natural de la tierra; pero ningún incircunciso comerá de ella.

KJV.text: And when a stranger shall sojourn with thee, and will keep the passover to the Lord, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as one that is born in the land: for no uncircumcised person shall eat thereof.

WEBM.text: When a stranger lives as a foreigner with you, and would like to keep the Passover to the Lord, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it. He shall be as one who is born in the land; but no uncircumcised person shall eat of it.

JFA.text: Haverá uma mesma lei para o natural e para o estrangeiro que peregrinar entre vós.

RVA.text: La misma ley será para el natural y para el extranjero que peregrinare entre vosotros.

KJV.text: One law shall be to him that is homeborn, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among you.

WEBM.text: One law shall be to him who is born at home, and to the stranger who lives as a foreigner among you.”

JFA.text: Assim, pois, fizeram todos os filhos de Israel; como o Senhor ordenara a Moisés e a Arão, assim fizeram.

RVA.text: Así lo hicieron todos los hijos de Israel; como mandó Jehová á Moisés y á Aarón, así lo hicieron.

KJV.text: Thus did all the children of Israel; as the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.

WEBM.text: All the children of Israel did so. As the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.

JFA.text: E naquele mesmo dia o Senhor tirou os filhos de Israel da terra do Egito, segundo os seus exércitos.

RVA.text: Y en aquel mismo día sacó Jehová á los hijos de Israel de la tierra de Egipto por sus escuadrones.

KJV.text: And it came to pass the selfsame day, that the Lord did bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.

WEBM.text: That same day, the Lord brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.

JFA.text: Fez também Bezaleel a arca de madeira de acácia; o seu comprimento era de dois côvados e meio, a sua largura de um côvado e meio, e a sua altura de um côvado e meio.

RVA.text: Y LA mano de Jehová fué sobre mí, y sacóme en espíritu de Jehová, y púsome en medio de un campo que estaba lleno de huesos.

KJV.text: The hand of the Lord was upon me, and carried me out in the spirit of the Lord, and set me down in the midst of the valley which was full of bones,

WEBM.text: The hand of the Lord was on me, and he brought me out in the Spirit of the Lord, and set me down in the middle of the valley; and it was full of bones.

JFA.text: Cobriu-a de ouro puro por dentro e por fora, fez-lhe uma moldura de ouro ao redor.

RVA.text: E hízome pasar cerca de ellos por todo alrededor: y he aquí que eran muy muchos sobre la haz del campo, y por cierto secos en gran manera.

KJV.text: And caused me to pass by them round about: and, behold, there were very many in the open valley; and, lo, they were very dry.

WEBM.text: He caused me to pass by them all around: and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and behold, they were very dry.

JFA.text: Efundiu-lhe quatro argolas de ouro nos seus quatro cantos, duas argolas num lado e duas no outro.

RVA.text: Y díjome: Hijo del hombre, ¿vivirán estos huesos? Y dije: Señor Jehová, tú lo sabes.

KJV.text: And he said unto me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O Lord God, thou knowest.

WEBM.text: He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” I answered, “O Lord God, you know.”

JFA.text: Também fez varais de madeira de acácia, e os cobriu de ouro.

RVA.text: Díjome entonces: Profetiza sobre estos huesos, y diles: Huesos secos, oid palabra de Jehová.

KJV.text: Again he said unto me, Prophesy upon these bones, and say unto them, O ye dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.

WEBM.text: Again he said to me, “Prophesy over these bones, and tell them, ‘You dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.

JFA.text: E meteu os varais pelas argolas aos lados da arca, para se levar a arca.

RVA.text: Así ha dicho el Señor Jehová á estos huesos: He aquí, yo hago entrar espíritu en vosotros, y viviréis.

KJV.text: Thus saith the Lord God unto these bones; Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and ye shall live:

WEBM.text: The Lord God says to these bones: “Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and you will live.

JFA.text: Fez também um propiciatório de ouro puro; o seu comprimento era de dois côvados e meio, e a sua largura de um côvado e meio.

RVA.text: Y pondré nervios sobre vosotros, y haré subir sobre vosotros carne, y os cubriré de piel, y pondré en vosotros espíritu, y viviréis; y sabréis que yo soy Jehová.

KJV.text: And I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live; and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

WEBM.text: I will lay sinews on you, and will bring up flesh on you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and you will live. Then you will know that I am the Lord.”’”

JFA.text: Fez também dois querubins de ouro; de ouro batido os fez nas duas extremidades do propiciatório.

RVA.text: Profeticé pues, como me fué mandado; y hubo un ruido mientras yo profetizaba, y he aquí un temblor, y los huesos se llegaron cada hueso á su hueso.

KJV.text: So I prophesied as I was commanded: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold a shaking, and the bones came together, bone to his bone.

WEBM.text: So I prophesied as I was commanded. As I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold, there was an earthquake. Then the bones came together, bone to its bone.

JFA.text: Um querubim numa extremidade, e o outro querubim na outra; de uma só peça com o propiciatório fez os querubins nas duas extremidades dele.

RVA.text: Y miré, y he aquí nervios sobre ellos, y la carne subió, y la piel cubrío por encima de ellos: mas no había en ellos espíritu.

KJV.text: And when I beheld, lo, the sinews and the flesh came up upon them, and the skin covered them above: but there was no breath in them.

WEBM.text: I saw, and, behold, there were sinews on them, and flesh came up, and skin covered them above; but there was no breath in them.

JFA.text: E os querubins estendiam as suas asas por cima do propiciatório, cobrindo-o com as asas, tendo as faces voltadas um para o outro; para o propiciatório estavam voltadas as faces dos querubins.

RVA.text: Y díjome: Profetiza al espíritu, profetiza, hijo del hombre, y di al espíritu: Así ha dicho el Señor Jehová: Espíritu, ven de los cuatro vientos, y sopla sobre estos muertos, y vivirán.

KJV.text: Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, Thus saith the Lord God; Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.

WEBM.text: Then he said to me, “Prophesy to the wind, prophesy, son of man, and tell the wind, ‘The Lord God says: “Come from the four winds, breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live.”’”

JFA.text: Fez também a mesa de madeira de acácia; o seu comprimento era de dois côvados, a sua largura de um côvado, e a sua altura de um côvado e meio.

RVA.text: Y profeticé como me había mandado, y entró espíritu en ellos, y vivieron, y estuvieron sobre sus pies, un ejército grande en extremo.

KJV.text: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up upon their feet, an exceeding great army.

WEBM.text: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up on their feet, an exceedingly great army.

JFA.text: Cobriu-a de ouro puro, e fez-lhe uma moldura de ouro ao redor.

RVA.text: Díjome luego: Hijo del hombre, todos estos huesos son la casa de Israel. He aquí, ellos dicen: Nuestros huesos se secaron, y pereció nuestra esperanza, y somos del todo talados.

KJV.text: Then he said unto me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel: behold, they say, Our bones are dried, and our hope is lost: we are cut off for our parts.

WEBM.text: Then he said to me, “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel. Behold, they say, ‘Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost. We are completely cut off.’

JFA.text: Fez-lhe também ao redor uma guarnição de quatro dedos de largura, e ao redor na guarnição fez uma moldura de ouro.

RVA.text: Por tanto profetiza, y diles: Así ha dicho el Señor Jehová: He aquí, yo abro vuestros sepulcros, pueblo mío, y os haré subir de vuestras sepulturas, y os traeré á la tierra de Israel.

KJV.text: Therefore prophesy and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, O my people, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.

WEBM.text: Therefore prophesy, and tell them, ‘The Lord God says: “Behold, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, my people; and I will bring you into the land of Israel.

JFA.text: Fundiu-lhe também nos quatro cantos que estavam sobre os seus quatro pés.

RVA.text: Y sabréis que yo soy Jehová, cuando abriere vuestros sepulcros, y os sacare de vuestras sepulturas, pueblo mío.

KJV.text: And ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I have opened your graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves,

WEBM.text: You will know that I am the Lord, when I have opened your graves, and caused you to come up out of your graves, my people.

JFA.text: Junto da guarnição estavam as argolas para os lugares dos varais, para se levar a mesa.

RVA.text: Y pondré mi espíritu en vosotros, y viviréis, y os haré reposar sobre vuestra tierra; y sabréis que yo Jehová hablé, y lo hice, dice Jehová.

KJV.text: And shall put my spirit in you, and ye shall live, and I shall place you in your own land: then shall ye know that I the Lord have spoken it, and performed it, saith the Lord.

WEBM.text: I will put my Spirit in you, and you will live. Then I will place you in your own land; and you will know that I, the Lord, have spoken it and performed it,” says the Lord.’”

JFA.text: Fez também estes varais de madeira de acácia, e os cobriu de ouro, para se levar a mesa.

RVA.text: Y fué á mí palabra de Jehová, diciendo:

KJV.text: The word of the Lord came again unto me, saying,

WEBM.text: The word of the Lord came again to me, saying,

JFA.text: E de ouro puro fez os utensílios que haviam de estar sobre a mesa, os seus pratos e as suas colheres, as suas tigelas e os seus cântaros, com que se haviam de oferecer as libações.

RVA.text: Tú, hijo del hombre, tómate ahora un palo, y escribe en él: A Judá, y á los hijos de Israel sus compañeros. Toma después otro palo, y escribe en él: A José, palo de Ephraim, y á toda la casa de Israel sus compañeros.

KJV.text: Moreover, thou son of man, take thee one stick, and write upon it, For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write upon it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim and for all the house of Israel his companions:

WEBM.text: “You, son of man, take one stick, and write on it, ‘For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions.’ Then take another stick, and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel his companions.’

JFA.text: Fez também o candelabro de ouro puro; de ouro batido fez o candelabro, tanto o seu pedestal como a sua haste; os seus copos, os seus cálices e as suas corolas formavam com ele uma só peça.

RVA.text: Júntalos luego el uno con el otro, para que sean en uno, y serán uno en tu mano.

KJV.text: And join them one to another into one stick; and they shall become one in thine hand.

WEBM.text: Then join them for yourself to one another into one stick, that they may become one in your hand.

JFA.text: Dos seus lados saíam seis braços: três de um lado do candelabro e três do outro lado.

RVA.text: Y cuando te hablaren los hijos de tu pueblo, diciendo: ¿No nos enseñarás qué te propones con eso?

KJV.text: And when the children of thy people shall speak unto thee, saying, Wilt thou not shew us what thou meanest by these?

WEBM.text: “When the children of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Won’t you show us what you mean by these?’

JFA.text: Em um braço havia três copos a modo de flores de amêndoa, com cálice e corola; igualmente no outro braço três copos a modo de flores de amêndoa, com cálice e corola; assim se fez com os seis braços que saíam do candelabro.

RVA.text: Diles: Así ha dicho el Señor Jehová: He aquí, yo tomo el palo de José que está en la mano de Ephraim, y á las tribus de Israel sus compañeros, y pondrélos con él, con el palo de Judá, y harélos un palo, y serán uno en mi mano.

KJV.text: Say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his fellows, and will put them with him, even with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they shall be one in mine hand.

WEBM.text: Tell them, ‘The Lord God says: “Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his companions; and I will put them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in my hand.

JFA.text: Mas na haste central havia quatro copos a modo de flores de amêndoa, com os seus cálices e as suas corolas.

RVA.text: Y los palos sobre que escribieres, estarán en tu mano delante de sus ojos;

KJV.text: And the sticks whereon thou writest shall be in thine hand before their eyes.

WEBM.text: The sticks on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.”’

JFA.text: Também havia um cálice debaixo de dois braços, formando com a haste uma só peça, e outro cálice debaixo de dois outros braços, de uma só peça com a haste, e ainda outro cálice debaixo de dois outros braços, de uma só peça com a haste; e assim se fez para os seis braços que saíam da haste.

RVA.text: Y les dirás: Así ha dicho el Señor Jehová: He aquí, yo tomo á los hijos de Israel de entre las gentes á las cuales fueron, y los juntaré de todas partes, y los traeré á su tierra:

KJV.text: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the heathen, whither they be gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land:

WEBM.text: Say to them, ‘The Lord God says: “Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the nations, where they have gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land.

JFA.text: Os seus cálices e os seus braços formavam uma só peça com a haste; o todo era uma obra batida de ouro puro.

RVA.text: Y los haré una nación en la tierra, en los montes de Israel; y un rey será á todos ellos por rey: y nunca más serán dos naciones, ni nunca más serán divididos en dos reinos:

KJV.text: And I will make them one nation in the land upon the mountains of Israel; and one king shall be king to them all: and they shall be no more two nations, neither shall they be divided into two kingdoms any more at all.

WEBM.text: I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel. One king will be king to them all. They will no longer be two nations. They won’t be divided into two kingdoms any more at all.

JFA.text: Também de ouro puro lhe fez as lâmpadas, em número de sete, com os seus espevitadores e os seus cinzeiros.

RVA.text: Ni más se contaminarán con sus ídolos, y con sus abominaciones, y con todas sus rebeliones: y los salvaré de todas sus habitaciones en las cuales pecaron, y los limpiaré; y me serán por pueblo, y yo á ellos por Dios.

KJV.text: Neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions: but I will save them out of all their dwellingplaces, wherein they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people, and I will be their God.

WEBM.text: They won’t defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but I will save them out of all their dwelling places, in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. So they will be my people, and I will be their God.

JFA.text: De um talento de ouro puro fez o candelabro e todos os seus utensilios.

RVA.text: Y mi siervo David será rey sobre ellos, y á todos ellos será un pastor: y andarán en mis derechos, y mis ordenanzas guardarán, y las pondrán por obra.

KJV.text: And David my servant shall be king over them; and they all shall have one shepherd: they shall also walk in my judgments, and observe my statutes, and do them.

WEBM.text: “‘“My servant David will be king over them. They all will have one shepherd. They will also walk in my ordinances, and observe my statutes, and do them.

JFA.text: De madeira de acácia fez o altar do incenso; de um côvado era o seu comprimento, e de um côvado a sua largura, quadrado, e de dois côvados a sua altura; as suas pontas formavam uma só peça com ele.

RVA.text: Y habitarán en la tierra que dí á mi siervo Jacob, en la cual habitaron vuestros padres, en ella habitarán ellos, y sus hijos, y los hijos de sus hijos para siempre; y mi siervo David les será príncipe para siempre.

KJV.text: And they shall dwell in the land that I have given unto Jacob my servant, wherein your fathers have dwelt; and they shall dwell therein, even they, and their children, and their children's children for ever: and my servant David shall be their prince for ever.

WEBM.text: They will dwell in the land that I have given to Jacob my servant, in which your fathers lived. They will dwell therein, they, and their children, and their children’s children, forever. David my servant will be their prince forever.

JFA.text: Cobriu-o de ouro puro, tanto a face superior como as suas paredes ao redor, e as suas pontas, e fez-lhe uma moldura de ouro ao redor.

RVA.text: Y concertaré con ellos pacto de paz, perpetuo pacto será con ellos: y los asentaré, y los multiplicaré, y pondré mi santuario entre ellos para siempre.

KJV.text: Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them: and I will place them, and multiply them, and will set my sanctuary in the midst of them for evermore.

WEBM.text: Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them. It will be an everlasting covenant with them. I will place them, multiply them, and will set my sanctuary among them forever more.

JFA.text: Fez-lhe também duas argolas de ouro debaixo da sua moldura, nos dois cantos de ambos os lados, como lugares dos varais, para com eles se levar o altar.

RVA.text: Y estará en ellos mi tabernáculo, y seré á ellos por Dios, y ellos me serán por pueblo.

KJV.text: My tabernacle also shall be with them: yea, I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

WEBM.text: My tent also will be with them. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

JFA.text: E os varais fez de madeira de acácia, e os cobriu de ouro.

RVA.text: Y sabrán las gentes que yo Jehová santifico á Israel, estando mi santuario entre ellos para siempre.

KJV.text: And the heathen shall know that I the Lord do sanctify Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them for evermore.

WEBM.text: The nations will know that I am the Lord who sanctifies Israel, when my sanctuary is among them forever more.”’”

JFA.text: Tornou a dar à luz a um filho - a seu irmão Abel. Abel foi pastor de ovelhas, e Caim foi lavrador da terra.

RVA.text: Y después parió á su hermano Abel. Y fué Abel pastor de ovejas, y Caín fué labrador de la tierra.

KJV.text: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
