WEBM.text: Again she gave birth, to Cain’s brother Abel. Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

JFA.text: Ao cabo de dias trouxe Caim do fruto da terra uma oferta ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Y aconteció andando el tiempo, que Caín trajo del fruto de la tierra una ofrenda á Jehová.

KJV.text: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the Lord.

WEBM.text: As time passed, Cain brought an offering to the Lord from the fruit of the ground.

JFA.text: Abel também trouxe dos primogênitos das suas ovelhas, e da sua gordura. Ora, atentou o Senhor para Abel e para a sua oferta.

RVA.text: Y Abel trajo también de los primogénitos de sus ovejas, y de su grosura. Y miró Jehová con agrado á Abel y á su ofrenda;

KJV.text: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the Lord had respect unto Abel and to his offering:

WEBM.text: Abel also brought some of the firstborn of his flock and of its fat. the Lord respected Abel and his offering.

JFA.text: Mas para Caim e para a sua oferta não atentou. Pelo que irou-se Caim fortemente, e descaiu-lhe o semblante.

RVA.text: Mas no miró propicio á Caín y á la ofrenda suya. Y ensañóse Caín en gran manera, y decayó su semblante.

KJV.text: But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.

WEBM.text: But he didn’t respect Cain and his offering. Cain was very angry, and the expression on his face fell.

JFA.text: Então o Senhor perguntou a Caim: Por que te iraste? e por que está descaído o teu semblante?

RVA.text: Entonces Jehová dijo á Caín: ¿Por qué te has ensañado, y por qué se ha inmutado tu rostro?

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?

WEBM.text: The Lord said to Cain, “Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?

JFA.text: Porventura se procederes bem, não se há de levantar o teu semblante? e se não procederes bem, o pecado jaz à porta, e sobre ti será o seu desejo; mas sobre ele tu deves dominar.

RVA.text: Si bien hicieres, ¿no serás ensalzado? y si no hicieres bien, el pecado está á la puerta: con todo esto, á ti será su deseo, y tú te enseñorearás de él.

KJV.text: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

WEBM.text: If you do well, won’t it be lifted up? If you don’t do well, sin crouches at the door. Its desire is for you, but you are to rule over it.”

JFA.text: Falou Caim com o seu irmão Abel. E, estando eles no campo, Caim se levantou contra o seu irmão Abel, e o matou.

RVA.text: Y habló Caín á su hermano Abel: y aconteció que estando ellos en el campo, Caín se levantó contra su hermano Abel, y le mató.

KJV.text: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.

WEBM.text: Cain said to Abel, his brother, “Let’s go into the field.” While they were in the field, Cain rose up against Abel, his brother, and killed him.

JFA.text: Perguntou, pois, o Senhor a Caim: Onde está Abel, teu irmão? Respondeu ele: Não sei; sou eu o guarda do meu irmão?

RVA.text: Y Jehová dijo á Caín: ¿Dónde está Abel tu hermano? Y él respondió: No sé; ¿soy yo guarda de mi hermano?

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: Am I my brother's keeper?

WEBM.text: The Lord said to Cain, “Where is Abel, your brother?” He said, “I don’t know. Am I my brother’s keeper?”

JFA.text: E disse Deus: Que fizeste? A voz do sangue de teu irmão está clamando a mim desde a terra.

RVA.text: Y él le dijo: ¿Qué has hecho? La voz de la sangre de tu hermano clama á mí desde la tierra.

KJV.text: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.

WEBM.text: The Lord said, “What have you done? The voice of your brother’s blood cries to me from the ground.

JFA.text: Agora maldito és tu desde a terra, que abriu a sua boca para da tua mão receber o sangue de teu irmão.

RVA.text: Ahora pues, maldito seas tú de la tierra que abrió su boca para recibir la sangre de tu hermano de tu mano:

KJV.text: And now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;

WEBM.text: Now you are cursed because of the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.

JFA.text: Quando lavrares a terra, não te dará mais a sua força; fugitivo e vagabundo serás na terra.

RVA.text: Cuando labrares la tierra, no te volverá á dar su fuerza: errante y extranjero serás en la tierra.

KJV.text: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

WEBM.text: From now on, when you till the ground, it won’t yield its strength to you. You will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth.”

JFA.text: Então disse Caim ao Senhor: É maior a minha punição do que a que eu possa suportar.

RVA.text: Y dijo Caín á Jehová: Grande es mi iniquidad para ser perdonada.

KJV.text: And Cain said unto the Lord, My punishment is greater than I can bear.

WEBM.text: Cain said to the Lord, “My punishment is greater than I can bear.

JFA.text: Eis que hoje me lanças da face da terra; também da tua presença ficarei escondido; serei fugitivo e vagabundo na terra; e qualquer que me encontrar matar-me-á.

RVA.text: He aquí me echas hoy de la faz de la tierra, y de tu presencia me esconderé; y seré errante y extranjero en la tierra; y sucederá que cualquiera que me hallare, me matará.

KJV.text: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that every one that findeth me shall slay me.

WEBM.text: Behold, you have driven me out today from the surface of the ground. I will be hidden from your face, and I will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth. Whoever finds me will kill me.”

JFA.text: O Senhor, porém, lhe disse: Portanto quem matar a Caim, sete vezes sobre ele cairá a vingança. E pôs o Senhor um sinal em Caim, para que não o ferisse quem quer que o encontrasse.

RVA.text: Y respondióle Jehová: Cierto que cualquiera que matare á Caín, siete veces será castigado. Entonces Jehová puso señal en Caín, para que no lo hiriese cualquiera que le hallara.

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the Lord set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.

WEBM.text: The Lord said to him, “Therefore whoever slays Cain, vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold.” The Lord appointed a sign for Cain, so that anyone finding him would not strike him.

JFA.text: Então saiu Caim da presença do Senhor, e habitou na terra de Node, ao oriente do Éden.

RVA.text: Y salió Caín de delante de Jehová, y habitó en tierra de Nod, al oriente de Edén.

KJV.text: And Cain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

WEBM.text: Cain left the Lord’s presence, and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.

JFA.text: Prosseguiu Deus: Toma agora teu filho; o teu único filho, Isaque, a quem amas; vai à terra de Moriá, e oferece-o ali em holocausto sobre um dos montes que te hei de mostrar.

RVA.text: Y dijo: Toma ahora tu hijo, tu único, Isaac, á quien amas, y vete á tierra de Moriah, y ofrécelo allí en holocausto sobre uno de los montes que yo te diré.

KJV.text: And he said, Take now thy son, thine only son Isaac, whom thou lovest, and get thee into the land of Moriah; and offer him there for a burnt offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of.

WEBM.text: He said, “Now take your son, your only son, Isaac, whom you love, and go into the land of Moriah. Offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains which I will tell you of.”

JFA.text: Levantou-se, pois, Abraão de manhã cedo, albardou o seu jumento, e tomou consigo dois de seus moços e Isaque, seu filho; e, tendo cortado lenha para o holocausto, partiu para ir ao lugar que Deus lhe dissera.

RVA.text: Y Abraham se levantó muy de mañana, y enalbardó su asno, y tomó consigo dos mozos suyos, y á Isaac su hijo: y cortó leña para el holocausto, y levantóse, y fué al lugar que Dios le dijo.

KJV.text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son, and clave the wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went unto the place of which God had told him.

WEBM.text: Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled his donkey; and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went to the place of which God had told him.

JFA.text: Ao terceiro dia levantou Abraão os olhos, e viu o lugar de longe.

RVA.text: Al tercer día alzó Abraham sus ojos, y vió el lugar de lejos.

KJV.text: Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off.

WEBM.text: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place far off.

JFA.text: E disse Abraão a seus moços: Ficai-vos aqui com o jumento, e eu e o mancebo iremos até lá; depois de adorarmos, voltaremos a vós.

RVA.text: Entonces dijo Abraham á sus mozos: Esperaos aquí con el asno, y yo y el muchacho iremos hasta allí, y adoraremos, y volveremos á vosotros.

KJV.text: And Abraham said unto his young men, Abide ye here with the ass; and I and the lad will go yonder and worship, and come again to you.

WEBM.text: Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey. The boy and I will go over there. We will worship, and come back to you.”

JFA.text: Tomou, pois, Abraão a lenha do holocausto e a pôs sobre Isaque, seu filho; tomou também na mão o fogo e o cutelo, e foram caminhando juntos.

RVA.text: Y tomó Abraham la leña del holocausto, y púsola sobre Isaac su hijo: y él tomó en su mano el fuego y el cuchillo; y fueron ambos juntos.

KJV.text: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering, and laid it upon Isaac his son; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife; and they went both of them together.

WEBM.text: Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. He took in his hand the fire and the knife. They both went together.

JFA.text: Então disse Isaque a Abraão, seu pai: Meu pai! Respondeu Abraão: Eis-me aqui, meu filho! Perguntou-lhe Isaque: Eis o fogo e a lenha, mas onde está o cordeiro para o holocausto?

RVA.text: Entonces habló Isaac á Abraham su padre, y dijo: Padre mío. Y él respondió: Heme aquí, mi hijo. Y él dijo: He aquí el fuego y la leña; mas ¿dónde está el cordero para el holocausto?

KJV.text: And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood: but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?

WEBM.text: Isaac spoke to Abraham his father, and said, “My father?” He said, “Here I am, my son.” He said, “Here is the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?”

JFA.text: Respondeu Abraão: Deus proverá para si o cordeiro para o holocausto, meu filho. E os dois iam caminhando juntos.

RVA.text: Y respondió Abraham: Dios se proveerá de cordero para el holocausto, hijo mío. E iban juntos.

KJV.text: And Abraham said, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering: so they went both of them together.

WEBM.text: Abraham said, “God will provide himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son.” So they both went together.

JFA.text: Havendo eles chegado ao lugar que Deus lhe dissera, edificou Abraão ali o altar e pôs a lenha em ordem; o amarrou, a Isaque, seu filho, e o deitou sobre o altar em cima da lenha.

RVA.text: Y como llegaron al lugar que Dios le había dicho, edificó allí Abraham un altar, y compuso la leña, y ató á Isaac su hijo, y púsole en el altar sobre la leña.

KJV.text: And they came to the place which God had told him of; and Abraham built an altar there, and laid the wood in order, and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar upon the wood.

WEBM.text: They came to the place which God had told him of. Abraham built the altar there, and laid the wood in order, bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, on the wood.

JFA.text: E, estendendo a mão, pegou no cutelo para imolar a seu filho.

RVA.text: Y extendió Abraham su mano, y tomó el cuchillo, para degollar á su hijo.

KJV.text: And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his son.

WEBM.text: Abraham stretched out his hand, and took the knife to kill his son.

JFA.text: Mas o anjo do Senhor lhe bradou desde o céu, e disse: Abraão, Abraão! Ele respondeu: Eis-me aqui.

RVA.text: Entonces el ángel de Jehová le dió voces del cielo, y dijo: Abraham, Abraham. Y él respondió: Heme aquí.

KJV.text: And the angel of the Lord called unto him out of heaven, and said, Abraham, Abraham: and he said, Here am I.

WEBM.text: The angel of the Lord called to him out of the sky, and said, “Abraham, Abraham!” He said, “Here I am.”

JFA.text: Então disse o anjo: Não estendas a mão sobre o mancebo, e não lhe faças nada; porquanto agora sei que temes a Deus, visto que não me negaste teu filho, o teu único filho.

RVA.text: Y dijo: No extiendas tu mano sobre el muchacho, ni le hagas nada; que ya conozco que temes á Dios, pues que no me rehusaste tu hijo, tu único;

KJV.text: And he said, Lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing thou hast not withheld thy son, thine only son from me.

WEBM.text: He said, “Don’t lay your hand on the boy or do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your only son, from me.”

JFA.text: Nisso levantou Abraão os olhos e olhou, e eis atrás de si um carneiro embaraçado pelos chifres no mato; e foi Abraão, tomou o carneiro e o ofereceu em holocausto em lugar de seu filho.

RVA.text: Entonces alzó Abraham sus ojos, y miró, y he aquí un carnero á sus espaldas trabado en un zarzal por sus cuernos: y fué Abraham, y tomó el carnero, y ofrecióle en holocausto en lugar de su hijo.

KJV.text: And Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns: and Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son.

WEBM.text: Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and saw that behind him was a ram caught in the thicket by his horns. Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering instead of his son.

JFA.text: Pelo que chamou Abraão àquele lugar Jeová-Jiré; donde se diz até o dia de hoje: No monte do Senhor se proverá.

RVA.text: Y llamó Abraham el nombre de aquel lugar, Jehová proveerá. Por tanto se dice hoy: En el monte de Jehová será provisto.

KJV.text: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovahjireh: as it is said to this day, In the mount of the Lord it shall be seen.

WEBM.text: Abraham called the name of that place “The Lord Will Provide”. As it is said to this day, “On the Lord’s mountain, it will be provided.”

JFA.text: Então o anjo do Senhor bradou a Abraão pela segunda vez desde o céu.

RVA.text: Y llamó el ángel de Jehová á Abraham segunda vez desde el cielo,

KJV.text: And the angel of the Lord called unto Abraham out of heaven the second time,

WEBM.text: The angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time out of the sky.

JFA.text: E disse: Por mim mesmo jurei, diz o Senhor, porquanto fizeste isto, e não me negaste teu filho, o teu único filho.

RVA.text: Y dijo: Por mí mismo he jurado, dice Jehová, que por cuanto has hecho esto, y no me has rehusado tu hijo, tu único;

KJV.text: And said, By myself have I sworn, saith the Lord, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son:

WEBM.text: And said, “‘I have sworn by myself,’ says the Lord, ‘because you have done this thing, and have not withheld your son, your only son.

JFA.text: Que deveras te abençoarei, e grandemente multiplicarei a tua descendência, como as estrelas do céu e como a areia que está na praia do mar; e a tua descendência possuirá a porta dos seus inimigos.

RVA.text: Bendiciendo te bendeciré, y multiplicando multiplicaré tu simiente como las estrellas del cielo, y como la arena que está á la orilla del mar; y tu simiente poseerá las puertas de sus enemigos:

KJV.text: That in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies;

WEBM.text: That I will bless you greatly, and I will multiply your offspring greatly like the stars of the heavens, and like the sand which is on the seashore. Your offspring will possess the gate of his enemies.

JFA.text: E em tua descendência serão benditas todas as nações da terra; porquanto obedeceste à minha voz.

RVA.text: En tu simiente serán benditas todas las gentes de la tierra, por cuanto obedeciste á mi voz.

KJV.text: And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.

WEBM.text: All the nations of the earth will be blessed by your offspring, because you have obeyed my voice.’”

JFA.text: Depois de muitos dias veio a Elias a palavra do Senhor, no terceiro ano, dizendo: Vai, apresenta-te a Acabe; e eu mandarei chuva sobre a terra.

RVA.text: Pasados muchos días, fué palabra de Jehová á Elías en el tercer año, diciendo: Ve, muéstrate á Achâb, y yo daré lluvia sobre la haz de la tierra.

KJV.text: And it came to pass after many days, that the word of the Lord came to Elijah in the third year, saying, Go, shew thyself unto Ahab; and I will send rain upon the earth.

WEBM.text: After many days, the Lord’s word came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, “Go, show yourself to Ahab; and I will send rain on the earth.”

JFA.text: Então Elias foi apresentar-se a Acabe. E a fome era extrema em Samária.

RVA.text: Fué pues Elías á mostrarse á Achâb. Había á la sazón grande hambre en Samaria.

KJV.text: And Elijah went to shew himself unto Ahab. And there was a sore famine in Samaria.

WEBM.text: Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. The famine was severe in Samaria.

JFA.text: Acabe chamou a Obadias, o mordomo (ora, Obadias temia muito ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Y Achâb llamó á Abdías su mayordomo, el cual Abdías era en grande manera temeroso de Jehová;

KJV.text: And Ahab called Obadiah, which was the governor of his house. (Now Obadiah feared the Lord greatly:

WEBM.text: Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared the Lord greatly.)

JFA.text: Pois sucedeu que, destruindo Jezabel os profetas do Senhor, Obadias tomou cem profetas e os escondeu, cinquenta numa cova e cinquenta noutra, e os sustentou com pão e água).

RVA.text: Porque cuando Jezabel destruía á los profetas de Jehová, Abdías tomó cien profetas, los cuales escondió de cincuenta en cincuenta por cuevas, y sustentólos á pan y agua.

KJV.text: For it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the Lord, that Obadiah took an hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)

WEBM.text: For when Jezebel cut off the Lord’s prophets, Obadiah took one hundred prophets, and hid them fifty to a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)

JFA.text: E disse Acabe a Obadias: Vai pela terra a todas as fontes de água, e a todos os rios. Pode ser ser que achemos erva para salvar a vida dos cavalos e mulas, de maneira que não percamos todos os os animais.

RVA.text: Y dijo Achâb á Abdías: Ve por el país á todas las fuentes de aguas, y á todos los arroyos; que acaso hallaremos grama con que conservemos la vida á los caballos y á las acémilas, para que no nos quedemos sin bestias.

KJV.text: And Ahab said unto Obadiah, Go into the land, unto all fountains of water, and unto all brooks: peradventure we may find grass to save the horses and mules alive, that we lose not all the beasts.

WEBM.text: Ahab said to Obadiah, “Go through the land, to all the springs of water, and to all the brooks. Perhaps we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we not lose all the animals.”

JFA.text: E repartiram entre si a terra, para a percorrerem; e foram a sós, Acabe por um caminho, e Obadias por outro.

RVA.text: Y partieron entre sí el país para recorrerlo: Achâb fué de por sí por un camino, y Abdías fué separadamente por otro.

KJV.text: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.

WEBM.text: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it. Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.

JFA.text: Quando, pois, Obadias já estava em caminho, eis que Elias se encontrou com ele; e Obadias, reconhecendo-o, prostrou-se com o rosto em terra e disse: És tu, meu senhor Elias?

RVA.text: Y yendo Abdías por el camino, topóse con Elías; y como le conoció, postróse sobre su rostro, y dijo: ¿No eres tú mi señor Elías?

KJV.text: And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, Art thou that my lord Elijah?

WEBM.text: As Obadiah was on the way, behold, Elijah met him. He recognized him, and fell on his face, and said, “Is it you, my lord Elijah?”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe ele: Sou eu. Vai, dize a teu senhor: Eis que Elias está aqui.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: Yo soy; ve, di á tu amo: He aquí Elías.

KJV.text: And he answered him, I am: go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.

WEBM.text: He answered him, “It is I. Go, tell your lord, ‘Behold, Elijah is here!’”

JFA.text: Ele, porém, disse: Em que pequei, para que entregues teu servo na mão de Acabe, para ele me matar?

RVA.text: Pero él dijo: ¿En qué he pecado, para que tú entregues tu siervo en mano de Achâb para que me mate?

KJV.text: And he said, What have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me?

WEBM.text: He said, “How have I sinned, that you would deliver your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?

JFA.text: Vive o Senhor teu Deus, que não há nação nem reino aonde o meu senhor não tenha mandado em busca de ti; e dizendo eles: Aqui não está; então fazia-os jurar que não te haviam achado.

RVA.text: Vive Jehová tu Dios, que no ha habido nación ni reino donde mi señor no haya enviado á buscarte; y respondiendo ellos: No está aquí, él ha conjurado á reinos y naciones si no te han hallado.

KJV.text: As the Lord thy God liveth, there is no nation or kingdom, whither my lord hath not sent to seek thee: and when they said, He is not there; he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they found thee not.

WEBM.text: As the Lord your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent to seek you. When they said, ‘He is not here,’ he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they didn’t find you.

JFA.text: Agora tu dizes: Vai, dize a teu senhor: Eis que Elias está aqui.

RVA.text: ¿Y ahora tú dices: Ve, di á tu amo: Aquí está Elías?

KJV.text: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.

WEBM.text: Now you say, ‘Go, tell your lord, “Behold, Elijah is here.”’

JFA.text: E será que, apartando-me eu de ti, o Espírito do Senhor te levará não sei para onde; e, vindo eu dar as novas a Acabe, e não te achando ele, matar-me-á. Todavia eu, teu servo, temo ao Senhor desde a minha mocidade.

RVA.text: Y acontecerá que, luego que yo me haya partido de ti, el espíritu de Jehová te llevará donde yo no sepa; y viniendo yo, y dando las nuevas á Achâb, y no hallándote él, me matará; y tu siervo teme á Jehová desde su mocedad.

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that the Spirit of the Lord shall carry thee whither I know not; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he cannot find thee, he shall slay me: but I thy servant fear the Lord from my youth.

WEBM.text: It will happen, as soon as I leave you, that the Lord’s Spirit will carry you I don’t know where; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he can’t find you, he will kill me. But I, your servant, have feared the Lord from my youth.

JFA.text: Porventura não disseram a meu senhor o que fiz, quando Jezabel matava os profetas do Senhor, como escondi cem dos profetas do Senhor, cinquenta numa cova e cinquenta noutra, e os sustentei com pão e água.

RVA.text: ¿No ha sido dicho á mi señor lo que hice, cuando Jezabel mataba á los profetas de Jehová que escondí cien: varones de los profetas de Jehová: que escondí cien varones de los profetas de Jehová de cincuenta en cincuenta en cuevas, y los mantuve á pan y agua?

KJV.text: Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of the Lord, how I hid an hundred men of the Lord's prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water?

WEBM.text: Wasn’t it told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the Lord’s prophets, how I hid one hundred men of the Lord’s prophets with fifty to a cave, and fed them with bread and water?

JFA.text: E agora tu dizes: Vai, dize a teu senhor: Eis que Elias está aqui! Ele me matará.

RVA.text: ¿Y ahora dices tú: Ve, di á tu amo: Aquí está Elías: para que él me mate?

KJV.text: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here: and he shall slay me.

WEBM.text: Now you say, ‘Go, tell your lord, “Behold, Elijah is here”.’ He will kill me.”

JFA.text: E disse Elias: Vive o Senhor dos exércitos, em cuja presença estou, que dereras hoje hei de apresentar-me a ele.

RVA.text: Y díjole Elías: Vive Jehová de los ejércitos, delante del cual estoy, que hoy me mostraré á él.

KJV.text: And Elijah said, As the Lord of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, I will surely shew myself unto him to day.

WEBM.text: Elijah said, “As the Lord of Armies lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today.”

JFA.text: Então foi Obadias encontrar-se com Acabe, e lho anunciou; e Acabe foi encontrar-se com Elias.

RVA.text: Entonces Abdías fué á encontrarse con Achâb, y dióle el aviso; y Achâb vino á encontrarse con Elías.

KJV.text: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him: and Ahab went to meet Elijah.

WEBM.text: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.

JFA.text: E sucedeu que, vendo Acabe a Elias, disse-lhe: És tu, perturbador de Israel?

RVA.text: Y como Achâb vió á Elías, díjole Achâb: ¿Eres tú el que alborotas á Israel?

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said unto him, Art thou he that troubleth Israel?

WEBM.text: When Ahab saw Elijah, Ahab said to him, “Is that you, you troubler of Israel?”

JFA.text: Respondeu Elias: Não sou eu que tenho perturbado a Israel, mas és tu e a casa de teu pai, por terdes deixado os mandamentos do Senhor, e por teres tu seguido os baalins.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: Yo no he alborotado á Israel, sino tú y la casa de tu padre, dejando los mandamientos de Jehová, y siguiendo á los Baales.

KJV.text: And he answered, I have not troubled Israel; but thou, and thy father's house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of the Lord, and thou hast followed Baalim.

WEBM.text: He answered, “I have not troubled Israel; but you, and your father’s house, in that you have forsaken the Lord’s commandments, and you have followed the Baals.

JFA.text: Agora pois manda reunir-se a mim todo o Israel no monte Carmelo, como também os quatrocentos e cinquenta profetas de Baal, e os quatrocentos profetas de Asera, que comem da mesa de Jezabel.

RVA.text: Envía pues ahora y júntame á todo Israel en el monte de Carmelo, y los cuatrocientos y cincuenta profetas de Baal, y los cuatrocientos profetas de los bosques, que comen de la mesa de Jezabel.

KJV.text: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel unto mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty, and the prophets of the groves four hundred, which eat at Jezebel's table.

WEBM.text: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel to Mount Carmel, and four hundred fifty of the prophets of Baal, and four hundred of the prophets of the Asherah, who eat at Jezebel’s table.”

JFA.text: Então Acabe convocou todos os filhos de Israel, e reuniu os profetas no monte Carmelo.

RVA.text: Entonces Achâb envió á todos los hijos de Israel, y juntó los profetas en el monte de Carmelo.

KJV.text: So Ahab sent unto all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together unto mount Carmel.

WEBM.text: So Ahab sent to all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together to Mount Carmel.

JFA.text: E Elias se chegou a todo o povo, e disse: Até quando coxeareis entre dois pensamentos? Se o Senhor é Deus, segui-o; mas se Baal, segui-o. O povo, porém, não lhe respondeu nada.

RVA.text: Y acercándose Elías á todo el pueblo, dijo: ¿Hasta cuándo claudicaréis vosotros entre dos pensamientos? Si Jehová es Dios, seguidle; y si Baal, id en pos de él. Y el pueblo no respondió palabra.

KJV.text: And Elijah came unto all the people, and said, How long halt ye between two opinions? if the Lord be God, follow him: but if Baal, then follow him. And the people answered him not a word.

WEBM.text: Elijah came near to all the people, and said, “How long will you waver between the two sides? If the Lord is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him.” The people didn’t say a word.

JFA.text: Então disse Elias ao povo: Só eu fiquei dos profetas do Senhor; mas os profetas de Baal são quatrocentos e cinqüenta homens.

RVA.text: Y Elías tornó á decir al pueblo: Sólo yo he quedado profeta de Jehová; mas de los profetas de Baal hay cuatrocientos y cincuenta hombres.

KJV.text: Then said Elijah unto the people, I, even I only, remain a prophet of the Lord; but Baal's prophets are four hundred and fifty men.

WEBM.text: Then Elijah said to the people, “I, even I only, am left as a prophet of the Lord; but Baal’s prophets are four hundred fifty men.

JFA.text: Dêem-se-nos, pois, dois novilhos; e eles escolham para si um dos novilhos, e o dividam em pedaços, e o ponham sobre a lenha, porém não lhe metam fogo; e eu prepararei o outro novilho, e o porei sobre a lenha, e não lhe meterei fogo.

RVA.text: Dénsenos pues dos bueyes, y escójanse ellos el uno, y córtenlo en pedazos, y pónganlo sobre leña, mas no pongan fuego debajo; y yo aprestaré el otro buey, y pondrélo sobre leña, y ningún fuego pondré debajo.

KJV.text: Let them therefore give us two bullocks; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under: and I will dress the other bullock, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under:

WEBM.text: Let them therefore give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under it.

JFA.text: Então invocai o nome do vosso deus, e eu invocarei o nome do Senhor; e há de ser que o deus que responder por meio de fogo, esse será Deus. E todo o povo respondeu, dizendo: É boa esta palavra.

RVA.text: Invocad luego vosotros en el nombre de vuestros dioses, y yo invocaré en el nombre de Jehová: y el Dios que respondiere por fuego, ése sea Dios. Y todo el pueblo respondió, diciendo: Bien dicho.

KJV.text: And call ye on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the Lord: and the God that answereth by fire, let him be God. And all the people answered and said, It is well spoken.

WEBM.text: You call on the name of your god, and I will call on the Lord’s name. The God who answers by fire, let him be God.” All the people answered, “What you say is good.”

JFA.text: Disse, pois, Elias aos profetas de Baal: Escolhei para vós: um dos novilhos, e preparai-o primeiro, porque sois muitos, e invocai o nome do Senhor, vosso deus, mas não metais fogo ao sacrifício.

RVA.text: Entonces Elías dijo á los profetas de Baal: Escogeos el un buey, y haced primero, pues que vosotros sois los más: é invocad en el nombre de vuestros dioses, mas no pongáis fuego debajo.

KJV.text: And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress it first; for ye are many; and call on the name of your gods, but put no fire under.

WEBM.text: Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose one bull for yourselves, and dress it first; for you are many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under it.”

JFA.text: E, tomando o novilho que se lhes dera, prepararam-no, e invocaram o nome de Baal, desde a manhã até o meio-dia, dizendo: Ah Baal, responde-nos! Porém não houve voz; ninguém respondeu. E saltavam em volta do altar que tinham feito.

RVA.text: Y ellos tomaron el buey que les fué dado, y aprestáronlo, é invocaron en el nombre de Baal desde la mañana hasta el medio día, diciendo: ­Baal, respóndenos! Mas no había voz, ni quien respondiese; entre tanto, ellos andaban saltando cerca del altar que habían hecho.

KJV.text: And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any that answered. And they leaped upon the altar which was made.

WEBM.text: They took the bull which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, “Baal, hear us!” But there was no voice, and nobody answered. They leaped about the altar which was made.

JFA.text: Sucedeu que, ao meio-dia, Elias zombava deles, dizendo: Clamai em altas vozes, porque ele é um deus; pode ser que esteja falando, ou que tenha alguma coisa que fazer, ou que intente alguma viagem; talvez esteja dormindo, e necessite de que o acordem.

RVA.text: Y aconteció al medio día, que Elías se burlaba de ellos, diciendo: Gritad en alta voz, que dios es: quizá está conversando, ó tiene algún empeño, ó va de camino; acaso duerme, y despertará.

KJV.text: And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, Cry aloud: for he is a god; either he is talking, or he is pursuing, or he is in a journey, or peradventure he sleepeth, and must be awaked.

WEBM.text: At noon, Elijah mocked them, and said, “Cry aloud; for he is a god. Either he is deep in thought, or he has gone somewhere, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he sleeps and must be awakened.”

JFA.text: E eles clamavam em altas vozes e, conforme o seu costume, se retalhavam com facas e com lancetas, até correr o sangue sobre eles.

RVA.text: Y ellos clamaban á grandes voces, y sajábanse con cuchillos y con lancetas conforme á su costumbre, hasta chorrear la sangre sobre ellos.

KJV.text: And they cried aloud, and cut themselves after their manner with knives and lancets, till the blood gushed out upon them.

WEBM.text: They cried aloud, and cut themselves in their way with knives and lances, until the blood gushed out on them.

JFA.text: Também sucedeu que, passado o meio dia, profetizaram eles até a hora de se oferecer o sacrifício da tarde. Porém não houve voz; ninguém respondeu, nem atendeu.

RVA.text: Y como pasó el medio día, y ellos profetizaran hasta el tiempo del sacrificio del presente, y no había voz, ni quien respondiese ni escuchase;

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when midday was past, and they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded.

WEBM.text: When midday was past, they prophesied until the time of the evening offering; but there was no voice, no answer, and nobody paid attention.

JFA.text: Então Elias disse a todo o povo: chegai-vos a mim. E todo o povo se chegou a ele. E Elias reparou o altar do Senhor, que havia sido derrubado.

RVA.text: Elías dijo entonces á todo el pueblo: Acercaos á mí. Y todo el pueblo se llegó á él: y él reparó el altar de Jehová que estaba arruinado.

KJV.text: And Elijah said unto all the people, Come near unto me. And all the people came near unto him. And he repaired the altar of the Lord that was broken down.

WEBM.text: Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me!”; and all the people came near to him. He repaired the Lord’s altar that had been thrown down.

JFA.text: Tomou doze pedras, conforme o número das tribos dos filhos de Jacó, ao qual viera a palavra do Senhor, dizendo: Israel será o teu nome.

RVA.text: Y tomando Elías doce piedras, conforme al número de las tribus de los hijos de Jacob, al cual había sido palabra de Jehová, diciendo: Israel será tu nombre;

KJV.text: And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, unto whom the word of the Lord came, saying, Israel shall be thy name:

WEBM.text: Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the Lord’s word came, saying, “Israel shall be your name.”

JFA.text: E com as pedras edificou o altar em nome do Senhor; depois fez em redor do altar um rego, em que podiam caber duas medidas de semente.

RVA.text: Edificó con las piedras un altar en el nombre de Jehová: después hizo una reguera alrededor del altar, cuanto cupieran dos satos de simiente.

KJV.text: And with the stones he built an altar in the name of the Lord: and he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed.

WEBM.text: With the stones he built an altar in the Lord’s name. He made a trench around the altar, large enough to contain two seahs of seed.

JFA.text: Então armou a lenha, e dividiu o novilho em pedaços, e o pôs sobre a lenha, e disse: Enchei de água quatro cântaros, e derramai-a sobre o holocausto e sobre a lenha.

RVA.text: Compuso luego la leña, y cortó el buey en pedazos, y púsolo sobre la leña.

KJV.text: And he put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid him on the wood, and said, Fill four barrels with water, and pour it on the burnt sacrifice, and on the wood.

WEBM.text: He put the wood in order, and cut the bull in pieces, and laid it on the wood. He said, “Fill four jars with water, and pour it on the burnt offering, and on the wood.”

JFA.text: Disse ainda: fazei-o segunda vez; e o fizeram segunda vez. De novo disse: Fazei-o terceira vez; e o fizeram terceira vez.

RVA.text: Y dijo: Henchid cuatro cántaros de agua, y derramadla sobre el holocausto y sobre la leña. Y dijo: Hacedlo otra vez; y otra vez lo hicieron. Dijo aún: Hacedlo la tercera vez; é hiciéronlo la tercera vez.

KJV.text: And he said, Do it the second time. And they did it the second time. And he said, Do it the third time. And they did it the third time.

WEBM.text: He said, “Do it a second time;” and they did it the second time. He said, “Do it a third time;” and they did it the third time.

JFA.text: De maneira que a água corria ao redor do altar; e ele encheu de água também o rego.

RVA.text: De manera que las aguas corrían alrededor del altar; y había también henchido de agua la reguera.

KJV.text: And the water ran round about the altar; and he filled the trench also with water.

WEBM.text: The water ran around the altar; and he also filled the trench with water.

JFA.text: Sucedeu pois que, sendo já hora de se oferecer o sacrifício da tarde, o profeta Elias se chegou, e disse: o Senhor, Deus de Abraão, de Isaque, e de Israel, seja manifestado hoje que tu és Deus em Israel, e que eu sou teu servo, e que conforme a tua palavra tenho feito todas estas coisas.

RVA.text: Y como llegó la hora de ofrecerse el holocausto, llegóse el profeta Elías, y dijo: Jehová Dios de Abraham, de Isaac, y de Israel, sea hoy manifiesto que tú eres Dios en Israel, y que yo soy tu siervo, y que por mandato tuyo he hecho todas estas cosas.

KJV.text: And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, Lord God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that thou art God in Israel, and that I am thy servant, and that I have done all these things at thy word.

WEBM.text: At the time of the evening offering, Elijah the prophet came near, and said, “The Lord, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known today that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.

JFA.text: Responde-me, ó Senhor, responde-me para que este povo conheça que tu, ó Senhor, és Deus, e que tu fizeste voltar o seu coração.

RVA.text: Respóndeme, Jehová, respóndeme; para que conozca este pueblo que tú, oh Jehová, eres el Dios, y que tú volviste atrás el corazón de ellos.

KJV.text: Hear me, O Lord, hear me, that this people may know that thou art the Lord God, and that thou hast turned their heart back again.

WEBM.text: Hear me, the Lord, hear me, that this people may know that you, the Lord, are God, and that you have turned their heart back again.”

JFA.text: Então caiu fogo do Senhor, e consumiu o holocausto, a lenha, as pedras, e o pó, e ainda lambeu a água que estava no rego.

RVA.text: Entonces cayó fuego de Jehová, el cual consumió el holocausto, y la leña, y las piedras, y el polvo, y aun lamió las aguas que estaban en la reguera.

KJV.text: Then the fire of the Lord fell, and consumed the burnt sacrifice, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.

WEBM.text: Then the Lord’s fire fell, and consumed the burnt offering, the wood, the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.

JFA.text: Quando o povo viu isto, prostraram-se todos com o rosto em terra e disseram: O senhor é Deus! O Senhor é Deus!

RVA.text: Y viéndolo todo el pueblo, cayeron sobre sus rostros, y dijeron: ­Jehová es el Dios! ­Jehová es el Dios!

KJV.text: And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces: and they said, The Lord, he is the God; the Lord, he is the God.

WEBM.text: When all the people saw it, they fell on their faces. They said, “The Lord, he is God! The Lord, he is God!”

JFA.text: Disse-lhes Elias: Agarrai os profetas de Baal! que nenhum deles escape: Agarraram-nos; e Elias os fez descer ao ribeiro de Quisom, onde os matou.

RVA.text: Y díjoles Elías: Prended á los profetas de Baal, que no escape ninguno. Y ellos los prendieron; y llevólos Elías al arroyo de Cisón, y allí los degolló.

KJV.text: And Elijah said unto them, Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape. And they took them: and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there.

WEBM.text: Elijah said to them, “Seize the prophets of Baal! Don’t let one of them escape!” They seized them; and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and killed them there.

JFA.text: Então disse Elias a Acabe: Sobe, come e bebe, porque há ruído de abundante chuva.

RVA.text: Y entonces Elías dijo á Achâb: Sube, come y bebe; porque una grande lluvia suena.

KJV.text: And Elijah said unto Ahab, Get thee up, eat and drink; for there is a sound of abundance of rain.

WEBM.text: Elijah said to Ahab, “Get up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.”

JFA.text: Acabe, pois, subiu para comer e beber; mas Elias subiu ao cume do Carmelo e, inclinando-se por terra, meteu o rosto entre os joelhos.

RVA.text: Y Achâb subió á comer y á beber. Y Elías subió á la cumbre del Carmelo; y postrándose en tierra, puso su rostro entre las rodillas.

KJV.text: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he cast himself down upon the earth, and put his face between his knees,

WEBM.text: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he bowed himself down on the earth, and put his face between his knees.

JFA.text: E disse ao seu moço: Sobe agora, e olha para a banda do mar. E ele subiu, olhou, e disse: Não há nada. Então disse Elias: Volta lá sete vezes.

RVA.text: Y dijo á su criado: Sube ahora, y mira hacia la mar. Y él subió, y miró, y dijo: No hay nada. Y él le volvió á decir: Vuelve siete veces.

KJV.text: And said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up, and looked, and said, There is nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.

WEBM.text: He said to his servant, “Go up now, and look toward the sea.” He went up, and looked, and said, “There is nothing.” He said, “Go again” seven times.

JFA.text: Sucedeu que, à sétima vez, disse: Eis que se levanta do mar uma nuvem, do tamanho da mão dum homem: Então disse Elias: Sobe, e dize a Acabe: Aparelha o teu carro, e desce, para que a chuva não te impeça.

RVA.text: Y á la séptima vez dijo: Yo veo una pequeña nube como la palma de la mano de un hombre, que sube de la mar. Y él dijo: Ve, y di á Achâb: Unce y desciende, porque la lluvia no te ataje.

KJV.text: And it came to pass at the seventh time, that he said, Behold, there ariseth a little cloud out of the sea, like a man's hand. And he said, Go up, say unto Ahab, Prepare thy chariot, and get thee down that the rain stop thee not.

WEBM.text: On the seventh time, he said, “Behold, a small cloud, like a man’s hand, is rising out of the sea.” He said, “Go up, tell Ahab, ‘Get ready and go down, so that the rain doesn’t stop you.’”

JFA.text: E sucedeu que em pouco tempo o céu se enegreceu de nuvens e vento, e caiu uma grande chuva. Acabe, subindo ao carro, foi para Jizreel.

RVA.text: Y aconteció, estando en esto, que los cielos se oscurecieron con nubes y viento; y hubo una gran lluvia. Y subiendo Achâb, vino á Jezreel.

KJV.text: And it came to pass in the mean while, that the heaven was black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.

WEBM.text: In a little while, the sky grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.

JFA.text: E a mão do Senhor estava sobre Elias, o qual cingiu os lombos, e veio correndo perante Acabe, até a entrada de Jizreel.

RVA.text: Y la mano de Jehová fué sobre Elías, el cual ciñó sus lomos, y vino corriendo delante de Achâb hasta llegar á Jezreel.

KJV.text: And the hand of the Lord was on Elijah; and he girded up his loins, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.

WEBM.text: the Lord’s hand was on Elijah; and he tucked his cloak into his belt and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.

JFA.text: Houve um homem de Ramataim-Zofim, da região montanhosa de Efraim, cujo nome era Elcana, filho de Jeroão, filho de Eliú, filho de Toú, filho de Zufe, efraimita.

RVA.text: Hubo un varón de Ramathaim de Sophim, del monte de Ephraim, que se llamaba Elcana, hijo de Jeroham, hijo de Eliú, hijo de Thohu, hijo de Suph, Ephrateo.

KJV.text: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaimzophim, of mount Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephrathite:

WEBM.text: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the hill country of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.

JFA.text: Tinha ele duas mulheres: uma se chamava Ana, e a outra Penina. Penina tinha filhos, porém Ana não os tinha.

RVA.text: Y tenía él dos mujeres; el nombre de la una era Anna, y el nombre de la otra Peninna. Y Peninna tenía hijos, mas Anna no los tenía.

KJV.text: And he had two wives; the name of the one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah: and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.

WEBM.text: He had two wives. The name of one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah. Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.

JFA.text: De ano em ano este homem subia da sua cidade para adorar e sacrificar ae Senhor dos exércites em Siló. Assistiam ali os sacerdotes do Senhor, Hofni e Finéias, os dois filhos de Eli.

RVA.text: Y subía aquel varón todos los años de su ciudad, á adorar y sacrificar á Jehová de los ejércitos en Silo, donde estaban dos hijos de Eli, Ophni y Phinees, sacerdotes de Jehová.

KJV.text: And this man went up out of his city yearly to worship and to sacrifice unto the Lord of hosts in Shiloh. And the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, the priests of the Lord, were there.

WEBM.text: This man went up out of his city from year to year to worship and to sacrifice to the Lord of Armies in Shiloh. The two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, priests to the Lord, were there.

JFA.text: No dia em que Elcana sacrificava, costumava dar quinhões a Penina, sua mulher, e a todos os seus filhos e filhas.

RVA.text: Y cuando venía el día, Elcana sacrificaba, y daba á Peninna su mujer, y á todos sus hijos y á todas sus hijas, á cada uno su parte.

KJV.text: And when the time was that Elkanah offered, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and her daughters, portions:

WEBM.text: When the day came that Elkanah sacrificed, he gave portions to Peninnah his wife and to all her sons and her daughters;

JFA.text: Porém a Ana, embora a amasse, dava um só quinhão, porquanto o Senhor lhe havia cerrado a madre.

RVA.text: Mas á Anna daba una parte escogida; porque amaba á Anna, aunque Jehová había cerrado su matriz.

KJV.text: But unto Hannah he gave a worthy portion; for he loved Hannah: but the Lord had shut up her womb.

WEBM.text: but he gave a double portion to Hannah, for he loved Hannah, but the Lord had shut up her womb.

JFA.text: Ora, a sua rival muito a provocava para irritá-la, porque o Senhor lhe havia cerrado a madre.

RVA.text: Y su competidora la irritaba, enojándola y entristeciéndola, porque Jehová había cerrado su matriz.

KJV.text: And her adversary also provoked her sore, for to make her fret, because the Lord had shut up her womb.

WEBM.text: Her rival provoked her severely, to irritate her, because the Lord had shut up her womb.

JFA.text: E assim sucedia de ano em ano que, ao subirem à casa do Senhor, Penina provocava a Ana; pelo que esta chorava e não comia.

RVA.text: Y así hacía cada año: cuando subía á la casa de Jehová, enojaba así á la otra; por lo cual ella lloraba, y no comía.

KJV.text: And as he did so year by year, when she went up to the house of the Lord, so she provoked her; therefore she wept, and did not eat.

WEBM.text: So year by year, when she went up to the Lord’s house, her rival provoked her. Therefore she wept, and didn’t eat.

JFA.text: Então Elcana, seu marido, lhe perguntou: Ana, por que choras? e porque não comes? e por que está triste o teu coração? Não te sou eu melhor de que dez filhos?

RVA.text: Y Elcana su marido le dijo: Anna, ¿por qué lloras? ¿y por qué no comes? ¿y por qué está afligido tu corazón? ¿No te soy yo mejor que diez hijos?

KJV.text: Then said Elkanah her husband to her, Hannah, why weepest thou? and why eatest thou not? and why is thy heart grieved? am not I better to thee than ten sons?

WEBM.text: Elkanah her husband said to her, “Hannah, why do you weep? Why don’t you eat? Why is your heart grieved? Am I not better to you than ten sons?”

JFA.text: Então Ana se levantou, depois que comeram e beberam em Siló; e Eli, sacerdote, estava sentado, numa cadeira, junto a um pilar do templo do Senhor.

RVA.text: Y levantóse Anna después que hubo comido y bebido en Silo; y mientras el sacerdote Eli estaba sentado en una silla junto á un pilar del templo de Jehová,

KJV.text: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest sat upon a seat by a post of the temple of the Lord.

WEBM.text: So Hannah rose up after they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of the Lord’s temple.

JFA.text: Ela, pois, com amargura de alma, orou ao Senhor, e chorou muito.

RVA.text: Ella con amargura de alma oró á Jehová, y lloró abundantemente.

KJV.text: And she was in bitterness of soul, and prayed unto the Lord, and wept sore.

WEBM.text: She was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to the Lord, weeping bitterly.

JFA.text: E fez um voto, dizendo: ç Senhor dos exércitos! se deveras atentares para a aflição da tua serva, e de mim te lembrares, e da tua serva não te esqueceres, mas lhe deres um filho varão, ao Senhor o darei por todos os dias da sua vida, e pela sua cabeça não passará navalha.

RVA.text: E hizo voto, diciendo: Jehová de los ejércitos, si te dignares mirar la aflicción de tu sierva, y te acordares de mí, y no te olvidares de tu sierva, mas dieres á tu sierva un hijo varón, yo lo dedicaré á Jehová todos los días de su vida, y no subirá navaja sobre su cabeza.

KJV.text: And she vowed a vow, and said, O Lord of hosts, if thou wilt indeed look on the affliction of thine handmaid, and remember me, and not forget thine handmaid, but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man child, then I will give him unto the Lord all the days of his life, and there shall no razor come upon his head.

WEBM.text: She vowed a vow, and said, “The Lord of Armies, if you will indeed look at the affliction of your servant and remember me, and not forget your servant, but will give to your servant a boy, then I will give him to the Lord all the days of his life, and no razor shall come on his head.”

JFA.text: Continuando ela a orar perante e Senhor, Eli observou a sua boca.

RVA.text: Y fué que como ella orase largamente delante de Jehová, Eli estaba observando la boca de ella.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, as she continued praying before the Lord, that Eli marked her mouth.

WEBM.text: As she continued praying before the Lord, Eli saw her mouth.

JFA.text: Porquanto Ana falava no seu coração; só se moviam os seus lábios, e não se ouvia a sua voz; pelo que Eli a teve por embriagada.

RVA.text: Mas Anna hablaba en su corazón, y solamente se movían sus labios, y su voz no se oía; y túvola Eli por borracha.

KJV.text: Now Hannah, she spake in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard: therefore Eli thought she had been drunken.

WEBM.text: Now Hannah spoke in her heart. Only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard. Therefore Eli thought she was drunk.

JFA.text: E lhe disse: Até quando estarás tu embriagada? Aparta de ti o teu vinho.

RVA.text: Entonces le dijo Eli: ¿Hasta cuándo estarás borracha?; digiere tu vino.

KJV.text: And Eli said unto her, How long wilt thou be drunken? put away thy wine from thee.

WEBM.text: Eli said to her, “How long will you be drunk? Get rid of your wine!”

JFA.text: Mas Ana respondeu: Não, Senhor meu, eu sou uma mulher atribulada de espírito; não bebi vinho nem bebida forte, porém derramei a minha alma perante o Senhor.

RVA.text: Y Anna le respondió, diciendo: No, señor mío: mas yo soy una mujer trabajada de espíritu: no he bebido vino ni sidra, sino que he derramado mi alma delante de Jehová.

KJV.text: And Hannah answered and said, No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit: I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but have poured out my soul before the Lord.

WEBM.text: Hannah answered, “No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit. I have not been drinking wine or strong drink, but I poured out my soul before the Lord.

JFA.text: Não tenhas, pois, a tua serva por filha de Belial; porque da multidão dos meus cuidados e do meu desgosto tenho falado até agora.

RVA.text: No tengas á tu sierva por una mujer impía: porque por la magnitud de mis congojas y de mi aflicción he hablado hasta ahora.

KJV.text: Count not thine handmaid for a daughter of Belial: for out of the abundance of my complaint and grief have I spoken hitherto.

WEBM.text: Don’t consider your servant a wicked woman; for I have been speaking out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation.”

JFA.text: Então lhe respondeu Eli: Vai-te em paz; e o Deus de Israel te conceda a petição que lhe fizeste.

RVA.text: Y Eli respondió, y dijo: Ve en paz, y el Dios de Israel te otorgue la petición que le has hecho.

KJV.text: Then Eli answered and said, Go in peace: and the God of Israel grant thee thy petition that thou hast asked of him.

WEBM.text: Then Eli answered, “Go in peace; and may the God of Israel grant your petition that you have asked of him.”

JFA.text: Ao que disse ela: Ache a tua serva graça aos teus olhos. Assim a mulher se foi o seu caminho, e comeu, e já não era triste o seu semblante.

RVA.text: Y ella dijo: Halle tu sierva gracia delante de tus ojos. Y fuése la mujer su camino, y comió, y no estuvo más triste.

KJV.text: And she said, Let thine handmaid find grace in thy sight. So the woman went her way, and did eat, and her countenance was no more sad.

WEBM.text: She said, “Let your servant find favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and ate; and her facial expression wasn’t sad any more.

JFA.text: Depois, levantando-se de madrugada, adoraram perante o Senhor e, voltando, foram a sua casa em Ramá. Elcana conheceu a Ana, sua mulher, e o Senhor se lembrou dela.

RVA.text: Y levantándose de mañana, adoraron delante de Jehová, y volviéronse, y vinieron á su casa en Ramatha. Y Elcana conoció á Anna su mujer, y Jehová se acordó de ella.

KJV.text: And they rose up in the morning early, and worshipped before the Lord, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah: and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and the Lord remembered her.

WEBM.text: They rose up in the morning early and worshiped the Lord, then returned and came to their house to Ramah. Then Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and the Lord remembered her.

JFA.text: De modo que Ana concebeu e, no tempo devido, teve um filho, ao qual chamou Samuel; porque, dizia ela, o tenho pedido ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Y fué que corrido el tiempo, después de haber concebido Anna, parió un hijo, y púsole por nombre Samuel, diciendo: Por cuanto lo demandé á Jehová.

KJV.text: Wherefore it came to pass, when the time was come about after Hannah had conceived, that she bare a son, and called his name Samuel, saying, Because I have asked him of the Lord.

WEBM.text: When the time had come, Hannah conceived, and bore a son; and she named him Samuel, saying, “Because I have asked him of the Lord.”

JFA.text: Subiu, pois aquele homem, Elcana, com toda a sua casa, para oferecer ao Senhor o sacrifício anual e cumprir o seu voto.

RVA.text: Después subió el varón Elcana, con toda su familia, á sacrificar á Jehová el sacrificio acostumbrado, y su voto.

KJV.text: And the man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer unto the Lord the yearly sacrifice, and his vow.

WEBM.text: The man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer to the Lord the yearly sacrifice and his vow.

JFA.text: Ana, porém, não subiu, pois disse a seu marido: Quando o menino for desmamado, então e levarei, para que apareça perante o Senhor, e lá fique para sempre.

RVA.text: Mas Anna no subió, sino dijo á su marido: Yo no subiré hasta que el niño sea destetado; para que lo lleve y sea presentado delante de Jehová, y se quede allá para siempre.

KJV.text: But Hannah went not up; for she said unto her husband, I will not go up until the child be weaned, and then I will bring him, that he may appear before the Lord, and there abide for ever.

WEBM.text: But Hannah didn’t go up, for she said to her husband, “Not until the child is weaned; then I will bring him, that he may appear before the Lord, and stay there forever.”

JFA.text: E Elcana, seu marido, lhe disse: faze o que bem te parecer; fica até que o desmames; tão-somente confirme o Senhor a sua palavra. Assim ficou a mulher, e amamentou seu filho, até que o desmamou.

RVA.text: Y Elcana su marido le respondió: Haz lo que bien te pareciere; quédate hasta que lo destetes; solamente Jehová cumpla su palabra. Y quedóse la mujer, y crió su hijo hasta que lo destetó.

KJV.text: And Elkanah her husband said unto her, Do what seemeth thee good; tarry until thou have weaned him; only the Lord establish his word. So the woman abode, and gave her son suck until she weaned him.

WEBM.text: Elkanah her husband said to her, “Do what seems good to you. Wait until you have weaned him; only may the Lord establish his word.” So the woman waited and nursed her son until she weaned him.

JFA.text: Depois de o ter desmamado, ela o tomou consigo, com um touro de três anos, uma efa de farinha e um odre de vinho, e o levou à casa do Senhor, em Siló; e era o menino ainda muito criança.

RVA.text: Y después que lo hubo destetado, llevólo consigo, con tres becerros, y un epha de harina, y una vasija de vino, y trájolo á la casa de Jehová en Silo: y el niño era pequeño.

KJV.text: And when she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bullocks, and one ephah of flour, and a bottle of wine, and brought him unto the house of the Lord in Shiloh: and the child was young.

WEBM.text: When she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bulls, and one ephah of meal, and a container of wine, and brought him to the Lord’s house in Shiloh. The child was young.

JFA.text: Então degolaram o touro, e trouxeram o menino a Eli.

RVA.text: Y matando el becerro, trajeron el niño á Eli.

KJV.text: And they slew a bullock, and brought the child to Eli.

WEBM.text: They killed the bull, and brought the child to Eli.

JFA.text: E disse ela: Ah, meu Senhor! tão certamente como vive a tua alma, meu Senhor, eu sou aquela mulher que aqui esteve contigo, orando ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Y ella dijo: ­Oh, señor mío! vive tu alma, señor mío, yo soy aquella mujer que estuvo aquí junto á ti orando á Jehová.

KJV.text: And she said, Oh my lord, as thy soul liveth, my lord, I am the woman that stood by thee here, praying unto the Lord.

WEBM.text: She said, “Oh, my lord, as your soul lives, my lord, I am the woman who stood by you here, praying to the Lord.

JFA.text: Por este menino orava eu, e o Senhor atendeu a petição que eu lhe fiz.

RVA.text: Por este niño oraba, y Jehová me dió lo que le pedí.

KJV.text: For this child I prayed; and the Lord hath given me my petition which I asked of him:

WEBM.text: I prayed for this child, and the Lord has given me my petition which I asked of him.

JFA.text: Por isso eu também o entreguei ao Senhor; por todos os dias que viver, ao Senhor está entregue. E adoraram ali ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Yo pues le vuelvo también á Jehová: todos los días que viviere, será de Jehová. Y adoró allí á Jehová.

KJV.text: Therefore also I have lent him to the Lord; as long as he liveth he shall be lent to the Lord. And he worshipped the Lord there.

WEBM.text: Therefore I have also given him to the Lord. As long as he lives he is given to the Lord.” He worshiped the Lord there.

JFA.text: Ora, havia um homem de Benjamim, cujo nome era Quis, filho de Abiel, filho de Zeror, filho de Becorate, filho de Afias, filho dum benjamita; era varão forte e valoroso.

RVA.text: Y habia un varón de Benjamín, hombre valeroso, el cual se llamaba Cis, hijo de Abiel, hijo de Seor, hijo de Bechôra, hijo de Aphia, hijo de un hombre de Benjamín.

KJV.text: Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a mighty man of power.

WEBM.text: Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah, the son of a Benjamite, a mighty man of valor.

JFA.text: Tinha este um filho, chamado Saul, jovem e tão belo que entre os filhos de Israel não havia outro homem mais belo de que ele; desde os ombros para cima sebressaía em altura a todo o povo.

RVA.text: Y tenía él un hijo que se llamaba Saúl, mancebo y hermoso, que entre los hijos de Israel no había otro más hermoso que él; del hombro arriba sobrepujaba á cualquiera del pueblo.

KJV.text: And he had a son, whose name was Saul, a choice young man, and a goodly: and there was not among the children of Israel a goodlier person than he: from his shoulders and upward he was higher than any of the people.

WEBM.text: He had a son whose name was Saul, an impressive young man; and there was not among the children of Israel a more handsome person than he. From his shoulders and upward he was taller than any of the people.

JFA.text: Tinham-se perdido as jumentas de Quis, pai de Saul; pelo que disse Quis a Saul, seu filho: Toma agora contigo um dos moços, levanta-te e vai procurar as jumentas.

RVA.text: Y habíanse perdido las asnas de Cis, padre de Saúl; por lo que dijo Cis á Saúl su hijo: Toma ahora contigo alguno de los criados, y levántate, y ve á buscar las asnas.

KJV.text: And the asses of Kish Saul's father were lost. And Kish said to Saul his son, Take now one of the servants with thee, and arise, go seek the asses.

WEBM.text: The donkeys of Kish, Saul’s father, were lost. Kish said to Saul his son, “Now take one of the servants with you, and arise, go look for the donkeys.”

JFA.text: Passaram, pois, pela região montanhosa de Efraim, como também pela terra e Salisa, mas não as acharam; depois passaram pela terra de Saalim, porém tampouco estavam ali; passando ainda pela terra de Benjamim, não as acharam.

RVA.text: Y él pasó al monte de Ephraim, y de allí á la tierra de Salisa, y no las hallaron. Pasaron luego por la tierra de Saalim, y tampoco. Después pasaron por la tierra de Benjamín, y no las encontraron.

KJV.text: And he passed through mount Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalisha, but they found them not: then they passed through the land of Shalim, and there they were not: and he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they found them not.

WEBM.text: He passed through the hill country of Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalishah, but they didn’t find them. Then they passed through the land of Shaalim, and they weren’t there. Then he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they didn’t find them.

JFA.text: Vindo eles, então, à terra de Zufe, Saul disse para o moço que ia com ele: Vem! Voltemos, para que não suceda que meu pai deixe de inquietar-se pelas jumentas e se aflija por causa de nós.

RVA.text: Y cuando vinieron á la tierra de Suph, Saúl dijo á su criado que tenía consigo: Ven, volvámonos; porque quizá mi padre, dejado el cuidado de las asnas, estará congojado por nosotros.

KJV.text: And when they were come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant that was with him, Come, and let us return; lest my father leave caring for the asses, and take thought for us.

WEBM.text: When they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, “Come! Let’s return, lest my father stop caring about the donkeys and be anxious for us.”

JFA.text: Mas ele lhe disse: Eis que há nesta cidade um homem de Deus, e ele é muito considerado; tudo quanto diz, sucede infalivelmente. Vamos, pois, até lá; porventura nos mostrará o caminho que devemos seguir.

RVA.text: Y él le respondió: He aquí ahora hay en esta ciudad un hombre de Dios, que es varón insigne: todas las cosas que él dijere, sin duda vendrán. Vamos pues allá: quizá nos enseñará nuestro camino por donde hayamos de ir.

KJV.text: And he said unto him, Behold now, there is in this city a man of God, and he is an honourable man; all that he saith cometh surely to pass: now let us go thither; peradventure he can shew us our way that we should go.

WEBM.text: The servant said to him, “Behold now, there is a man of God in this city, and he is a man who is held in honor. All that he says surely happens. Now let’s go there. Perhaps he can tell us which way to go.”

JFA.text: Então Saul disse ao seu moço: Porém se lá formos, que levaremos ao homem? Pois o pão de nossos alforjes se acabou, e presente nenhum temos para levar ao homem de Deus; que temos?

RVA.text: Y Saúl respondió á su criado: Vamos ahora: ¿mas qué llevaremos al varón? Porque el pan de nuestras alforjas se ha acabado, y no tenemos qué presentar al varón de Dios: ¿qué tenemos?

KJV.text: Then said Saul to his servant, But, behold, if we go, what shall we bring the man? for the bread is spent in our vessels, and there is not a present to bring to the man of God: what have we?

WEBM.text: Then Saul said to his servant, “But behold, if we go, what should we bring the man? For the bread is spent in our sacks, and there is not a present to bring to the man of God. What do we have?”

JFA.text: O moço tornou a responder a Saul, e disse: Eis que ainda tenho em mão um quarto dum siclo de prata, o qual darei ao homem de Deus, para que nos mostre o caminho.

RVA.text: Entonces tornó el criado á responder á Saúl, diciendo: He aquí se halla en mi mano la cuarta parte de un siclo de plata: esto daré al varón de Dios, porque nos declare nuestro camino.

KJV.text: And the servant answered Saul again, and said, Behold, I have here at hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver: that will I give to the man of God, to tell us our way.

WEBM.text: The servant answered Saul again and said, “Behold, I have in my hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver. I will give that to the man of God, to tell us our way.”

JFA.text: Antigamente em Israel, indo alguém consultar a Deus, dizia assim: Vinde, vamos ao vidente; porque ao profeta de hoje, outrora se chamava vidente.

RVA.text: Antiguamente en Israel cualquiera que iba á consultar á Dios, decía así: Venid y vamos hasta el vidente: porque el que ahora se llama profeta, antiguamente era llamado vidente.

KJV.text: Beforetime in Israel, when a man went to enquire of God, thus he spake, Come, and let us go to the seer: for he that is now called a Prophet was beforetime called a Seer.

WEBM.text: (In earlier times in Israel, when a man went to inquire of God, he said, “Come! Let’s go to the seer;” for he who is now called a prophet was before called a seer.)

JFA.text: Então disse Saul ao moço: Dizes bem; vem, pois, vamos! E foram-se à cidade onde estava e homem de Deus.

RVA.text: Dijo entonces Saúl á su criado: Bien dices; ea pues, vamos. Y fueron á la ciudad donde estaba el varón de Dios.

KJV.text: Then said Saul to his servant, Well said; come, let us go. So they went unto the city where the man of God was.

WEBM.text: Then Saul said to his servant, “Well said. Come! Let’s go.” So they went to the city where the man of God was.

JFA.text: Quando eles iam subindo à cidade, encontraram umas moças que saíam para tirar água; e perguntaram-lhes: Está aqui o vidente?

RVA.text: Y cuando subían por la cuesta de la ciudad, hallaron unas mozas que salían por agua, á las cuales dijeron: ¿Está en este lugar el vidente?

KJV.text: And as they went up the hill to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said unto them, Is the seer here?

WEBM.text: As they went up the ascent to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said to them, “Is the seer here?”

JFA.text: Ao que elas lhes responderam: Sim, eis aí o tens diante de ti; apressa-te, porque hoje veio à cidade, porquanto o povo tem hoje sacrifício no alto.

RVA.text: Y ellas respondiéndoles, dijeron: Sí; helo aquí delante de ti: date pues priesa, porque hoy ha venido á la ciudad en atención á que el pueblo tiene hoy sacrificio en el alto.

KJV.text: And they answered them, and said, He is; behold, he is before you: make haste now, for he came to day to the city; for there is a sacrifice of the people to day in the high place:

WEBM.text: They answered them and said, “He is. Behold, he is before you. Hurry now, for he has come today into the city; for the people have a sacrifice today in the high place.

JFA.text: Entrando vós na cidade, logo o achareis, antes que ele suba ao alto para comer; pois o povo não comerá até que ele venha, porque ele é o que abençoa a sacrifício, e depois os convidados comem. Subi agora, porque a esta hora o achareis.

RVA.text: Y cuando entrareis en la ciudad, le encontraréis luego, antes que suba al alto á comer; pues el pueblo no comerá hasta que él haya venido, por cuanto él haya de bendecir el sacrificio, y después comerán los convidados. Subid pues ahora, porque ahora le hallaréis.

KJV.text: As soon as ye be come into the city, ye shall straightway find him, before he go up to the high place to eat: for the people will not eat until he come, because he doth bless the sacrifice; and afterwards they eat that be bidden. Now therefore get you up; for about this time ye shall find him.

WEBM.text: As soon as you have come into the city, you will immediately find him before he goes up to the high place to eat; for the people will not eat until he comes, because he blesses the sacrifice. Afterwards those who are invited eat. Now therefore go up; for at this time you will find him.”

JFA.text: Subiram, pois, à cidade; e, ao entrarem, eis que Samuel os encontrou, quando saía para subir ao alto.

RVA.text: Ellos entonces subieron á la ciudad; y cuando en medio de la ciudad estuvieron, he aquí Samuel que delante de ellos salía para subir al alto.

KJV.text: And they went up into the city: and when they were come into the city, behold, Samuel came out against them, for to go up to the high place.

WEBM.text: They went up to the city. As they came within the city, behold, Samuel came out toward them to go up to the high place.

JFA.text: Ora, o Senhor revelara isto aos ouvidos de Samuel, um dia antes de Saul chegar, dizendo:

RVA.text: Y un día antes que Saúl viniese, Jehová había revelado al oído de Samuel, diciendo:

KJV.text: Now the Lord had told Samuel in his ear a day before Saul came, saying,

WEBM.text: Now the Lord had revealed to Samuel a day before Saul came, saying,

JFA.text: Amanhã a estas horas te enviarei um homem da terra de Benjamim, o qual ungirás por príncipe sobre o meu povo de Israel; e ele livrará o meu povo da mão dos filisteus; pois olhei para o meu povo, porque o seu clamor chegou a mim.

RVA.text: Mañana á esta misma hora yo enviaré á ti un varón de la tierra de Benjamín, al cual ungirás por príncipe sobre mi pueblo Israel, y salvará mi pueblo de mano de los Filisteos: pues yo he mirado á mi pueblo, porque su clamor ha llegado hasta mí.

KJV.text: To morrow about this time I will send thee a man out of the land of Benjamin, and thou shalt anoint him to be captain over my people Israel, that he may save my people out of the hand of the Philistines: for I have looked upon my people, because their cry is come unto me.

WEBM.text: “Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man out of the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him to be prince over my people Israel. He will save my people out of the hand of the Philistines; for I have looked upon my people, because their cry has come to me.”

JFA.text: E quando Samuel viu a Saul, o Senhor e disse: Eis aqui o homem de quem eu te falei. Este dominará sobre o meu povo.

RVA.text: Y luego que Samuel vió á Saúl, Jehová le dijo: He aquí éste es el varón del cual te hablé; éste señoreará á mi pueblo.

KJV.text: And when Samuel saw Saul, the Lord said unto him, Behold the man whom I spake to thee of! this same shall reign over my people.

WEBM.text: When Samuel saw Saul, the Lord said to him, “Behold, the man of whom I spoke to you! He will have authority over my people.”

JFA.text: Então Saul se chegou a Samuel na porta, e disse: Mostra-me, peço-te, onde é a casa do vidente.

RVA.text: Y llegando Saúl á Samuel en medio de la puerta, díjole: Ruégote que me enseñes dónde está la casa del vidente.

KJV.text: Then Saul drew near to Samuel in the gate, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, where the seer's house is.

WEBM.text: Then Saul approached Samuel in the gateway, and said, “Please tell me where the seer’s house is.”

JFA.text: Respondeu Samuel a Saul: Eu sou o vidente; sobe diante de mim ao alto, porque comereis hoje comigo; pela manhã te despedirei, e tudo quanto está no teu coração to declararei.

RVA.text: Y Samuel respondió á Saúl, y dijo: Yo soy el vidente: sube delante de mí al alto, y comed hoy conmigo, y por la mañana te despacharé, y te descubriré todo lo que está en tu corazón.

KJV.text: And Samuel answered Saul, and said, I am the seer: go up before me unto the high place; for ye shall eat with me to day, and to morrow I will let thee go, and will tell thee all that is in thine heart.

WEBM.text: Samuel answered Saul and said, “I am the seer. Go up before me to the high place, for you are to eat with me today. In the morning I will let you go and will tell you all that is in your heart.

JFA.text: Também quanto às jumentas que há três dias se te perderam, não te preocupes com elas, porque já foram achadas. Mas para quem é tudo o que é desejável em Israel? porventura não é para ti, e para toda a casa de teu pai?

RVA.text: Y de las asnas que se te perdieron hoy ha tres días, pierde cuidado de ellas, porque se han hallado. Mas ¿por quién es todo el deseo de Israel, sino por ti y por toda la casa de tu padre?

KJV.text: And as for thine asses that were lost three days ago, set not thy mind on them; for they are found. And on whom is all the desire of Israel? Is it not on thee, and on all thy father's house?

WEBM.text: As for your donkeys who were lost three days ago, don’t set your mind on them, for they have been found. For whom does all Israel desire? Is it not you and all your father’s house?”

JFA.text: Então respondeu Saul: Acaso não sou eu benjamita, da menor das tribos de Israel? E não é a minha família a menor de todas as famílias da tribo de Benjamim? Por que, pois, me falas desta maneira?

RVA.text: Y Saúl respondió, y dijo: ¿No soy yo hijo de Benjamín, de las más pequeñas tribus de Israel? y mi familia ¿no es la más pequeña de todas las familias de la tribu de Benjamín? ¿por qué pues me has dicho cosa semejante?

KJV.text: And Saul answered and said, Am not I a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? and my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? wherefore then speakest thou so to me?

WEBM.text: Saul answered, “Am I not a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? And my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? Why then do you speak to me like this?”

JFA.text: Samuel, porém, tomando a Saul e ao seu moço, levou-os à câmara, e deu-lhes o primeiro lugar entre os convidados, que eram cerca de trinta homens.

RVA.text: Y trabando Samuel de Saúl y de su criado, metiólos en la sala, y dióles lugar á la cabecera de los convidados, que eran como unos treinta hombres.

KJV.text: And Samuel took Saul and his servant, and brought them into the parlour, and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden, which were about thirty persons.

WEBM.text: Samuel took Saul and his servant and brought them into the guest room, and made them sit in the best place among those who were invited, who were about thirty persons.

JFA.text: Depois disse Samuel ao cozinheiro: Traze a porção que te dei, da qual te disse: põe-na à parte contigo.

RVA.text: Y dijo Samuel al cocinero: Trae acá la porción que te dí, la cual te dije que guardases aparte.

KJV.text: And Samuel said unto the cook, Bring the portion which I gave thee, of which I said unto thee, Set it by thee.

WEBM.text: Samuel said to the cook, “Bring the portion which I gave you, of which I said to you, ‘Set it aside.’”

JFA.text: Levantou, pois, o cozinheiro a espádua, com o que havia nela, e pô-la diante de Saul. E disse Samuel: Eis que o que foi reservado está diante de ti. Come; porque te foi guardado para esta ocasião, para que o comesses com os convidados. Assim comeu Saul naquele dia com Samuel.

RVA.text: Entonces alzó el cocinero una espaldilla, con lo que estaba sobre ella, y púsola delante de Saúl. Y Samuel dijo: He aquí lo que estaba reservado: ponlo delante de ti, y come; porque de industria se guardó para ti, cuando dije: Yo he convidado al pueblo. Y Saúl comió aquel día con Samuel.
