KJV.text: And the cook took up the shoulder, and that which was upon it, and set it before Saul. And Samuel said, Behold that which is left! set it before thee, and eat: for unto this time hath it been kept for thee since I said, I have invited the people. So Saul did eat with Samuel that day.

WEBM.text: The cook took up the thigh, and that which was on it, and set it before Saul. Samuel said, “Behold, that which has been reserved! Set it before yourself and eat; because it has been kept for you for the appointed time, for I said, ‘I have invited the people.’” So Saul ate with Samuel that day.

JFA.text: Então desceram do alto para a cidade, e falou Samuel com Saul, no eirado.

RVA.text: Y cuando hubieron descendido de lo alto á la ciudad, él habló con Saúl en el terrado.

KJV.text: And when they were come down from the high place into the city, Samuel communed with Saul upon the top of the house.

WEBM.text: When they had come down from the high place into the city, he talked with Saul on the housetop.

JFA.text: E se levantaram de madrugada, quase ao subir da alva, pois Samuel chamou a Saul, que estava no eirado, dizendo: Levanta-te para eu te despedir. Levantou-se, pois, Saul, e sairam ambos, ele e Samuel.

RVA.text: Y al otro día madrugaron: y como al apuntar del alba, Samuel llamó á Saúl, que estaba en el terrado; y dijo: Levántate, para que te despache. Levantóse luego Saúl, y salieron fuera ambos, él y Samuel.

KJV.text: And they arose early: and it came to pass about the spring of the day, that Samuel called Saul to the top of the house, saying, Up, that I may send thee away. And Saul arose, and they went out both of them, he and Samuel, abroad.

WEBM.text: They arose early; and about daybreak, Samuel called to Saul on the housetop, saying, “Get up, that I may send you away.” Saul arose, and they both went outside, he and Samuel, together.

JFA.text: Quando desciam para a extremidade da cidade, Samuel disse a Saul: Dize ao moço que passe adiante de nós (e ele passou); tu, porém, espera aqui, e te farei ouvir a palavra de Deus.

RVA.text: Y descendiendo ellos al cabo de la ciudad, dijo Samuel á Saúl: Di al mozo que vaya delante, (y adelantóse el mozo); mas espera tú un poco para que te declare palabra de Dios.

KJV.text: And as they were going down to the end of the city, Samuel said to Saul, Bid the servant pass on before us, (and he passed on), but stand thou still a while, that I may shew thee the word of God.

WEBM.text: As they were going down at the end of the city, Samuel said to Saul, “Tell the servant to go on ahead of us.” He went ahead, then Samuel said, “But stand still first, that I may cause you to hear God’s message.”

JFA.text: Então Samuel tomou um vaso de azeite, e o derramou sobre a cabeça de Saul, e o beijou, e disse: Porventura não te ungiu o Senhor para ser príncipe sobre a sua herança?

RVA.text: Tomando entonces Samuel una ampolla de aceite, derramóla sobre su cabeza, y besólo, y díjole: ¿No te ha ungido Jehová por capitán sobre su heredad?

KJV.text: Then Samuel took a vial of oil, and poured it upon his head, and kissed him, and said, Is it not because the Lord hath anointed thee to be captain over his inheritance?

WEBM.text: Then Samuel took the vial of oil and poured it on his head, then kissed him and said, “Hasn’t the Lord anointed you to be prince over his inheritance?

JFA.text: Quando te apartares hoje de mim, encontrarás dois homens junto ao sepulcro de Raquel, no termo de Benjamim, em Zelza, os quais te dirão: Acharam-se as jumentas que foste buscar, e eis que já o teu pai deixou de pensar nas jumentas, e anda aflito por causa de ti, dizendo: Que farei eu por meu filho?

RVA.text: Hoy, después que te hayas apartado de mí, hallarás dos hombres junto al sepulcro de Rachêl, en el término de Benjamín, en Selsah, los cuales te dirán: Las asnas que habías ido á buscar, se han hallado; tu padre pues ha dejado ya el negocio de las asnas, si bien está angustioso por vosotros, diciendo: ¿Qué haré acerca de mi hijo?

KJV.text: When thou art departed from me to day, then thou shalt find two men by Rachel's sepulchre in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee, The asses which thou wentest to seek are found: and, lo, thy father hath left the care of the asses, and sorroweth for you, saying, What shall I do for my son?

WEBM.text: When you have departed from me today, then you will find two men by Rachel’s tomb, on the border of Benjamin at Zelzah. They will tell you, ‘The donkeys which you went to look for have been found; and behold, your father has stopped caring about the donkeys and is anxious for you, saying, “What shall I do for my son?”’

JFA.text: Então dali passarás mais adiante, e chegarás ao carvalho de Tabor; ali te encontrarão três homens, que vão subindo a Deus, a Betel, levando um três cabritos, outro três formas de pão, e o outro um odre de vinho.

RVA.text: Y como de allí te fueres más adelante, y llegares á la campiña de Tabor, te saldrán al encuentro tres hombres que suben á Dios en Beth-el, llevando el uno tres cabritos, y el otro tres tortas de pan, y el tercero una vasija de vino:

KJV.text: Then shalt thou go on forward from thence, and thou shalt come to the plain of Tabor, and there shall meet thee three men going up to God to Bethel, one carrying three kids, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine:

WEBM.text: “Then you will go on forward from there, and you will come to the oak of Tabor. Three men will meet you there going up to God to Bethel: one carrying three young goats, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a container of wine.

JFA.text: Eles te saudarão, e te darão dois pães, que receberás das mãos deles.

RVA.text: Los cuales, luego que te hayan saludado, te darán dos panes, los que tomarás de manos de ellos.

KJV.text: And they will salute thee, and give thee two loaves of bread; which thou shalt receive of their hands.

WEBM.text: They will greet you and give you two loaves of bread, which you shall receive from their hand.

JFA.text: Depois chegarás ao outeiro de Deus, onde está a guarnição dos filisteus; ao entrares ali na cidade, encontrarás um grupo de profetas descendo do alto, precedido de saltérios, tambores, flautas e harpas, e eles profetizando.

RVA.text: De allí vendrás al collado de Dios donde está la guarnición de los Filisteos; y cuando entrares allá en la ciudad encontrarás una compañía de profetas que descienden del alto, y delante de ellos salterio, y adufe, y flauta, y arpa, y ellos profetizando:

KJV.text: After that thou shalt come to the hill of God, where is the garrison of the Philistines: and it shall come to pass, when thou art come thither to the city, that thou shalt meet a company of prophets coming down from the high place with a psaltery, and a tabret, and a pipe, and a harp, before them; and they shall prophesy:

WEBM.text: “After that you will come to the hill of God, where the garrison of the Philistines is; and it will happen, when you have come there to the city, that you will meet a band of prophets coming down from the high place with a lute, a tambourine, a pipe, and a harp before them; and they will be prophesying.

JFA.text: E o Espírito do Senhor se apoderará de ti, e profetizarás com eles, e serás transformado em outro homem.

RVA.text: Y el espíritu de Jehová te arrebatará, y profetizarás con ellos, y serás mudado en otro hombre.

KJV.text: And the Spirit of the Lord will come upon thee, and thou shalt prophesy with them, and shalt be turned into another man.

WEBM.text: Then the Lord’s Spirit will come mightily on you, then you will prophesy with them and will be turned into another man.

JFA.text: Quando estes sinais te vierem, faze o que achar a tua mão para fazer, pois Deus é contigo.

RVA.text: Y cuando te hubieren sobrevenido estas señales, haz lo que te viniere á la mano, porque Dios es contigo.

KJV.text: And let it be, when these signs are come unto thee, that thou do as occasion serve thee; for God is with thee.

WEBM.text: Let it be, when these signs have come to you, that you do what is appropriate for the occasion; for God is with you.

JFA.text: Tu, porém, descerás adiante de mim a Gilgal, e eis que eu descerei a ter contigo, para oferecer holocaustos e sacrifícios de ofertas pacíficas. Esperarás sete dias, até que eu vá ter contigo e te declare o que hás de fazer.

RVA.text: Y bajarás delante de mí á Gilgal; y luego descenderé yo á ti para sacrificar holocaustos, é inmolar víctimas pacíficas. Espera siete días, hasta que yo venga á ti, y te enseñe lo que has de hacer.

KJV.text: And thou shalt go down before me to Gilgal; and, behold, I will come down unto thee, to offer burnt offerings, and to sacrifice sacrifices of peace offerings: seven days shalt thou tarry, till I come to thee, and shew thee what thou shalt do.

WEBM.text: “Go down ahead of me to Gilgal; and behold, I will come down to you to offer burnt offerings and to sacrifice sacrifices of peace offerings. Wait seven days, until I come to you and show you what you are to do.”

JFA.text: Ao virar Saul as costas para se apartar de Samuel, Deus lhe mudou o coração em outro; e todos esses sinais aconteceram naquele mesmo dia.

RVA.text: Y fué que así como tornó él su hombro para partirse de Samuel, mudóle Dios su corazón; y todas estas señales acaecieron en aquel día.

KJV.text: And it was so, that when he had turned his back to go from Samuel, God gave him another heart: and all those signs came to pass that day.

WEBM.text: It was so, that when he had turned his back to go from Samuel, God gave him another heart; and all those signs happened that day.

JFA.text: Quando eles iam chegando ao outeiro, eis que um grupo de profetas lhes saiu ao encontro; e o Espírito de Deus se apoderou de Saul, e ele profetizou no meio deles.

RVA.text: Y cuando llegaron allá al collado, he aquí la compañía de los profetas que venía á encontrarse con él, y el espíritu de Dios lo arrebató, y profetizó entre ellos.

KJV.text: And when they came thither to the hill, behold, a company of prophets met him; and the Spirit of God came upon him, and he prophesied among them.

WEBM.text: When they came there to the hill, behold, a band of prophets met him; and the Spirit of God came mightily on him, and he prophesied among them.

JFA.text: Todos os que o tinham conhecido antes, ao verem que ele profetizava com os profetas, diziam uns aos outros: Que é que sucedeu ao filho de Quis? Está também Saul entre os profetas?

RVA.text: Y aconteció que, cuando todos los que le conocían de ayer y de antes, vieron como profetizaba con los profetas, el pueblo decía el uno al otro: ¿Qué ha sucedido al hijo de Cis? ¿Saúl también entre los profetas?

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when all that knew him beforetime saw that, behold, he prophesied among the prophets, then the people said one to another, What is this that is come unto the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?

WEBM.text: When all who knew him before saw that, behold, he prophesied with the prophets, then the people said to one another, “What is this that has come to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?”

JFA.text: Então um homem dali respondeu, e disse: Pois quem é o pai deles? Pelo que se tornou em provérbio: Está também Saul entre os profetas?

RVA.text: Y alguno de allí respondió, y dijo: ¿Y quién es el padre de ellos? Por esta causa se tornó en proverbio: ¿También Saúl entre los profetas?

KJV.text: And one of the same place answered and said, But who is their father? Therefore it became a proverb, Is Saul also among the prophets?

WEBM.text: One from the same place answered, “Who is their father?” Therefore it became a proverb, “Is Saul also among the prophets?”

JFA.text: Tendo ele acabado de profetizar, foi ao alto.

RVA.text: Y cesó de profetizar, y llegó al alto.

KJV.text: And when he had made an end of prophesying, he came to the high place.

WEBM.text: When he had finished prophesying, he came to the high place.

JFA.text: Depois o tio de Saul perguntou-lhe, a ele e ao seu moço: Aonde fostes?: Respondeu ele: Procurar as jumentas; e, não as tendo encontrado, fomos ter com Samuel.

RVA.text: Y un tío de Saúl dijo á él y á su criado: ¿Dónde fuisteis? Y él respondió: A buscar las asnas; y como vimos que no parecían, fuimos á Samuel.

KJV.text: And Saul's uncle said unto him and to his servant, Whither went ye? And he said, To seek the asses: and when we saw that they were no where, we came to Samuel.

WEBM.text: Saul’s uncle said to him and to his servant, “Where did you go?” He said, “To seek the donkeys. When we saw that they were not found, we came to Samuel.”

JFA.text: Disse mais o tio de Saul: Declara-me, peço-te, o que vos disse Samuel.

RVA.text: Y dijo el tío de Saúl: Yo te ruego me declares qué os dijo Samuel.

KJV.text: And Saul's uncle said, Tell me, I pray thee, what Samuel said unto you.

WEBM.text: Saul’s uncle said, “Please tell me what Samuel said to you.”

JFA.text: Ao que respondeu Saul a seu tio: Declarou-nos, seguramente, que as jumentas tinham sido encontradas. Mas quanto ao assunto do reino, de que Samuel falara, nada lhe declarou.

RVA.text: Y Saúl respondió á su tío: Declarónos expresamente que las asnas habían parecido. Mas del negocio del reino, de que Samuel le había hablado, no le descubrió nada.

KJV.text: And Saul said unto his uncle, He told us plainly that the asses were found. But of the matter of the kingdom, whereof Samuel spake, he told him not.

WEBM.text: Saul said to his uncle, “He told us plainly that the donkeys were found.” But concerning the matter of the kingdom, of which Samuel spoke, he didn’t tell him.

JFA.text: Então Samuel convocou o povo ao Senhor em Mizpá.

RVA.text: Y Samuel convocó el pueblo á Jehová en Mizpa;

KJV.text: And Samuel called the people together unto the Lord to Mizpeh;

WEBM.text: Samuel called the people together to the Lord to Mizpah;

JFA.text: E disse aos filhos de Israel: Assim diz o Senhor Deus de Israel: Eu fiz subir a Israel do Egito, e vos livrei da mão dos egípcios e da mão de todos os reinos que vos oprimiam.

RVA.text: Y dijo á los hijos de Israel: Así ha dicho Jehová el Dios de Israel: Yo saqué á Israel de Egipto, y os libré de mano de los Egipcios, y de mano de todos los reinos que os afligieron:

KJV.text: And said unto the children of Israel, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, I brought up Israel out of Egypt, and delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all kingdoms, and of them that oppressed you:

WEBM.text: and he said to the children of Israel, “The Lord, the God of Israel, says ‘I brought Israel up out of Egypt and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all the kingdoms that oppressed you.’

JFA.text: Mas vós hoje rejeitastes a vosso Deus, àquele que vos livrou de todos os vossos males e angústias, e lhe dissestes: Põe um rei sobre nós. Agora, pois, ponde-vos perante o Senhor, segundo as vossas tribos e segundo os vossos milhares.

RVA.text: Mas vosotros habéis desechado hoy á vuestro Dios, que os guarda de todas vuestras aflicciones y angustias, y dijisteis: No, sino pon rey sobre nosotros. Ahora pues, poneos delante de Jehová por vuestras tribus y por vuestros millares.

KJV.text: And ye have this day rejected your God, who himself saved you out of all your adversities and your tribulations; and ye have said unto him, Nay, but set a king over us. Now therefore present yourselves before the Lord by your tribes, and by your thousands.

WEBM.text: But you have today rejected your God, who himself saves you out of all your calamities and your distresses; and you have said to him, ‘No! Set a king over us!’ Now therefore present yourselves before the Lord by your tribes and by your thousands.”

JFA.text: Tendo, pois, Samuel feito chegar todas as tribos de Israel, foi tomada por sorte a tribo de Benjamim.

RVA.text: Y haciendo allegar Samuel todas las tribus de Israel, fué tomada la tribu de Benjamín.

KJV.text: And when Samuel had caused all the tribes of Israel to come near, the tribe of Benjamin was taken.

WEBM.text: So Samuel brought all the tribes of Israel near, and the tribe of Benjamin was chosen.

JFA.text: E, quando fez chegar a tribo de Benjamim segundo as suas famílias, foi tomada a família de Matri, e dela foi tomado Saul, filho de Quis; e o procuraram, mas não foi encontrado.

RVA.text: E hizo llegar la tribu de Benjamín por sus linajes, y fué tomada la familia de Matri; y de ella fué tomado Saúl hijo de Cis. Y le buscaron, mas no fué hallado.

KJV.text: When he had caused the tribe of Benjamin to come near by their families, the family of Matri was taken, and Saul the son of Kish was taken: and when they sought him, he could not be found.

WEBM.text: He brought the tribe of Benjamin near by their families and the family of the Matrites was chosen. Then Saul the son of Kish was chosen; but when they looked for him, he could not be found.

JFA.text: Pelo que tornaram a perguntar ao Senhor: Não veio o homem ainda para cá? E respondeu o Senhor: Eis que se escondeu por entre a bagagem.

RVA.text: Preguntaron pues otra vez á Jehová, si había aún de venir allí aquel varón. Y respondió Jehová: He aquí que él está escondido entre el bagaje.

KJV.text: Therefore they enquired of the Lord further, if the man should yet come thither. And the Lord answered, Behold he hath hid himself among the stuff.

WEBM.text: Therefore they asked of the Lord further, “Is there yet a man to come here?” the Lord answered, “Behold, he has hidden himself among the baggage.”

JFA.text: Correram, pois, e o trouxeram dali; e estando ele no meio do povo, sobressaía em altura a todo o povo desde os ombros para cima.

RVA.text: Entonces corrieron, y tomáronlo de allí, y puesto en medio del pueblo, desde el hombro arriba era más alto que todo el pueblo.

KJV.text: And they ran and fetched him thence: and when he stood among the people, he was higher than any of the people from his shoulders and upward.

WEBM.text: They ran and got him there. When he stood among the people, he was higher than any of the people from his shoulders and upward.

JFA.text: Então disse Samuel a todo o povo: Vedes já a quem o Senhor escolheu: Não há entre o povo nenhum semelhante a ele. Então todo o povo o aclamou, dizendo: Viva o rei.

RVA.text: Y Samuel dijo á todo el pueblo: ¿Habéis visto al que ha elegido Jehová, que no hay semejante á él en todo el pueblo? Entonces el pueblo clamó con alegría, diciendo: Viva el rey.

KJV.text: And Samuel said to all the people, See ye him whom the Lord hath chosen, that there is none like him among all the people? And all the people shouted, and said, God save the king.

WEBM.text: Samuel said to all the people, “Do you see him whom the Lord has chosen, that there is no one like him among all the people?” All the people shouted and said, “Long live the king!”

JFA.text: Também declarou Samuel ao povo a lei do reino, e a escreveu num livro, e pô-lo perante o Senhor. Então Samuel despediu todo o povo, cada um para sua casa.

RVA.text: Samuel recitó luego al pueblo el derecho del reino, y escribiólo en un libro, el cual guardó delante de Jehová.

KJV.text: Then Samuel told the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book, and laid it up before the Lord. And Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.

WEBM.text: Then Samuel told the people the regulations of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book and laid it up before the Lord. Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.

JFA.text: E foi também Saul para sua casa em Gibeá; e foram com ele homens de valor, aqueles cujo coração Deus tocara.

RVA.text: Y envió Samuel á todo el pueblo cada uno á su casa. Y Saúl también se fué á su casa en Gabaa, y fueron con él el ejército, el corazón de los cuales Dios había tocado.

KJV.text: And Saul also went home to Gibeah; and there went with him a band of men, whose hearts God had touched.

WEBM.text: Saul also went to his house in Gibeah; and the army went with him, whose hearts God had touched.

JFA.text: Mas alguns homens ímpios disseram: Como pode este homem nos livrar? E o desprezaram, e não lhe trouxeram presentes; porém ele se fez como surdo.

RVA.text: Pero los impíos dijeron: ¿Cómo nos ha de salvar éste? Y tuviéronle en poco, y no le trajeron presente: mas él disimuló.

KJV.text: But the children of Belial said, How shall this man save us? And they despised him, and brought no presents. But he held his peace.

WEBM.text: But certain worthless fellows said, “How could this man save us?” They despised him, and brought him no tribute. But he held his peace.

JFA.text: Então disse o Senhor a Samuel: Até quando terás dó de Saul, havendo-o eu rejeitado, para que não reine sobre Israel? Enche o teu vaso de azeite, e vem; enviar-te-ei a Jessé o belemita, porque dentre os seus filhos me tenho provido de um rei.

RVA.text: Y dijo Jehová á Samuel: ¿Hasta cuándo has tú de llorar á Saúl, habiéndolo yo desechado para que no reine sobre Israel? Hinche tu cuerno de aceite, y ven, te enviaré á Isaí de Beth-lehem: porque de sus hijos me he provisto de rey.

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Samuel, How long wilt thou mourn for Saul, seeing I have rejected him from reigning over Israel? fill thine horn with oil, and go, I will send thee to Jesse the Bethlehemite: for I have provided me a king among his sons.

WEBM.text: the Lord said to Samuel, “How long will you mourn for Saul, since I have rejected him from being king over Israel? Fill your horn with oil, and go. I will send you to Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have provided a king for myself among his sons.”

JFA.text: Disse, porém, Samuel: Como irei eu? pois Saul o ouvirá e me matará. Então disse o Senhor: Leva contigo uma bezerra, e dize: Vim para oferecer sacrifício ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Y dijo Samuel: ¿Cómo iré? Si Saúl lo entendiere, me matará. Jehová respondió: Toma contigo una becerra de la vacada, y di: A sacrificar á Jehová he venido.

KJV.text: And Samuel said, How can I go? if Saul hear it, he will kill me. And the Lord said, Take an heifer with thee, and say, I am come to sacrifice to the Lord.

WEBM.text: Samuel said, “How can I go? If Saul hears it, he will kill me.” the Lord said, “Take a heifer with you, and say, I have come to sacrifice to the Lord.

JFA.text: E convidarás a Jessé para o sacrifício, e eu te farei saber o que hás de fazer; e ungir-me-ás a quem eu te designar.

RVA.text: Y llama á Isaí al sacrificio, y yo te enseñaré lo que has de hacer; y ungirme has al que yo te dijere.

KJV.text: And call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will shew thee what thou shalt do: and thou shalt anoint unto me him whom I name unto thee.

WEBM.text: Call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show you what you shall do. You shall anoint to me him whom I name to you.”

JFA.text: Fez, pois, Samuel o que dissera o Senhor, e veio a Belém; então os anciãos da cidade lhe saíram ao encontro, tremendo, e perguntaram: É de paz a tua vinda?

RVA.text: Hizo pues Samuel como le dijo Jehová: y luego que él llegó á Beth-lehem, los ancianos de la ciudad le salieron á recibir con miedo, y dijeron: ¿Es pacífica tu venida?

KJV.text: And Samuel did that which the Lord spake, and came to Bethlehem. And the elders of the town trembled at his coming, and said, Comest thou peaceably?

WEBM.text: Samuel did that which the Lord spoke, and came to Bethlehem. The elders of the city came to meet him trembling, and said, “Do you come peaceably?”

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: É de paz; vim oferecer sacrifício ao Senhor. Santificai-vos, e vinde comigo ao sacrifício. E santificou ele a Jessé e a seus filhos, e os convidou para o sacrifício.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: Sí, vengo á sacrificar á Jehová; santificaos, y venid conmigo al sacrificio. Y santificando él á Isaí y á sus hijos, llamólos al sacrificio.

KJV.text: And he said, Peaceably: I am come to sacrifice unto the Lord: sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. And he sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.

WEBM.text: He said, “Peaceably; I have come to sacrifice to the Lord. Sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice.” He sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.

JFA.text: E sucedeu que, entrando eles, viu a Eliabe, e disse: Certamente está perante o Senhor o seu ungido.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que como ellos vinieron, él vió á Eliab, y dijo: De cierto delante de Jehová está su ungido.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when they were come, that he looked on Eliab, and said, Surely the Lord's anointed is before him.

WEBM.text: When they had come, he looked at Eliab, and said, “Surely the Lord’s anointed is before him.”

JFA.text: Mas o Senhor disse a Samuel: Não atentes para a sua aparência, nem para a grandeza da sua estatura, porque eu o rejeitei; porque o Senhor não vê como vê o homem, pois o homem olha para o que está diante dos olhos, porém o Senhor olha para o coraçao.

RVA.text: Y Jehová respondió á Samuel: No mires á su parecer, ni á lo grande de su estatura, porque yo lo desecho; porque Jehová mira no lo que el hombre mira; pues que el hombre mira lo que está delante de sus ojos, mas Jehová mira el corazón.

KJV.text: But the Lord said unto Samuel, Look not on his countenance, or on the height of his stature; because I have refused him: for the Lord seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the Lord looketh on the heart.

WEBM.text: But the Lord said to Samuel, “Don’t look on his face, or on the height of his stature, because I have rejected him; for I don’t see as man sees. For man looks at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.”

JFA.text: Depois chamou Jessé a Abinadabe, e o fez passar diante de Samuel, o qual disse: Nem a este escolheu o Senhor.

RVA.text: Entonces llamó Isaí á Abinadab, é hízole pasar delante de Samuel, el cual dijo: Ni á éste ha elegido Jehová.

KJV.text: Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. And he said, Neither hath the Lord chosen this.

WEBM.text: Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. He said, “The Lord has not chosen this one, either.”

JFA.text: Então Jessé fez passar a Samá; Samuel, porém, disse: Tampouco a este escolheu o Senhor.

RVA.text: Hizo luego pasar Isaí á Samma. Y él dijo: Tampoco á éste ha elegido Jehová.

KJV.text: Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. And he said, Neither hath the Lord chosen this.

WEBM.text: Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. He said, “The Lord has not chosen this one, either.”

JFA.text: Assim fez passar Jessé a sete de seus filhos diante de Samuel; porém Samuel disse a Jessé: O Senhor não escolheu a nenhum destes.

RVA.text: E hizo pasar Isaí sus siete hijos delante de Samuel; mas Samuel dijo á Isaí: Jehová no ha elegido á éstos.

KJV.text: Again, Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. And Samuel said unto Jesse, The Lord hath not chosen these.

WEBM.text: Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. Samuel said to Jesse, “The Lord has not chosen these.”

JFA.text: Disse mais Samuel a Jessé: São estes todos os teus filhos? Respondeu Jessé: Ainda falta o menor, que está apascentando as ovelhas. Disse, pois, Samuel a Jessé: Manda trazê-lo, porquanto não nos sentaremos até que ele venha aqui.

RVA.text: Entonces dijo Samuel á Isaí: ¿Hanse acabado los mozos? Y él respondió: Aun queda el menor, que apacienta las ovejas. Y dijo Samuel á Isaí: Envía por él, porque no nos asentaremos á la mesa hasta que él venga aquí.

KJV.text: And Samuel said unto Jesse, Are here all thy children? And he said, There remaineth yet the youngest, and, behold, he keepeth the sheep. And Samuel said unto Jesse, Send and fetch him: for we will not sit down till he come hither.

WEBM.text: Samuel said to Jesse, “Are all your children here?” He said, “There remains yet the youngest. Behold, he is keeping the sheep.” Samuel said to Jesse, “Send and get him, for we will not sit down until he comes here.”

JFA.text: Jessé mandou buscá-lo e o fez entrar. Ora, ele era ruivo, de belos olhos e de gentil aspecto. Então disse o Senhor: Levanta-te, e unge-o, porque é este mesmo.

RVA.text: Envió pues por él, é introdújolo; el cual era rubio, de hermoso parecer y de bello aspecto. Entonces Jehová dijo: Levántate y úngelo, que éste es.

KJV.text: And he sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, and withal of a beautiful countenance, and goodly to look to. And the Lord said, Arise, anoint him: for this is he.

WEBM.text: He sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, with a handsome face and good appearance. the Lord said, “Arise! Anoint him, for this is he.”

JFA.text: Então Samuel tomou o vaso de azeite, e o ungiu no meio de seus irmãos; e daquele dia em diante o Espírito do Senhor se apoderou de Davi. Depois Samuel se levantou, e foi para Ramá.

RVA.text: Y Samuel tomó el cuerno del aceite, y ungiólo de entre sus hermanos: y desde aquel día en adelante el espíritu de Jehová tomó á David. Levantóse luego Samuel, y volvióse á Rama.

KJV.text: Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brethren: and the Spirit of the Lord came upon David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah.

WEBM.text: Then Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the middle of his brothers. Then the Lord’s Spirit came mightily on David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up and went to Ramah.

JFA.text: Ora, o Espírito do Senhor retirou-se de Saul, e o atormentava um espírito maligno da parte do Senhor.

RVA.text: Y el espíritu de Jehová se apartó de Saúl, y atormentábale el espíritu malo de parte de Jehová.

KJV.text: But the Spirit of the Lord departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the Lord troubled him.

WEBM.text: Now the Lord’s Spirit departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the Lord troubled him.

JFA.text: Então os criados de Saul lhe disseram: Eis que agora um espírito maligno da parte de Deus te atormenta.

RVA.text: Y los criados de Saúl le dijeron: He aquí ahora, que el espíritu malo de parte de Dios te atormenta.

KJV.text: And Saul's servants said unto him, Behold now, an evil spirit from God troubleth thee.

WEBM.text: Saul’s servants said to him, “See now, an evil spirit from God troubles you.

JFA.text: Dize, pois, Senhor nosso, a teus servos que estão na tua presença, que busquem um homem que saiba tocar harpa; e quando o espírito maligno da parte do Senhor vier sobre ti, ele tocara com a sua mão, e te sentirás melhor.

RVA.text: Diga pues nuestro señor á tus siervos que están delante de ti, que busquen alguno que sepa tocar el arpa; para que cuando fuere sobre ti el espíritu malo de parte de Dios, él taña con su mano, y tengas alivio.

KJV.text: Let our lord now command thy servants, which are before thee, to seek out a man, who is a cunning player on an harp: and it shall come to pass, when the evil spirit from God is upon thee, that he shall play with his hand, and thou shalt be well.

WEBM.text: Let our lord now command your servants who are in front of you to seek out a man who is a skillful player on the harp. Then when the evil spirit from God is on you, he will play with his hand, and you will be well.”

JFA.text: Então disse Saul aos seus servos: Buscai-me, pois, um homem que toque bem, e trazei-mo.

RVA.text: Y Saúl respondió á sus criados: Buscadme pues ahora alguno que taña bien, y traédmelo.

KJV.text: And Saul said unto his servants, Provide me now a man that can play well, and bring him to me.

WEBM.text: Saul said to his servants, “Provide me now a man who can play well, and bring him to me.”

JFA.text: Respondeu um dos mancebos: Eis que tenho visto um filho de Jessé, o belemita, que sabe tocar bem, e é forte e destemido, homem de guerra, sisudo em palavras, e de gentil aspecto; e o Senhor é com ele.

RVA.text: Entonces uno de los criados respondió, diciendo: He aquí yo he visto á un hijo de Isaí de Beth-lehem, que sabe tocar, y es valiente y vigoroso, y hombre de guerra, prudente en sus palabras, y hermoso, y Jehová es con él.

KJV.text: Then answered one of the servants, and said, Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite, that is cunning in playing, and a mighty valiant man, and a man of war, and prudent in matters, and a comely person, and the Lord is with him.

WEBM.text: Then one of the young men answered and said, “Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite who is skillful in playing, a mighty man of valor, a man of war, prudent in speech, and a handsome person; and the Lord is with him.”

JFA.text: Pelo que Saul enviou mensageiros a Jessé, dizendo: Envia-me Davi, teu filho, o que está com as ovelhas.

RVA.text: Y Saúl envió mensajeros á Isaí, diciendo: Envíame á David tu hijo, el que está con las ovejas.

KJV.text: Wherefore Saul sent messengers unto Jesse, and said, Send me David thy son, which is with the sheep.

WEBM.text: Therefore Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and said, “Send me David your son, who is with the sheep.”

JFA.text: Jessé, pois, tomou um jumento carregado de pão, e um odre de vinho, e um cabrito, e os enviou a Saul pela mão de Davi, seu filho.

RVA.text: Y tomó Isaí un asno cargado de pan, y un vasija de vino y un cabrito, y enviólo á Saúl por mano de David su hijo.

KJV.text: And Jesse took an ass laden with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a kid, and sent them by David his son unto Saul.

WEBM.text: Jesse took a donkey loaded with bread, and a container of wine, and a young goat, and sent them by David his son to Saul.

JFA.text: Assim Davi veio e se apresentou a Saul, que se agradou muito dele e o fez seu escudeiro.

RVA.text: Y viniendo David á Saúl, estuvo delante de él: y amólo él mucho, y fué hecho su escudero.

KJV.text: And David came to Saul, and stood before him: and he loved him greatly; and he became his armourbearer.

WEBM.text: David came to Saul and stood before him. He loved him greatly; and he became his armor bearer.

JFA.text: Então Saul mandou dizer a Jessé: Deixa ficar Davi ao meu serviço, pois achou graça aos meus olhos.

RVA.text: Y Saúl envió á decir á Isaí: Yo te ruego que esté David conmigo; porque ha hallado gracia en mis ojos.

KJV.text: And Saul sent to Jesse, saying, Let David, I pray thee, stand before me; for he hath found favour in my sight.

WEBM.text: Saul sent to Jesse, saying, “Please let David stand before me, for he has found favor in my sight.”

JFA.text: E quando o espírito maligno da parte de Deus vinha sobre Saul, Davi tomava a harpa, e a tocava com a sua mão; então Saul sentia alívio, e se achava melhor, e o espírito maligno se retirava dele.

RVA.text: Y cuando el espíritu malo de parte de Dios era sobre Saúl, David tomaba el arpa, y tañía con su mano; y Saúl tenía refrigerio, y estaba mejor, y el espíritu malo se apartaba de él.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when the evil spirit from God was upon Saul, that David took an harp, and played with his hand: so Saul was refreshed, and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.

WEBM.text: When the spirit from God was on Saul, David took the harp and played with his hand; so Saul was refreshed and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.

JFA.text: Ora, os filisteus ajuntaram as suas forças para a guerra e congregaram-se em Socó, que pertence a Judá, e acamparam entre Socó e Azeca, em Efes-Damim.

RVA.text: Y los Filisteos juntaron sus ejércitos para la guerra, y congregáronse en Sochô, que es de Judá, y asentaron el campo entre Sochô y Azeca, en Ephes-dammim.

KJV.text: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle, and were gathered together at Shochoh, which belongeth to Judah, and pitched between Shochoh and Azekah, in Ephesdammim.

WEBM.text: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle; and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and encamped between Socoh and Azekah in Ephesdammim.

JFA.text: Saul, porém, e os homens de Israel se ajuntaram e acamparam no vale de Elá, e ordenaram a batalha contra os filisteus.

RVA.text: Y también Saúl y los hombres de Israel se juntaron, y asentaron el campo en el valle del Alcornoque, y ordenaron la batalla contra los Filisteos.

KJV.text: And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and pitched by the valley of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.

WEBM.text: Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and encamped in the valley of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.

JFA.text: Os filisteus estavam num monte de um lado, e os israelitas estavam num monte do outro lado; e entre eles o vale.

RVA.text: Y los Filisteos estaban sobre el un monte de la una parte, é Israel estaba sobre el otro monte de la otra parte, y el valle entre ellos:

KJV.text: And the Philistines stood on a mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.

WEBM.text: The Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.

JFA.text: Então saiu do arraial dos filisteus um campeão, cujo nome era Golias, de Gate, que tinha de altura seis côvados e um palmo.

RVA.text: Salió entonces un varón del campo de los Filisteos que se puso entre los dos campos, el cual se llamaba Goliath, de Gath, y tenía de altura seis codos y un palmo.

KJV.text: And there went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.

WEBM.text: A champion out of the camp of the Philistines named Goliath of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span went out.

JFA.text: Trazia na cabeça um capacete de bronze, e vestia uma couraça escameada, cujo peso era de cinco mil siclos de bronze.

RVA.text: Y traía un almete de acero en su cabeza, é iba vestido con corazas de planchas: y era el peso de la coraza cinco mil siclos de metal:

KJV.text: And he had an helmet of brass upon his head, and he was armed with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.

WEBM.text: He had a helmet of bronze on his head, and he wore a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of bronze.

JFA.text: Também trazia grevas de bronze nas pernas, e um dardo de bronze entre os ombros.

RVA.text: Y sobre sus piernas traía grebas de hierro, y escudo de acero á sus hombros.

KJV.text: And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a target of brass between his shoulders.

WEBM.text: He had bronze shin armor on his legs and a bronze javelin between his shoulders.

JFA.text: A haste da sua lança era como o órgão de um tear, e a ponta da sua lança pesava seiscentos siclos de ferro; adiante dele ia o seu escudeiro.

RVA.text: El asta de su lanza era como un enjullo de telar, y tenía el hierro de su lanza seiscientos siclos de hierro: é iba su escudero delante de él.

KJV.text: And the staff of his spear was like a weaver's beam; and his spear's head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and one bearing a shield went before him.

WEBM.text: The staff of his spear was like a weaver’s beam; and his spear’s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron. His shield bearer went before him.

JFA.text: Ele, pois, de pé, clamava às fileiras de Israel e dizia-lhes: Por que saístes a ordenar a batalha? Não sou eu filisteu, e vós servos de Saul? Escolhei dentre vós um homem que desça a mim.

RVA.text: Y paróse, y dió voces á los escuadrones de Israel, diciéndoles: ¿Para qué salís á dar batalla? ¿no soy yo el Filisteo, y vosotros los siervos de Saúl? Escoged de entre vosotros un hombre que venga contra mí:

KJV.text: And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel, and said unto them, Why are ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.

WEBM.text: He stood and cried to the armies of Israel, and said to them, “Why have you come out to set your battle in array? Am I not a Philistine, and you servants to Saul? Choose a man for yourselves, and let him come down to me.

JFA.text: Se ele puder pelejar comigo e matar-me, seremos vossos servos; porem, se eu prevalecer contra ele e o matar, então sereis nossos servos, e nos servireis.

RVA.text: Si él pudiere pelear conmigo, y me venciere, nosotros seremos vuestros siervos: y si yo pudiere más que él, y lo venciere, vosotros seréis nuestros siervos y nos serviréis.

KJV.text: If he be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants: but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.

WEBM.text: If he is able to fight with me and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him and kill him, then you will be our servants and serve us.”

JFA.text: Disse mais o filisteu: Desafio hoje as fileiras de Israel; dai-me um homem, para que nós dois pelejemos.

RVA.text: Y añadió el Filisteo: Hoy yo he desafiado el campo de Israel; dadme un hombre que pelee conmigo.

KJV.text: And the Philistine said, I defy the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.

WEBM.text: The Philistine said, “I defy the armies of Israel today! Give me a man, that we may fight together!”

JFA.text: Ouvindo, então, Saul e todo o Israel estas palavras do filisteu, desalentaram-se, e temeram muito.

RVA.text: Y oyendo Saúl y todo Israel estas palabras del Filisteo, conturbáronse, y tuvieron gran miedo.

KJV.text: When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.

WEBM.text: When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed and greatly afraid.

JFA.text: Ora, Davi era filho de um homem efrateu, de Belém de Judá, cujo nome era Jessé, que tinha oito filhos; e nos dias de Saul este homem era já velho e avançado em idade entre os homens.

RVA.text: Y David era hijo de aquel hombre Ephrateo de Beth-lehem de Judá, cuyo nombre era Isaí, el cual tenía ocho hijos; y era este hombre en el tiempo de Saúl, viejo, y de grande edad entre los hombres.

KJV.text: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehemjudah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man went among men for an old man in the days of Saul.

WEBM.text: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem Judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons. The man was an elderly old man in the days of Saul.

JFA.text: Os três filhos mais velhos de Jessé tinham seguido a Saul à guerra; eram os nomes de seus três filhos que foram à guerra: Eliabe, o primogênito, o segundo Abinadabe, e o terceiro Samá.

RVA.text: Y los tres hijos mayores de Isaí habían ido á seguir á Saúl en la guerra. Y los nombres de sus tres hijos que habían ido á la guerra, eran, Eliab el primogénito, el segundo Abinadab, y el tercero Samma.

KJV.text: And the three eldest sons of Jesse went and followed Saul to the battle: and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next unto him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.

WEBM.text: The three oldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle; and the names of his three sons who went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.

JFA.text: Davi era o mais moço; os três maiores seguiram a Saul.

RVA.text: Y David era el menor. Siguieron pues los tres mayores á Saúl.

KJV.text: And David was the youngest: and the three eldest followed Saul.

WEBM.text: David was the youngest; and the three oldest followed Saul.

JFA.text: Mas Davi ia e voltava de Saul, para apascentar as ovelhas de seu pai em Belem.

RVA.text: Empero David había ido y vuelto de con Saúl, para apacentar las ovejas de su padre en Beth-lehem.

KJV.text: But David went and returned from Saul to feed his father's sheep at Bethlehem.

WEBM.text: Now David went back and forth from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.

JFA.text: Chegava-se, pois, o filisteu pela manhã e à tarde; e apresentou-se por quarenta dias.

RVA.text: Venía pues aquel Filisteo por la mañana y á la tarde, y presentóse por cuarenta días.

KJV.text: And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.

WEBM.text: The Philistine came near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.

JFA.text: Disse então Jessé a Davi, seu filho: Toma agora para teus irmãos uma refa deste grão tostado e estes dez pães, e corre a levá-los ao arraial, a teus irmãos.

RVA.text: Y dijo Isaí á David su hijo: Toma ahora para tus hermanos un epha de este grano tostado, y estos diez panes, y llévalo presto al campamento á tus hermanos.

KJV.text: And Jesse said unto David his son, Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched corn, and these ten loaves, and run to the camp of thy brethren;

WEBM.text: Jesse said to David his son, “Now take for your brothers an ephah of this parched grain and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to your brothers;

JFA.text: Leva, também, estes dez queijos ao seu comandante de mil; e verás como passam teus irmãos, e trarás notícias deles.

RVA.text: Llevarás asimismo estos diez quesos de leche al capitán, y cuida de ver si tus hermanos están buenos, y toma prendas de ellos.

KJV.text: And carry these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and look how thy brethren fare, and take their pledge.

WEBM.text: and bring these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand; and see how your brothers are doing, and bring back news.”

JFA.text: Ora, estavam Saul, e eles, e todos os homens de Israel no vale de Elá, pelejando contra os filisteus.

RVA.text: Y Saúl y ellos y todos lo de Israel, estaban en el valle del Alcornoque, peleando con los Filisteos.

KJV.text: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.

WEBM.text: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.

JFA.text: Davi então se levantou de madrugada e, deixando as ovelhas com um guarda, carregou-se e partiu, como Jessé lhe ordenara; e chegou ao arraial quando o exército estava saindo em ordem de batalha e dava gritos de guerra.

RVA.text: Levantóse pues David de mañana, y dejando las ovejas al cuidado de un guarda, fuése con su carga, como Isaí le había mandado; y llegó al atrincheramiento del ejército, el cual había salido en ordenanza, y tocaba alarma para la pelea.

KJV.text: And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the trench, as the host was going forth to the fight, and shouted for the battle.

WEBM.text: David rose up early in the morning and left the sheep with a keeper, and took the provisions and went, as Jesse had commanded him. He came to the place of the wagons as the army which was going out to the fight shouted for the battle.

JFA.text: Os israelitas e os filisteus se punham em ordem de batalha, fileira contra fileira.

RVA.text: Porque así los Israelitas como los Filisteos estaban en ordenanza, escuadrón contra escuadrón.

KJV.text: For Israel and the Philistines had put the battle in array, army against army.

WEBM.text: Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army.

JFA.text: E Davi, deixando na mão do guarda da bagagem a carga que trouxera, correu às fileiras; e, chegando, perguntou a seus irmãos se estavam bem.

RVA.text: Y David dejó de sobre sí la carga en mano del que guardaba el bagaje, y corrió al escuadrón; y llegado que hubo, preguntaba por sus hermanos, si estaban buenos.

KJV.text: And David left his carriage in the hand of the keeper of the carriage, and ran into the army, and came and saluted his brethren.

WEBM.text: David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage and ran to the army, and came and greeted his brothers.

JFA.text: Enquanto ainda falava com eles, eis que veio subindo do exército dos filisteus o campeão, cujo nome era Golias, o filisteu de Gate, e falou conforme aquelas palavras; e Davi as ouviu.

RVA.text: Y estando él hablando con ellos, he aquí aquel varón que se ponía en medio de los dos campos, que se llamaba Goliath, el Filisteo de Gath, salió de los escuadrones de los Filisteos, y habló las mismas palabras; las cuales oyó David.

KJV.text: And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the armies of the Philistines, and spake according to the same words: and David heard them.

WEBM.text: As he talked with them, behold, the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, came up out of the ranks of the Philistines, and said the same words; and David heard them.

JFA.text: E todos os homens de Israel, vendo aquele homem, fugiam, de diante dele, tomados de pavor.

RVA.text: Y todos los varones de Israel que veían aquel hombre, huían de su presencia, y tenían gran temor.

KJV.text: And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid.

WEBM.text: All the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him and were terrified.

JFA.text: Diziam os homens de Israel: Vistes aquele homem que subiu? pois subiu para desafiar a Israel. Ao homem, pos, que o matar, o rei cumulará de grandes riquezas, e lhe dará a sua filha, e fará livre a casa de seu pai em Israel.

RVA.text: Y cada uno de los de Israel decía: ¿No habéis visto aquel hombre que ha salido? él se adelanta para provocar á Israel. Al que le venciere, el rey le enriquecerá con grandes riquezas, y le dará su hija, y hará franca la casa de su padre en Israel.

KJV.text: And the men of Israel said, Have ye seen this man that is come up? surely to defy Israel is he come up: and it shall be, that the man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father's house free in Israel.

WEBM.text: The men of Israel said, “Have you seen this man who has come up? He has surely come up to defy Israel. The king will give great riches to the man who kills him, and will give him his daughter, and will make his father’s house tax-free in Israel.”

JFA.text: Então falou Davi aos homens que se achavam perto dele, dizendo: Que se fará ao homem que matar a esse filisteu, e tirar a afronta de sobre Israel? pois quem é esse incircunciso filisteu, para afrontar os exércitos do Deus vivo?

RVA.text: Entonces habló David á los que junto á él estaban, diciendo: ¿Qué harán al hombre que venciere á este Filisteo, y quitare el oprobio de Israel? Porque ¿quién es este Filisteo incircunciso, para que provoque á los escuadrones del Dios viviente?

KJV.text: And David spake to the men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?

WEBM.text: David spoke to the men who stood by him, saying, “What shall be done to the man who kills this Philistine and takes away the reproach from Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?”

JFA.text: E o povo lhe repetiu aquela palavra, dizendo: Assim se fará ao homem que o matar.

RVA.text: Y el pueblo le respondió las mismas palabras, diciendo: Así se hará al hombre que lo venciere.

KJV.text: And the people answered him after this manner, saying, So shall it be done to the man that killeth him.

WEBM.text: The people answered him in this way, saying, “So shall it be done to the man who kills him.”

JFA.text: Eliabe, seu irmão mais velho, ouviu-o quando falava àqueles homens; pelo que se acendeu a sua ira contra Davi, e disse: Por que desceste aqui, e a quem deixaste aquelas poucas ovelhas no deserto? Eu conheço a tua presunção, e a maldade do teu coração; pois desceste para ver a peleja.

RVA.text: Y oyéndole hablar Eliab su hermano mayor con aquellos hombres, Eliab se encendió en ira contra David, y dijo: ¿Para qué has descendido acá? ¿y á quién has dejado aquellas pocas ovejas en el desierto? Yo conozco tu soberbia y la malicia de tu corazón, que para ver la batalla has venido.

KJV.text: And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men; and Eliab's anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why camest thou down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy pride, and the naughtiness of thine heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.

WEBM.text: Eliab his oldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab’s anger burned against David, and he said, “Why have you come down? With whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride and the evil of your heart; for you have come down that you might see the battle.”

JFA.text: Respondeu Davi: Que fiz eu agora? porventura não há razão para isso?

RVA.text: Y David respondió: ¿Qué he hecho yo ahora? Estas, ¿no son palabras?

KJV.text: And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?

WEBM.text: David said, “What have I now done? Is there not a cause?”

JFA.text: E virou-se dele para outro, e repetiu as suas perguntas; e o povo lhe respondeu como da primeira vez.

RVA.text: Y apartándose de él hacia otros, habló lo mismo; y respondiéronle los del pueblo como primero.

KJV.text: And he turned from him toward another, and spake after the same manner: and the people answered him again after the former manner.

WEBM.text: He turned away from him toward another, and spoke like that again; and the people answered him again the same way.

JFA.text: Então, ouvidas as palavras que Davi falara, foram elas referidas a Saul, que mandou chamá-lo.

RVA.text: Y fueron oídas las palabras que David había dicho, las cuales como refiriesen delante de Saúl, él lo hizo venir.

KJV.text: And when the words were heard which David spake, they rehearsed them before Saul: and he sent for him.

WEBM.text: When the words were heard which David spoke, they rehearsed them before Saul; and he sent for him.

JFA.text: E Davi disse a Saul: Não desfaleça o coração de ninguém por causa dele; teu servo irá, e pelejará contra este filisteu.

RVA.text: Y dijo David á Saúl: No desmaye ninguno á causa de él; tu siervo irá y peleará con este Filisteo.

KJV.text: And David said to Saul, Let no man's heart fail because of him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.

WEBM.text: David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail because of him. Your servant will go and fight with this Philistine.”

JFA.text: Saul, porém, disse a Davi: Não poderás ir contra esse filisteu para pelejar com ele, pois tu ainda és moço, e ele homem de guerra desde a sua mocidade.

RVA.text: Y dijo Saúl á David: No podrás tú ir contra aquel Filisteo, para pelear con él; porque tú eres mozo, y él un hombre de guerra desde su juventud.

KJV.text: And Saul said to David, Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him: for thou art but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.

WEBM.text: Saul said to David, “You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for you are but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.”

JFA.text: Então disse Davi a Saul: Teu servo apascentava as ovelhas de seu pai, e sempre que vinha um leão, ou um urso, e tomava um cordeiro do rebanho.

RVA.text: Y David respondió á Saúl: Tu siervo era pastor en las ovejas de su padre, y venía un león, ó un oso, y tomaba algún cordero de la manada,

KJV.text: And David said unto Saul, Thy servant kept his father's sheep, and there came a lion, and a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock:

WEBM.text: David said to Saul, “Your servant was keeping his father’s sheep; and when a lion or a bear came and took a lamb out of the flock,

JFA.text: Eu saía após ele, e o matava, e lho arrancava da boca; levantando-se ele contra mim, segurava-o pela queixada, e o feria e matava.

RVA.text: Y salía yo tras él, y heríalo, y librábale de su boca: y si se levantaba contra mí, yo le echaba mano de la quijada, y lo hería y mataba.

KJV.text: And I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered it out of his mouth: and when he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and smote him, and slew him.

WEBM.text: I went out after him, struck him, and rescued it out of his mouth. When he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, struck him, and killed him.

JFA.text: O teu servo matava tanto ao leão como ao urso; e este incircunciso filisteu será como um deles, porquanto afrontou os exércitos do Deus vivo.

RVA.text: Fuese león, fuese oso, tu siervo lo mataba; pues este Filisteo incircunciso será como uno de ellos, porque ha provocado al ejército del Dios viviente.

KJV.text: Thy servant slew both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied the armies of the living God.

WEBM.text: Your servant struck both the lion and the bear. This uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, since he has defied the armies of the living God.”

JFA.text: Disse mais Davi: O Senhor, que me livrou das garras do leão, e das garras do urso, me livrará da mão deste filisteu. Então disse Saul a Davi: Vai, e o Senhor seja contigo.

RVA.text: Y añadió David: Jehová que me ha librado de las garras del león y de las garras del oso, él también me librará de la mano de este Filisteo. Y dijo Saúl á David: Ve, y Jehová sea contigo.

KJV.text: David said moreover, The Lord that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said unto David, Go, and the Lord be with thee.

WEBM.text: David said, “The Lord, who delivered me out of the paw of the lion and out of the paw of the bear, will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine.” Saul said to David, “Go! the Lord will be with you.”

JFA.text: E vestiu a Davi da sua própria armadura, pôs-lhe sobre a cabeça um capacete de bronze, e o vestiu de uma couraça.

RVA.text: Y Saúl vistió á David de sus ropas, y puso sobre su cabeza un almete de acero, y armóle de coraza.

KJV.text: And Saul armed David with his armour, and he put an helmet of brass upon his head; also he armed him with a coat of mail.

WEBM.text: Saul dressed David with his clothing. He put a helmet of bronze on his head, and he clad him with a coat of mail.

JFA.text: Davi cingiu a espada sobre a armadura e procurou em vão andar, pois não estava acostumado àquilo. Então disse Davi a Saul: Não posso andar com isto, pois não estou acostumado. E Davi tirou aquilo de sobre si.

RVA.text: Y ciñó David su espada sobre sus vestidos, y probó á andar, porque nunca había probado. Y dijo David á Saúl: Yo no puedo andar con esto, porque nunca lo practiqué. Y echando de sí David aquellas cosas,

RVA.text: Tomó su cayado en su mano, y escogióse cinco piedras lisas del arroyo, y púsolas en el saco pastoril y en el zurrón que traía, y con su honda en su mano vase hacia el Filisteo.

KJV.text: And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd's bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.

RVA.text: Entonces dijo David al Filisteo: Tú vienes á mí con espada y lanza y escudo; mas yo vengo á ti en el nombre de Jehová de los ejércitos, el Dios de los escuadrones de Israel, que tú has provocado.

KJV.text: This day will the Lord deliver thee into mine hand; and I will smite thee, and take thine head from thee; and I will give the carcases of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the air, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.

KJV.text: And the men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until thou come to the valley, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even unto Gath, and unto Ekron.

WEBM.text: saying, ‘Go to this people and say, in hearing, you will hear, but will in no way understand. In seeing, you will see, but will in no way perceive.

JFA.text: Porque o coração deste povo se endureceu, e com os ouvidos ouviram tardamente, e fecharam os olhos; para que não vejam com os olhos, nem ouçam com os ouvidos, nem entendam com o coração nem se convertam e eu os cure.

RVA.text: Porque el corazón de este pueblo se ha engrosado, Y de los oídos oyeron pesadamente, Y sus ojos taparon; Porque no vean con los ojos, Y oigan con los oídos, Y entiendan de corazón, Y se conviertan, Y yo los sane.

KJV.text: For the heart of this people is waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes have they closed; lest they should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.

WEBM.text: For this people’s heart has grown callous. Their ears are dull of hearing. Their eyes they have closed. Lest they should see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and would turn again, then I would heal them.’Isaiah 6:9-09

JFA.text: Seja-vos pois notório que esta salvação de Deus é enviada aos gentios, e eles ouvirão.

RVA.text: Séaos pues notorio que á los Gentiles es enviada esta salud de Dios: y ellos oirán.

KJV.text: Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles, and that they will hear it.

WEBM.text: “Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations, and they will listen.”

JFA.text: E, havendo ele dito isto, partiram os judeus, tendo entre si grande contenda.

RVA.text: Y habiendo dicho esto, los Judíos salieron, teniendo entre sí gran contienda.

KJV.text: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.

WEBM.text: When he had said these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves.

JFA.text: E morou dois anos inteiros na casa que alugara, e recebia a todos os que o visitavam.

RVA.text: Pablo empero, quedó dos años enteros en su casa de alquiler, y recibía á todos los que á él venían,

KJV.text: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, and received all that came in unto him,

WEBM.text: Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house and received all who were coming to him,

JFA.text: Pregando o reino de Deus e ensinando as coisas concernentes ao Senhor Jesus Cristo, com toda a liberdade, sem impedimento algum.

RVA.text: Predicando el reino de Dios y enseñando lo que es del Señor Jesucristo con toda libertad, sin impedimento.

KJV.text: Preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.

WEBM.text: preaching God’s Kingdom, and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness, without hindrance.

JFA.text: Pareceu bem a Dario constituir sobre o reino cento e vinte sátrapas, que estivessem por todo o reino.

RVA.text: Parecio bien á Darío constituir sobre el reino ciento veinte gobernadores, que estuviesen en todo el reino.

KJV.text: It pleased Darius to set over the kingdom an hundred and twenty princes, which should be over the whole kingdom;

WEBM.text: It pleased Darius to set over the kingdom one hundred twenty local governors, who should be throughout the whole kingdom;

JFA.text: E sobre eles três presidentes, dos quais Daniel era um; a fim de que estes sátrapas lhes dessem conta, e que o rei não sofresse dano.

RVA.text: Y sobre ellos tres presidentes, de los cuales Daniel era el uno, á quienes estos gobernadores diesen cuenta, porque el rey no recibiese daño.

KJV.text: And over these three presidents; of whom Daniel was first: that the princes might give accounts unto them, and the king should have no damage.

WEBM.text: and over them three presidents, of whom Daniel was one; that these local governors might give account to them, and that the king should suffer no loss.

JFA.text: Então o mesmo Daniel sobrepujava a estes presidentes e aos sátrapas; porque nele havia um espírito excelente; e o rei pensava constituí-lo sobre todo o reino.

RVA.text: Pero el mismo Daniel era superior á estos gobernadores y presidentes, porque había en él más abundancia de espíritu: y el rey pensaba de ponerlo sobre todo el reino.

KJV.text: Then this Daniel was preferred above the presidents and princes, because an excellent spirit was in him; and the king thought to set him over the whole realm.

WEBM.text: Then this Daniel was distinguished above the presidents and the local governors, because an excellent spirit was in him; and the king thought to set him over the whole realm.

JFA.text: Nisso os presidentes e os sátrapas procuravam achar ocasião contra Daniel a respeito do reino mas não podiam achar ocasião ou falta alguma; porque ele era fiel, e não se achava nele nenhum erro nem falta.

RVA.text: Entonces los presidentes y gobernadores buscaban ocasiones contra Daniel por parte del reino; mas no podían hallar alguna ocasión ó falta, porque él era fiel, y ningún vicio ni falta fué en él hallado.

KJV.text: Then the presidents and princes sought to find occasion against Daniel concerning the kingdom; but they could find none occasion nor fault; forasmuch as he was faithful, neither was there any error or fault found in him.

WEBM.text: Then the presidents and the local governors sought to find occasion against Daniel as touching the kingdom; but they could find no occasion or fault, because he was faithful. There wasn’t any error or fault found in him.

JFA.text: Pelo que estes homens disseram: Nunca acharemos ocasião alguma contra este Daniel, a menos que a procuremos no que diz respeito a lei do seu Deus.

RVA.text: Entonces dijeron aquellos hombres: No hallaremos contra este Daniel ocasión alguna, si no la hallamos contra él en la ley de su Dios.

KJV.text: Then said these men, We shall not find any occasion against this Daniel, except we find it against him concerning the law of his God.

WEBM.text: Then these men said, “We won’t find any occasion against this Daniel, unless we find it against him concerning the law of his God.”

JFA.text: Então os presidentes e os sátrapas foram juntos ao rei, e disseram-lhe assim: o rei Dario, vive para sempre.

RVA.text: Entonces estos gobernadores y presidentes se juntaron delante del rey, y le dijeron así: Rey Darío, para siempre vive:

KJV.text: Then these presidents and princes assembled together to the king, and said thus unto him, King Darius, live for ever.

WEBM.text: Then these presidents and local governors assembled together to the king, and said this to him, “King Darius, live forever!

JFA.text: Todos os presidentes do reino, os prefeitos e os sátrapas, os conselheiros e os governadores, concordaram em que o rei devia baixar um decreto e publicar o respectivo interdito, que qualquer que, por espaço de trinta dias, fizer uma petição a qualquer deus, ou a qualquer homem, exceto a ti, ó rei, seja lançado na cova dos leões.

RVA.text: Todos los presidentes del reino, magistrados, gobernadores, grandes y capitanes, han acordado por consejo promulgar un real edicto, y confirmarlo, que cualquiera que demandare petición de cualquier dios ú hombre en el espacio de treinta días, sino de ti, oh rey, sea echado en el foso de los leones.

KJV.text: All the presidents of the kingdom, the governors, and the princes, the counsellors, and the captains, have consulted together to establish a royal statute, and to make a firm decree, that whosoever shall ask a petition of any God or man for thirty days, save of thee, O king, he shall be cast into the den of lions.

WEBM.text: All the presidents of the kingdom, the deputies and the local governors, the counselors and the governors, have consulted together to establish a royal statute, and to make a strong decree, that whoever asks a petition of any god or man for thirty days, except of you, O king, he shall be cast into the den of lions.

JFA.text: Agora pois, ó rei, estabelece o interdito, e assina o edital, para que não seja mudado, conforme a lei dos medos e dos persas, que não se pode revogar.

RVA.text: Ahora, oh rey, confirma el edicto, y firma la escritura, para que no se pueda mudar, conforme á la ley de Media y de Persia, la cual no se revoca.

KJV.text: Now, O king, establish the decree, and sign the writing, that it be not changed, according to the law of the Medes and Persians, which altereth not.

WEBM.text: Now, O king, establish the decree, and sign the writing, that it not be changed, according to the law of the Medes and Persians, which doesn’t alter.”

JFA.text: Em virtude disto o rei Dario assinou o edital e o interdito.

RVA.text: Firmó pues el rey Darío la escritura y el edicto.

KJV.text: Wherefore king Darius signed the writing and the decree.

WEBM.text: Therefore king Darius signed the writing and the decree.

JFA.text: Quando Daniel soube que o edital estava assinado, entrou em sua casa, no seu quarto em cima, onde estavam abertas as janelas que davam para o lado de Jerusalém; e três vezes no dia se punha de joelhos e orava, e dava graças diante do seu Deus, como também antes costumava fazer.

RVA.text: Y Daniel, cuando supo que la escritura estaba firmada, entróse en su casa, y abiertas las ventanas de su cámara que estaban hacia Jerusalem, hincábase de rodillas tres veces al día, y oraba, y confesaba delante de su Dios, como lo solía hacer antes.

KJV.text: Now when Daniel knew that the writing was signed, he went into his house; and his windows being open in his chamber toward Jerusalem, he kneeled upon his knees three times a day, and prayed, and gave thanks before his God, as he did aforetime.

WEBM.text: When Daniel knew that the writing was signed, he went into his house (now his windows were open in his room toward Jerusalem) and he kneeled on his knees three times a day, and prayed, and gave thanks before his God, as he did before.

JFA.text: Então aqueles homens foram juntos, e acharam a Daniel orando e suplicando diante do seu Deus.

RVA.text: Entonces se juntaron aquellos hombres, y hallaron á Daniel orando y rogando delante de su Dios.

KJV.text: Then these men assembled, and found Daniel praying and making supplication before his God.

WEBM.text: Then these men assembled together, and found Daniel making petition and supplication before his God.

JFA.text: Depois se foram à presença do rei e lhe perguntaram no tocante ao interdito real: Porventura não assinaste um interdito pelo qual todo homem que fizesse uma petição a qualquer deus, ou a qualquer homem por espaço de trinta dias, exceto a ti, ó rei, fosse lançado na cova dos leões? Respondeu o rei, e disse: Esta palavra é certa, conforme a lei dos medos e dos persas, que não se pode revogar.

RVA.text: Llegáronse luego, y hablaron delante del rey acerca del edicto real: ¿No has confirmado edicto que cualquiera que pidiere á cualquier dios ú hombre en el espacio de treinta días, excepto á ti, oh rey, fuese echado en el foso de los leones? Respondió el rey y dijo: Verdad es, conforme á la ley de Media y de Persia, la cual no se abroga.

KJV.text: Then they came near, and spake before the king concerning the king's decree; Hast thou not signed a decree, that every man that shall ask a petition of any God or man within thirty days, save of thee, O king, shall be cast into the den of lions? The king answered and said, The thing is true, according to the law of the Medes and Persians, which altereth not.

WEBM.text: Then they came near, and spoke before the king concerning the king’s decree: “Haven’t you signed a decree that every man who makes a petition to any god or man within thirty days, except to you, O king, shall be cast into the den of lions?” The king answered, “This thing is true, according to the law of the Medes and Persians, which doesn’t alter.”

JFA.text: Então responderam ao rei, dizendo-lhe Esse Daniel, que é dos exilados de Judá, e não tem feito caso de ti, ó rei, nem do interdito que assinaste; antes três vezes por dia faz a sua oração.

RVA.text: Entonces respondieron y dijeron delante del rey: Daniel que es de los hijos de la cautividad de los Judíos, no ha hecho cuenta de ti, oh rey, ni del edicto que confirmaste; antes tres veces al día hace su petición.

KJV.text: Then answered they and said before the king, That Daniel, which is of the children of the captivity of Judah, regardeth not thee, O king, nor the decree that thou hast signed, but maketh his petition three times a day.

WEBM.text: Then they answered and said before the king, “That Daniel, who is of the children of the captivity of Judah, doesn’t respect you, O king, nor the decree that you have signed, but makes his petition three times a day.”

JFA.text: Ouvindo então o rei a notícia, ficou muito penalizado, e a favor de Daniel propôs dentro do seu coração livrá-lo; e até o pôr do sol trabalhou para o salvar.

RVA.text: El rey entonces, oyendo el negocio, pesóle en gran manera, y sobre Daniel puso cuidado para librarlo; y hasta puestas del sol trabajó para librarle.

KJV.text: Then the king, when he heard these words, was sore displeased with himself, and set his heart on Daniel to deliver him: and he laboured till the going down of the sun to deliver him.

WEBM.text: Then the king, when he heard these words, was very displeased, and set his heart on Daniel to deliver him; and he labored until the going down of the sun to rescue him.

JFA.text: Nisso aqueles homens foram juntos ao rei, e lhe disseram: Sabe, ó rei, que é lei dos medos e persas que nenhum interdito ou decreto que o rei estabelecer, se pode mudar.

RVA.text: Empero aquellos hombres se reunieron cerca del rey, y dijeron al rey: Sepas, oh rey, que es ley de Media y de Persia, que ningún decreto ú ordenanza que el rey confirmare pueda mudarse.

KJV.text: Then these men assembled unto the king, and said unto the king, Know, O king, that the law of the Medes and Persians is, That no decree nor statute which the king establisheth may be changed.

WEBM.text: Then these men assembled together to the king, and said to the king, “Know, O king, that it is a law of the Medes and Persians, that no decree nor statute which the king establishes may be changed.”

JFA.text: Então o rei deu ordem, e trouxeram Daniel, e o lançaram na cova dos leões. Ora, disse o rei a Daniel: O teu Deus, a quem tu continuamente serves, ele te livrará.

RVA.text: Entonces el rey mandó, y trajeron á Daniel, y echáronle en el foso de los leones. Y hablando el rey dijo á Daniel: El Dios tuyo, á quien tú continuamente sirves, él te libre.

KJV.text: Then the king commanded, and they brought Daniel, and cast him into the den of lions. Now the king spake and said unto Daniel, Thy God whom thou servest continually, he will deliver thee.

WEBM.text: Then the king commanded, and they brought Daniel, and cast him into the den of lions. The king spoke and said to Daniel, “Your God whom you serve continually, he will deliver you.”

JFA.text: E uma pedra foi trazida e posta sobre a boca da cova; e o rei a selou com o seu anel e com o anel dos seus grandes, para que no tocante a Daniel nada se mudasse.

RVA.text: Y fué traída una piedra, y puesta sobre la puerta del foso, la cual selló el rey con su anillo, y con el anillo de sus príncipes, porque el acuerdo acerca de Daniel no se mudase.

KJV.text: And a stone was brought, and laid upon the mouth of the den; and the king sealed it with his own signet, and with the signet of his lords; that the purpose might not be changed concerning Daniel.

WEBM.text: A stone was brought, and laid on the mouth of the den; and the king sealed it with his own signet, and with the signet of his lords; that nothing might be changed concerning Daniel.

JFA.text: Depois o rei se dirigiu para o seu palácio, e passou a noite em jejum; e não foram trazidos à sua presença instrumentos de música, e fugiu dele o sono.

RVA.text: Fuése luego el rey á su palacio, y acostóse ayuno; ni instrumentos de música fueron traídos delante de él, y se le fué el sueño.

KJV.text: Then the king went to his palace, and passed the night fasting: neither were instruments of musick brought before him: and his sleep went from him.

WEBM.text: Then the king went to his palace, and passed the night fasting. No musical instruments were brought before him; and his sleep fled from him.

JFA.text: Então o rei se levantou ao romper do dia, e foi com pressa à cova dos leões.

RVA.text: El rey, por tanto, se levantó muy de mañana, y fué apriesa al foso de los leones:

KJV.text: Then the king arose very early in the morning, and went in haste unto the den of lions.

WEBM.text: Then the king arose very early in the morning, and went in haste to the den of lions.

JFA.text: E, chegando-se à cova, chamou por Daniel com voz triste; e disse o rei a Daniel. Daniel, servo do Deus vivo, dar-se-ia o caso que o teu Deus, a quem tu continuamente serves, tenha podido livrar- te dos leões?

RVA.text: Y llegándose cerca del foso llamó á voces á Daniel con voz triste: y hablando el rey dijo á Daniel: Daniel, siervo del Dios viviente, el Dios tuyo, á quien tú continuamente sirves ¿te ha podido librar de los leones?

KJV.text: And when he came to the den, he cried with a lamentable voice unto Daniel: and the king spake and said to Daniel, O Daniel, servant of the living God, is thy God, whom thou servest continually, able to deliver thee from the lions?

WEBM.text: When he came near to the den to Daniel, he cried with a troubled voice. The king spoke and said to Daniel, “Daniel, servant of the living God, is your God, whom you serve continually, able to deliver you from the lions?”

JFA.text: Então Daniel falou ao rei: rei, vive para sempre.

RVA.text: Entonces habló Daniel con el rey: oh rey, para siempre vive.

KJV.text: Then said Daniel unto the king, O king, live for ever.

WEBM.text: Then Daniel said to the king, “O king, live forever!

JFA.text: O meu Deus enviou o seu anjo, e fechou a boca dos leões, e eles não me fizeram mal algum; porque foi achada em mim inocência diante dele; e também diante de ti, ó rei, não tenho cometido delito algum.

RVA.text: El Dios mío envió su ángel, el cual cerró la boca de los leones, para que no me hiciesen mal: porque delante de él se halló en mí justicia: y aun delante de ti, oh rey, yo no he hecho lo que no debiese.

KJV.text: My God hath sent his angel, and hath shut the lions' mouths, that they have not hurt me: forasmuch as before him innocency was found in me; and also before thee, O king, have I done no hurt.

WEBM.text: My God has sent his angel, and has shut the lions’ mouths, and they have not hurt me; because as before him innocence was found in me; and also before you, O king, I have done no harm.”

JFA.text: Então o rei muito se alegrou, e mandou tirar a Daniel da cova. Assim foi tirado Daniel da cova, e não se achou nele lesão alguma, porque ele havia confiado em seu Deus.

RVA.text: Entonces se alegró el rey en gran manera á causa de él, y mandó sacar á Daniel del foso: y fué Daniel sacado del foso, y ninguna lesión se halló en él, porque creyó en su Dios.

KJV.text: Then was the king exceedingly glad for him, and commanded that they should take Daniel up out of the den. So Daniel was taken up out of the den, and no manner of hurt was found upon him, because he believed in his God.

WEBM.text: Then the king was exceedingly glad, and commanded that they should take Daniel up out of the den. So Daniel was taken up out of the den, and no kind of harm was found on him, because he had trusted in his God.
