WEBM.text: Moses said, “This is what the Lord says: ‘About midnight I will go out into the middle of Egypt,

JFA.text: E todos os primogênitos na terra do Egito morrerão, desde o primogênito de Faraó, que se assenta sobre o seu trono, até o primogênito da serva que está detrás da mó, e todos os primogênitos dos animais.

RVA.text: Y morirá todo primogénito en tierra de Egipto, desde el primogénito de Faraón que se sienta en su trono, hasta el primogénito de la sierva que está tras la muela; y todo primogénito de las bestias.

KJV.text: And all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first born of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even unto the firstborn of the maidservant that is behind the mill; and all the firstborn of beasts.

WEBM.text: and all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne, even to the firstborn of the female servant who is behind the mill, and all the firstborn of livestock.

JFA.text: Pelo que haverá grande clamor em toda a terra do Egito, como nunca houve nem haverá jamais.

RVA.text: Y habrá gran clamor por toda la tierra de Egipto, cual nunca fué, ni jamás será.

KJV.text: And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there was none like it, nor shall be like it any more.

WEBM.text: There will be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there has not been, nor will be any more.

JFA.text: Mas contra os filhos de Israel nem mesmo um cão moverá a sua língua, nem contra homem nem contra animal; para que saibais que o Senhor faz distinção entre os egípcios e os filhos de Israel.

RVA.text: Mas entre todos los hijos de Israel, desde el hombre hasta la bestia, ni un perro moverá su lengua: para que sepáis que hará diferencia Jehová entre los Egipcios y los Israelitas.

KJV.text: But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog move his tongue, against man or beast: that ye may know how that the Lord doth put a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.

WEBM.text: But against any of the children of Israel a dog won’t even bark or move its tongue, against man or animal, that you may know that the Lord makes a distinction between the Egyptians and Israel.

JFA.text: Então todos estes teus servos descerão a mim, e se inclinarão diante de mim, dizendo: Sai tu, e todo o povo que te segue as pisadas. Depois disso eu sairei. E Moisés saiu da presença de Faraó ardendo em ira.

RVA.text: Y descenderán á mí todos estos tus siervos, é inclinados delante de mí dirán: Sal tú, y todo el pueblo que está bajo de ti; y después de esto yo saldré. Y salióse muy enojado de con Faraón.

KJV.text: And all these thy servants shall come down unto me, and bow down themselves unto me, saying, Get thee out, and all the people that follow thee: and after that I will go out. And he went out from Pharaoh in a great anger.

WEBM.text: All these servants of yours will come down to me, and bow down themselves to me, saying, “Get out, with all the people who follow you;” and after that I will go out.’” He went out from Pharaoh in hot anger.

JFA.text: Pois o Senhor dissera a Moisés: Faraó não vos ouvirá, para que as minhas maravilhas se multipliquem na terra do Egito.

RVA.text: Y Jehová dijo á Moisés: Faraón no os oirá, para que mis maravillas se multipliquen en la tierra de Egipto.

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you; that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.

WEBM.text: the Lord said to Moses, “Pharaoh won’t listen to you, that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”

JFA.text: E Moisés e Arão fizeram todas estas maravilhas diante de Faraó; mas o Senhor endureceu o coração de Faraó, que não deixou ir da sua terra os filhos de Israel.

RVA.text: Y Moisés y Aarón hicieron todos estos prodigios delante de Faraón: mas Jehová había endurecido el corazón de Faraón, y no envió á los hijos de Israel fuera de su país.

KJV.text: And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: and the Lord hardened Pharaoh's heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go out of his land.

WEBM.text: Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh, but the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he didn’t let the children of Israel go out of his land.

JFA.text: Ora, o Senhor falou a Moisés e a Arão na terra do Egito, dizendo.

RVA.text: Y hablo Jehová á Moisés y á Aarón en la tierra de Egipto, diciendo:

KJV.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt saying,

WEBM.text: the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,

JFA.text: Este mês será para vós o princípio dos meses; este vos será o primeiro dos meses do ano.

RVA.text: Este mes os será principio de los meses; será este para vosotros el primero en los meses del año.

KJV.text: This month shall be unto you the beginning of months: it shall be the first month of the year to you.

WEBM.text: “This month shall be to you the beginning of months. It shall be the first month of the year to you.

JFA.text: Falai a toda a congregação de Israel, dizendo: Ao décimo dia deste mês tomará cada um para si um cordeiro, segundo as casas dos pais, um cordeiro para cada família.

RVA.text: Hablad á toda la congregación de Israel, diciendo: En el diez de aqueste mes tómese cada uno un cordero por las familias de los padres, un cordero por familia:

KJV.text: Speak ye unto all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to the house of their fathers, a lamb for an house:

WEBM.text: Speak to all the congregation of Israel, saying, ‘On the tenth day of this month, they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to their fathers’ houses, a lamb for a household;

JFA.text: Mas se a família for pequena demais para um cordeiro, tomá-lo-á juntamente com o vizinho mais próximo de sua casa, conforme o número de almas; conforme ao comer de cada um, fareis a conta para o cordeiro.

RVA.text: Mas si la familia fuere pequeña que no baste á comer el cordero, entonces tomará á su vecino inmediato á su casa, y según el número de las personas, cada uno conforme á su comer, echaréis la cuenta sobre el cordero.

KJV.text: And if the household be too little for the lamb, let him and his neighbour next unto his house take it according to the number of the souls; every man according to his eating shall make your count for the lamb.

WEBM.text: and if the household is too little for a lamb, then he and his neighbor next to his house shall take one according to the number of the souls. You shall make your count for the lamb according to what everyone can eat.

JFA.text: O cordeiro, ou cabrito, será sem defeito, macho de um ano, o qual tomareis das ovelhas ou das cabras.

RVA.text: El cordero será sin defecto, macho de un año: tomaréislo de las ovejas ó de las cabras:

KJV.text: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year: ye shall take it out from the sheep, or from the goats:

WEBM.text: Your lamb shall be without defect, a male a year old. You shall take it from the sheep or from the goats.

JFA.text: E o guardareis até o décimo quarto dia deste mês; e toda a assembléia da congregação de Israel o matará à tardinha.

RVA.text: Y habéis de guardarlo hasta el día catorce de este mes; y lo inmolará toda la congregación del pueblo de Israel entre las dos tardes.

KJV.text: And ye shall keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month: and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it in the evening.

WEBM.text: You shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month; and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at evening.

JFA.text: Tomarão do sangue, e pô-lo-ão em ambos os umbrais e na verga da porta, nas casas em que o comerem.

RVA.text: Y tomarán de la sangre, y pondrán en los dos postes y en el dintel de las casas en que lo han de comer.

KJV.text: And they shall take of the blood, and strike it on the two side posts and on the upper door post of the houses, wherein they shall eat it.

WEBM.text: They shall take some of the blood, and put it on the two door posts and on the lintel, on the houses in which they shall eat it.

JFA.text: E naquela noite comerão a carne assada ao fogo, com pães ázimos; com ervas amargosas a comerao.

RVA.text: Y aquella noche comerán la carne asada al fuego, y panes sin levadura: con hierbas amargas lo comerán.

KJV.text: And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roast with fire, and unleavened bread; and with bitter herbs they shall eat it.

WEBM.text: They shall eat the meat in that night, roasted with fire, with unleavened bread. They shall eat it with bitter herbs.

JFA.text: Não comereis dele cru, nem cozido em água, mas sim assado ao fogo; a sua cabeça com as suas pernas e com a sua fressura.

RVA.text: Ninguna cosa comeréis de él cruda, ni cocida en agua, sino asada al fuego; su cabeza con sus pies y sus intestinos.

KJV.text: Eat not of it raw, nor sodden at all with water, but roast with fire; his head with his legs, and with the purtenance thereof.

WEBM.text: Don’t eat it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roasted with fire; with its head, its legs and its inner parts.

JFA.text: Nada dele deixareis até pela manhã; mas o que dele ficar até pela manhã, queimá-lo-eis no fogo.

RVA.text: Ninguna cosa dejaréis de él hasta la mañana; y lo que habrá quedado hasta la mañana, habéis de quemarlo en el fuego.

KJV.text: And ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; and that which remaineth of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire.

WEBM.text: You shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; but that which remains of it until the morning you shall burn with fire.

JFA.text: Assim pois o comereis: Os vossos lombos cingidos, os vossos sapatos nos pés, e o vosso cajado na mão; e o comereis apressadamente; esta é a páscoa do Senhor.

RVA.text: Y así habéis de comerlo: ceñidos vuestros lomos, vuestros zapatos en vuestros pies, y vuestro bordón en vuestra mano; y lo comeréis apresuradamente: es la Pascua de Jehová.

KJV.text: And thus shall ye eat it; with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste: it is the Lord's passover.

WEBM.text: This is how you shall eat it: with your belt on your waist, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and you shall eat it in haste: it is the Lord’s Passover.

JFA.text: Porque naquela noite passarei pela terra do Egito, e ferirei todos os primogênitos na terra do Egito, tanto dos homens como dos animais; e sobre todos os deuses do Egito executarei juízos; eu sou o Senhor.

RVA.text: Pues yo pasaré aquella noche por la tierra de Egipto, y heriré á todo primogénito en la tierra de Egipto, así en los hombres como en las bestias: y haré juicios en todos los dioses de Egipto. YO JEHOVA.

KJV.text: For I will pass through the land of Egypt this night, and will smite all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgment: I am the Lord.

WEBM.text: For I will go through the land of Egypt in that night, and will strike all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and animal. I will execute judgments against all the gods of Egypt. I am the Lord.

JFA.text: Mas o sangue vos será por sinal nas casas em que estiverdes; vendo eu o sangue, passarei por cima de vós, e não haverá entre vós praga para vos destruir, quando eu ferir a terra do Egito.

RVA.text: Y la sangre os será por señal en las casas donde vosotros estéis; y veré la sangre, y pasaré de vosotros, y no habrá en vosotros plaga de mortandad, cuando heriré la tierra de Egipto.

KJV.text: And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where ye are: and when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and the plague shall not be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of Egypt.

WEBM.text: The blood shall be to you for a token on the houses where you are. When I see the blood, I will pass over you, and no plague will be on you to destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.

JFA.text: E este dia vos será por memorial, e celebrá-lo-eis por festa ao Senhor; através das vossas gerações o celebrareis por estatuto perpétuo.

RVA.text: Y este día os ha de ser en memoria, y habéis de celebrarlo como solemne á Jehová durante vuestras generaciones: por estatuto perpetuo lo celebraréis.

KJV.text: And this day shall be unto you for a memorial; and ye shall keep it a feast to the Lord throughout your generations; ye shall keep it a feast by an ordinance for ever.

WEBM.text: This day shall be a memorial for you. You shall keep it as a feast to the Lord. You shall keep it as a feast throughout your generations by an ordinance forever.

JFA.text: Por sete dias comereis pães ázimos; logo ao primeiro dia tirareis o fermento das vossas casas, porque qualquer que comer pão levedado, entre o primeiro e o sétimo dia, esse será cortado de Israel.

RVA.text: Siete días comeréis panes sin levadura; y así el primer día haréis que no haya levadura en vuestras casas: porque cualquiera que comiere leudado desde el primer día hasta el séptimo, aquella alma será cortada de Israel.

KJV.text: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

WEBM.text: “‘Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread; even the first day you shall put away yeast out of your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

JFA.text: E ao primeiro dia haverá uma santa convocação; também ao sétimo dia tereis uma santa convocação; neles não se fará trabalho algum, senão o que diz respeito ao que cada um houver de comer; somente isso poderá ser feito por vós.

RVA.text: El primer día habrá santa convocación, y asimismo en el séptimo día tendréis una santa convocación: ninguna obra se hará en ellos, excepto solamente que aderecéis lo que cada cual hubiere de comer.

KJV.text: And in the first day there shall be an holy convocation, and in the seventh day there shall be an holy convocation to you; no manner of work shall be done in them, save that which every man must eat, that only may be done of you.

WEBM.text: In the first day there shall be to you a holy convocation, and in the seventh day a holy convocation; no kind of work shall be done in them, except that which every man must eat, only that may be done by you.

JFA.text: Guardareis, pois, a festa dos pães ázimos, porque nesse mesmo dia tirei vossos exércitos da terra do Egito; pelo que guardareis este dia através das vossas gerações por estatuto perpétuo.

RVA.text: Y guardaréis la fiesta de los ázimos, porque en aqueste mismo día saqué vuestros ejércitos de la tierra de Egipto: por tanto guardaréis este día en vuestras generaciones por costumbre perpetua.

KJV.text: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your armies out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day in your generations by an ordinance for ever.

WEBM.text: You shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this same day I have brought your armies out of the land of Egypt. Therefore you shall observe this day throughout your generations by an ordinance forever.

JFA.text: No primeiro mês, aos catorze dias do mês, à tarde, comereis pães ázimos até vinte e um do mês à tarde.

RVA.text: En el mes primero, el día catorce del mes por la tarde, comeréis los panes sin levadura, hasta el veintiuno del mes por la tarde.

KJV.text: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at even, ye shall eat unleavened bread, until the one and twentieth day of the month at even.

WEBM.text: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread, until the twenty first day of the month at evening.

JFA.text: Por sete dias não se ache fermento algum nas vossas casas; porque qualquer que comer pão levedado, esse será cortado da congregação de Israel, tanto o peregrino como o natural da terra.

RVA.text: Por siete días no se hallará levadura en vuestras casas, porque cualquiera que comiere leudado, así extranjero como natural del país, aquella alma será cortada de la congregación de Israel.

KJV.text: Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses: for whosoever eateth that which is leavened, even that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he be a stranger, or born in the land.

WEBM.text: There shall be no yeast found in your houses for seven days, for whoever eats that which is leavened, that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he is a foreigner, or one who is born in the land.

JFA.text: Nenhuma coisa levedada comereis; em todas as vossas habitações comereis pães ázimos.

RVA.text: Ninguna cosa leudada comeréis; en todas vuestras habitaciones comeréis panes sin levadura.

KJV.text: Ye shall eat nothing leavened; in all your habitations shall ye eat unleavened bread.

WEBM.text: You shall eat nothing leavened. In all your habitations you shall eat unleavened bread.’”

JFA.text: Chamou, pois, Moisés todos os anciãos de Israel, e disse-lhes: Ide e tomai-vos cordeiros segundo as vossas famílias, e imolai a páscoa.

RVA.text: Y Moisés convocó á todos los ancianos de Israel, y díjoles: Sacad, y tomaos corderos por vuestras familias, y sacrificad la pascua.

KJV.text: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said unto them, Draw out and take you a lamb according to your families, and kill the passover.

WEBM.text: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said to them, “Draw out, and take lambs according to your families, and kill the Passover.

JFA.text: Então tomareis um molho de hissopo, embebê-lo-eis no sangue que estiver na bacia e marcareis com ele a verga da porta e os dois umbrais; mas nenhum de vós sairá da porta da sua casa até pela manhã.

RVA.text: Y tomad un manojo de hisopo, y mojadle en la sangre que estará en una jofaina, y untad el dintel y los dos postes con la sangre que estará en la jofaina; y ninguno de vosotros salga de las puertas de su casa hasta la mañana.

KJV.text: And ye shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the bason, and strike the lintel and the two side posts with the blood that is in the bason; and none of you shall go out at the door of his house until the morning.

WEBM.text: You shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two door posts with the blood that is in the basin. None of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.

JFA.text: Porque o Senhor passará para ferir aos egípcios; e, ao ver o sangue na verga da porta e em ambos os umbrais, o Senhor passará aquela porta, e não deixará o destruidor entrar em vossas casas para vos ferir.

RVA.text: Porque Jehová pasará hiriendo á los Egipcios; y como verá la sangre en el dintel y en los dos postes, pasará Jehová aquella puerta, y no dejará entrar al heridor en vuestras casas para herir.

KJV.text: For the Lord will pass through to smite the Egyptians; and when he seeth the blood upon the lintel, and on the two side posts, the Lord will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroyer to come in unto your houses to smite you.

WEBM.text: For the Lord will pass through to strike the Egyptians; and when he sees the blood on the lintel, and on the two door posts, the Lord will pass over the door, and will not allow the destroyer to come in to your houses to strike you.

JFA.text: Portanto guardareis isto por estatuto para vós e para vossos filhos, para sempre.

RVA.text: Y guardaréis esto por estatuto para vosotros y para vuestros hijos para siempre.

KJV.text: And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons for ever.

WEBM.text: You shall observe this thing for an ordinance to you and to your sons forever.

JFA.text: Quando, pois, tiverdes entrado na terra que o Senhor vos dará, como tem prometido, guardareis este culto.

RVA.text: Y será, cuando habréis entrado en la tierra que Jehová os dará, como tiene hablado, que guardaréis este rito.

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, when ye be come to the land which the Lord will give you, according as he hath promised, that ye shall keep this service.

WEBM.text: It shall happen when you have come to the land which the Lord will give you, as he has promised, that you shall keep this service.

JFA.text: E quando vossos filhos vos perguntarem: Que quereis dizer com este culto?

RVA.text: Y cuando os dijeren vuestros hijos: ¿Qué rito es este vuestro?

KJV.text: And it shall come to pass, when your children shall say unto you, What mean ye by this service?

WEBM.text: It will happen, when your children ask you, ‘What do you mean by this service?’

JFA.text: Respondereis: Este é o sacrifício da páscoa do Senhor, que passou as casas dos filhos de Israel no Egito, quando feriu os egípcios, e livrou as nossas casas. Então o povo inclinou-se e adorou.

RVA.text: Vosotros responderéis: Es la víctima de la Pascua de Jehová, el cual pasó las casas de los hijos de Israel en Egipto, cuando hirió á los Egipcios, y libró nuestras casas. Entonces el pueblo se inclinó y adoró.

KJV.text: That ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of the Lord's passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshipped.

WEBM.text: that you shall say, ‘It is the sacrifice of the Lord’s Passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he struck the Egyptians, and spared our houses.’” The people bowed their heads and worshiped.

JFA.text: E foram os filhos de Israel, e fizeram isso; como o Senhor ordenara a Moisés e a Arão, assim fizeram.

RVA.text: Y los hijos de Israel se fueron, é hicieron puntualmente así; como Jehová había mandado á Moisés y á Aarón.

KJV.text: And the children of Israel went away, and did as the Lord had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.

WEBM.text: The children of Israel went and did so; as the Lord had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.

JFA.text: E aconteceu que à meia-noite o Senhor feriu todos os primogênitos na terra do Egito, desde o primogênito de Faraó, que se assentava em seu trono, até o primogênito do cativo que estava no cárcere, e todos os primogênitos dos animais.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que á la medianoche Jehová hirió á todo primogénito en la tierra de Egipto, desde el primogénito de Faraón que se sentaba sobre su trono, hasta el primogénito del cautivo que estaba en la cárcel, y todo primogénito de los animales.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, that at midnight the Lord smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sat on his throne unto the firstborn of the captive that was in the dungeon; and all the firstborn of cattle.

WEBM.text: At midnight, the Lord struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sat on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the firstborn of livestock.

JFA.text: E Faraó levantou-se de noite, ele e todos os seus servos, e todos os egípcios; e fez-se grande clamor no Egito, porque não havia casa em que não houvesse um morto.

RVA.text: Y levantóse aquella noche Faraón, él y todos sus siervos, y todos los Egipcios; y había un gran clamor en Egipto, porque no había casa donde no hubiese muerto.

KJV.text: And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt; for there was not a house where there was not one dead.

WEBM.text: Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt, for there was not a house where there was not one dead.

JFA.text: Então Moisés estendeu a mão sobre o mar; e o Senhor fez retirar o mar por um forte vento oriental toda aquela noite, e fez do mar terra seca, e as águas foram divididas.

RVA.text: Y extendió Moisés su mano sobre la mar, é hizo Jehová que la mar se retirase por recio viento oriental toda aquella noche; y tornó la mar en seco, y las aguas quedaron divididas.

KJV.text: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the Lord caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.

WEBM.text: Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the Lord caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.

JFA.text: E os filhos de Israel entraram pelo meio do mar em seco; e as águas foram-lhes qual muro à sua direita e à sua esquerda.

RVA.text: Entonces los hijos de Israel entraron por medio de la mar en seco, teniendo las aguas como muro á su diestra y á su siniestra:

KJV.text: And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.

WEBM.text: The children of Israel went into the middle of the sea on the dry ground; and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.

JFA.text: E os egípcios os perseguiram, e entraram atrás deles até o meio do mar, com todos os cavalos de Faraó, os seus carros e os seus cavaleiros.

RVA.text: Y siguiéndolos los Egipcios, entraron tras ellos hasta el medio de la mar, toda la caballería de Faraón, sus carros, y su gente de á caballo.

KJV.text: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh's horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.

WEBM.text: The Egyptians pursued, and went in after them into the middle of the sea: all of Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.

JFA.text: Na vigília da manhã, o Senhor, na coluna do fogo e da nuvem, olhou para o campo dos egípcios, e alvoroçou o campo dos egípcios.

RVA.text: Y aconteció á la vela de la mañana, que Jehová miró al campo de los Egipcios desde la columna de fuego y nube, y perturbó el campo de los Egipcios.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, that in the morning watch the Lord looked unto the host of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of the cloud, and troubled the host of the Egyptians,

WEBM.text: In the morning watch, the Lord looked out on the Egyptian army through the pillar of fire and of cloud, and confused the Egyptian army.

JFA.text: Embaraçou-lhes as rodas dos carros, e fê-los andar dificultosamente; de modo que os egípcios disseram: Fujamos de diante de Israel, porque o Senhor peleja por eles contra os egípcios.

RVA.text: Y quitóles las ruedas de sus carros, y trastornólos gravemente. Entonces los Egipcios dijeron: Huyamos de delante de Israel, porque Jehová pelea por ellos contra los Egipcios.

KJV.text: And took off their chariot wheels, that they drave them heavily: so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for the Lord fighteth for them against the Egyptians.

WEBM.text: He took off their chariot wheels, and they drove them heavily; so that the Egyptians said, “Let’s flee from the face of Israel, for the Lord fights for them against the Egyptians!”

JFA.text: Nisso o Senhor disse a Moisés: Estende a mão sobre o mar, para que as águas se tornem sobre os egípcios, sobre os seus carros e sobre os seus cavaleiros.

RVA.text: Y Jehová dijo á Moisés: Extiende tu mano sobre la mar, para que las aguas vuelvan sobre los Egipcios, sobre sus carros, y sobre su caballería.

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.

WEBM.text: the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the sea, that the waters may come again on the Egyptians, on their chariots, and on their horsemen.”

JFA.text: Então Moisés estendeu a mão sobre o mar, e o mar retomou a sua força ao amanhecer, e os egípcios fugiram de encontro a ele; assim o Senhor derribou os egípcios no meio do mar.

RVA.text: Y Moisés extendió su mano sobre la mar, y la mar se volvió en su fuerza cuando amanecía; y los Egipcios iban hacia ella: y Jehová derribó á los Egipcios en medio de la mar.

KJV.text: And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to his strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and the Lord overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.

WEBM.text: Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to its strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it. the Lord overthrew the Egyptians in the middle of the sea.

JFA.text: As águas, tornando, cobriram os carros e os cavaleiros, todo o exército de Faraó, que atrás deles havia entrado no mar; não ficou nem sequer um deles.

RVA.text: Y volvieron las aguas, y cubrieron los carros y la caballería, y todo el ejército de Faraón que había entrado tras ellos en la mar; no quedó de ellos ni uno.

KJV.text: And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.

WEBM.text: The waters returned, and covered the chariots and the horsemen, even all Pharaoh’s army that went in after them into the sea. There remained not so much as one of them.

JFA.text: Mas os filhos de Israel caminharam a pé enxuto pelo meio do mar; as águas foram-lhes qual muro à sua direita e à sua esquerda.

RVA.text: Y los hijos de Israel fueron por medio de la mar en seco, teniendo las aguas por muro á su diestra y á su siniestra.

KJV.text: But the children of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.

WEBM.text: But the children of Israel walked on dry land in the middle of the sea, and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.

JFA.text: Assim o Senhor, naquele dia, salvou Israel da mão dos egípcios; e Israel viu os egípcios mortos na praia do mar.

RVA.text: Así salvó Jehová aquel día á Israel de mano de los Egipcios; é Israel vió á los Egipcios muertos á la orilla de la mar.

KJV.text: Thus the Lord saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea shore.

WEBM.text: Thus the Lord saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore.

JFA.text: E viu Israel a grande obra que o Senhor operara contra os egípcios; pelo que o povo temeu ao Senhor, e creu no Senhor e em Moisés, seu servo.

RVA.text: Y vió Israel aquel grande hecho que Jehová ejecutó contra los Egipcios: y el pueblo temió á Jehová, y creyeron á Jehová y á Moisés su siervo.

KJV.text: And Israel saw that great work which the Lord did upon the Egyptians: and the people feared the Lord, and believed the Lord, and his servant Moses.

WEBM.text: Israel saw the great work which the Lord did to the Egyptians, and the people feared the Lord; and they believed in the Lord and in his servant Moses.

JFA.text: Mas o povo, vendo que Moisés tardava em descer do monte, acercou-se de Arão, e lhe disse: Levanta-te, faze-nos um deus que vá adiante de nós; porque, quanto a esse Moisés, o homem que nos tirou da terra do Egito, não sabemos o que lhe aconteceu.

RVA.text: Mas viendo el pueblo que Moisés tardaba en descender del monte, allegóse entonces á Aarón, y dijéronle: Levántate, haznos dioses que vayan delante de nosotros; porque á este Moisés, aquel varón que nos sacó de la tierra de Egipto, no sabemos qué le haya acontecido.

KJV.text: And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down out of the mount, the people gathered themselves together unto Aaron, and said unto him, Up, make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.

WEBM.text: When the people saw that Moses delayed coming down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together to Aaron, and said to him, “Come, make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.”

JFA.text: E Arão lhes disse: Tirai os pendentes de ouro que estão nas orelhas de vossas mulheres, de vossos filhos e de vossas filhas, e trazei-mos.

RVA.text: Y Aarón les dijo: Apartad los zarcillos de oro que están en las orejas de vuestras mujeres, y de vuestros hijos, y de vuestras hijas, y traédmelos.

KJV.text: And Aaron said unto them, Break off the golden earrings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them unto me.

WEBM.text: Aaron said to them, “Take off the golden rings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them to me.”

JFA.text: Então todo o povo, tirando os pendentes de ouro que estavam nas suas orelhas, os trouxe a Arão.

RVA.text: Entonces todo el pueblo apartó los zarcillos de oro que tenían en sus orejas, y trajéronlos á Aarón:

KJV.text: And all the people brake off the golden earrings which were in their ears, and brought them unto Aaron.

WEBM.text: All the people took off the golden rings which were in their ears, and brought them to Aaron.

JFA.text: Ele os recebeu de suas mãos, e com um buril deu forma ao ouro, e dele fez um bezerro de fundição. Então eles exclamaram: Eis aqui, ó Israel, o teu deus, que te tirou da terra do Egito.

RVA.text: El cual los tomó de las manos de ellos, y formólo con buril, é hizo de ello un becerro de fundición. Entonces dijeron: Israel, estos son tus dioses, que te sacaron de la tierra de Egipto.

KJV.text: And he received them at their hand, and fashioned it with a graving tool, after he had made it a molten calf: and they said, These be thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.

WEBM.text: He received what they handed him, fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made it a molded calf. Then they said, “These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.”

JFA.text: E Arão, vendo isto, edificou um altar diante do bezerro e, fazendo uma proclamação, disse: Amanhã haverá festa ao Senhor.

RVA.text: Y viendo esto Aarón, edificó un altar delante del becerro; y pregonó Aarón, y dijo: Mañana será fiesta á Jehová.

KJV.text: And when Aaron saw it, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made proclamation, and said, To morrow is a feast to the Lord.

WEBM.text: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made a proclamation, and said, “Tomorrow shall be a feast to the Lord.”

JFA.text: No dia seguinte levantaram-se cedo, ofereceram holocaustos, e trouxeram ofertas pacíficas; e o povo sentou-se a comer e a beber; depois levantou-se para folgar.

RVA.text: Y el día siguiente madrugaron, y ofrecieron holocaustos, y presentaron pacíficos: y sentóse el pueblo á comer y á beber, y levantáronse á regocijarse.

KJV.text: And they rose up early on the morrow, and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.

WEBM.text: They rose up early on the next day, and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.

JFA.text: Então disse o Senhor a Moisés: Vai, desce; porque o teu povo, que fizeste subir da terra do Egito, se corrompeu.

RVA.text: Entonces Jehová dijo á Moisés: Anda, desciende, porque tu pueblo que sacaste de tierra de Egipto se ha corrompido:

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Go, get thee down; for thy people, which thou broughtest out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves:

WEBM.text: the Lord spoke to Moses, “Go, get down; for your people, who you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves!

JFA.text: Depressa se desviou do caminho que eu lhe ordenei; eles fizeram para si um bezerro de fundição, e adoraram-no, e lhe ofereceram sacrifícios, e disseram: Eis aqui, ó Israel, o teu deus, que te tirou da terra do Egito.

RVA.text: Presto se han apartado del camino que yo les mandé, y se han hecho un becerro de fundición, y lo han adorado, y han sacrificado á él, y han dicho: Israel, estos son tus dioses, que te sacaron de la tierra de Egipto.

KJV.text: They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them: they have made them a molten calf, and have worshipped it, and have sacrificed thereunto, and said, These be thy gods, O Israel, which have brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.

WEBM.text: They have turned away quickly out of the way which I commanded them. They have made themselves a molded calf, and have worshiped it, and have sacrificed to it, and said, ‘These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.’”

JFA.text: Disse mais o Senhor a Moisés: Tenho observado este povo, e eis que é povo de dura cerviz.

RVA.text: Dijo más Jehová á Moisés: Yo he visto á este pueblo, que por cierto es pueblo de dura cerviz:

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked people:

WEBM.text: the Lord said to Moses, “I have seen these people, and behold, they are a stiff-necked people.

JFA.text: Agora, pois, deixa-me, para que a minha ira se acenda contra eles, e eu os consuma; e eu farei de ti uma grande nação.

RVA.text: Ahora pues, déjame que se encienda mi furor en ellos, y los consuma: y á ti yo te pondré sobre gran gente.

KJV.text: Now therefore let me alone, that my wrath may wax hot against them, and that I may consume them: and I will make of thee a great nation.

WEBM.text: Now therefore leave me alone, that my wrath may burn hot against them, and that I may consume them; and I will make of you a great nation.”

JFA.text: Moisés, porém, suplicou ao Senhor seu Deus, e disse: ç Senhor, por que se acende a tua ira contra o teu povo, que tiraste da terra do Egito com grande força e com forte mão?

RVA.text: Entonces Moisés oró á la faz de Jehová su Dios, y dijo: Oh Jehová, ¿por qué se encenderá tu furor en tu pueblo, que tú sacaste de la tierra de Egipto con gran fortaleza, y con mano fuerte?

KJV.text: And Moses besought the Lord his God, and said, Lord, why doth thy wrath wax hot against thy people, which thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power, and with a mighty hand?

WEBM.text: Moses begged the Lord his God, and said, “The Lord, why does your wrath burn hot against your people, that you have brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?

JFA.text: Por que hão de falar os egípcios, dizendo: Para mal os tirou, para matá-los nos montes, e para destruí-los da face da terra?. Torna-te da tua ardente ira, e arrepende-te deste mal contra o teu povo.

RVA.text: ¿Por qué han de hablar los Egipcios, diciendo: Para mal los sacó, para matarlos en los montes, y para raerlos de sobre la haz de la tierra? Vuélvete del furor de tu ira, y arrepiéntete del mal de tu pueblo.

KJV.text: Wherefore should the Egyptians speak, and say, For mischief did he bring them out, to slay them in the mountains, and to consume them from the face of the earth? Turn from thy fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against thy people.

WEBM.text: Why should the Egyptians talk, saying, ‘He brought them out for evil, to kill them in the mountains, and to consume them from the surface of the earth?’ Turn from your fierce wrath, and turn away from this evil against your people.

JFA.text: Lembra-te de Abraão, de Isaque, e de Israel, teus servos, aos quais por ti mesmo juraste, e lhes disseste: Multiplicarei os vossos descendentes como as estrelas do céu, e lhes darei toda esta terra de que tenho falado, e eles a possuirão por herança para sempre.

RVA.text: Acuérdate de Abraham, de Isaac, y de Israel tus siervos, á los cuales has jurado por ti mismo, y dícholes: Yo multiplicaré vuestra simiente como las estrellas del cielo; y daré á vuestra simiente toda esta tierra que he dicho, y la tomarán por heredad para siempre.

KJV.text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, thy servants, to whom thou swarest by thine own self, and saidst unto them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have spoken of will I give unto your seed, and they shall inherit it for ever.

WEBM.text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your own self, and said to them, ‘I will multiply your offspring[a] as the stars of the sky, and all this land that I have spoken of I will give to your offspring, and they shall inherit it forever.’”

JFA.text: Então o Senhor se arrependeu do mal que dissera que havia de fazer ao seu povo.

RVA.text: Entonces Jehová se arrepintió del mal que dijo que había de hacer á su pueblo.

KJV.text: And the Lord repented of the evil which he thought to do unto his people.

WEBM.text: So the Lord turned away from the evil which he said he would do to his people.

JFA.text: E virou-se Moisés, e desceu do monte com as duas tábuas do testemunho na mão, tábuas escritas de ambos os lados; de um e de outro lado estavam escritas.

RVA.text: Y volvióse Moisés, y descendió del monte trayendo en su mano las dos tablas del testimonio, las tablas escritas por ambos lados; de una parte y de otra estaban escritas.

KJV.text: And Moses turned, and went down from the mount, and the two tables of the testimony were in his hand: the tables were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other were they written.

WEBM.text: Moses turned, and went down from the mountain, with the two tablets of the covenant in his hand; tablets that were written on both their sides. They were written on one side and on the other.

JFA.text: E aquelas tábuas eram obra de Deus; também a escritura era a mesma escritura de Deus, esculpida nas tábuas.

RVA.text: Y las tablas eran obra de Dios, y la escritura era escritura de Dios grabada sobre las tablas.

KJV.text: And the tables were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, graven upon the tables.

WEBM.text: The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tablets.

JFA.text: Ora, ouvindo Josué a voz do povo que jubilava, disse a Moisés: Alarido de guerra há no arraial.

RVA.text: Y oyendo Josué el clamor del pueblo que gritaba, dijo á Moisés: Alarido de pelea hay en el campo.

KJV.text: And when Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said unto Moses, There is a noise of war in the camp.

WEBM.text: When Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, “There is the noise of war in the camp.”

JFA.text: Respondeu-lhe Moisés: Não é alarido dos vitoriosos, nem alarido dos vencidos, mas é a voz dos que cantam que eu ouço.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: No es eco de algazara de fuertes, ni eco de alaridos de flacos: algazara de cantar oigo yo.

KJV.text: And he said, It is not the voice of them that shout for mastery, neither is it the voice of them that cry for being overcome: but the noise of them that sing do I hear.

WEBM.text: He said, “It isn’t the voice of those who shout for victory. It is not the voice of those who cry for being overcome; but the noise of those who sing that I hear.”

JFA.text: Chegando ele ao arraial e vendo o bezerro e as danças, acendeu-se-lhe a ira, e ele arremessou das mãos as tábuas, e as despedaçou ao pé do monte.

RVA.text: Y aconteció, que como llegó él al campo, y vió el becerro y las danzas, enardeciósele la ira á Moisés, y arrojó las tablas de sus manos, y quebrólas al pie del monte.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, as soon as he came nigh unto the camp, that he saw the calf, and the dancing: and Moses' anger waxed hot, and he cast the tables out of his hands, and brake them beneath the mount.

WEBM.text: As soon as he came near to the camp, he saw the calf and the dancing. Then Moses’ anger grew hot, and he threw the tablets out of his hands, and broke them beneath the mountain.

JFA.text: Então tomou o bezerro que tinham feito, e queimou-o no fogo; e, moendo-o até que se tornou em pó, o espargiu sobre a água, e deu-o a beber aos filhos de Israel.

RVA.text: Y tomó el becerro que habían hecho, y quemólo en el fuego, y moliólo hasta reducirlo á polvo, que esparció sobre las aguas, y diólo á beber á los hijos de Israel.

KJV.text: And he took the calf which they had made, and burnt it in the fire, and ground it to powder, and strawed it upon the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.

WEBM.text: He took the calf which they had made, and burned it with fire, ground it to powder, and scattered it on the water, and made the children of Israel drink it.

JFA.text: E perguntou Moisés a Arão: Que te fez este povo, que sobre ele trouxeste tamanho pecado?

RVA.text: Y dijo Moisés á Aarón: ¿Qué te ha hecho este pueblo, que has traído sobre él tan gran pecado?

KJV.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, What did this people unto thee, that thou hast brought so great a sin upon them?

WEBM.text: Moses said to Aaron, “What did these people do to you, that you have brought a great sin on them?”

JFA.text: Ao que respondeu Arão: Não se acenda a ira do meu senhor; tu conheces o povo, como ele é inclinado ao mal.

RVA.text: Y respondió Aarón: No se enoje mi señor; tú conoces el pueblo, que es inclinado á mal.

KJV.text: And Aaron said, Let not the anger of my lord wax hot: thou knowest the people, that they are set on mischief.

WEBM.text: Aaron said, “Don’t let the anger of my lord grow hot. You know the people, that they are set on evil.

JFA.text: Pois eles me disseram: Faze-nos um deus que vá adiante de nós; porque, quanto a esse Moisés, o homem que nos tirou da terra do Egito, não sabemos o que lhe aconteceu.

RVA.text: Porque me dijeron: Haznos dioses que vayan delante de nosotros, que á este Moisés, el varón que nos sacó de tierra de Egipto, no sabemos qué le ha acontecido.

KJV.text: For they said unto me, Make us gods, which shall go before us: for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.

WEBM.text: For they said to me, ‘Make us gods, which shall go before us. As for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.’

JFA.text: Então eu lhes disse: Quem tem ouro, arranque-o. Assim mo deram; e eu o lancei no fogo, e saiu este bezerro.

RVA.text: Y yo les respondí: ¿Quién tiene oro? Apartadlo. Y diéronmelo, y echélo en el fuego, y salió este becerro.

KJV.text: And I said unto them, Whosoever hath any gold, let them break it off. So they gave it me: then I cast it into the fire, and there came out this calf.

WEBM.text: I said to them, ‘Whoever has any gold, let them take it off.’ So they gave it to me; and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf.”

JFA.text: Quando, pois, Moisés viu que o povo estava desenfreado (porque Arão o havia desenfreado, para escárnio entre os seus inimigos).

RVA.text: Y viendo Moisés que el pueblo estaba despojado, porque Aarón lo había despojado para verguenza entre sus enemigos,

KJV.text: And when Moses saw that the people were naked; (for Aaron had made them naked unto their shame among their enemies:)

WEBM.text: When Moses saw that the people were out of control, (for Aaron had let them lose control, causing derision among their enemies),

JFA.text: Pôs-se em pé à entrada do arraial, e disse: Quem está ao lado do Senhor, venha a mim. Ao que se ajuntaram a ele todos os filhos de Levi.

RVA.text: Púsose Moisés á la puerta del real, y dijo: ¿Quién es de Jehová? júntese conmigo. Y juntáronse con él todos los hijos de Leví.

KJV.text: Then Moses stood in the gate of the camp, and said, Who is on the Lord's side? let him come unto me. And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together unto him.

WEBM.text: then Moses stood in the gate of the camp, and said, “Whoever is on the Lord’s side, come to me!” All the sons of Levi gathered themselves together to him.

JFA.text: Então ele lhes disse: Assim diz o Senhor, o Deus de Israel: Cada um ponha a sua espada sobre a coxa; e passai e tornai pelo arraial de porta em porta, e mate cada um a seu irmão, e cada um a seu amigo, e cada um a seu vizinho.

RVA.text: Y él les dijo: Así ha dicho Jehová, el Dios de Israel: Poned cada uno su espada sobre su muslo: pasad y volved de puerta á puerta por el campo, y matad cada uno á su hermano, y á su amigo, y á su pariente.

KJV.text: And he said unto them, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Put every man his sword by his side, and go in and out from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay every man his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbour.

WEBM.text: He said to them, “The Lord, the God of Israel, says, ‘Every man put his sword on his thigh, and go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and every man kill his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.’”

JFA.text: E os filhos de Levi fizeram conforme a palavra de Moisés; e caíram do povo naquele dia cerca de três mil homens.

RVA.text: Y los hijos de Leví lo hicieron conforme al dicho de Moisés: y cayeron del pueblo en aquel día como tres mil hombres.

KJV.text: And the children of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.

WEBM.text: The sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses. About three thousand men fell of the people that day.

JFA.text: Porquanto Moisés tinha dito: Consagrai-vos hoje ao Senhor; porque cada um será contra o seu filho, e contra o seu irmão; para que o Senhor vos conceda hoje uma bênção.

RVA.text: Entonces Moisés dijo: Hoy os habéis consagrado á Jehová, porque cada uno se ha consagrado en su hijo, y en su hermano, para que dé él hoy bendición sobre vosotros.

KJV.text: For Moses had said, Consecrate yourselves today to the Lord, even every man upon his son, and upon his brother; that he may bestow upon you a blessing this day.

WEBM.text: Moses said, “Consecrate yourselves today to the Lord, for every man was against his son and against his brother, that he may give you a blessing today.”

JFA.text: No dia seguinte disse Moisés ao povo Vós tendes cometido grande pecado; agora porém subirei ao Senhor; porventura farei expiação por vosso pecado.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que el día siguiente dijo Moisés al pueblo: Vosotros habéis cometido un gran pecado: mas yo subiré ahora á Jehová; quizá le aplacaré acerca de vuestro pecado.

KJV.text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses said unto the people, Ye have sinned a great sin: and now I will go up unto the Lord; peradventure I shall make an atonement for your sin.

WEBM.text: On the next day, Moses said to the people, “You have sinned a great sin. Now I will go up to the Lord. Perhaps I shall make atonement for your sin.”

JFA.text: Assim tornou Moisés ao Senhor, e disse: Oh! este povo cometeu um grande pecado, fazendo para si um deus de ouro.

RVA.text: Entonces volvió Moisés á Jehová, y dijo: Ruégote, pues este pueblo ha cometido un gran pecado, porque se hicieron dioses de oro,

KJV.text: And Moses returned unto the Lord, and said, Oh, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made them gods of gold.

WEBM.text: Moses returned to the Lord, and said, “Oh, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made themselves gods of gold.

JFA.text: Agora, pois, perdoa o seu pecado; ou se não, risca-me do teu livro, que tens escrito.

RVA.text: Que perdones ahora su pecado, y si no, ráeme ahora de tu libro que has escrito.

KJV.text: Yet now, if thou wilt forgive their sin--; and if not, blot me, I pray thee, out of thy book which thou hast written.

WEBM.text: Yet now, if you will, forgive their sin—and if not, please blot me out of your book which you have written.”

JFA.text: Então disse o Senhor a Moisés: Aquele que tiver pecado contra mim, a este riscarei do meu livro.

RVA.text: Y Jehová respondió á Moisés: Al que pecare contra mí, á éste raeré yo de mi libro.

KJV.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Whosoever hath sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book.

WEBM.text: the Lord said to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against me, I will blot him out of my book.

JFA.text: Vai pois agora, conduze este povo para o lugar de que te hei dito; eis que o meu anjo irá adiante de ti; porém no dia da minha visitação, sobre eles visitarei o seu pecado.

RVA.text: Ve pues ahora, lleva á este pueblo donde te he dicho: he aquí mi ángel irá delante de ti; que en el día de mi visitación yo visitaré en ellos su pecado.

KJV.text: Therefore now go, lead the people unto the place of which I have spoken unto thee: behold, mine Angel shall go before thee: nevertheless in the day when I visit I will visit their sin upon them.

WEBM.text: Now go, lead the people to the place of which I have spoken to you. Behold, my angel shall go before you. Nevertheless, in the day when I punish, I will punish them for their sin.”

JFA.text: Feriu, pois, o Senhor ao povo, por ter feito o bezerro que Arão formara.

RVA.text: Y Jehová hirió al pueblo, porque habían hecho el becerro que formó Aarón.

KJV.text: And the Lord plagued the people, because they made the calf, which Aaron made.

WEBM.text: the Lord struck the people, because of what they did with the calf, which Aaron made.

JFA.text: E deslocando-se os homens para o oriente, acharam um vale na terra de Sinar; e ali habitaram.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que, como se partieron de oriente, hallaron una vega en la tierra de Shinar, y asentaron allí.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.

WEBM.text: As they traveled east, they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they lived there.

JFA.text: Disseram uns aos outros: Eia pois, façamos tijolos, e queimemo-los bem. Os tijolos lhes serviram de pedras e o betume de argamassa.

RVA.text: Y dijeron los unos á los otros: Vaya, hagamos ladrillo y cozámoslo con fuego. Y fuéles el ladrillo en lugar de piedra, y el betún en lugar de mezcla.

KJV.text: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.

WEBM.text: They said to one another, “Come, let’s make bricks, and burn them thoroughly.” They had brick for stone, and they used tar for mortar.

JFA.text: Disseram mais: Eia, edifiquemos para nós uma cidade e uma torre cujo cume toque no céu, e façamo-nos um nome, para que não sejamos espalhados sobre a face de toda a terra.

RVA.text: Y dijeron: Vamos, edifiquémonos una ciudad y una torre, cuya cúspide llegue al cielo; y hagámonos un nombre, por si fuéremos esparcidos sobre la faz de toda la tierra.

KJV.text: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.

WEBM.text: They said, “Come, let’s build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let’s make a name for ourselves, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth.”

JFA.text: Então desceu o Senhor para ver a cidade e a torre que os filhos dos homens edificavam. E disse: Eis que o povo é um e todos têm uma só língua; e isto é o que começam a fazer; agora não haverá restrição para tudo o que eles intentarem fazer.

RVA.text: Y descendió Jehová para ver la ciudad y la torre que edificaban los hijos de los hombres.

KJV.text: And the Lord came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.

WEBM.text: the Lord came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.

JFA.text: Eia, desçamos, e confundamos ali a sua linguagem, para que não entenda um a língua do outro.

RVA.text: Ahora pues, descendamos, y confundamos allí sus lenguas, para que ninguno entienda el habla de su compañero.

KJV.text: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.

WEBM.text: Come, let’s go down, and there confuse their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.”

JFA.text: Assim o Senhor os espalhou dali sobre a face de toda a terra; e cessaram de edificar a cidade.

RVA.text: Así los esparció Jehová desde allí sobre la faz de toda la tierra, y dejaron de edificar la ciudad.

KJV.text: So the Lord scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.

WEBM.text: So the Lord scattered them abroad from there on the surface of all the earth. They stopped building the city.

JFA.text: Por isso se chamou o seu nome Babel, porquanto ali confundiu o Senhor a linguagem de toda a terra, e dali o Senhor os espalhou sobre a face de toda a terra.

RVA.text: Por esto fué llamado el nombre de ella Babel, porque allí confudió Jehová el lenguaje de toda la tierra, y desde allí los esparció sobre la faz de toda la tierra.

KJV.text: Therefore is the name of it called Babel; because the Lord did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the Lord scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

WEBM.text: Therefore its name was called Babel, because there the Lord confused the language of all the earth. From there, the Lord scattered them abroad on the surface of all the earth.

JFA.text: Eu farei de ti uma grande nação; abençoar-te-ei, e engrandecerei o teu nome; e tu, sê uma bênção.

RVA.text: Y haré de ti una nación grande, y bendecirte he, y engrandeceré tu nombre, y serás bendición:

KJV.text: And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing.

WEBM.text: I will make of you a great nation. I will bless you and make your name great. You will be a blessing.

JFA.text: Partiu, pois Abrão, como o Senhor lhe ordenara, e Ló foi com ele. Tinha Abrão setenta e cinco anos quando saiu de Harã.

RVA.text: Y fuése Abram, como Jehová le dijo; y fué con él Lot: y era Abram de edad de setenta y cinco años cuando salió de Harán.

KJV.text: So Abram departed, as the Lord had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.

WEBM.text: So Abram went, as the Lord had told him. Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed from Haran.

JFA.text: Abrão levou consigo a Sarai, sua mulher, e a Ló, filho de seu irmão, e todos os bens que haviam adquirido, e as almas que lhes acresceram em Harã; e saíram a fim de irem à terra de Canaã; e à terra de Canaã chegaram.

RVA.text: Y tomó Abram á Sarai su mujer, y á Lot hijo de su hermano, y toda su hacienda que habían ganado, y las almas que habían adquirido en Harán, y salieron para ir á tierra de Canaán; y á tierra de Canaán llegaron.

KJV.text: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.

WEBM.text: Abram took Sarai his wife, Lot his brother’s son, all their possessions that they had gathered, and the people whom they had acquired in Haran, and they went to go into the land of Canaan. They entered into the land of Canaan.

JFA.text: Passou Abrão pela terra até o lugar de Siquém, até o carvalho de Moré. Nesse tempo estavam os cananeus na terra.

RVA.text: Y pasó Abram por aquella tierra hasta el lugar de Sichêm, hasta el valle de Moreh: y el Cananeo estaba entonces en la tierra.

KJV.text: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.

WEBM.text: Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. At that time, Canaanites were in the land.

JFA.text: Apareceu, porém, o Senhor a Abrão, e disse: e tua semente darei esta terra. Abrão, pois, edificou ali um altar ao Senhor, que lhe aparecera.

RVA.text: Y apareció Jehová á Abram, y le dijo: A tu simiente daré esta tierra. Y edificó allí un altar á Jehová, que le había aparecido.

KJV.text: And the Lord appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the Lord, who appeared unto him.

WEBM.text: the Lord appeared to Abram and said, “I will give this land to your offspring.” He built an altar there to the Lord, who had appeared to him.

JFA.text: Então passou dali para o monte ao oriente de Betel, e armou a sua tenda, ficando-lhe Betel ao ocidente, e Ai ao oriente; também ali edificou um altar ao Senhor, e invocou o nome do Senhor.

RVA.text: Y pasóse de allí á un monte al oriente de Bethel, y tendió su tienda, teniendo á Bethel al occidente y Hai al oriente: y edificó allí altar á Jehová é invocó el nombre de Jehová.

KJV.text: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the Lord, and called upon the name of the Lord.

WEBM.text: He left from there to go to the mountain on the east of Bethel and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to the Lord and called on the Lord’s name.

JFA.text: Depois continuou Abrão o seu caminho, seguindo ainda para o sul.

RVA.text: Y movió Abram de allí, caminando y yendo hacia el Mediodía.

KJV.text: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the south.

WEBM.text: Abram traveled, still going on toward the South.

JFA.text: Ora, havia fome naquela terra; Abrão, pois, desceu ao Egito, para peregrinar ali, porquanto era grande a fome na terra.

RVA.text: Y hubo hambre en la tierra, y descendió Abram á Egipto para peregrinar allá; porque era grande el hambre en la tierra.

KJV.text: And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land.

WEBM.text: There was a famine in the land. Abram went down into Egypt to live as a foreigner there, for the famine was severe in the land.

JFA.text: Quando ele estava prestes a entrar no Egito, disse a Sarai, sua mulher: Ora, bem sei que és mulher formosa à vista.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que cuando estaba para entrar en Egipto, dijo á Sarai su mujer: He aquí, ahora conozco que eres mujer hermosa de vista;

KJV.text: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:

WEBM.text: When he had come near to enter Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, “See now, I know that you are a beautiful woman to look at.

JFA.text: E acontecerá que, quando os egípcios te virem, dirão: Esta é mulher dele. E me matarão a mim, mas a ti te guardarão em vida.

RVA.text: Y será que cuando te habrán visto los Egipcios, dirán: Su mujer es: y me matarán á mí, y á ti te reservarán la vida.

KJV.text: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they shall say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.

WEBM.text: It will happen that when the Egyptians see you, they will say, ‘This is his wife.’ They will kill me, but they will save you alive.

JFA.text: Dize, peço-te, que és minha irmã, para que me vá bem por tua causa, e que viva a minha alma em atenção a ti.

RVA.text: Ahora pues, di que eres mi hermana, para que yo haya bien por causa tuya, y viva mi alma por amor de ti.

KJV.text: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.

WEBM.text: Please say that you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and that my soul may live because of you.”

JFA.text: E aconteceu que, entrando Abrão no Egito, viram os egípcios que a mulher era mui formosa.

RVA.text: Y aconteció que, como entró Abram en Egipto, los Egipcios vieron la mujer que era hermosa en gran manera.

KJV.text: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.

WEBM.text: When Abram had come into Egypt, Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.

JFA.text: Até os príncipes de Faraó a viram e gabaram-na diante dele; e foi levada a mulher para a casa de Faraó.

RVA.text: Viéronla también los príncipes de Faraón, y se la alabaron; y fué llevada la mujer á casa de Faraón:

KJV.text: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.

WEBM.text: The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.

JFA.text: E ele tratou bem a Abrão por causa dela; e este veio a ter ovelhas, bois e jumentos, servos e servas, jumentas e camelos.

RVA.text: E hizo bien á Abram por causa de ella; y tuvo ovejas, y vacas, y asnos, y siervos, y criadas, y asnas y camellos.

KJV.text: And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.

WEBM.text: He dealt well with Abram for her sake. He had sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.

JFA.text: Feriu, porém, o Senhor a Faraó e a sua casa com grandes pragas, por causa de Sarai, mulher de Abrão.

RVA.text: Mas Jehová hirió á Faraón y á su casa con grandes plagas, por causa de Sarai mujer de Abram.

KJV.text: And the Lord plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram's wife.

WEBM.text: the Lord afflicted Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram’s wife.

JFA.text: Então chamou Faraó a Abrão, e disse: Que é isto que me fizeste? por que não me disseste que ela era tua mulher?

RVA.text: Entonces Faraón llamó á Abram y le dijo: ¿Qué es esto que has hecho conmigo? ¿Por qué no me declaraste que era tu mujer?

KJV.text: And Pharaoh called Abram and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?

WEBM.text: Pharaoh called Abram and said, “What is this that you have done to me? Why didn’t you tell me that she was your wife?

JFA.text: Por que disseste: E minha irmã? de maneira que a tomei para ser minha mulher. Agora, pois, eis aqui tua mulher; toma-a e vai-te.

RVA.text: ¿Por qué dijiste: Es mi hermana? poniéndome en ocasión de tomarla para mí por mujer? Ahora pues, he aquí tu mujer, tómala y vete.

KJV.text: Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.

WEBM.text: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her to be my wife? Now therefore, see your wife, take her, and go your way.”

JFA.text: E Faraó deu ordens aos seus guardas a respeito dele, os quais o despediram a ele, e a sua mulher, e a tudo o que tinha.

RVA.text: Entonces Faraón dió orden á sus gentes acerca de Abram; y le acompañaron, y á su mujer con todo lo que tenía.

KJV.text: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.

WEBM.text: Pharaoh commanded men concerning him, and they escorted him away with his wife and all that he had.

JFA.text: Jacó habitava na terra das peregrinações de seu pai, na terra de Canaã.

RVA.text: Y habito Jacob en la tierra donde peregrinó su padre, en la tierra de Canaán.

KJV.text: And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.

WEBM.text: Jacob lived in the land of his father’s travels, in the land of Canaan.

JFA.text: Estas são as gerações de Jacó. José, aos dezessete anos de idade, estava com seus irmãos apascentando os rebanhos; sendo ainda jovem, andava com os filhos de Bila, e com os filhos de Zilpa, mulheres de seu pai; e José trazia a seu pai más notícias a respeito deles.

RVA.text: Estas fueron las generaciones de Jacob. José, siendo de edad de diez y siete años apacentaba las ovejas con sus hermanos; y el joven estaba con los hijos de Bilha, y con los hijos de Zilpa, mujeres de su padre: y noticiaba José á su padre la mala fama de ellos.

KJV.text: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.

WEBM.text: This is the history of the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brothers. He was a boy with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father’s wives. Joseph brought an evil report of them to their father.

JFA.text: Israel amava mais a José do que a todos os seus filhos, porque era filho da sua velhice; e fez-lhe uma túnica de várias cores.

RVA.text: Y amaba Israel á José más que á todos sus hijos, porque le había tenido en su vejez: y le hizo una ropa de diversos colores.

KJV.text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colours.

WEBM.text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age, and he made him a tunic of many colors.

JFA.text: Vendo, pois, seus irmãos que seu pai o amava mais do que a todos eles, odiavam-no, e não lhe podiam falar pacificamente.

RVA.text: Y viendo sus hermanos que su padre lo amaba más que á todos sus hermanos, aborrecíanle, y no le podían hablar pacíficamente.

KJV.text: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.

WEBM.text: His brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, and they hated him, and couldn’t speak peaceably to him.

JFA.text: José teve um sonho, que contou a seus irmãos; por isso o odiaram ainda mais.

RVA.text: Y soñó José un sueño y contólo á sus hermanos; y ellos vinieron á aborrecerle más todavía.

KJV.text: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.

WEBM.text: Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brothers, and they hated him all the more.

JFA.text: Pois ele lhes disse: Ouvi, peço-vos, este sonho que tive.

RVA.text: Y él les dijo: Oíd ahora este sueño que he soñado:

KJV.text: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:

WEBM.text: He said to them, “Please hear this dream which I have dreamed:

JFA.text: Estávamos nós atando molhos no campo, e eis que o meu molho, levantando-se, ficou em pé; e os vossos molhos o rodeavam, e se inclinavam ao meu molho.

RVA.text: He aquí que atábamos manojos en medio del campo, y he aquí que mi manojo se levantaba, y estaba derecho, y que vuestros manojos estaban alrededor, y se inclinaban al mío.

KJV.text: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.

WEBM.text: for behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and behold, my sheaf arose and also stood upright; and behold, your sheaves came around, and bowed down to my sheaf.”

JFA.text: Responderam-lhe seus irmãos: Tu pois, deveras reinarás sobre nós? Tu deveras terás domínio sobre nós? Por isso ainda mais o odiavam por causa dos seus sonhos e das suas palavras.

RVA.text: Y respondiéronle sus hermanos: ¿Has de reinar tú sobre nosotros, ó te has de enseñorear sobre nosotros? Y le aborrecieron aún más á causa de sus sueños y de sus palabras.

KJV.text: And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.

WEBM.text: His brothers asked him, “Will you indeed reign over us? Will you indeed have dominion over us?” They hated him all the more for his dreams and for his words.

JFA.text: Teve José outro sonho, e o contou a seus irmãos, dizendo: Tive ainda outro sonho; e eis que o sol, e a lua, e onze estrelas se inclinavam perante mim.

RVA.text: Y soñó aún otro sueño, y contólo á sus hermanos, diciendo: He aquí que he soñado otro sueño, y he aquí que el sol y la luna y once estrellas se inclinaban á mí.

KJV.text: And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me.

WEBM.text: He dreamed yet another dream, and told it to his brothers, and said, “Behold, I have dreamed yet another dream: and behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars bowed down to me.”

JFA.text: Quando o contou a seu pai e a seus irmãos, repreendeu-o seu pai, e disse-lhe: Que sonho é esse que tiveste? Porventura viremos, eu e tua mãe, e teus irmãos, a inclinar-nos com o rosto em terra diante de ti?

RVA.text: Y contólo á su padre y á sus hermanos: y su padre le reprendió, y díjole: ¿Qué sueño es este que soñaste? ¿Hemos de venir yo y tu madre, y tus hermanos, á inclinarnos á ti á tierra?

KJV.text: And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?

WEBM.text: He told it to his father and to his brothers. His father rebuked him, and said to him, “What is this dream that you have dreamed? Will I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow ourselves down to the earth before you?”

JFA.text: Seus irmãos, pois, o invejavam; mas seu pai guardava o caso no seu coração.

RVA.text: Y sus hermanos le tenían envidia, mas su padre paraba la consideración en ello.

KJV.text: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.

WEBM.text: His brothers envied him, but his father kept this saying in mind.

JFA.text: Ora, foram seus irmãos apascentar o rebanho de seu pai, em Siquém.

RVA.text: Y fueron sus hermanos á apacentar las ovejas de su padre en Sichêm.

KJV.text: And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.

WEBM.text: His brothers went to feed their father’s flock in Shechem.

JFA.text: Disse, pois, Israel a José: Não apascentam teus irmãos o rebanho em Siquém? Vem, e enviar-te-ei a eles. Respondeu-lhe José: Eis-me aqui.

RVA.text: Y dijo Israel á José: Tus hermanos apacientan las ovejas en Sichêm: ven, y te enviaré á ellos. Y él respondió: Heme aquí.

KJV.text: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.

WEBM.text: Israel said to Joseph, “Aren’t your brothers feeding the flock in Shechem? Come, and I will send you to them.” He said to him, “Here I am.”

JFA.text: Disse-lhe Israel: Vai, vê se vão bem teus irmãos, e o rebanho; e traze-me resposta. Assim o enviou do vale de Hebrom; e José foi a Siquém.

RVA.text: Y él le dijo: Ve ahora, mira cómo están tus hermanos y cómo están las ovejas, y tráeme la respuesta. Y enviólo del valle de Hebrón, y llegó á Sichêm.

KJV.text: And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

WEBM.text: He said to him, “Go now, see whether it is well with your brothers, and well with the flock; and bring me word again.” So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

JFA.text: E um homem encontrou a José, que andava errante pelo campo, e perguntou-lhe: Que procuras?

RVA.text: Y hallólo un hombre, andando él perdido por el campo, y preguntóle aquel hombre, diciendo: ¿Qué buscas?

KJV.text: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?

WEBM.text: A certain man found him, and behold, he was wandering in the field. The man asked him, “What are you looking for?”

JFA.text: Respondeu ele: Estou procurando meus irmãos; dize-me, peço-te, onde apascentam eles o rebanho.

RVA.text: Y él respondió: Busco á mis hermanos: ruégote que me muestres dónde pastan.

KJV.text: And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.

WEBM.text: He said, “I am looking for my brothers. Tell me, please, where they are feeding the flock.”

JFA.text: Disse o homem: Foram-se daqui; pois ouvi-lhes dizer: Vamos a Dotã. José, pois, seguiu seus irmãos, e os achou em Dotã.

RVA.text: Y aquel hombre respondió: Ya se han ido de aquí; yo les oí decir: Vamos á Dothán. Entonces José fué tras de sus hermanos, y hallólos en Dothán.

KJV.text: And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.

WEBM.text: The man said, “They have left here, for I heard them say, ‘Let’s go to Dothan.’” Joseph went after his brothers, and found them in Dothan.

JFA.text: Eles o viram de longe e, antes que chegasse aonde estavam, conspiraram contra ele, para o matarem.

RVA.text: Y como ellos lo vieron de lejos, antes que cerca de ellos llegara, proyectaron contra él para matarle.

KJV.text: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.

WEBM.text: They saw him afar off, and before he came near to them, they conspired against him to kill him.

JFA.text: Dizendo uns aos outros: Eis que lá vem o sonhador!

RVA.text: Y dijeron el uno al otro: He aquí viene el soñador;

KJV.text: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.

WEBM.text: They said to one another, “Behold, this dreamer comes.

JFA.text: Vinde pois agora, fmatemo-lo e lancemo-lo numa das covas; e diremos: uma besta-fera o devorou. Veremos, então, o que será dos seus sonhos.

KJV.text: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.

JFA.text: Mas Rúben, ouvindo isso, livrou-o das mãos deles, dizendo: Não lhe tiremos a vida.

JFA.text: Também lhes disse Rúben: Não derrameis sangue; lançai-o nesta cova, que está no deserto, e não lanceis mão nele. Disse isto para livrá-lo das mãos deles, a fim de restituí-lo a seu pai.

RVA.text: Y díjoles Rubén: No derraméis sangre; echadlo en esta cisterna que está en el desierto, y no pongáis mano en él; por librarlo así de sus manos, para hacerlo volver á su padre.

KJV.text: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again.

JFA.text: Logo que José chegou a seus irmãos, estes o despiram da sua túnica, a túnica de várias cores, que ele trazia.

WEBM.text: When Joseph came to his brothers, they stripped Joseph of his tunic, the tunic of many colors that was on him;

RVA.text: Y sentáronse á comer pan: y alzando los ojos miraron, y he aquí una compañía de Ismaelitas que venía de Galaad, y sus camellos traían aromas y bálsamo y mirra, é iban á llevarlo á Egipto.

KJV.text: And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.

RVA.text: Entonces Judá dijo á sus hermanos: ¿Qué provecho el que matemos á nuestro hermano y encubramos su muerte?

RVA.text: Y levantáronse todos sus hijos y todas sus hijas para consolarlo; mas él no quiso tomar consolación, y dijo: Porque yo tengo de descender á mi hijo enlutado hasta la sepultura. Y llorólo su padre.
