JFA.text: E de que também tomei por mulher a Rute, a moabita, que foi mulher de Malom, para suscitar o nome do falecido na sua herança, para que a nome dele não seja desarraigado dentre seus irmãos e da porta do seu lugar; disto sois hoje testemunhas.

RVA.text: Y que también tomo por mi mujer á Ruth Moabita, mujer de Mahalón, para suscitar el nombre del difunto sobre su heredad, para que el nombre del muerto no se borre de entre sus hermanos y de la puerta de su lugar. Vosotros sois hoy testigos.

KJV.text: Moreover Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, have I purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance, that the name of the dead be not cut off from among his brethren, and from the gate of his place: ye are witnesses this day.

WEBM.text: Moreover, Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, I have purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead on his inheritance, that the name of the dead may not be cut off from among his brothers and from the gate of his place. You are witnesses today.”

JFA.text: Ao que todo o povo que estava na porta e os anciãos responderam: Somos testemunhas. O Senhor faça a esta mulher, que entra na tua casa, como a Raquel e a Léia, que juntas edificaram a casa de Israel. Porta-te valorosamente em Efrata, e faze-te nome afamado em Belém.

RVA.text: Y dijeron todos los del pueblo que estaban á la puerta con los ancianos: Testigos somos. Jehová haga á la mujer que entra en tu casa como á Rachêl y á Lea, las cuales dos edificaron la casa de Israel; y tú seas ilustre en Ephrata, y tengas nombradía en Beth-lehem;

KJV.text: And all the people that were in the gate, and the elders, said, We are witnesses. The Lord make the woman that is come into thine house like Rachel and like Leah, which two did build the house of Israel: and do thou worthily in Ephratah, and be famous in Bethlehem:

WEBM.text: All the people who were in the gate, and the elders, said, “We are witnesses. May the Lord make the woman who has come into your house like Rachel and like Leah, which both built the house of Israel; and treat you worthily in Ephrathah, and be famous in Bethlehem.

JFA.text: Também seja a tua casa como a casa de Pérez, que Tamar deu a Judá, pela posteridade que o Senhor te der desta moça.

RVA.text: Y de la simiente que Jehová te diere de aquesta moza, sea tu casa como la casa de Phares, al que parió Thamar á Judá.

KJV.text: And let thy house be like the house of Pharez, whom Tamar bare unto Judah, of the seed which the Lord shall give thee of this young woman.

WEBM.text: Let your house be like the house of Perez, whom Tamar bore to Judah, of the offspring[a] which the Lord will give you by this young woman.”

JFA.text: Assim tomou Boaz a Rute, e ela lhe foi por mulher; ele a conheceu, e o Senhor permitiu a Rute conceber, e ela teve um filho.

RVA.text: Booz pues tomó á Ruth, y ella fué su mujer; y luego que entró á ella, Jehová le dió que concibiese y pariese un hijo.

KJV.text: So Boaz took Ruth, and she was his wife: and when he went in unto her, the Lord gave her conception, and she bare a son.

WEBM.text: So Boaz took Ruth and she became his wife; and he went in to her, and the Lord enabled her to conceive, and she bore a son.

JFA.text: Disseram então as mulheres a Noêmi: Bendito seja o Senhor, que não te deixou hoje sem remidor; e torne-se o seu nome afamado em Israel.

RVA.text: Y las mujeres decían á Noemi: Loado sea Jehová, que hizo que no te faltase hoy pariente, cuyo nombre será nombrado en Israel.

KJV.text: And the women said unto Naomi, Blessed be the Lord, which hath not left thee this day without a kinsman, that his name may be famous in Israel.

WEBM.text: The women said to Naomi, “Blessed be the Lord, who has not left you today without a near kinsman. Let his name be famous in Israel.

JFA.text: Ele será restaurador da tua vida, e consolador da tua velhice, pois tua nora, que te ama, o deu à luz; ela te é melhor do que sete filhos.

RVA.text: El cual será restaurador de tu alma, y el que sustentará tu vejez; pues que tu nuera, la cual te ama y te vale más que siete hijos, le ha parido.

KJV.text: And he shall be unto thee a restorer of thy life, and a nourisher of thine old age: for thy daughter in law, which loveth thee, which is better to thee than seven sons, hath born him.

WEBM.text: He shall be to you a restorer of life and sustain you in your old age; for your daughter-in-law, who loves you, who is better to you than seven sons, has given birth to him.”

JFA.text: E Noêmi tomou o menino, pô-lo no seu regaço, e foi sua ama.

RVA.text: Y tomando Noemi el hijo, púsolo en su regazo, y fuéle su ama.

KJV.text: And Naomi took the child, and laid it in her bosom, and became nurse unto it.

WEBM.text: Naomi took the child, laid him in her bosom, and became nurse to him.

JFA.text: E as vizinhas deram-lhe nome, dizendo: A Noêmi nasceu um filho, E chamaram ao menino Obede. Este é o pai de Jessé, pai de Davi.

RVA.text: Y las vecinas diciendo, á Noemi ha nacido un hijo, le pusieron nombre; y llamáronle Obed. Este es padre de Isaí, padre de David.

KJV.text: And the women her neighbours gave it a name, saying, There is a son born to Naomi; and they called his name Obed: he is the father of Jesse, the father of David.

WEBM.text: The women, her neighbors, gave him a name, saying, “A son is born to Naomi”. They named him Obed. He is the father of Jesse, the father of David.

JFA.text: São estas as gerações de Pérez: Pérez gerou a Hezrom.

RVA.text: Y estas son las generaciones de Phares: Phares engendró á Hesrón;

KJV.text: Now these are the generations of Pharez: Pharez begat Hezron,

WEBM.text: Now this is the history of the generations of Perez: Perez became the father of Hezron,

JFA.text: Hezrom gerou a Rão, Rão gerou a Aminadabe.

RVA.text: Y Hesrón engendró á Ram, y Ram engendró á Aminadab;

KJV.text: And Hezron begat Ram, and Ram begat Amminadab,

WEBM.text: and Hezron became the father of Ram, and Ram became the father of Amminadab,

JFA.text: Aminadabe gereu a Nasom, Nasom gerou a Salmom.

RVA.text: Y Aminadab engendró á Nahasón, y Nahasón engendró á Salmón;

KJV.text: And Amminadab begat Nahshon, and Nahshon begat Salmon,

WEBM.text: and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon became the father of Salmon,

JFA.text: Salmom gerou a Boaz, Boaz gerou a Obede.

RVA.text: Y Salmón engendró á Booz, y Booz engendró á Obed;

KJV.text: And Salmon begat Boaz, and Boaz begat Obed,

WEBM.text: and Salmon became the father of Boaz, and Boaz became the father of Obed,

JFA.text: Obede gerou a Jessé, e Jessé gerou a Davi.

RVA.text: Y Obed engendró á Isaí, é Isaí engendró á David.

KJV.text: And Obed begat Jesse, and Jesse begat David.

WEBM.text: and Obed became the father of Jesse, and Jesse became the father of David.

JFA.text: Então Jesus, olhando em redor, disse aos seus discípulos: Quão dificilmente entrarão no reino de Deus os que têm riquezas!

RVA.text: Entonces Jesús, mirando alrededor, dice á sus discípulos: ­Cuán dificilmente entrarán en el reino de Dios los que tienen riquezas!

KJV.text: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

WEBM.text: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!”

JFA.text: Ora, ele adquiriu um campo com o salário da sua iniquidade; e precipitando-se, caiu prostrado e arrebentou pelo meio, e todas as suas entranhas se derramaram.

RVA.text: Este, pues, adquirió un campo del salario de su iniquidad, y colgándose, reventó por medio, y todas sus entrañas se derramaron.

KJV.text: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.

WEBM.text: Now this man obtained a field with the reward for his wickedness, and falling headlong, his body burst open, and all his intestines gushed out.

JFA.text: Para que possais andar de maneira digna do Senhor, agradando-lhe em tudo, frutificando em toda boa obra, e crescendo no conhecimento de Deus.

RVA.text: Para que andéis como es digno del Señor, agradándo le en todo, fructificando en toda buena obra, y creciendo en el conocimiento de Dios.

KJV.text: That ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God.

WEBM.text: That you may walk worthily of the Lord, to please him in all respects, bearing fruit in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God.

JFA.text: E vos vestistes do novo, que se renova para o pleno conhecimento, segundo a imagem daquele que o criou.

RVA.text: Y revestídoos del nuevo, el cual por el conocimiento es renovado conforme á la imagen del que lo crió.

KJV.text: And have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him.

WEBM.text: And have put on the new man, who is being renewed in knowledge after the image of his Creator.

JFA.text: Mas agora, em Cristo Jesus, vós, que antes estáveis longe, já pelo sangue de Cristo chegastes perto.

RVA.text: Mas ahora en Cristo Jesús, vosotros que en otro tiempo estabais lejos, habéis sido hechos cercanos por la sangre de Cristo.

KJV.text: But now in Christ Jesus ye who sometimes were far off are made nigh by the blood of Christ.

WEBM.text: But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off are made near in the blood of Christ.

JFA.text: A vos renovar no espírito da vossa mente.

RVA.text: Y á renovarnos en el espíritu de vuestra mente.

KJV.text: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind.

WEBM.text: And that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind.

JFA.text: Sabendo, contudo, que o homem não é justificado por obras da lei, mas sim, pela fé em Cristo Jesus, temos também crido em Cristo Jesus para sermos justificados pela fé em Cristo, e não por obras da lei; pois por obras da lei nenhuma carne será justificada.

RVA.text: Sabiendo que el hombre no es justificado por las obras de la ley, sino por la fe de Jesucristo, nosotros también hemos creído en Jesucristo, para que fuésemos justificados por la fe de Cristo, y no por las obras de la ley; por cuanto por las obras de la ley ninguna carne será justificada.

KJV.text: Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.

WEBM.text: Yet knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but through faith in Jesus Christ, even we believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ, and not by the works of the law, because no flesh will be justified by the works of the law.

JFA.text: Porque todos quantos fostes batizados em Cristo vos revestistes de Cristo.

RVA.text: Porque todos los que habéis sido bautizados en Cristo, de Cristo estáis vestidos.

KJV.text: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.

WEBM.text: For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ.

JFA.text: Digo-vos que assim haverá maior alegria no céu por um pecador que se arrepende, do que por noventa e nove justos que não necessitam de arrependimento.

RVA.text: Os digo, que así habrá más gozo en el cielo de un pecador que se arrepiente, que de noventa y nueve justos, que no necesitan arrepentimiento.

KJV.text: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.

WEBM.text: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.

JFA.text: Pois eu, o Senhor, não mudo; por isso vós, ó filhos de Jacó, não sois consumidos.

RVA.text: Porque yo Jehová, no me mudo; y así vosotros, hijos de Jacob, no habéis sido consumidos.

KJV.text: For I am the Lord, I change not; therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.

WEBM.text: For I, the Lord, don’t change; therefore you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed.

JFA.text: Jesus, fixando neles o olhar, respondeu: Aos homens é isso impossível, mas a Deus tudo é possível.

RVA.text: Y mirándo los Jesús, les dijo: Para con los hombres imposible es esto; mas para con Dios todo es posible.

KJV.text: But Jesus beheld them, and said unto them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.

WEBM.text: Looking at them, Jesus said, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
